Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property and golf”
Reviews.Author: GaryDassatti
Reviews.Content: Visited here in December with another couple and it is an amazing property with all emenities you would want or need. One night we decided to go to dinner at Emeralds in City Walk and cars are waiting outside to take you anywhere you need to go at very reasonable rates and can be just billed to your room. Breakfast service is great and our friends who stayed one night more than us had dinner at the main resaurant and they stated that it was the best meal, service, etc that they had ever had. The golf course which is part of the property is also great and the staff at both are amazing. We will be visiting again next month. While at the golf course, we met Se Ri Pak who is an LPGA star and Hall of Famer. Picture attached.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: allgood34
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a software conference in Nov 2011. The hotel staff and amazing and extremely helpful. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The rooms are large, clean, comfortable and quiet. The only downfall was the cost of dining in the hotel restaurants or making purchases in the in hotel shops. The hotel is too far away from town to walk to which almost forces you to dine in if you do not have a car during your stay. Overall though this hotel rocks and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elite”
Reviews.Author: Nowaiser
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good for who is visiting Orlando for Disney. you don't need to worry about the them park parking or anything else the bus will take you there as a King. the people will treat you as you a prince show you how your convenience is important for them. Having Disney view is very important so you can enjoy the summing pool and the fair works of Disney. Definitely ill come again. My family and I like the spa as well all the product from Guerlain.

Reviews.Title: “Pool and wait staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Billkeever
Reviews.Content: Everyone was wonderful but the pool and restaurant wait staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travel08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was top notch. The service was outstanding and the hotel is absolutely beautiful. If you are visiting Orlando and don't want to be overwhelmed by Disney tourists, this is your oasis. Walked over to the Hilton which is also on property and saw pool full packed with kids. Turned around and went back to the peaceful Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to family trip”
Reviews.Author: Catavpac
Reviews.Content: After 4 days in hilton we upgraded to 3 nights here. King suite with fireworks/ pool view. The room was just amazing! Housekeeping was the best weve had in a long time. Sweet cupcake platter was sent up for our daughter birthday, enough for eveyone to enjoy. Drinks down in peacock alley was always very enjoyable. Pools were great but the food and staff at pool resturant was rather dissapointing. A few big conventions going on at Hilton and Waldorf during our entire stay but never felt too overcrowded with people. Front desk gave us a very generous late check out, with two small children and a 10pm flight home it was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: L2T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for three nights in April with our two children. The hotel was wonderful--very well done. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the hotel bar was lovely. It is connected to the Hilton and guests have use of that pool as well as the Waldorf pool. As we had young children, we headed to the the water slide and lazy river at the Hilton which kept the kids (and us!) entertained for hours. We had a lovely lunch pool side. Our room had a Disney view and we could see the fireworks at night. If you are looking for a trip to Disney with a way to escape Disney at the end of the day, the Waldorf perfect. If we go to Disney again, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spa was a rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: suelhallmd
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 was scheduled for massage at the same time. Spa staff took about 10 min. painstakingly asking us which scent massage oil we wanted our therapist to use and which drink we wanted at the conclusion and then another 5-10 min to walk us through the spa, get changed out of our clothes and be called one by one for our massage. This left about 35 min at most for a 50 min massage that cost $180, and at the end I got tap water to drink instead of the much-hyped blueberry flavored "special" drink called Wisdom. The massage felt so rushed that it was hard to enjoy. Afterwards, no staff even asked for feedback or if our service was good. This was the shortest and most expensive and least enjoyable massage I have ever had and I get massages on a fairly frequent basis. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Fan1967
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days here for spring break recently with my wife and two children (ages 4 & 7) and we thoroughly enjoyed our time at this property. We were Hilton Honors Diamond upgraded to a 14th floor corner suite overlooking the pool area with views of Disney and have nothing but positive things to say about the room: very large, well appointed, very comfortable beds, balcony was great, etc. The service at the Waldorf was also top notch and 100% of the staff we encountered during our stay was very friendly and helpful. We utilized the hotel as a base for our visits to Disney, Legoland and Kennedy Space Center and the Waldorf was a relaxing place to return to after each eventful/tiring day. The pool was very nice and relaxing although we did end up spending more time at the Hilton due to the lazy river and water slides. This is a first class hotel in all regards and we definitely will stay here again during future Disney visits!

Reviews.Title: “Quality & style”
Reviews.Author: Eeva_xx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Delux Room for two nights in February with my spouse. I had diveded risks, and we stayed also in another hotel in Orlando. I regret that we did, as Waldorf-Astoria was such a nice place. + The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. + The pool area was nice, with nice couch sets and fire places to enjoy after evening swim + The gym was well equipped, fresh and nice. It was also easy and nice to go for a morning jog, with the walkway on the side of the golf course. + The front desk staff was really helpful, and provided us with good tips. There was a small incident with the iron ( leaking some rusty water on my dress) and the front desk handled the feedback well and compensated me immediately. Unfortunately we did not try their own restaurants, so no comments on those. Would absolutely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bankolekole
Reviews.Content: Only here for a weekend but what a beautiful and well kept hotel. Would have loved to have had time to go to spa. Service was first rate. Very helpful staff all round who seemed to always know your name. Very convenient for Disney

Reviews.Title: “One great night!”
Reviews.Author: Ndalsteve
Reviews.Content: Got to spend one night here in April, and the service and amenities were top! It was Easter weekend so they had a egg hunt and Easter bunnies for the kids to pet. Then they had egg dying in he kids room. I really enjoyed my stay. The negative thing is it's really far from any restaurants and all food closes like around 8:00 so your forced to use room service.

Reviews.Title: “Thought a Waldorf Astoria would be nicer”
Reviews.Author: meandmygirls3
Reviews.Content: I thought the service would be better at this high end resort. The management yes'ed me when there were issues to be addressed and did not take care of the problems. I found charges on my bill that were not mine.The room was dusty and the shower was leaking thru to the floor and when I asked the management to fix it at first they did nothing then they sent someone up to the room to check it out and sent me a note that they couldn't so anything and when I went to speak to the manager on the 3rd day he finally sent someone up to repair the leak but nothing was ever done about the excesive dust in the room. My whole family was congested and sneezing the whole time we were there, there was a layer of dust on a shoe box the I had brought with me after being there 2 days. The nice thing about this hotel was that they are connected to a Hilton which has a lazy river pool which the kids loved and they showed disney movies for the kids in the evening

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NNSJRL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Disney and stayed at the Waldorf Astoria from 4-18 to 4-22. The service was perfect from check in to check out. The Disney/pool view room on 11th floor was wonderfully decorated and spacious. I would give this hotel 6 Stars if I could. The restaurants were great and it's nice to be connected to the Hilton next door in case you want to eat there. Would not change a thing about this hotel and it was so nice to return here after a long day of crowds and screaming kids at Disney. I know some of the reviews say that this is not a kid friendly hotel but our 3 1/2 year had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria Not a big deal”
Reviews.Author: Jo B
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler for business and Diamond member I was not impressed at all, I have received better service from some of the Hampton Inns I have visited. The room was nice, service terrible, waited for our room to be ready no communication from staff, would never stay there again, will stay at a Hilton next time

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: rtr59
Reviews.Content: Here's what's great about the Waldorf Orlando- It's beautiful. The pools, golf course, bar(s), lobby, rooms, etc. We're diamond members and were upgraded to a gorgeous suite with views of the golf course, pools on one side and on the other a lovely view of the parking deck and downtown disney in the distance. (nice if you want to see fireworks at night). In our suite, we had a huge bathroom with a soaking tub and shower, a separate bedroom, living room with sofa bed, dining area and wet bar with expresso maker and over sized mini-fridge. My son especially loved the doorbell :) We had issues with a lot of miscommunication between the front desk and housekeeping. It took forever to get what we needed whenever we called, and for the duration of our stay the hotel did not have any wash cloths. Strange for a Waldorf. They actually finally found a few for us that they borrowed from the Hilton next door! Room service was also an issue. We ordered mac and cheese for our child and a cheeseburger for me. After an hour, we called to see where the food was. No record of the order. A few minutes later the room service manager called to inform us that the order had been sent to the Hilton-so they said they would start over and comp us for the mac and cheese. I felt the entire order should be comped considering this situation-but, it didn't matter because our son was already asleep-it had been 2 hours by now. So, we cancelled the mac and cheese and stuck with the cheeseburger. I had to ask to have it comped, which I thought was kind of tacky considering the situation. But, it was comped and arrived within a half hour and it was very good. Aside from that, the rest of our stay was wonderful. All of the staff was pleasant, cheery and helpful. No surly, bored or irritated people working at this hotel-which was nice, considering the fact that the place was over run with families with kids running around everywhere. The fabulous thing that we discovered was the fact that even though the waldorf pools were gorgeous and there were children swimming there, adjacent to the hotel is the orlando Hilton and they have a zero entry lazy river pool, water slide and great area for families with kids. Excellent poolside food/beverage service, plenty of big, fluffy pool towels and to top it all off-when it got dark, their was a giant movie screen set up and everyone was treated to a movie while they swam around and played at the pool. We were also able to order take out and have it delivered to the Hilton's front lobby and take it to the pool where we had pizza one night for dinner. A great option when you're spending hundreds a day at Disney, etc. So, stay at the Waldorf for the beauty and upscale ambience (and high prices) and play next door at the Orlando HIlton. Whether you're looking for a quiet, romantic time chilling by the pool in your private cabana ($$) at the Waldorf or playing over at the HIlton with the kids-it's a winning combination. They also have comfy free bus transportation all day long to the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: travelermia
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel experiences ever. Beautiful hotel with room overlooking golf course. Room was outstanding: bed super comfortable; bathroom spacious with nice toiletries and great towels. Staff is friendly and helpful. What more do you want? Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton with a Waldorf badge... bus service to park terrible”
Reviews.Author: off-for-a-ride
Reviews.Content: This hotel is "nice" but not good. We preferred it to the Disney hotel that we stayed in immediately after (Animal Kingdom) but not by a huge margin. It is an over priced version of the Hilton next door (which shares all facilities). You do pay more for everything in addition to your room (i.e. a drink by the Waldorf pool bar will be several dollars more compared to a short walk to the Hilton pool bar ... food etc ditto). The rooms were very nice and comfortable (if a little below what you might think from the name) but service was very poor (we had internet problems that were not handled well at all). Pools are nice (Hilton better for kids Waldorf better for adults but you can use both). You will have terrible bus service to the parks ... they are very infrequent compared to other hotels ... best to try to get on at the Hilton because the Waldorf usually had standing room only and occasionaly not even that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: swhip
Reviews.Content: I planned a last minute spring break trip to Disney for my family and decided to give the Waldorf a try. I am now completely spoiled and I wonder how any other hotel will live up to this stay. From the moment we checked in, the service was impeccable! We've stayed at several Four Season Hotels in the past, and still, I was blown away. We took a very early flight in and arrived before 11 AM. We were checked right in and given a 15th floor room with views of all the parks and their firework displays. The room was gorgeous! The bed was heaven (though I do favor the bed at the Four Seasons). And the bathroom was very large and meticulously clean! We mentioned our oldest had just turned 6 and when we arrived back from The Magic Kingdom on our first day, there were cupcakes, a card and a gift waiting for her in the room. Just another example of how they really go above and beyond in terms of service. The location is perfect! We rented a car and we were literally minutes outside of every park! Just and FYI, navigation took us to the wrong location. Be sure to use the actual address and not just the Waldorf Orlando that may come up as a selection. We were there for 6 days and only spent 2 of those days at the pool. Both of my girls had a blast! The pool was not crowded at all. I was expecting spring break being chaos with children everywhere. Not the case here! It was delightful and relaxing! My husband and I were able to enjoy ourselves as well. I seriously debated on staying at the Hilton next door simply because I knew my kids would love the slide and lazy river. I'm so glad I went with the Waldorf! The Hilton pool was exactly what I imaged spring break would be. It was nice to be able to leave that behind after a couple hours and go back over to our pool. The food and drinks at the hotel were also incredible. My husband thought the breakfast buffet was one of the most amazing spreads he has ever seen. So such to choose from and delish! We had a magical family vacation and would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but Management need to iron out some problems to warrant 5 star prices.”
Reviews.Author: JuliaHLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week holiday in Florida and decided to treat ourselves to a few nights at the Waldorf to finish our trip in style. I agree with other travellers that you need to look out for signs for the Bonnet Creek Resort otherwise the hotel is not the easiest to find. Anyway we arrived mid afternoon and was greeted by valet parking who efficiently emptied the car and whisked it away. There is no self parking but if you're staying at the Waldorf why would you want that anyway? We initially had a Deluxe Disney View room with twin Queen beds which was on the top floor so fantastic views. As a Hilton Honors member I had requested an upgrade to a suite but sadly none was available. We were on the Wandering Wizards package which included breakfast and a Harry Potter wand toy for my son. I discreetly asked at reception about the wand as I wanted it as a surprise for my son and was told that it would be ready and waiting for him in the room. He was very excited about a surprise gift and raced up to the room. Unfortunately he hunted the room but couldn't find the gift. I rang down to reception and had to explain (and spoilt the surprise) and they said they would send it up. What wasn't mentioned was the toy needs batteries to work so he couldn't use it anyway. I know this sounds minor and it is, but it sets the tone. I thought a 5 star hotel would consider small things like this that make a huge difference to a little boy. The room was excellent and well equipped although I noticed the Nexpresso maker only had two pods of decaf coffee and very little milk left. We dined at the Bull and Bear and agree with other reviewers that although excellent food, the menu was very limited, expensive, with little choice for children. Our meal for three (two adults one child) was $ 160 + and that was with only two glasses of wine. The pool at the Waldorf and adjacent Hilton were great. My son particularly liked the lazy river. You could hire inflatable rings to float round at $5. The pool staff at both hotels were very good and efficient in taking orders for drinks etc. The cocktails were well made and we were asked regularly if we needed anymore. We had breakfast included within our package and were given a voucher for two adults when I checked in. I didn't query this at the time as I presumed my son would have been included. I was a bit surprised to receive a bill at breakfast of $18 for my son. I queried it with the waiting staff but was told to raise it with reception. The breakfast was very good with an extensive selection of hot or cold food. The chef at the omelette station was great and cooked exact to order. The following day we returned to our room after a day out and although the room had been serviced we were surprised to note that our dirty coffee cups from the morning were still there and we had been left with no coffee replacements or any milk. I rang down and some were brought up immediately. We also tried to use the in room safe but unfortunately the previous guests had left it in locked mode. I called down and was told that a security guard would be up to unlock the safe so we could use it. After about 45 minutes I rang down again to chase up the security guard as we were keen to go out. The guest services operator apologised and security was at our door within 5 minutes and sorted the problem. Our flight home was delayed by 24 hours so I asked if our stay could be extended and as we'd already packed our bags asked if a suite was now available. I was told that would be no problem but my original upgrade request could not be honoured and I would have to pay the rate as a new booking. $469 + taxes. I agreed and was told a bellman would be up to help move our bags to the new room in a few minutes with two new keys. After 20 minutes I called down again and a bellman arrived but no keys so he had to let us in with his access key. The room was amazing and although expensive was very spacious and what I expect of the Waldorf. Unfortunately our extension did not include breakfast so that made it. Very expensive night. The final annoyance was on the final day and after agreeing a late check out which had been part of our earlier package our room key didn't work. I went down to reception (from the 15th floor) and she apologised and 'zapped' it again. I returned back to the room.....and guess what....the key still didn't work. I traipsed back to reception which had approx 4 staff members standing around and she zapped it again and said she would send up a security guard again if it still didn't work. What really surprised me is that not one member of staff offered to accompany me back upstairs. Also the security guard didn't turn up. The above examples sound like a catalogue of complaints and fairly minor in nature and I agree, individually, they are small but added together it spoilt the end of our trip. Also at the price paid I simply do not expect amateur service. I have stayed at the Waldorf in NYC in the past few months and the service was exceptionally good. I am a traveller who is happy to pay a premium for good service but will have to secure a very good deal to return to this hotel again. There are hotels at half the price very near by who offer excellent service. It is such a shame as the complacency from some staff reflects poorly on the others. This could be an outstanding hotel but customer service does not appear to be a priority.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: maconbartows
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to do a last minute getaway for our anniversary and found ourselves in the Orlando area at the Waldorf. We could not have planned this trip any better. From the moment we stepped in the staff EVERYWHERE was courteous, kind, helpful, literally jumping to serve us in any way they could. Upon check in they offered us vouchers for the breakfast and several vouchers for spa services. The hotel is beautifully appointed. The beds are incredible. The housekeeping staff was extremely thorough -- they service your room in the morning and in the evening. It was always beautiful. The grounds around the hotel are immaculate. Our room overlooked the beautiful golf course and brick paved walking path. There is a very nice fitness room but the hotel complex, which includes the Waldorf and it's sister property the Hilton, is surrounded with beautiful walking/biking/jogging paths with park benches along the way if you would rather walk/run outside. The Hilton is connected by both outside sidewalks and interior corridors and guests may use facilities at either hotel --- pool, fitness room, restaurants, etc. The pool at the Waldorf was always full as there were many families there during our stay but the pool attendants were bountiful and they did an incredible job of helping to find seating, keeping chairs ready for guests, etc. I never had any trouble finding seating at the pool. The hotel also offers bikes and surreys for use. With the lovely paths this is definitely a plus. The rooms were magnificent and the bathrooms very large and very beautifully decorated as well. As with any 5 star, robes and slippers were in the rooms as well as a Nesesspresso machine and a nice selection of coffees as well as a mini fridge. The breakfast buffet was absolutely incredible!!!!! I don't understand the "negative" written by another reviewer. We ate at the buffet four mornings and there was never a line anywhere. Homemade maple syrup is not of the same texture as "Mrs. Butterworths." It does have a more natural watery consistency because there is no high fructose corn syrup in it. The buffet had every imaginable item you could possibly conceive for breakfast on it and everything on it was homemade. There was an omelet station with about 12 items you could select for your omelet, a waffle station, a crepe' station, 8 different types of fresh fruit, smoked salmon with several cream cheese varieties and 4 or 5 different bagel varieties. There were scrambled eggs, fingerling potatoes, crisp bacon, beautiful sausage links, and french toast. There was also a huge selection of homemade pastries --- AT LEAST 30 different things, all homemade at Oscars -- croissants, chocolate croissants, Swedish croissants, banana nut bread, various muffins, etc etc etc. Seriously, there were too many to even remember. They also had three or four different cereals (for children, I'm sure) as well as an incredible homemade granola with additional toppings you could add. Then there was the "bread station" with about 8 different types of homemade breads which you could toast or eat cold along with butter and different homemade jams. There was also an assorted olive tray, with a variety of cheeses and salamis. The highlight of the breakfast for me was the "Juice Bar." This bar included 6 different freshly made juices each morning. They have someone who works full time all morning just to make the juices ---Apple /Kiwi, Apple/Pomegrante, Watermelon, Orange/Strawberry, Pear/Honeydew, Orange/Carrot. Of course, just plain Orange or Apple juice was also available. The weather was beautiful while we were there so each morning we enjoyed having breakfast on the patio and lingering for an hour or so with our coffee and juices. I really can't say enough how incredibly wonderful the entire staff of this hotel was. We used the Disney Shuttle several different days and it was punctual to the minute both at the hotel and at the parks, going and coming. From the valet attendants, to the door attendant, to the front desk, pool attendants, housekeeping ---- ALL were incredible and extremely professional and helpful. I would go to Orlando again just to stay at this hotel and enjoy the amenities it provides.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blondechick32
Reviews.Content: My hsuband and child (age 7) stayed at this hotel the second weekend in April 2012. We had a difficult time finding it due to the fact our Garmin couldn't locate the street name. We have stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek (it is next door) previously, but just couldn't remember how to get there. I called the hotel, and they gave us a different street name to use. Worked perfectly. I would definitely suggest calling before your trip if you are driving. First impression: The lobby is gorgeous!! Beautiful marble and tile floors. Definitely a contemporary feel. Check-in went smoothly. Super friendly staff. Mandatory $20 valet parking system. This was one of the only negatives about this resort. Positives: Heavenly bed!!! Beautiful room. Gorgeous bathroom with separate tub/glass shower. Drawers in the vanity, which was such a plus! Robes, slippers, Salvatore Ferragmo toiletries and lighted magnifying mirror in the bathroom. The room had two closets in the entry way area as well. Kids club/activities. My son enjoyed going to this. The food. Nice health club. Lovely spa. We also rented a cabana ($300 for the day or $150 for a half day--AFTER 4 p.m.). The cabana came with two bottles of three different types of sodas (your choice), several bottles of water, Evian mist, a pitcher of virgin Mojitos, a HUGE fresh fruit platter and sunscreen packets. Yes, $300 is high, but we felt like it was worth it, as we were there from 10-5. There is a TV in the cabana as well. We had lunch delivered to our cabana from Aquamarine which was very good. Negatives: Mandatory valet parking. I thought this was ridiculous since there was a garage closeby. Plus, you are in and out so much going to Disney. That can get a little pricey, but you are staying at The Waldorf. The "young" staff around the pool. They weren't very attentive until I talked to the man in charge of the pool area. Things changed after that. Otherwise, the staff was great! I definitely will be returning. We have stayed at many hotels in Orlando while visiting Disney. This one is luxury at its finest! We also love The Hilton Bonnet Creek next door. We had a great rate. In fact, we have paid much more to stay in several of the deluxe Disney resorts with rooms not nearly as nice for twice the money!! We paid $278 a night for our room on Expedia with a Florida resident rate. Try finding that at a Disney Deluxe in peak season!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Maria G
Reviews.Content: From the check-in to check-out the staff were friendly and professional. Also the personal at pool area and pool restaurant were great as well as staff and service at dinner restaurant. Food was great. Bathroom very spacious and beds very comfortable. Only 2 negative things. First cabana at pool cost $150 for half day and $300 for full day. Stayed at many hotels in with same standard and don't charge extra for Cabanas. Half of cabanas were empty. Second thing we wanted a suite but were 2 friends and 1 child. No suites had 2 queen beds and the deluxe room with 2 queen beds couldn't have a roll-in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TravelBod
Reviews.Content: I understand that this was the first Waldorf Astoria outside of new York. I was lucky enough to get an upgrade to stay here recently. First, all credit to the staff at the sister Hilton hotel, next door, for upgrading me to a suite at the Waldorf. A generous lounge, kitchen and balcony before you even get to the bed and bathroom. The standard of fixtures and fittings are of an excellent quality as you would expect. The pool area is one of the nicest I've used, with terrific pool side staff, great menu and plenty of shade. The hotel has three restaurants plus options for in room dining. Although not the purpose of my trio, the close proximity to Disney resort must be a bonus, with a shuttle bus on hand for eager families. Great decor in this hotel, attentive staff and wonderful FOH staff. I will return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RusLadyLondon
Reviews.Content: Such a perfect gem in the USA. Amazing new hotel, very clean, very modern, perfect interior everywhere (public spaces, restaurants, rooms), just can't praise it enough. We were staying in a suite with a balcony, nice pool views, fireworks in Magic Kingdom every night from 10pm sharp, don't miss it! I had the best bathrobe in my life, even bought one for myself from the hotel shop, around $86, can't wait to start using it. Opulent bedroom, gorgeous bathroom with everything you might need, great toiletries from Salvatore Ferragamo, amazing smell.Lots of towels in all sizes. Just a couple of concerns: 1. We hired a car with Garmin GPS at Miami and travelled all the way to Orlando. The adress the hotel provided us with (Bonnet Creek Resort Lane) was not on our GPS, neither was Waldorf Astoria hotel itself. I knew from Tripadvisor that Waldorf was overlooking Hilton so we started driving around Hiltons (there are 2 or 3 in the area), but it was all wrong. It took us 40 more minutes to realise there is no such thing as Bonnet Creek Resort, what it used to be has been completely redevelopped and new Hilton and Waldorf Astoria hotels added. If you have the same problem with your GPS look for Bonnet Creek Resort. 2. Dining: we travelled with a 9 y.o., so I must admit there aren't many dining options for that age group. In Waldorf, you can eat in the lobby if you like, but in Easter it was overcrowded. There is Bull&Bear Grill, which does not cater for kids and the prices are just ridiculous, $48 for a steak with no sides, + 18-20% compulsory tips -by far too much, so we ate there just once. We found a perfect place in Hilton (the hotels are connected on the lobby level, you don't have to go outside, and you can buy/dine in Hilton using the Astoria hotel card, really handy). The Italian restaurant La Luce in Hilton is amazing, reasonably priced and the dishes are very, very tasty. We had pizzas, pastas, risotto, fired seafood, etc. - sensational. There is another place in Hilton for people with kids, Harvest restaurant, but it looks more like Butlins, we didn't try it. On the last night we went to Wyndham hotel for dinner, good value for money but not as good as La Luce. And also you have to pay straight after dinner! 3. Last thing - Such a shame we did not have enough time to relish the hotel enough as we were SO busy in Disney every day! Pay more and book one more day just to stay in and RELAX, it's well worth it. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “golf !”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: only played golf here--the course is awesome started out with valet parking(never had that before on any course) the staff is excellent then the course (wow) great layout and super fast greens(we will play again)

Reviews.Title: “Great...but the extras!”
Reviews.Author: JDH128
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel with excellent rooms, public areas, pool, eating options and bars. Stayed on the 14th floor (great views) during the Easter break. Hotel very busy and pool area quite crowded. Staff made sure everyone found seats though. Very difficult to criticise the facilities, but for balance, a few minor gripes: - Room wasn't ready until after 6.00pm on day of arrival. This may be exceptional. - Valet parking is compulsory and $20 a day. - Mini bar in room is empty - Water in room $6 a bottle - Buffet breakfast around $30 plus 18%-20% tip advised...which seems a lot for pouring an orange juice and some coffee. Would definitely stay again though. Excellent overall

Reviews.Title: “hotel is sublime! WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alolly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a very special treat from my sister for my birthday. Every part of the day spent at this hotel was fabulous. Loved it, we were so spoilt by the staff who were very friendly and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for the staff. We appreciated their attention to the finer details.. Bull and Bear yes it was expensive but this was a meal of a lifetime! Try The Lemon - they will explain! The breakfast was beautifully presented and very tasty, everyone is catered for.staff very attentive but never intrusive. Swimming pool is a fantastic feature of this magnificent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Cenobre
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights in february and have to say we loved everything about this hotel. The bed is probably the best hotel bed we ever slept...so cozy and comfortable! When we did the reservation, we applied for the e-upgrade system...during check in, we were offered to change for a suite, which was gorgeous. This hotel is the luxury choice if you are looking for a upscale experience in Orlando! The only minor issue was the quality of the in room dining...we ordered 2 nights in a row...the food was heavy on the salt and they did something wrong with salad dressing...it was too sour.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: beeboHull
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for one night before travelling back home to the UK. The hotel is stunning and certainly has the wow factor. All the staff were attentive and friendly. My only negative is the pricey bottled water in the room at 6 dollars and was quoted 30 dollars per person for breakfast buffet!!! We went to IHop and got breakfast for 3 for just over 30 dollars!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings but lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: pab34
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a special "girls weekend" to mark her 13th birthday. The hotel was running an excellent offer of a $100 resort credit per night and although the price for our suite was costly I felt that the offer would help defray the cost of our food. I spoke to a very kind woman with whom I made our reservation and explained the purpose of our visit. She spoke with me for quite some time and seemed genuinely interested in making our stay memorable. Upon arrival we were greeted appropriately and there were gentlemen present to hold the doors open as well as bellmen to take our luggage. The front staff was welcoming but did appear a bit unexperienced. The lobby was absolutely beautiful and seemed very warm and friendly opposed to the initial feel of the Grande Lakes Ritz which we have previously stayed. Our room was a gorgeous Deluxe Suite with a very nice balcony that over looked the pool. Although I did request a high floor and did not get it, even though I am a Hilton Honors member, I was very pleased with our room assignment. Upon entering our suite there were two cupcakes with several toppings to choose from and a happy birthday note for my daughter. Needless to say that was a very nice touch. Now, at this point I must say that the bellman did stay a little too long "showing" me the room. I never felt uncomfortable but I did feel as though he was going the extra mile for a bigger tip perhaps. The weather was not very nice the weekend we stayed but we did dine at the outdoor pool area. The food was great and our server was attentive however I had to interrupt the very talkative bar tender to politely request that he send someone to take our order. Our first night was fabulous and the next morning we ate breakfast at Oscar's. Once again, noone was available to seat us and I had to find the hostess. I did find the service to be subpar but my daughter enjoyed the food and we were fortunate to have the amazing chocolate croissants. Our visit continued with a stop at the adjoining Hilton's lazy river pool which is a must see. Unfortunately our second night's stay was interrupted by loud neighboring guests. I did call the front desk and ask that the issue be addressed as I was suffering from a severe migraine. Now for me this is where the Waldorf does not stack up against the Ritz in customer service. Although I was told a security guard would be sent up I was never asked if I needed anything such as a pain reliever or perhaps chamomile tea. As a parent traveling with a lone teen and with it being quite late I think it should have been basic common courtesy to see if I needed anything. That may sound a little over the top for some but I can tell you that the details are what create and sustain luxury hotels. The next morning I requested late check out but was also denied inspite of the prior evening's events. After my visit I received an e-mail survey from the Waldorf and was contacted by the evening manager who did credit my bill a small portion to make up for the poor service. This is a beautiful hotel with so much potential. I really hope they hire some experienced hospitality workers so they can improve their customer service. The absolute best part of our stay was a special dinner at Bull and Bear which I will be reviewing separately in the restaurant section. I would also like to add that there was an age limit for use of the spa at the time of our visit so my daughter and I could not even get a mani/pedi together. I was very surprised since many of the local spas offer a "Mommy and Me" package let alone allowing teens who are accompanied by an adult.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreMontrealCanada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just returning from a 5 nights trip in Orlando at the Waldorf Hotel. This is a great hotel and a great location, the hotel is at 10 minutes away from Epcot, Magic Kingdom and 5 minutes away from typhoon lagoon. The rooms are nice and the bed very comfortable, you have everything you need. The service is outstanding, from concierge, reception, room service, valets, waiters everyone is smiling and were very friendly. on the negative side: no free internet access in the room, valet parking is $20.00 a day when the parking is nearby, breakfast buffet is 30$ per person + tip 18% to 22% recommended. But this is the Waldorf Astoria and pay for what you get. The people that are yielling in hallway after 11:00 pm no respect for other and children running without parents all over the hallway this is not pleasant We played 6 rounds of Golf including the Waldorf Astoria which is in great shape and nice to play, again the golf club personal were very friendly and courteous. The driving range was very nice with free driving balls. Great location, great staff, nice food and superb golf club Recommandation for hotel director: have no kid floor for couples who wants to have a good time and have a great time

Reviews.Title: “Best Spa and Hair Salon - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne K
Reviews.Content: Let me just say this: I am willing to drive 2.5 hours one way to get my hair done so well by VANESSA! I just had a lovely experience at the Guerlain Spa at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. Hair stylist Vanessa is a superstar! I got a full color highlight weave and hair cut and I cannot tell you enough how pleased I am (and I am very particular about who I allow to touch my hair after some bad experiences). Vanessa is so charming and easy to work with and she was perfect. And my hair is now perfect! Vanessa is a "one-stop shop" person: she also can do your make-up and manicure and pedicure beautifully. The cost was not that much higher than other places, quite reasonable, and to experience it all in such a beautiful location was so worth it. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: FranceMartine
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this beautiful hotel. A wonderful 5 star hotel. Service top everywhere! Pity we had to eat in the bar the first night because we didn't book on time in the restaurant. Would love to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cherzner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the Waldorf for my birthday in February. Every bit of positive reviews I've read on here were true. From the early planning stages with conversations with the Concierge prior to our arrival, to check-in to check out, everything was wonderful. Spent the entire day our first day at the resort. Ate at the pool, grabbed drinks at the pool bar. The bartender (forget name now) was excellent. He was friendly and provided exactly what we needed (good conversation and good drinks). The Bull and Bear was outstanding, that evening as well. We had celebrated our 10 year anniversary that evening, as well, and they provided us a wonderful dessert as a gift. We are already making plans to spend a long weekend with our parents next year at the same time here. Everyone deserves to be spoiled. Make sure you have breakfast too, as the layout was excellent!! Make sure you eat at the poolside grill and the Bull and Bear. Walk between the Waldorf and the Hilton next door, as the landscape and connection point provided the perfect evening stroll after a heavy meal. If you have kids, consider spending it at the Hilton where the pool is bound to be the best part of any kids trip! The only remote negative......every once in a while it sounded like someone was dragging a heavy chair over tile in the room above us. Luckily, not at night or the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Dullege
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely extraordinary. The rooms were exceptional, we stayed in a luxury suite, and the maintenance of all aspects of our stay was unparalleled. The gym was phenomenal and not "just" for a hotel gym. The staff were all extremely pleasant to deal with and it seemed that they took their jobs very seriously. The pool area was beautiful and the landscape around the entire property was very well manicured. We had a broken tap in our tub, called the front desk, and they sent a repair man up within 10 minutes and he was out in 5. At one point I left some cash out on our table and, when the cleaning staff came in (as they do twice a day) the saw it and immediately locked down our room so we had the assurance that nothing would ever go missing. Overall our trip to Disney was complemented extremely well by our stay in the Waldorf. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All hotels should be like this!”
Reviews.Author: AnnualLeaveLover
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my 4 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. There isn't much I can add to the gushing reviews before me. They truly deserve their Travellers' Choice 2012 Winner award for Luxury! Beds were so comfortable it was difficult getting out everyday. Turn-down service was lovely with them setting a relaxing atmosphere by laying out the robes, chocolates and even setting the TV to play jazz music. Nice touch! Hotels find it very hard to design a shower that doesn't leak, but the WA has mastered this. Finally! No pools in the bathroom! The bathroom was massive. The tub was relatively small, but I personally don't use tubs anyway. The free Nespresso machines were a very nice touch. My only gripes/comments are: 1. Breakfast at Oscars - they made us wait even though the restaurant was half empty! Not sure what was going on there. There was a crowd waiting when they appeared like they could sit us all anyway. The wait wasn't very long, but it was odd with the number of empty tables they had. The buffet breakfast was great with lots of choice (unlimited coffee and orange juice, omelette and waffle station, pastries galore, cold cuts, fruit and standard breakfast fare - sausages, eggs, etc) at $28 per person without tip. 2. We needed to extend our stay by one night but they couldn't accommodate us as they were fully booked. I just felt that they dropped the ball on their top-notch service during the stay by being unaccommodating. The lady at the front desk wasn't very helpful or friendly and I was surprised she didn't offer to check with the Hilton next door for us, even though that would be the next logical step given that they share facilities and it's right next door! I had to ask her whether she could help check with the Hilton and we managed to get a room there. Comparing the Hilton Bonnet Creek to WA Orlando, the Hilton is A LOT more kid orientated. The Hilton has many small kids running around, so it'll be better staying at the WA if you'd prefer somewhere less chaotic (in a small children way). 3. The shuttle bus to Disney Land fills up pretty quickly as it stops at the Hilton first before it reaches the WA. For the 3 days we used the service, either from the hotel, or returning from the park, they usually had to call for a second bus. 3. The biggest gripe I had was the differential in pricing for services between the Hilton Bonnet Creek (literally next door, around 200m away) and the WA Orlando. A town car (i.e. taxi) to the airport from WA would cost $75 flat rate (quoted to me by the driver), whereas from the Hilton BC was $67. Excuse me?! I understand that the WA is more of a luxury hotel than the Hilton, but this is blatant price fixing!!!! Also, at the WA, the buffet breakfast was $28, whereas in the Hilton, it is $19 for 90% of the same food, and children under a certain age (can't remember how old) could eat for free. WHAT!? At least you can walk over from WA to use Hilton's amenities but I felt a bit cheated. Saying all that, I would return. Hotels need to learn about how a true hotel is run from WA Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful five stars Hotel with few mistake”
Reviews.Author: justteresa
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando for a week vacation from April 1-6, 2012. We choose to stay at Waldorf Astoria Orlando for 2 nights from 4/1-4/3. We did have a good stay but I think they can do a little better to improve their service. Pro: 1: The front desk people were very nice and fast check in. 2: The hotel is not too big. You got a great sleeping quality and very comfortable bed and wonderful turn down service. They even put a weather note for you which is really sweet. 3: The hotel has free shuttle to Disney world/Epcot/Animal kingdom... every half hour. 4: The room are nice and clean. Cons: 1:We have checked in at 9:30pm. The front desk was fast but she said they have to check room one more time to make sure everything OK. We stayed at lounge to eat and only 5-10 mins the room was ready. I went up and we still found 3 left over drinks on the refrigerate. I think they just need a little bit detail... this won't be happen. 2:At the check out day, the very earily morning 8:30am. A hotel lady knocked our door and asked when will we be checked out? OMG...this is 5 star hotel and you knocked your customer's door to check the check out time? and it was 8:20 to 8:30 am? We don't know who is that lady but she is hotel person for sure. Please.... this hotel is really great but they have to improve this "special knocking door service". We were so tired, we just need more sleep in the earily morning. OK...Other than these 2 reason. We do love this hotel and hope the manger can see this .... just a little improve...I would say I like this hotel better than Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “One Night”
Reviews.Author: MkMark
Reviews.Content: Nice looking Hotel, very comfy beds, excellently appointed rooms, only neagtive was the broken tap on the bath...

Reviews.Title: “The standard against which all future hotels will be judged”
Reviews.Author: rovingfamilyman
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to spend one night here. I have reviewed a few hotels, and have even given a few 5 stars. Afeter my stay at the Waldorf Orlando, I now know what 5 star service and comfort really is. The hotel iself is very very impressive. Beautiful looby, great lobby bar, and food at the 2 restaurants I ate at (poolside dinner and breakfast buffet) was excellent. Great pool. Ideal location (next to stellar golf course, and minutes from Disney and other attractions but set up in quiet Bonnett Creek area). The sizeable room was comfortable, with top notch bed, linens and TV. Spacious bathroom with all the amenities. The only small issue is that I could hear hallway traffic at night. I would have thought that solid construction and better doors would have prevented that. What really distinguished the Waldorf was the people. I had faxes hand delivered to my table, towels delivered and placed on my pool chair. I was greeted at every turn, the check in was fasty and pleasant and the rooms were spotless. Not a single interaction with staff was anything less than absolute professionalism. I can't comment on value for money. We got bumped there from the overbooked Hilton next door. Lucky us. Can't see how anyone could feel shortchanged, even at rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Plano_TXTraveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Waldorf. Although it is not kid-oriented, the staff went out of their way to make our five-year-old daughter feel wlecome on our trip to Disney. The room was probably the most comfortable room we have had in our recent travels. The bathroom was huge and had a large shower that was separate from the bathtub. The Waldorf and the Hilton share private coaches for transportation to the Disney parks. There were always plenty of seats and we never had to wait for another bus. We had dinner via room service a couple of nights and the service was fast and the food was good. My only complaint is that an 8.5 ounce Diet Coke cost $4.95 in the gift shop and that was really the only option.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: melissa26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week in Nov. We stayed with our 3 year old daughter in a suite, with our in laws in an adjoining bedroom. The suites are very nice and the beds are comfortable. Really liked the Nespresso machine in the room. The lobby is beautiful and the food was excellent. What I didn't like was the outside looked no different than the Hilton next door or any other big box hotel. The grounds were also pretty average. They had a zero entry pool which was great for my 3 year old, but again it wasn't much different than the Hilton next door. We used the hotel bus to get to the parks. The bus played a constant rotation of Disney movies which kept my little one entertained however with all the stops it took at least 45 minutes to get back to the hotel after a long day at the parks. Overall, we were pleased with our stay as the hotel was a tranquil haven after a long crazy day at the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “indulge yourself”
Reviews.Author: MPM_chicago
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over the world is many of the most wonderful hotels. This experience competes with the best. Check in was flawless, room was gorgeous, service impeccable. Cleaned my shoes, didn't expect a tip, room service was delicious. Spa was to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Treated So Well...”
Reviews.Author: Aena D
Reviews.Content: I was delighted to be going back for a stay at the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando. Since they made my first stay there very enjoyable. My girlfriends and i planned a reunion/birthday trip. We called the hotel prior to our arrival to inform them of the special occasion. After an exhausting red-eye flight, I was expecting the gracious and warm welcome that I became rather used to during my first stay at the Waldorf. I was not impressed by the young man working at concierge. I felt he was very dismissive; I got the sense he assumed we were young and naive. Although my friends and I may look young, we're all professional adults; which is why I can't comprehend why we were treated so poorly. I informed the young man at the concierge again about the momentous occasion, and that it was my friend's birthday. I asked if there was anything they could do in order to make it special. He told me they charged for champagne and chocolate covered strawberries but would send them up. The last time I was there, it was my wedding anniversary and we were never charged for the champagne or chocolate covered strawberries. In fact, we were also given a complimentary suite. When I informed him of this, he said he could do nothing about it. I called my husband, who then called the reservations department. They set up the complimentary strawberries, and the young man seemed surprised. I also asked about any upgrades; because truly, nothing beats a Waldorf suite for me. He kept insisting they had no free upgrades available. I stopped him and said as a preferred Hilton Honors member, I wouldn't mind paying for the upgrade. I was informed there were no upgrades available even if I paid, and I was just about done checking in. The entire time while I was trying to speak to him, he kept answering phone calls and interrupting me to say hello to other guests. I felt quite the disappointment and my sudden change of mood became very clear. To make up for it, he offered vouchers for each of us to get a free beverage at the bar, but after the way we were treated, none of us wanted anything from him. He also tried to cut us a deal, saying he wasn't supposed to do this but he could offer us a small percentage off the spa services if we bought any spa packages, but we turned him down. The rest of our time was amazing there. The room service and the door men were divine and just plain sweet. The pool is heavenly and the shuttle to Disney is the biggest plus. We also ate at the Bull & Bear and were treated incredibly well by the manager and the waiters. Nothing beats the Bull & Bear steak, and their dessert is to die for. I wish I could just focus more on the positive like I did for my first review at the Waldorf (subject: My favorite!) because it was fantastic. However, the way we were treated when we first arrived did leave me feeling rather unimportant. Thus, this stay for me at the Waldorf was bittersweet.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a five star resort”
Reviews.Author: JMG44
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel, helpful staff, clean and well decorated rooms with large picture windows and a great location. Large pools and spa. However service was spotty with missed turn down service, housecleaning and replenishment of hotel amenities inconsistent. It's worth the extra money to book a room facing the Disney parks to enjoy the evening fireworks. Convenient free transportation to all Disney parks. It's too bad at the rates charged you must use valet parking at $20.00 per day and pay for Internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jan_vandenbosch
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel with good service, good restaurant and nice golf course. Rooms are spacious and well appointed and everything properly worked. Room service was quick and efficient. Bull and bear restaurant is probably oNe of top five In orlando but on the expensice side. Food was excellent however and wine list well balanced. Bar and outside area are still cosy as hotel is not as large asthe adjacent hilton or dolphin&swan. Breakfast is ok but could be smarter. Swimmingpool area is nice and pool is good. Golf course is challenging and very beautifull. In all, stayed for 6 nights and was very saqtisfied.

Reviews.Title: “This is the CHOICE and NOT an Alternative to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: tnghi121
Reviews.Content: Having 2 toddlers who are travelling to Disney for the first time, I was comtemplating whether to stay on Disney properties or off and Waldorf Astoria was the best decision we could ever make. A. THE LOCATION: It is as close to Magic Kingdom as some of the Disney Resorts such as Coronado Springs, All-Star Sports Resorts...The frequent shuttle service provided to Hilton Bonnet Creek and Waldorf Astoria (WA) makes it a convenient, quiet, elegant choice to stay when visiting Disney. Moreover, depends on the location of the room (such as those facing the pool and golf course and are closer to the Hilton property), you might be able to see the fireworks from Epcot at night. Shuttle service goes every 30 minutes (with exact schedule time) to and from MK. Epcot is every hour and Animal Kingdom is evey 2 hours (I think). I've never experienced any shuttle service as on time and precised as this. Disney transportation does not go on schedule. It is more like every 20-25 min. Everyone just form a line and wait. B: FIRST IMPRESSION: Having passed through the Grand and massive Wyndham at the entrance of Bonnet Creek, I was heartbroken seeing the WA. The hotel building was smaller, the look wasn't resort-ish; but rather a more modern looking building with some unattractive light blue color outside. Even the entrance of the hotel is not as grand as the Hilton next door. C. THE LOBBY: Big, clean, nice view of the pool but somewhat sterile. Don't expect the Grand lobby look of the WA New York. The multi color neon light behind the check in area was another miss. However, the hotel's goal is trying to achieve a more modern and not traditional look. The marble lobby is very clean. D. THE ROOM: We had the Deluxe Suite (945 sft) room on the 11th floor with the expansive view of the pool/golf course and fireworks at Epcot. The decor is modern and elegant, simple but tasteful. The separate livingroom has blueray DVD player and the most luxurious pull out queen size sofa bed (I think it was memory foam). The breakfast area has a dining table and chairs for 4 with generous cabinets for wetbar and a small/wine refrigerator. The beds in the bedroom, however, weren't the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in (be advised that we prefer our beds a touch firmer, just personal choice and in no way means that these beds are not comfortable). The marble bathroom is very clean with separate tube and shower. The room is very clean and comfortable overall. E. THE FOOD: Breakfast buffet at Oscar was decent with made to order omelet, crepes, pancakes, fruits, scrable eggs, sausages, bacon, french toast, smoke salmon, grits, oatmeal, variety of bread, pastries, juices. Service was excellent at the restaurant. La Luce (at Hilton) was a surprisingly good place for delicious Italian food (best pizza, thumbs up for clams with pasta, pork loin and rotisserie chicken). We didn't dine at Bull and Bear because of young children. However, the Manager Brendon was nice enough to allow us to order their food for room service. The steak was 8/10. Wasn't as juicy and sweet and melted in your mouth as I was hoping for. The fish was bland, fishy and dry (5/10). F. THE SERVICE: The best part about WA. From Georgie, the Assistant Director who was very personable and attentive, to Matt, the food manager, to the housekeepers and their supervisors. Everyone was extremely helpful, attentive. The star of my stay has to go to Michelle (personal concierge), who took all of my groceries that I've ordered thru Garden Grocers(snacks, yogurt, milk....for the kids and water...) and arranged them nicely in the fridge and cabinets before my arrival to the room. That was the best service I've ever experienced. OVERALL: I visited Polynesian, Grand Floridian, Contemporary, Animal Kingdom lodge and villa just to see if I made the right decision and could change it for next time. There was no way on earth I would change my mind. These resorts are older, more crowded, suffocated. I wouldn't want to go back to the same crowd at the park. WA is a choice above and not an alternative if you visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “***** Wow ******”
Reviews.Author: Hope L
Reviews.Content: Wow....there are still a few wonderful amazing hotels in the world. We recently stayed here for my sons spring break. They guys spent the weekend fishing and playing golf and I treated myself to the spa and a day by the pool. Great staff. Amazing room, we were upgraded thanks to my Hilton Honors status. Amazing Kind suite with a nice queen memory foam pull out for my son. Huge bathroom with great soaking tub. Wonderful espresso machine in the room. Room service at breakfast was outstanding. Over the top amazing customer service. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation for 3 Generations of our Family”
Reviews.Author: Genie S
Reviews.Content: We had six people traveling with us. Three generations of our family. We booked a suite and regular room. We were worried that they would not be adjoining as we were hoping. Morgan at the front desk was wonderful. She accomodated our request and that took all of the stress out of the trip so we were able to have a great time. Morgan has a great attention to detail, warm customer service, and professionalism. The rooms were clean, pool well managed, great room service and pool service. We loved the private bus that took us to and from each Disney resort. We also took advantage of the Nespresso machines in each room - coffee provided in the room was a life saver. The whole week was very comfortable, clean, well managed, and stress/hassle free. We would definitely stay at the Waldorf again when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Our entire family loved our stay at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: SCTravelgal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to treat ourselves to a few nights at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando during our most recent trip to Orlando. We had stayed at Disneys Boardwalk Villas for the first portion of our trip so that the kids could have the "Disney experience" but we must say, even our children loved the Waldorf.  From the moment we checked in the staff was more than accommodating and friendly. We were greeted with champagne to enjoy which was a treat! Kelly at the front desk welcomed us with a huge smile and made check in a breeze assuring us that if we needed anything at all to contact concierge and it would be taken care of.  Jose escorted us to our room and gave us a overview of the hotel, making sure he answered all questions that we had before he left.  We ate breakfast the first morning in Oscars which was amazing. Our server, Wes, paid special attention to our children which was really nice. We divided our time between the pool and the parks. although the pool at the Hilton was more kid friendly, we found the Waldorf pool to be relaxing and just what we needed to escape. We decided to try out Universal Studios one day and Jeremy at concierge was more than helpful giving us information on tickets, must see rides, and arranging transportation for us to the park.  Housekeeping always had our room ready and turndown service was a nice thing to come back to after a long day at the parks.  We were there during a local golf tournament so there was a lot of golfers and guys there in the evenings, especially in the lobby bar. Although we never spent much time in the bar area, we did stop by each evening after the parks to stock up on drinks for the room. The staff was more than helpful each time we stopped by always offering a smile even though they were very busy  One of the bartenders, Christine,  was there each evening we stopped by and although busy, still made us feel welcome and greeted us with a smile.  My kids said they were the best smoothies and asked for one each night....thanks for making my kids feel special.  My wife and I were able to break away on our last evening to have a special dinner without the kids. We stopped by the lobby bar after lunch and enjoyed a cocktail and chat with Derek. He made a few suggestions for dinner....thanks for suggesting Seasons 52, it was amazing.  Ordered room service one day and it was a bit slow and the order wasn't correct, but that and the fact that there were no minibars in the rooms were our only complaints. We will definitely be back to the Waldorf again, hopefully for our anniversary this year.

Reviews.Title: “Too Bad I Couldn't Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Ralph R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2011 for a conference at a different hotel and again in 2012 for the same conference. I loved everything about the property in 2011, however, in 2012 I was unable to sleep as the mattress was like a cloud of fiber fill. My back and neck were in pain the first night. I asked if the hotel could do anything, but they could not so I slept on the floor. While I love the property I cant return in 2013. I travel frequently and never had a similar problem. Otherwise I continue to love this hotel. The Peacock Alley has a great pianist who plays in the evening and creates a very relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame what they have done to the Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelerForSure
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf presents itself as a premium brand, ha! This place is just a step above the Holiday Inn and it could have been so much nicer with just a bit more attention to detail. The lobby is lovely, I was annoyed that they charge for self parking, it's Disney and so many travel by private car or rental, there should be an option. The check in was nice, I upgraded online to a suite which was in size, sensational! Over 1700 square feet with a balcony for an extra $90 I felt was well worth it. But in the normal Waldorf style they "cheaped" out on so many things. The suite was huge with a nice bar. The bathroom was huge with a teany tiny tub! They had the room for a nice tub, but NO they put in this nothing tub. The lighting in the bathroom was SO poor, the CEO should try to shave with that lighting! The bed was way to soft and the TV was at an angle from the bed. Amenities were just so-so for a so called top hotel. The worst was the charges for WiFI, what a rip off! And they do something to block your 3G or 4G, I could not log on to my IPad ATT account. WiFi is free at the pool and in the lobby, but that was pretty inconvinient. These hotels and their added WiFi charges, I get it, they just want to milk every dime out of a traveler, but come on, it's the 21st Century and just about everyone is on line. Very annoying. The room finishes were "cheap" and the ergonomics of the room was odd, they should make hotel designers actually stay in a room to test it out. The views were great of the golf couse and the pool area was very nice. There was just "something" missing in the whole experience. And check out is at 11AM how silly is that unless you are on your way to Disney (I wasn't) so had to rush out. I asked for a later check out and they rudely said "NO". I would not return to this hotel, there are so many to choose from everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: AnnieofMD
Reviews.Content: We got off to a bad start at the Waldorf. Despite an abundance of staff at the front door, no one came to help us manage our multiple suitcases, computer bags, etc. as we got out of a cab. In fact, they pretty much ignored us. Someone did open the door for us, and at that point, asked if we needed help with our bags. By then, we were were rather put out and proceeded to check-in without assistance. Other issues: we asked for a room with a king bed, and got two queens, the staff had trouble stocking our room with linens (we had a bath mat 2 of our 7 nights; didn't have washcloths at all on two nights, etc.), and there were no plugs near the bed so we ran extension cords across the second bed to plug in our medical devices. Breakfast at Oscar's was good, but the staff couldn't seem to keep up with the demand--when I visited the buffet twice, there were no scrambled eggs or bacon. All that being said, the hotel is attractive, clean, and we had an otherwise pleasant stay. We just didn't experience the quality of service that one would expect from a hotel with the name Waldorf. The convention center facilities--located between the Waldorf and the Hilton were excellent and offered a very pleasant atmosphere with lots of light and sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: lovecabo079
Reviews.Content: Best value for your money! Thought it was going to be way out of our league price wise but very affordable. A lot less than the Ritz and yet far better service and rooms. The concierge there was awesome!!! She was so patient and helpful. So close to all parks. We went to Disney, Universal, and Legoland. All very close. We even went to a Red Sox v Yankee game which wasnt very far to Steinbrenner field. This hotel is attached to the Hilton which was a great convenience in terms of having different restaurant choices. We will always stay at the Waldorf whenever visiting Orlando or any of the surrounding cities. The service is exceptional!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt vs Waldorf....in the end it was no contest.”
Reviews.Author: mklsim
Reviews.Content: We had reservations booking at the WA especially after our great experience with the Hyatt Regency last year. Our primary concern was if the lack of parrots and a lagoon style pool would hinder our 6yr old's enthusiasm for the WA. We arrived at the WA, and were promptly greeted by the valet guys. Unloaded the luggage, and we dragged them thru the front doors. No doorman in site. No automatic doors. We checked in without any problems. Very professional and provided great service. At this point we were still concerned about how child friendly they were. Our room was awesome. We really liked the whole look of the hotel and decor and the service provided by the staff. We loved the pool, and the hotel lobby bar (peacock alley). Again service was wonderful and food was very good. Trying to compare the two hotels is like comparing apples and oranges. The Hyatt is definitely more geared to a family experience and the Waldorf Astoria is more luxury/business travel oriented. Our 6 year old loved the fact that there was a lazy river and slide at the Hilton pool, and we had more selection of restaurants to choose from. Since the WA and Hilton shared facilities. I I would recommend both hotels if we could, but I give the edge to the WA if you want some pampering. As parents we relished the fact that the pool was never too crowded. Restaurants were great for the most part were never too busy. Great workout room...very modern! It just felt luxurious. Nespresso machine in the room was used frequently...very nice touch.Turn down service and house cleaning were like ninja's. By the time we got back from breakfast and dinner...everything was done. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “So comfy...”
Reviews.Author: Spaniel33
Reviews.Content: When we eventually found it (almost impossible without GPS as the road signs are impossible to follow as they are all owned by Disney and more interested in getting you to their resorts), this was probably the best hotel experience we have ever had. The front desk staff were impeccably attentive and pleasant. The lobby and hotel as a whole are peaceful and elegant. The room was very well appointed, spacious and clean, and provided a real sense of luxury. The bed was the comfiest we have ever slept in. Breakfast was delicious with true five star service. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the Waldorf.”
Reviews.Author: emhams
Reviews.Content: Visited the Waldorf Astoria over new year and had lovely time. Pros Christmas decorations were fabulous and made the hotel look wonderful. Briliant view from the room. Could see the fireworks from Disney every night so make sure to ask for a high up room with a Disney view. The hotel has shuttles going to Disney throughout the day which are very efficient. The staff at the pool bar and restaurant were amazing and very friendly, especially Shannon and Ryan. The food at the pool restaurant was very yummy, the best in the hotel in fact. There are two pools at the Waldorf which was great. Room was a great size and cleaned very well. The rooms have a mini fridge which is great to store water etc in. Got rooms service on new years eve and they even gave us some free strawberries and chocolate which was very thoughtful. The Sushi bar in the Hilton hotel which is linked to the Waldorf is also worth a visit. If you get up early there is also free tea and coffee in the lobby. There is also a great grab and go breakfast service in the lobby in the morning, however you do have to pay for this. Cons No major cons which would put us off this hotel. However We were told there would be a tea and coffee maker in our room which there was not. It was only when we asked that they put one in our room. I would definitely recommend asking for one on arrival as it will save you a fortune on tea and coffee! The staff in peacock alley were extremely slow and I often had to wait quite a long time just for drinks. They could definitely do with getting trained by the pool bar staff who were very efficient! Many of the restaurants in the hotel are a little old fashioned but i'm not sure if this is just the American style. The hotel could also do with providing more information about the local area. I went through to the hilton which is joined on to the walorf and received lots of information about the malls etc in florida. Saying that the hilton is more geared at children whereas the waldorf is a nice escape from them. Overall had a wonderful experience at the Waldorf and it was a great escape from Disney. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Started Badly Ended Nicely”
Reviews.Author: aznycmama
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Waldorf for the second half of our Spring Break trip to Orlando (March 7 thru 11th) primarily because of the platinum perks we get from American Express Fine Resorts and Hotels program. We chose this hotel because we wanted a quieter, less chaotic environment sans Disney sensory overload. We chose right. Let me start with the positive... The hotel is beautiful. In true Waldorf fashion, the staff was impeccably poised and charming. We were upgraded from standard room to a one bedroom king suite which was a nice treat and the room was absolutely beautiful. I can't say enough about the room, it was luxurious and spacious we loved it! The bathroom alone was the size of a standard room! The breakfast buffet at Oscars, lunch at Aquamarine and late night room service was great. Attention to detail and excellent customer service is top notch. And now the not so positive... Our one and only bad experience was upon check-in with GABE the desk clerk who so willingly offered us our room upgrade to a suite on the 11th floor but made us wait (unnecessarily) for 2 1/2 hours for the room. Without too much whining on my part, he lied about the room being ready in an hour, he continued to lie for 2 1/2 hours, then after all that wait, he finally advised us that the room would be done in 5 minutes. 20 minutes later no Gabe and no room so we asked went to the front desk to ask Gabe and, what a surprise, Gabe had left for the day. The uber snobby night clerk who was now "helping" us had no idea that we've been waiting for a room. The nasty, brainless twit had no clue what we were talking about ("what suite on the 11th floor? Oh that's not ready, you can't have it" she snipped). After explaining all that had happene d and a phone call to Gabe, she begrudgingly offered us another suite on the 7th floor and ever so nicely (sarcasm here again) said, "take this one instead, it's not a big deal". Well, yes it was a big deal for us since we had to sit in the lounge (did I mention for 2 1/2 hours?) with 2 anxious little girls who were dying to go to Disneyworld and we were being told over and over again by Gabe that our room was almost ready and it was a complete lie. Ok, rant over but on a good note. We did talk to the very nice concierge the next day and mentioned what happened and without hesitation he apologized and comped us our first night's stay. Tip: The buses to and from the Disney resorts are well run and easy to use. The downside is, it can take up to 40 minutes to get to some of the Disney parks because of the bus stops in between so we chose to take a taxi to go into the Disney parks each day and took the Waldorf/Hilton bus back to the hotel each night. The bus ride back to the hotel only takes about 20 minutes. Overall: Our stay at the Waldorf was exceptional and restful. It was well worth the initial headache. We would highly recommend it. Room Tip: We stayed at room 730 (1 bedroom suite). Great view of the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Chris
Reviews.Content: I am the General Manager for another Hilton brand and I travel frequently, so I literally eat, sleep and breathe hotels.... Waldorf Orlando does it right! The staff was super friendly and so helpful. The room was beautiful and spotlessly clean! The bed was like sleeping on a cloud, it was the best night's sleep I'd had in a long time. Turn down service was delightful, the in-room espresso was yummy... I can't think of one thing that was disappointing, everything exceeded my expectations. We primarily visited Disney World, and the location was actually better than some of the Disney Hotels we've stayed at in the past. My husband and I enjoyed our trip so much, we booked the Waldorf in Key West - I only hope they can measure up to this property! I noticed when I went to write this review that they received a Trip Advisor Travelers Choice Award - They absolutely deserve it! Well done - I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Marianotg
Reviews.Content: The facility is 1st Class and the employees are "ambassadors" !! Location is great !! Very close to Disney World. The Golf Course is in pristine condition and green fees are really low if you are a guest. If you have young kids, like I do, you can use the "lazy River" and swimming pool of the Hilton Bonnet Creek that is just a 4 minute walk. We also tried the "La Luce" Italian Restaurant at the Hilton and it was great food !. Overall a great experience at a reasonable price. I would go back next time !!
