Reviews.Title: “Waldorf tradition continued”
Reviews.Author: Dave T
Reviews.Content: It has been years since my stay at the Waldorf Astoria Towers NYC but I remember it well and am happy to find that the hotel at Bonnet Creek is holding up the WA reputation for accomodations and attentive service. The friendly and competent service continued from arrival to departure. The Bull and Bear and Oscars restaurants were excellent as was La Luce at the adjacent Hilton. We enjoyed the pool area with its own restaurant and although we did not play in the rain we visited the Golf Club lounge and shop which is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Daddy, this must be royalty...”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRedEye
Reviews.Content: my 6 year old daughter said... Exquisite taste in everything. Decorations, room, service... All excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative to Disney park options but not perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Momtravel33
Reviews.Content: After years of staying at the Grand Floridian inside the park we decided to try a slightly more economical approach to our family vacation at Disney World. This is a nice but very large hotel with a corporate feel. It is very modern but both my husband and I felt the scale of the public areas was a bit massive. The good: Breakfast buffet at Oscars definitely met our expectations. Service was ALWAYS friendly with some staff seeming to know what they were doing and others needing a bit of direction. Food was great! Pool service was nice and pool area, in keeping with the hotel, is sprawling. This was fun for our children. Door/valet staff very polite and punctual each time we requested our car. The not-so-good: Hallways were messy with leftover glasses and room service that never seemed to be cleared. Also, the night we had dinner at the hotel (we ate at the bar because we did not want fine dining at Bull and Bear and there were no other options) the food was horrible. I read prior to booking that this was not a very kid-friendly hotel. To a certain extent I think this is true, however we saw more children during our stay than we expected. Perhaps this is due to the time of year. Either way, we felt our children were mostly well-received. The lazy river and slide at the Hilton next door were always there if we wanted a louder atmosphere! Overall, this is a nice property and I would stay here again, but as a family we definitely prefer the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Leaky bathroom spoilt the "Waldorf Astoria" experience”
Reviews.Author: LenaYong
Reviews.Content: This is the only other Waldorf outside of New York and my husband and I wanted to see if it would live up to its Big Apple reputation. It did but there were kinks in this Orlando armour. Firstly the pluses - we stayed in the premier room which was big and airy, with two large beds and an excellent view of the golf course. For the price we paid, there was a buffet breakfast thrown in at Oscars which was lavish to say the least as well as a $50 credit per night which can be used at any of its outlets. The staff at Oscars were extremely helpful and attentive - two worthy of mention were Carrie and Clay. There were also helpful reception staff and the concierge was equally noteworthy. They gave the name to a fantastic Japanese restaurant called Dragonfly which was superb! However, housekeeping failed to live up to expectations not replenishing soap or Q-tips when they were used. And there was the cause of a leaky shower stall that flooded the bathroom every time we bathed! The hotel only managed to solve the problem after we explained to them that the gap between the shower door and the wall meant water seeping out and making huge puddles. It didn't help that housekeeping never supplied us fresh floor towels after we mopped up the water. This was only rectified after I complained! Also, the hotel had placed the safe in the room on floor level so if you were not able to squat, you would have to sit on the carpet to open the safe every time you wanted to use it. That I found quite weird! But the good things were still plenty including the excellent Bull and Bear restaurant in the hotel. My husband and I had dinner there twice because the food was just so good. The 10-ounce burger gets top marks ... the best I have ever tasted and I have tasted many burgers in my lifetime. And the appetisers were a great fusion of colours and taste - try the truffle-flavoured devilled eggs or the escargots and gnocchi. They were an unusual blend but very good. Even the corn soup (not my husband's favourite choice) got a thumbs-up from him. For those who want to visit Disney theme parks, the Waldorf has a bus service to all the 4 parks on a fairly regular basis, or you could hop on a cab which would cost around $9 - $12 depending on which location. Because the hotel is linked to the Hilton, there are a lot more F&B outlets to choose from and one could get the hotel to use a golf cart to send you over to the Hilton if you were too lazy to walk the distance. In all, the Waldorf came somewhat shy of its big sister in New York but it was a good stay nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: AviaDeSer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel several times. The rooms are nicely decorated, beds are comfortable and the staff is very helpful. Make sure that you get the best of Waldorf package. It is really a good value compared to many other options in this or other hotels in the area. You get a free breakfast for two adults and kids as well as $50 resort credit per night (good for a great dinner for a family of four in one of the Waldorf or Hilton restaurants). If you are planning on visiting Disney attractions, they have a free shuttle. They also have a beautiful pool. My kids love this hotel and every time we come to Disney, they would rather want to stay in the hotel than go to the parks. I must say that our last visit was not as the previous ones (the room was not as clean and updated as rooms we had stayed in previously and they do not serve complimentary coffee in the lobby as they had in the past), but really everything else is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Kcv1976
Reviews.Content: I had such high expectations set after reading all of the wonderful reviews and was so excited that we were having a conference at The Waldorf, and even talked my husband into joining me for my 5 day business trip. I was highly disappointed to say the least. The hotel and the grounds are beautiful, and that is pretty much where it begins and ends. The food was horrible, we had breakfast and lunch at Oscars and it was not good at all not to mention the service was extremely slow. Also one morning my husband and I thought we would order room service, after and hour had passed from the time it was supposed to deliver I called to find out where our order was, the person on the other end of the phone recapped our order, I said yes that is correct and they proceeded to ask if we still wanted it. At this point I was so mad, I just told them to forget it we would go out and get something to eat, oh yeah and that was valentines day. Lastly, I was there for a conference and I had arranged for a car service to take us and some of my extremely important customers out to dinner in one of their vehicles, which was to be charged to my room. The driver took us to the restaurant and gave me his card and said just give me a call 30 minutes before you are ready to go and I will come pick you all up (there were 7 of us). Okay thank you no problem as we had just done this same exercise with another driver the previous night with no problem. Well this night when I called the driver he tells me he is now over an hour away and he can't come pick us up we will have to find our own way back to the Waldorf! Are you kidding me? Are these the type of people the Waldorf associate themselves with and have represent them? Needless to say I was so angry and embarrassed in front of my customers and had to get in some horribly dingy cab to get back to out hotel. Luckily the conference is not going to be held at the Waldorf again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: ladybug5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 30th Anniversary at the Waldorf Orlando. We were upgraded to a deluxe suite with Disney view so we could watch the fireworks from Disney and Epcot everynight. The hotel offers bus transportation to each of the four parks and down town disney. The service at this hotel is exceptional. Our room was over 900 square feet with a bath and a half which made it easy for two people to get ready at the same time. Our first evening we ordered room service. The filet was exceptional as were the ceasar salads and desert of angel food cake and ice cream. There golf course was just beautiful and usually quite empty. My only complaint would be the hotels location. You are a little isolated and there are no stores around that carry any kind of sundry items.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, though pricey hotel”
Reviews.Author: Popovova
Reviews.Content: Overall the rooms are outstanding, well-decorated, fresh smelling, and impeccably maintained. The beds are very comfortable, though over-done, especially for Florida weather. I've stayed here before, and when I checked in, I was offered an upgrade, but with a delay for availability. Instead, I opted for a ready room, which met my needs. The distances to meeting rooms are long, especially if you are attending a meeting that bridges the Hilton and Waldorf properties. Service was very good, with a smiling face always greeting me throughout the property. The only minor gripe was a 10 minute wait to check out. I would have preferred a bill under my door and simply leaving without a stop at the front desk. I'll happily return on a future visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service!”
Reviews.Author: V B
Reviews.Content: Brought my young family to this world class service. We travelled for pleasure. It was truly amazing, awed in many ways. I suggest this hotel to any family and all depends on what you are looking for. We wanted to get pampered and relax, spending a day at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A top pick in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to visit Orlando, specifically Harry Potter world, for our second anniversary. We decided to use points as I am a Hilton Diamond. The Waldorf's location is great as it is off the main roads and overlooks the Disney parks and beautiful golf course. The parking was valet only and easy but you were required to pay additional for it. Upon arrival, the bellhop greeted us, grabbed our bags, and ushered us inside. The front desk immediately assisted us and let us know we were being upgraded. We headed upstairs to find the room was wonderful! They had a personalized card that wished us Happy Anniversary along with Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Our room seemed very large with the living room and wet bar area being separated from the bedroom. The bathroom was very nice and spacious also. We spent one day just at the pool which was very nice. They brought you two towels when you picked our a chair. The first towel was put over your chair and it had a pocked on the top that kept it from falling! What a great idea! We ordered food and drinks while at the pool. The drinks and food were pretty good and reasonably priced considering you are at a high end resort. Overall, the stay was first class and perfect for an anniversary weekend! Would definitely burn through some points and come back again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my fav. hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: Angelita d
Reviews.Content: I visited Orlando last July for a weekend get-away as one of my fav. bands, Mana, was on concert here. The Waldorf Astoria proved to be an excellent choice! I had booked this hotel + flight on Expedia and we got a great deal. Moreover on my 1st morning there, boy was I impressed to see the hotel had slipped a welcome note under the door, giving my friends and I a $50/ room / day credit to use towards any of the hotel services. That was a $150 credit per room for our 3-night stay! I used mine for an awesome facial at the fabulous hotel spa. My friends used theirs for breakfast on the terrace by the pool. Very nice ;) The hotel rooms, pool, and grounds are a delight to the eyes. And I had only booked their basic 2-double beds room -- I can only imagine how nice the other rooms must be ;) The hotel attendants by the pool chase you around to give you towels and drinks. I found the hotel service to be very friendly and yet not invasive in any way. I look forward to returning to this hotel at the earliest opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the Waldorf Name”
Reviews.Author: maltamark
Reviews.Content: Granted my experience with this hotel is for a large conference, but I have been to many conferences in my career and this one is probably the worst in terms of hotel service, especially for a 5-star hotel and one with the Waldorf Astoria name. First, you have to ASK for nearly everything here. Almost nobody from the housekeepers to the pool staff to the banquet servers can anticipate your needs. Once you do ask, the wait is inordinate to the request. For example, after FOUR nights here already, the housekeepers have not replaced a single amenity (eg, soap). We called down before dinner and asked for more soap. We returned to the room and it wasn't left. We called more than 20 minutes ago, still no soap. Good luck getting a towel or a drink by the pool. The banquet food, for the most part, is horrible. By large consensus, our group had the worst steak of our lives the other night at a group dinner. Completely inedible. Perhaps they should bring down some managers and staff from New York to train the staff here how to run a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was amazing”
Reviews.Author: Best4Less
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the finest staff I have seen, the decor was very impressive. The pricing was fair based on the type of place it was. Very helpfull in every detail of our stay. Excellent experience all around, you will not be dissapointed...

Reviews.Title: “Not a stay, but an experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sam S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for a wedding and we "had" to stay a the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando. The experience was top notch begening with the greeter at the door asking to take our luggage up to the room. The front desk was simply friendly, not over-the-top either, she just seemed like she was sincerely happy to have us there. Even gave us champagne check-in!!! (after 4:00pm) She gave us a quick overview of the amazing amenities and a quick tour of the lobby always referring to us by Mr. & Mrs lastname. The bellman was also very nice greeting us by our names before we introduced ourselves. Took our luggage up to the room and explained where everything was should we need anything. The room was very nice, with the most comfortable bed i've slept in for a long time. Quiet all around, nice glass door showers. Even provided slippers by the bed every night! We also tried their buffet breakfast which was superb with plenty of variety to meet the highest breakfast standards. Kudos on the Salmon! I would definitely return if given the chance. The entire team at the Waldorf Orlando is sincerely the best i've experienced

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fabulous Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Pat_C
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from Orlando less than a week ago. On this trip, we decided to hotel hop as we have had some less than favorable hotel experiences in Orlando in the past and wanted to explore the many hotel options available. The Waldorf Astoria is definitely a WINNER !!!! Everything about our experience there was GREAT !!!! Check-in, Valet Parking, the Pool, Room Service EVERYTHING was just FANTASTIC!!! The lobby was beautiful and smelled so clean and fresh. Check-in was a breeze. The pool was big and clean. The food in the hotel delicious. The room was immaculate. The bathroom was huge and equipped with a separate tub and stand up shower. I was a little hesitant in booking at first because I read some reviews where customers felt cheated on their bills or felt that they were "nickeled and dimed" by the hotel. This did not happen to me at all. My bill was accurate and depicted the charges that applied to the purchases I made. I would recommend this hotel and will most definitely stay at the Waldorf Astoria again. My children and husbance wished we wouldve stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “the room was great”
Reviews.Author: ron w
Reviews.Content: it was the best hotel I have stayed at but the parking was the worst , the room had slippers and robes for me and my wife and clean with tv,s in each room great view of Disney wow this is a room a good choice ! you cant lose !worth the money .

Reviews.Title: “It can't get better than this.”
Reviews.Author: Flyaway9699
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5 pm after having spent 3 frustrating nights at the Ritz Carlton in Palm Beach to find our rooms were not ready. However, unlike the Ritz, the Waldorf Astoria staff member made an apology and gave an understandable explanation (the previous guests had not left in a timely fashion). More impressively they offered us an actual room to relax in while we waited for our rooms to be ready - a truly classy move. As well, we were given vouchers for drinks and that evening warm cookies and mild were delivered to our room compliments of the hotel with a written apology. After that there was no looking back. Sometimes it is how an establishment deals with the challenges that sets it apart. There is no question, this is one of the very best hotels we have stayed in and we have traveled extensively. The service is impeccable, with a smile and true desire to make your stay as fabulous as it can be. The beds are dreamy, the rooms are large enough (we had a suite with two rooms and a living room between) the view of the fireworks a real treat, the in-room Nespresso machine was much appreciated and the spa was one of the nicest I have had the pleasure of enjoying. Our package came with breakfast vouchers and we took advantage of the buffet breakfast each morning which fueled us for a full day of park hopping. Even with the NBA All Stars game in town and a large conference at the Hilton - which is attached - the service did not decline. The hotel was buzzing with activity and the presence of staff members available to deal with your every question and concern just seemed to increase with the activity. Although the pools are less populated by children than the Hilton, they are lovely and my children and I just walked over to the Hilton when we wanted a ride down the 'lazy river'. The pools are shared between the two hotels. All in all a spectacular hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Divine pleasures come to those that stay at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Lmdcj
Reviews.Content: A truly amazing hotel. Definitely worth it's ratings. Staff were excellent and very attentive to every need. The Peacock Alley bar is lovely as is the pianist and live music. Wish we had time to go to BB steak lounge definitely on the list for next time. Would recommend getting the Bell Staff to book transport to airport as chauffeurs take you for just an extra $7 compared to taxi. Hotel rooms are gorgeous. We stayed on the 15th floor the lounge was lovely, the ammenities great and the beds were divine. The staff here can't do enough to help you. The pools look lovely as did the hot tub unfortunately we arrived at dusk so never got to use them. The whole resort feels intimate an is truly a lovely place to stay especially if after a romantic escape

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Getaway Spot in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: tounderpar
Reviews.Content: The Bonnet Creek area is actually on the Disney Property. It's a piece of land that Walt could not acquire way back when. This Waldorf is a unique upscale venue in Orlando. It's patterned after Grand Lakes, with the golf course, a small convention area and an adjacent Hilton. All very nice pieces of the property. Of course the Waldorf is truly unique. My wife and I enjoyed a getaway and we were treated exceptionally. The service is some of the very best I've ever experienced and I travel extensively. Service is what sets it apart. It has tremendous restaurants, music and the rooms are on the large side. The golf clubhouse is literally steps from the front door and is very nice; tough, beautiful but fair. Adjacent Hilton is exceptional too; more of a family style pool. My wife said the spa was among the best she's ever been too; again service set it apart from other spa experiences. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PMM12
Reviews.Content: We had a suite facing Epcot to watch the fireworks at night which was well worth the price. Room service food was excellent, the entire suite, kitchen and bathrooms were spotless and everyone we encountered on the staff was professional and welcoming. Proximty to the Magic Kingdom was superb. If you are travelling with children I think the Hilton next door is a better fit but my kids loved the hotel there just were no other children at the pool. Also the business center is located at the Hilton so if you are expecting a FedEx or need other ammenities you need to go next door to the Hilton. The shuttle service was also very good but the ride home from the magic Kingdom will run you 40 minutes as the shuttle bus stops at other parks for Waldorf and Hilton guests. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Taylor L
Reviews.Content: I loved the Waldorf Astoria! My husband and I came in for our 1 year anniversary and it was to die for! Upon check in they realized that we were on an anniversary vacation and they immediately upgraded us to a suite. The view was amazing. Each staff member that we came in contact with greeted us by name and knew that it was our anniversary. We also received chocolate covered strawberries and champagne in our room. The restaruants at the hotel were sumply superb. The best of all was the Aquamarine pool bar. The staff was extrememly genuine and always smiling. Certain individuals that we would like to point out are Ryan, Shanna, Bridgett and Rich. The supervisor and manager, Ali and Cheryl, were also great and attentive. Thanks so much Waldorf, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “True to its reputation in service and price.”
Reviews.Author: arniejj
Reviews.Content: The expectation is superior service and attention to detail by the staff in every regard. We traveled with our 3 young children (10,9, & 7). They enjoyed the pool since they were 3 of 5 children there our entire stay. The neighboring Hilton on the other hand had a water slide and lazy river, which we ended up spending a good part of the day at. Fortunately they are next to each other so getting there was easy, either on the path outside or through the halls of the convention center. Though there were kids at the hotel, it is not designed for kids nor do I think it encouraged. The Hilton next door would have been a better and probably cheaper option for our family of 5. I won't knock the Waldorf though, coffee and tea in the lobby was nice as well as your selection of newspapers. Parking was a bit of a pain, when you're relegated to $20/day valet parking. Nonetheless, this is the expectation when you stay at a place like this. The common areas were well maintained and the restaurants seemed delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth visit since 2009 and the Waldorf's standards haven't dropped!”
Reviews.Author: FAMURattler
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Waldorf for a week long family vacation to Disney World. This is my fifth time visiting the hotel since it opened since 2009, and I can honestly say that the standards of this hotel are just as high in 2012 as they were during the grand opening in 2009. The staff is wonderful, the room service is excellent/prompt, and the hotel is immaculate! Nicola and the rest of the staff always go out of their way to add little special touches to our stay. This is a hotel that knows how to treat it's regular guests. A great alternative to the Disney Deluxe resorts or an alternative for those wanting a more "adult" Orlando experience. No complaints - this is a true 5 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Where Grown Ups Want to Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Kerigrace
Reviews.Content: After three nights in a Universal hotel it was a welcome relief to pull up to the valet at the Waldorf. Everyone there is friendly, helpful and informed. We arrived at noon and our room (suite) was ready for an early check in. Everything is so clean and beautiful and air conditioned. Our room was comfortable and spotless. The sheets, towels and pillows were perfect. Let me reiterate, after staying at a "park" hotel, which is a little like camping, this hotel was indeed vacation. The kids were thrilled that we could walk over to the Hilton and play in their pool with the water slide and lazy river. The golf course has a great place for lunch. There's a shuttle to the Disney parks. Downtown Disney has free parking and it was a 5 minute drive (almost nothing) from the hotel. We took the girls to Cirque du Soleil for a 6pm show and then had room service for dinner at 8pm while we watched a movie. I would highly recommend this hotel. If you need to bring the kids to Disney, but still want a civilized experience - stay at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Went out of their way to be superb!”
Reviews.Author: lillious
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked the Hilton next door but thought I had booked the Waldorf. The staff changed our reservation to the Waldorf quickly and were so nice about it! Our room was very comfortable and the decor beautiful. We had stayed here shortly after they opened 2 years ago and were anxious to return. We took advantage of the free transport to Epcot and it was great. Very friendly bus driver who also put in a Disney movie for the young children riding along. Although there is no coffee machine in the room there is a coffee station in the main lobby every morning-free. This is an awesome property and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great swimming pools, service but didn't get requested room”
Reviews.Author: perlani
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property - we loved the swimming pools, comfy bed and luxurious bathroom. Great service - we got extra blankets and toothbrushes quickly. The customer service always picked up on the first ring. The buffet breakfast at Oscar's was to die-for! Truly the best breakfast I've had anywhere. It seemed to have good conference facilities and it was convenient for me because my conference was there. Downsides - Tripadvisor reviews suggested in getting a high room with a view of DIsney to watch the night fireworks. So when I made the reservation, I made this room request. This was 3 months in advance, and then I called a month in advance to confirm the room request, and then called a day before arrival to confirm. At checkin at 3pm - they said they sorry but they did NOT have my requested rooms available! We got a low room, inside corner rooms with no view. Second downside - unreliable Hertz car rental office. The hotel is connected to the Hilton (Waldorf Astoria is part of Hilton) and we reserved a rental car to go to the Kennedy Space Station. We went to pick up the car in the morning and..no car. They said for us to wait and they would get the car from the other location. 2 hours later of waiting in the lobby? No car. The Hertz office simply did not know where the car was. We missed our lunch with the astronauts as a result. The hotel concierge was not helpful and could not find alternative transportation, other than telling me that I could book a car service for $170 each way. Thirdly - this hotel is not convenient for those wanting to go to Disney because it is not one of the Disney properties and you can't get to the DisneyWord/Epcot directly. You have to take the shuttle to the central parking place, and then take a Disney monorail/boat. In our case, we kept missing the shuttle, so had to take a cab to the parking place, and then wait for the Disney monorail/boat. We had gone to DisneyWorld in the morning and wanted to go home in the afternoon and play in the pool with the plan of going back to Disney for the fireworks, but it took so long to get back to the hotel - wait for the boat/monorail, wait for the shuttle - that we didn't end up going back to Disney later.

Reviews.Title: “Adult Luxury Next Door to Disney”
Reviews.Author: kelting
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent two nights at the Waldorf/Orlando enjoying grown-up activities while our brother and his family visited Disneyworld. As a Hilton honors member I expected the upgrades, etc, but was pleasantly surprised by the beautiful decor and wonderful dining options. For a resort hotel in this location, it's a lot better than it needs to be. Our suite was on the top floor, with a view toward the city of Orlando (Florida being flat,you could see it pretty well); the beds were very comfortable, and the small balcony and marble bath were treats. Only one sink, but we coped. We had dinner at The Bull and Bear restaurant, named for the original in NY, and were amazed at both the quality of food and service; an experience to rival a great New York steakhouse. Breakfast the next morning was something of a disappointment; the large dining room was crowded and the service (we opted for the menu rather than the scrum around the buffet) was slow. But that one experience aside, the Waldorf lived up to its name. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kpyoink
Reviews.Content: we kicked off our honeymoon here and it was a great start. room was spacious and clean, staff were helpful and attentive. breakfast buffet was included and was excellent, well organised with a huge amount of food on offer. good location and transport for disney.

Reviews.Title: “What a JOKE!”
Reviews.Author: rob s
Reviews.Content: this place is class in name only. Food and beverage staff are horrible and the hotel general manager will not even respond to complaints. Bills are inaccurate and they try and hide charges everywhere. Would never stay at this below average place and certainly would warn anyone planning an event here to go next door to the Wyndham where you will be taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: hammad413
Reviews.Content: I travel at least seven or eight times in the year. Usually I am fortunate enough to stay at some pretty nice locations. I can say that this hotel is the nicest hotel that I have stayed at in recent memory. Everything from the lobby to the room to the landscape of the property was perfect. Can not think of one negative thing to say. Loved the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Scgurl185
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymoond to Walt Disney World. We decided because it was our Honeymoon to stay at the Waldorf all week. While it is a beautiful hotel the service was a little much. Everyone was soo nice, but I guess you are paying for the ambience. We don't mind opening our own door etc. But I guess when you go somewhere like that it's nice to be treated like royalty. There are a lot of good things about the Waldorf. They have a bus that they share with the Hilton (which we'll prob. stay at next time.) that takes you to Downtown Disney, Epcot, Magic Kingdom, Hollywood Studios and the Animal Kingdom. The room service is great and the rooms are lovely. You can tell that a lot of the times the staff isn't treated with the upmost respect from the guests. We probably wouldn't stay again but it's a nice place to stay for a special occassion.

Reviews.Title: “Top flight hotel but breakfast at Oscar's needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: drhealth22102
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria in Orlando is a very good hotel. The front desk staff during the day are very nice. Late at night, the front desk staff is so so. I paid $500/night for a king suite. In the future, I would choose a king room for $300. Even though I booked thought Amex platinum, I did not receive an upgrade. I got a room on the third floor overlooking the roof. The interior was very nice. The room had 2 plasma tvs and the bathroom was large. The bar, peacock alley had excellent servers and a very nice atmosphere. Breakfast at Oscar's was so so. The hostesses are very kind. Jose was our waiter the first day. He was the best employee at the hotel. He engages you in intelligent conversation and remembers your name the next day. The server the next day was slow and subpar. His "my pleasure" sounded so fake. The carpet and furniture at Oscar's was garrish. It looked like a crummy Hilton. A lot of the other wait staff and omelette chefs were space cadets. Overall, we had a good stay, but not worth $500/night. They have attentive staff, but still not worthy of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Depends on what you need in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: angmohgao
Reviews.Content: You should stay at the Waldorf if you are: -- On a business trip and want to avoid the family crowds -- A wealthy baby boomer looking for luxury -- With a date looking for elegant romance -- A golfer If you have kids or want a more casual environment, stay at the Hilton next door. Location This is as close as you can get Disney without staying with Disney. It's close to all the Disney attractions including Downtown Disney. It is also easily accessible from I-4 exit 67. Price Rooms typically run $149-250 which is a real deal for an upscale hotel. Food There are two main restaurants in the hotel. The Bull & Bear is a super expensive steak house. Oscars is the hotel cafe where breakfast is $28. If you want more variety stay at the Hilton next door. Room tip -- if you stay on the side of the building over the Bull & Bear (even on a high floor) expect to smell charred steak during your stay. Room Rooms are large and well equipped in modern elegance. They have all the usual electronic amenities and Ferragamo toiletries. Pool/Spa High end luxurious spa. There are two pools. One of them is designed for kids but I've never seen any there. The pools are quiet -- perfect if you want to just relax and read a book. If you're looking for family fun or a festive atmosphere, you can take the long walk (or ride) to the Hilton pool which includes a lazy river. Lobby Gorgeous. A modern interpretation of the classic. Upscale yet accessible and artistic. The lobby bar is large with music. In February they have a gourmet chocolate bar. Valet Super fast and friendly. Very professional. They keep cars moving and you feel like a VIP. Service Overall excellent. Housekeeping was discreet, polite and thorough. Check in was fast and friendly. Check out was a horrible chaotic mess. There were about 50 people waiting for four check out counters. All the while there were hotel staff standing in the lobby with nothing to do. Check out was an absolutely horrible ending to an otherwise quality stay. HHonors No HHonors benefits even for Diamond members. No upgrade, no free breakfast. They do give free wifi however. With no perks it feels like you're an outsider. It's not the same as other Hilton hotels. Very disappointing when you would expect a higher level of service. Still can't understand why the perks are fewer the higher you go up the food chain at the Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip and Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melissa408
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently went to the Waldorf Astoria for a long weekend and I have to say I wish I could have stayed for a week. The staff was extremely attentive, the room was large and beautiful, and the overall atmosphere was amazing. There is a clear sense that the staff enjoys working there and cares about the service they provide. I will definately be back to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: itbe
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando was OUTSTANDING! The service was personal, kind, attentive and best of all the staff were truly GENUINE! The housekeeping is excellent. Thank you Monica!! I have severe allergies and the housekeeping were understanding and helpful. The concierge, Michelle, is a great girl and helped with our allergy issues. She also wished our youngest a happy Birthday with a cupcake! Room Service kindly sent waffles and Miguel, from the front desk, sent a stuffed bear to wish our youngest a wonderful birthday! We felt valued as guest and they treated us like royalty. Thanks to the entire team! The rooms are beautifully appointed, and very clean. We are looking forward to our next visit in the Excellent Waldorf Astoria Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Just. . . Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne W
Reviews.Content: The hotel, the grounds, the pool, and the resturants were amazing. The room was fantastic and the cleaning staff was exceptional. But what really put it over the top for us was the staff! Everywhere we went the staff managed to exceed our expectations. My favorite was at check-in, my husband casualy mentioned that it was our anniversary and within the hour, a lovely bottle of wine and a hand written note appeared in our room while we were in the gym. Really outstanding stay! I would highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marnsala
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Waldorf Orlando. Stayed in a 1 br suite with balcony. Paid a little extra and got breakfast included, great buffet each day. They had good AAA deals, not cheap but given it's a fancy hotel not crazy expensive. Staff were amazing, very helpful and friendly. Room was clean and nice (checked, no bugs). Bathroom: huge. Would have been nice to have had 2 bathrooms as I have had in other one bedroom rentals. Bed was comfortable. Our 2 yr old slept on the fold out sofa, was pretty comfy too. The pool is large and shallow (3-4 ft deep) and guests are able to use the hilton pool too, it has a lazy river and it's a few steps away. Ate at the restaurant in Hilton one night, Luce, was really good. Try the pudding for dessert, apparently it has facebook friends. The hotel is used a lot for conferences so the pool is empty most of the time. It was quiet, not a lot of other families. Pool restaurant is good too. I would stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Just Keeps Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: This was not our first trip to the Waldorf and it will not be our last. We take advantage of the Florida Resident rate when we go, and local residents should do the same. I simply do not think one can find a better hotel for the money in the heart of Disney (specifically, the EPCOT area). At check in, we found a butler behind us holding a tray of complimentary glasses of champagne. How's that for service? We were staying with a friend and the front desk was kind enough to obtain rooms that were close together (not next door, but close enough). What can I say about this hotel that the others haven't said? It's just downright luxurious. Everything, from the service to the food to the ambiance, is bar none. In fact, we made the mistake of going offsite for dinner on our first night and decided that driving elsewhere is simply not worth it. The food at the Waldorf is just sublime. We found out that one can walk all the way from the Waldorf to the sister property, the Hilton, with ease so next time we MAY try the dining options there. The Bull and Bear is a special dining event. The service is impeccable as well as the food. Don't leave without trying the creme brulee. Book a reservation though as they fill up, and dress a bit snazzier for this place. Breakfast at Oscar's is also wonderful. They have a wide selection of fresh fruit and veggie juices as well as wheatgrass shots available. It is nice to see healthier options like house-made pistachio granola, but what else would one expect at the Waldorf?? Grabbing a cappucino at Peacock Alley and sitting on the 2nd floor balcony just outside the bar, watching the morning go by, was worth every penny we invested in this place. Just go!

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Lovemygirltime
Reviews.Content: The lobby and bar area are modern and fresh. The pool area is beautiful with great food, drink and towel service.The rooms are refreshingly nice and the bathrooms are beautiful with a separate tub for soaking! I had a massage at the spa and enjoyed their steam room and shower as well. Loved it! I also ordered room service twice and it came right away. No complaints at all except for the service at the Bull and Bear steakhouse. Reservations at 730, appetizers didnt get to our table until after 9. It was a long long dinner. I hate to be rushed through a meal but this was agonizingly slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: Crhino
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a week at Waldorf in Orlando and we really enjoyed the hotel and the service. Pleasant and polite service throughout, The rooms were clean and comfortable. We used the shuttles daily to get to various parks and they ran reliably and on time every day. We have really found that the Waldorf properties are all excellent and we generally now look for them whenever we travel.

Reviews.Title: “I keep going back!”
Reviews.Author: volunteerstate
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Orlando for 15 years, and this hotel is one of the nicest I have experienced in the Orlando area. The service was sincere and friendly. It was especially refreshing not to be "nickeled and dimed" to death. The lobby bar is a great setting.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I begin?!”
Reviews.Author: Victor R
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Waldorf Astoria Orlando, I have been loyal to the Waldorf=Astoria and The Towers of the Waldorf=Astoria in New York. I live in Tampa, therefore always make the drive back home, but I decided to stay in MCO this time around. I was there for two nights in December, I feel bad it's taken me this long to write a review about how amazing the property is. While the entire staff is great, my hat goes off to Nicki Gonda, but ESPECIALLY to Michelle Maynard. I had various special requests on which Michelle truly outdid herself. She has such a passion for what she does it makes me feel great she is part of the Waldorf Astoria team, what an asset!!!!!!!!! The hotel grounds are kept impeccable, room was one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in, Oscar's was Oscar's, delicious!!!!---Upon check-out I decided it definitely wasn't a goodbye or a farewell, but an I'll see you later. I can't wait to be check-in again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic (again)”
Reviews.Author: alan m
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Waldorf after a two week stay stay and we are already planning our next trip. I have worked all my adult life in the hotel industry and this Hotel has everything. On arrival my wife and I and our 18yo were greeted warmly, and told we were being upgraded to a suite which was superb, quality furniture, lovely bathroom and an excellent balcony overlooking the wonderful golf course. We had complimentary wine on arrival and a fridge full of complimentary sodas, which my daughter took full advantage of. The hotel is immaculate, Peacock alley the main lounge bar is brilliant you can relax with the excellant piano player through the week or the equally good band at the weekend. The cocktail waitresses were brilliant very professional and nothing was too much trouble. My 18yo loved it here as she could take advantage of the free wifi too keep in touch back home. Breakfast was great at the hotel was great(especially as BA holidays provided us with free vouchers) great selection of fruit, pastries an omelette station, cheese, meats and a hot buffet, the chef even prepared fresh juices every day, my favourite was apple and pomegranite. I played golf on the wonderfull Rees Jones course but it was very busy with a conference staying. Very slow play but I still enjoyed myself. My family and I cannot wait to return to the Waldorf

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo C
Reviews.Content: Overall great property. we have visited several times and consistently good.

Reviews.Title: “Good service with some hiccups”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFr0mMaryland
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very nice experience. We celebrated my daughter's birthday. Service was very good. Food was excellent and very expensive. However, on one occasion when we came back from Universal studios at about 5 pm we found houskeeping still cleaning our room. We said no problem we would be back in 15 minutes. Then as I was trying to take shower I discovered that there was no shampoo or conditioner. I called reception and waited and then called again. At that point we did not have much time left before dinner so my husband went downstairs to buy shampoo at the gift shop. Houskeeping arrived with shampoo and conditioner as I was finishing to dry my hair, about 35 minutes after I first requested it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great food/beverage/staff”
Reviews.Author: Ken F
Reviews.Content: I recently did a 5 day business trip at the Waldorf-Astoria Orlando...what a great visit. The property and the guest suite a nice balance between luxury and polished, yet modern and comfortable. Particular thanks and recognition to the wait staff at the outdoor pool bar/restaurant: Andrew, Bridgett, Shanna - you rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLEEUNDERWOOD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with family. We had a suite and another room which was connected to the suite. Everything at the hotel is top-notch, including the people that work there. The staff has got to be the most friendly and knowledgeable i've ever seen at a hotel. The breakfast buffet is awesome, especially the bakery selection that is made fresh every morning. My only negative comment would be that if you get a suite, be prepared to wake up early, depending on who is above you, to the sound of the furniture being moved on the tile. They need to put moleskin on the bottom of the chairs as it is really loud when someone moves a chair. The remaining positives of the hotel more than makeup for that one minor negative. I would totally recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: cburley
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this property in late December 2011 while in the area for a quick Disney getaway. We typically stay at the higher end Disney resorts and thought that this time we would try the Waldorf. It proved to be a great decision! The physical location, on Bonnet Creek, a fair distance from the Magic Kingdom, is far outweighed by the superb service and comfort that one finds at the property. The Waldorf shares beautiful grounds with a Hilton and the two are connected by an underground walkway. Guests can utilize amenities in both hotels. Upon arrival we were greeted by valets and bell staff who graciously secured our vehicle and transported our belongings. Check-in was a prompt, efficient affair and we were soon off for a guided tour of the lobby area and an overview of services available. Elevator service was consistently prompt and the cabs were found to be spotless. We were sold a king suite with balcony. As expected, the rooms were spacious, spotless and had exceptional service to match. The sofa bed for our children was of the Tempurpedic variety and the housekeeper who prepared it each day was a simply a joy to speak with. The bath area was immaculately clean and well stocked with amenities one would expect at this price point. The pool area is a gem with spectacular service to match. It offered a nice respite from the crowds in the parks. The breakfast buffet was simply a "must do". Stunning presentation and food offerings combine with superb service to provide a great start to each day. Given our schedule we did not have the opportunity to enjoy lunch and dinner service at the property. Check-out was flawless and bell/valet service was stellar. Admittedly, a few more days at the Waldorf would have been just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fortunate for me that every place else was booked...”
Reviews.Author: Maconmerlyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here b/c everything else was booked...had stayed at the Hilton 2 years ago and was very impressed, but the Waldorf was truly next level...For less than $250, I stayed in a monster sized room complete w/ a balcony, living area w/ table for 4, sofa etc, and a very large bathroom. The room was clean and quiet and the staff prompt and attentive. In short, I was extremely disappointed that I arrived late and had to leave early. This was the most impressive property that I've stayed in when traveling to Orlando, and that includes stays at the JW and the Ritz. It's restaurant, the Bull and Bear, was also terrific and I will review separately.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable luxury in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Travelerwithkids65
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel with a great staff. It has everything you would expect at a luxury hotel, but then the service and attention to detail by the whole staff is what makes this even more impressive. We arrived early on a Friday for a long weekend and our room had been upgraded. Ask for the Disney view suites high floors so you can enjoy the fireworks from the parks on your balcony! (only a few rooms have the balcony but it is worth the extra cost). Breakfast at the restaurant was great even though it is pricey. Kids enjoyed the pools and you have full access to the Hilton pool which has a great Lazy River and slides for the kids. Awesome firepits for those chilly nights and you are literally a few minutes from Downtown Disney and all the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Lamole6393
Reviews.Content: Close to the parks but far enough away from the crowds to be able to relax. We booked a room with a Magic Kingdon veiw .We booked via the fine hotels and resorts program of platinum express card and got an upgrade to a suite looking at Magic Kingdom! Great for watching the Epcot fireworks. Being a new hotel the rooms were perfectly fitted and very much a first class feel to the place. The valet parking was not great, rather expensive and not particulary effcient. We did leave the hotel that much but each time it took a long time to get the car. The mandotory charge but a little steep for the service received. Apart from the valet the staff were very efficient and accomadating. Only downside is the food and beverage options are very expensive. Even more expensive than the Boca Raton Resort (also a Waldorf). The cost for breakfast was included for 2 in our rate but it was still $25 for my 7 year old to have the buffet.If we had not booked a rate including breakfast we would not have paid the $35 per adult plus tax and tip. The hotel does connect to the Hilton next door which has some nice restaurant options, but again very expensive; three bowls ( one for a 7 year old) of pasta and one glass of wine cost us $100. They had no formal kids menu which I thought odd for a Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to move in.”
Reviews.Author: keschpo
Reviews.Content: Stayes at the Waldorf for a conference and from the minute I walked in I was relaxed. The staff is lovely and even had a small welcome gift. The room was well appointed and luxurious. I had a great night sleep. Being a New Yorker it is hard to compare the Bull and Bear to the original. Usually end up picking at the food at conferences however, the food served was outstanding. Wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy the pool and grounds. Would love to come back for a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to welcome 2012!”
Reviews.Author: TeamHayes
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a luxurious, relaxing way to ring in the New Year and we found that at the Waldorf in Orlando. Having not been big fans of Orlando's Ritz Carlton (a bit too stuffy) we were unsure as what to expect at the WA. From the moment we arrived, the staff was welcoming, warm, and gracious. From dropping off the car curbside to having our reservations being exactly as asked (including the wonderful extras from American Express) to being escorted to the elevators after a tour of the lobby, our impression within the first 15 minutes was that we had found that great place where luxury meets comfort in a hotel. Our room was beautiful, with a view of the Disney Parks fireworks and also the fireworks provided by the hotel for the holiday weekend. The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, and the bathroom was well-stocked with fluffy towels and robes. We made good use of the gym, which was one of the most complete of any hotel gym we have visited. It was well-equipped and ventilated with lots of space for personalized workouts. The only negative for us was the mandatory valet parking. The team did a great job with the car, but because we did a lot of coming and going, it was a bit tiresome to not be able to get our own vehicle. That said, I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends looking for a special getaway in the Orlando area, and I hope we can come up with another occasion soon to justify the splurge:).

Reviews.Title: “Superb in EVERY way”
Reviews.Author: kellyinak
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a total of 6 nights. Everything about this hotel is perfect however you pay the price. There is no parking at this hotel. Expect to pay an extra $20 per day for valet parking. The hotel front desk staff are friendly and helpful. The interior of this hotel, magnificent! I would suggest renting a car if you stay at this hotel. The restaurants are expensive and had we taken a shuttle to this hotel, we would have been disappointed. If you have a view of the pool, be ready to see the Disney World fireworks at 9pm from your room. I would stay here every time I came to Orlando, if I could afford to. The extra touches made this hotel the best. Their complimentary turn down service is something I will never forget. A little note on your bed with delicious chocolates make for sweet dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality”
Reviews.Author: Floridagator
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel. Great views. Ask for view of Magic Kingdom. Be warned, more kids than your usual Waldorf. Very kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: CCHLondon
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel - great service and location, lovely big rooms and a fine view of disney. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, first class.”
Reviews.Author: rdklomp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Disney World half marathon last year and it was absolutely awesome. The hotel steakhouse was sensational with excellent service. The breakfast buffet was incredible and I highly recommend lunch as well. The golf course looks amazing and I wished golf was on our to do list but not that trip. They upgraded us to a suite and it was absolutely incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - second time around”
Reviews.Author: AtlantanITP
Reviews.Content: Big comfortable rooms, clean and friendly and helpful staff. Request a room higher up and facing the Disney properties so you can enjoy the fireworks each night. If you can afford it I highly recommend this hotel for your Disney / Orlando visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: EllenBM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night and wished we could have stayed a week! The grounds are lovely, the lobby is beautiful and the suite was incredible. My husband and I travel frequently and we both agreed that this property is one of the nicest we have ever been to. It is on par with Ritz properties and Four Seasons properties. If you have an opportunity to stay here, DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf - just lovely !”
Reviews.Author: lillystu
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay somewhere special and nice for a short family break with my 9 year old & my parents. It was my parents first trip to Orlando & I wanted to stay away from the "typical" Orlando crowd. The Waldorf was perfect! It is quite new & felt special. We did upgrade to a suite - which helps. The beds & pillows were the most comfortable EVER ! If fact we want to buy one !! The bar & resturant is lovely as is the pool area. It is a little further from Disney - but worth it if you want something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “A splurge but well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: jkskip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room for a night away before baby #2 comes, and we knew we wanted to stay somewhere really nice. We narrowed it down between the Waldorf and another hotel, but ultimately chose WA because of their bath tubs. As soon as you walk in, everything looks so beautiful from the doors, to the ceilings and even the furniture. The guest services workers were so friendly, and they upgraded us from a standard room to a delux king with no problem (all I had to do was ask). In addition to being beautiful, the hotel smells so wonderful! It's like they have air freshener coming out of the air conditioning! It was obvious we weren't at just another hotel from the moment we stepped into the elevator, and our room just confirmed that. The carpets were not the basic gross, short berber carpets you usually see: they were champagne colored plush carpet with a flowery design impressed upon them. It made you WANT to take off your shoes! The bed was huge and comfortable thanks to the down mattress cover, down blankets and multiple pillows. There was a couch and beautiful glass and chrome coffee table with magazines to read, as well as a loung chair and ottoman. Our room overlooked the driving range and putting green, unfortunately we didn't have a view of the Disney fireworks though (which is another perk of this hotel). The bathroom was great: huge counter, seperate shower with a rain shower head, and a seperate tub that you could really recline and relax in. All in all, if you want 5 star and can't afford the Ritz, you can't go wrong at the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: The WA Orlando is new, beautiful, and located within minutes of each Orlando area Disney park. The staff is incredible, easily living up to a Five Diamond caliber. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are spectacular. Every detail is considered, from complimentary shoe shining, to Voss water available in the room, to plush robes and top end bath products. The lobby is fabulous and the pools are very attractive. The hotel is meticulously clean with pure white glove service. This is the best WA I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon34438
Reviews.Content: I just came back last night and would definitely go back. Clean, spacious rooms and the service was exceptional. Keep up the good work Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “The best of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Fer13
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING!!! What a wonderful time we spend at such an incredible place!! It was 5 star and then some! The rooms were beautiful, the grounds were beautiful and the dining was superb. We had dinner at Bull & Bear...It was FABULOUS!!! We took in the amenities including the gym and we were pampered all the way. When I come back, this is definitely where I will be staying!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: sagekat
Reviews.Content: Nice place for Disney stay. Property is clean, modern. Room was spacious. Bus to Disney parks was convenient. I would stay here again in the future for family trip or business.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in the middle of WDW !”
Reviews.Author: UAEFOREX
Reviews.Content: Honestly, the most thing thats make me happy about staying in the Waldorf orlando, is the self satisfaction i had because of it. Since I planned my family trip to disney world and i am planning it since 2009, i read every book you can name and every site you can imagin, and thanks god it was succesful , and the good planning gave my family an excellent relaxing vacation in the middle of the christmas season, for example we never stood on a waiting line on any ride more than 20 min max, and on average it was 5-10 min. And by choosing Waldorf Astoria i felt that i really completed my homework by a home run. it was really great, clean, best of the best customer service, i can write a book on it, but i can give one simple example only and it will summerize the rest : when i reached the hotel after a looooong flight from Dubai, and once i enterd the hotel i found a gentelmann in a suite saying( welcome Mr.Alshareef your room is ready) , my answer was waaaaw thats a new one!, and me and my wife had a great first impression of this great hidden gem, and the whole family enjoyed their best vacation ever in this lovely city orlando with its friendly people and this wonderfull hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holidays done right”
Reviews.Author: becksok
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for four nights between Christmas and new years. Last year we stayed at the Hilton next door and saw the WA and knew we wanted to stay there the next time we were in Orlando. The entire staff from the valet, front desk, poolside help, lobby lounge waitstaff, hotel security, resturant waitstaff, golf course pros, housekeeping, room service staff were great and attentive. Just a great overall hotel with a quite upscale vibe. The hotel is nicely appointed. Not so much that I would be afriad to have my daughter walk around. There are kids but not nearly as many as the Hilton next door. The food is expensive but the selection in the buffet is worth the price. The poolside fireplaces were nice on the chilly nights. I would recommend this hotel for families who want a kid friendly hotel with a focus on adult needs as well. WA guest have full access to all Hilton pool and restruants which is good. We opted to fully enjoy all WA had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Reminds me of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JPang
Reviews.Content: This place reminds me of Vegas. It's not that it's not nice, but everything just seems a bit too big and everything from the service to the hotel finishes is not exactly refined. I haven't seen the other options in Orlando so can't tell how this compares to the competition, but let's just say that this reminds me of a newer, smaller, and slightly better version of the Bellagio in Vegas. The restaurant, Bull & Bear, is quite nice. The gym and swimming pool are also extremely good, probably one of the best that I've seen in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Simple Elegance”
Reviews.Author: FlyaBonanza
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in a deluxe suite with balcony and disney view over the New Years holiday weekend. The hotel is new and immaculate. Our room was spacious and extremely comfortable and quiet with excellent views of the pool, golf course and disney fireworks. We were able to see six different fireworks shows on New Years Eve while lounging in our robes from the comfort of our balcony. Our young children participated in the Waldorf Kids Club, both for the New Years Eve party and during the evening on New Years Day. The kids loved the activities and begged to go back. We spent a lot of time at the pool. The water was crystal clear, clean with no harsh chlorine smells. The pool deck is spotless with plenty of lounge chairs and shade. The pool staff were incredibly attentive and accommodating. We enjoyed the touch of live music with the talented acoustic guitar player. In the late afternoon each day, tables were set up on the pool deck with hot cocoa, smores, hot wassail, whipping cream, peppermint sticks. It was a fabulous sweet treat! As noted by other reviewers, the service at this hotel is unbelievable. EVERY staff person that we encountered said hello, and most acknowledged us by first and last name. The hotel was sold out while we were there and it was so impressive to see the level of professional attentiveness on the part of all employees. The scent throughout the hotel is a fresh light fragrance. The colors are muted neutrals and blues, and the overall feel is smply elegant. We walked to the Hilton a few times. It was loud with lots of kids. There appeared to be a soccer conference underway so there were young families everywhere. We really appreciated the elegance and solitude that the WA exuded the moment we crossed onto its premises. We dined at Oscars for a dinner and breakfast buffet with our children. Again, the service was excellent with special attention paid to the kids. We also dined at Bull and Bear and La Luce (Hilton) sans children. Both meals were exceptional, especially the Bull and Bear. The quality and preparation of food was impeccable. I can't imagine staying at a nicer hotel anywhere near Disney. The WA rivels any higher end Disney property in terms of price, but there is no comparison with respect to the service and quality relative to the value offered at WA. We look forward to returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel in Disney”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked brand new. Rooms clean and large. The hotel is attached to the Hilton (which also looked very nice) so you can use the facilities at either property. The Hilton has a large lazy river and waterslide. The property is very close to Disney. The only negative is that the restaurants are very expensive and so is the breakfast buffet (the buffet did have a great selection).

Reviews.Title: “I hate the Mouse but love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcnz
Reviews.Content: If you go to Orlando for work that is completely unconnected with the Mouse it can be difficult to find a hotel that is not organised around the Disney industry. This hotel fits the bill perfectly. I arrived really late at about 3am (thanks American for going technical at 11pm) and so not surprisingly check in was really simple but also very friendly. I had been upgraded to a large one bedroom suite which was blissful. Wonderfully comfortable bed, great bathroom and a large living/working area. As I had arrived on a Sunday the breakfast restaurant was packed with families but this was the only busy morning. The breakfast was OK but lacking in excitement or adventure. The hotel has very large public spaces which makes it easy to find a quiet spot to read or work in. I had dinner two nights in the signature restaurant. I had to be quite firm with them that just because it was a table for one did not mean I was happy to sit at the bar. The food itself was excellent and the service friendly but exact; no twenty year olds and their casual approach to life intruding here. I used the valet parking and on the first occasion I was handed the keys to my car, which was a rental so I had not really taken that much notice of what it was. As I sat down in the car I suddenly thought "i am sure I don't have a Saab" and hopped out. Sure enough it was not my car. Apart from this they were always very prompt and gave me the correct car. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at Disney again!”
Reviews.Author: joeohl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights starting on December 17th. As a Hilton diamond member, we were upgraded to a king suite (approximately 900 square feet). There was a reception(free beer and wine) for gold and diamond members one evening for guests at both the Hilton and Waldorf. We had a car and did not use the disney transportation. The valet was wonderful. Service at this hotel exceeded our expectations. The Bull and Bear is among the best steakhouses I have ever eaten. We have two kids (11 and 15) and they loved both pools at the Waldorf and Hilton. The hotel is kid friendly, yet it is not crazy like the Disney hotels. I did not play golf but the course looks beautiful. We will stay here every time we go to Universal or Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Luxory escape from Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravWayne_NJ
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two nights at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando during the 2011 Christmas holiday. Resort is perfectly located just outside of the Disney parks and has great access to all major highways. The staff were courteous and friendly and accomodations were top notch. Traveling under the Platinum American Express plan I was upgraded to a suite at check-in and enjoyed all the travel benefits through AMEX. First morning, we took full advantage of the spa and enjoyed the facilities for part of the day. The facilities were clean and provided a relaxing environment to wind down from the excitement of the parks. The golf course was beautiful but we did not have enough time to play but will make an effort on the next trip! Food was average in Oscar's. They do offer a buffet breakfast but between the children and adult guests touching the food items on the buffet we opted to order off the menu each morning rather than taking part in the buffet. Sitting next to the toaster I watched an adult male pick-up several bread options from the basket and put them back with his bare hands. While standing in line people were eating lox and cream cheese and licking their fingers and touching everything! Yes, I'm a bit of a germaphobe and this is not acceptable in a 5 Star resort. Since we had the option we went with ordering off the menu and advise others to do the same! Waldorf needs to manage the buffet better!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Overall, we had a nice experience. Room had a beautiful view of golf course and driving range. The room was spacious and luxorious to please most guests. Overall the resort was well maintained and very clean--one can certainly tell it is a newer property! I would strongly recommend if you are looking for a location that is close to the Disney parks but far enough to give you the sense of a relaxing, luxorious escape--this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place. Absolutely. Except For One Itsy Bitsy Thing....”
Reviews.Author: BluntedHedgehog
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest. As a serial monogamist Disney-ite (someone who plans their jailbreaks as often as possible but recognizes no theme park but The Mouse), I splurge for my 2-4 night holidays here. I've given up on the Disney-owned or sponsored properties after too many Deluxe resorts surprised me with rude/unhelpful staff and shabby housekeeping. But as one of the submerged 99%, going to the Waldorf Astoria felt awkward. Trolling through AAA rates and specials, having available dates so flexible my calendar started looking like a politician's morals, well, it took a bit of persistence and luck to find a price on the HHonors site that the Spouse wouldn't cite as evidence of Irreconcilable Differences. If you're used to trudging up to the Front Desk, exchanging pleasantries and plastic and then nipping off to your room in solitude, the Welcoming Committee at the WA is twelve steps above following the bellman and a Hohner Trumpet Call harmonica below having your own brass band. I was the proud rearguard for Chelsee, my Personal Concierge; Chelsee's personable but awe-inspiring understudy and my Weekend Life Coach/Bellman Steve (or Charlie). This was my escort to my suite-upgrade. I'm only kidding about Steve/Charlie being a Life Coach but he did seem to know more about everything than I did, including which of the four closets in the room held the slippers and how he could smuggle prime rib from the restaurant to my room since it wasn't on the room service menu. I was nearly sorry to see everyone leave since I forgot to ask which of the four remotes in the living area operated what. And Chelsee never made it back with the schedule of theme park shuttle times. But the room, ah, the room. A Sub Zero mini fridge to hold the contents of an oenophile's most ambitious dream, mirrored wet bar, glass dining table, marble floors (and heated, I think, in the bathroom), room to walk anywhere without fear of careening into furniture, glass door to the balcony with a sublime view of Downtown Disney and the Cirque du Soleil building, nearly full-sized Ferragamo toiletries and a separate glass walled shower large enough to wish I hadn't made the trip alone. The bathrobes were a bit disappointing; two part textile thingies that were comfortable enough but didn't really sing with barely restrained decadence. And sadly, nothing I wanted to purchase as a souvenir. Interesting touches such as a brass pull handle on the back of the bedroom desk chair. All the better to avoid soiling and wearing the damask upholstery. And mirabile dictu!-the chair height was ergonomically perfect for computer work! That alone was worth the price of admission. The bed was a lullaby confection of pillows and bolsters and duvet and woven coverlet and there was so much that I gratefully admitted defeat and stood aside while the evening turn-down magician made sense of it all. The towels were beyond compare for softness and size. I've seen bath sheets before but I tied three of these together and was able to comfortably lower myself from the 12th floor to the porte cochere. Part of that statement may contain flexible standards of veracity. So what was the Itsy Bitsy Problem? Well, that's kind of a multi-episode situation. One which would make Basil feel right at home. No, it wasn't a filigreed Siberian hamster in the biscuit box. But of three room service visits, all had glitches ranging from annoying (someone else's jam on the breakfast salt shaker) to the frustrating (requesting the filet mignon to be 'juicy, pink, not shoe leather but not pulsating' and getting a grey dry something that still managed to have terrific flavor) and a midnight snack that lead to an excess of alimentary entertainment. The situation was finally dealt with effectively and without the polite wide-eyed skepticism learnt from steely Risk Management personnel but it wasn't pleasant to run the gauntlet of staff to get to an upper managerial level better able to respond. Let me be very clear: I understand that they've Seen It All and guest service runs a tight race beside loyalty to the corporation. And as a former police officer from one of the more swank areas of South Florida, I know some of the scams hotels have to deal with. They have my sympathy but this one should have been handled without the guest having to plod up the corporate ladder getting callouses from the sandpaper of disbelieving looks. (Ow. Talk about a tortured sentence. Apologies. Caused by reliving the experience.) Will I be going back to the Waldorf Astoria Orlando? In a New York minute. Even if I have to pay rack rate. Will I order room service? Oh, yeah. Oscar's Angel Food Cake was the caloric equivalent of the fireworks over Cinderella's Castle. They both look incredible and you know you can't duplicate the experience anywhere else. And that goes for the entire Waldorf Astoria Experience. Stay tuned for the next visit! **Note to Parents Staying with Children Between the Ages of 5-15: Offer to give the little darlings $1 for every time they hear a staffer use the word 'absolutely'. You have to let them listen in on phone calls, too. Keep at least $25 per child, per day for payment and make sure they don't get the giggles when they're keeping track of the Luxury Language. Oh, and pay no attention to the spoiled families grousing that it takes 20 minutes for the WA bus to take them from EPCOT back to the hotel. Complaining because drinks aren't served and they don't have programmable entertainment in the seatbacks. I have no doubt that when they return home Jeeves or possibly Hobson transported them in the manner to which they were reared.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: sharaf2
Reviews.Content: The hotel entrance was good and the people at reception they treat you nicely. But the breakfast was expensive with less varities and the transportation service to Disney was terrible. There was only one bus each hour and was already full with passengers from neighboring hotel Hilton. For such a five star hotel it is shameful to see that sometimes you and your family needs to stand in the bus. This is against all safety regulation. I was really shocked to see this type of images. Also they use to charge my credit cards without informing us in advance as much as they wanted. Even the day of check out I had plus balance in my account to b refunded by hotel but they charged my credit card unnecessarily amount at that date. I asked them why? They told us it is mistake and computer is charging automatically.

Reviews.Title: “Aquamarine Staff Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TCappa
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review, or ever commented (unless you count a paper comment card) but after my experience at the pool bar, Aquamarine, I was so inspired. Let me preface this by saying first my wife and I had a great experience at the Waldorf Astoria over our intire stay. But what will make us come back was our service at Aquamarine. You don't expect great service at a pool bar, well we didn't, but the staff was exceptional. But the standout was the bartender, Ryan. When we were unsure of what to order, he helped with a wide variety of choices with incredible desciptions. Never once being pushy. And when we returned the next day, he remembered us right down to what we ordered. If you are ever at the Waldorf Astoria in Walt Disney World, stop by the pool and ask for Ryan. You won't be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of excellence”
Reviews.Author: Harry H
Reviews.Content: Harry H: Our experience was delightful at the WA Orlando from beginning to end. We came to the hotel to enjoy the holiday season with family living in the Orlando area. The Disney attractions were not on our radar. What we came to do was rest, relax, read, sleep, eat and entertain family. We all had nothing but praise and will undoubtably return as our plans allow. Our welcome at car arrival was genuine, while our welcome at reception was also filled with warmth. Our personal concierge promptly escorted us to our room, pointing out hotel features. Our room, a king, two room suite was unreal. There was so much space to stretch out, sleep, watch two tvs, and a kitchen area to allow for food and drink preparation for a small army. Room ammenties were luxcuroius. We so enjoyed the master bed and its high qulaity sheets, pillows and mattress. Our bathroom was promptly filled with the extra towels and soaps we requested. The Nespresso coffee machine was a joy. We have one similar at home and delight in its quality. Our room attendents saw to our every need, every day. I used the gym daily and delighted in its cleanliness and most modern equipment. Our experience at Oscars for morning buffet breakfasts was joyful. The food was amazing and we absolutely delighted in the French style baked goods that were both delicious and beautiful to look at. What was especially nice for all hotel guests was the free morning coffee/tea bar in the glorious lobby each morning. Service started at around 6 am and carried on until past 9 am,which was a real plus for all hotel guests. We have been in many 4 & 5 star hotels where this type coffee service is not as abundant. We definitely would return to the wonderful Waldorf property. A return dining experience to the Bull & Bear restaurant would rank as number 1 on our to-do list along with a return to the glorious Gurlain spa. Both are simply that amazing. We look forward to our return to this wonderful property and thank the WA staff for making our holiday weekend so memorable. Thank you.
