(PS--the hotel was a bit difficult to find as signage to the Bonnet Creek Resorts is minimal. I suggest better directionals as one exits I-4 and begins their drive to the WA.)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler212
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. The Waldorf-Astoria Orlando is very impressive. This was my first stay in the Waldorf so can't compare it to any other. The service was top-notch and the room was incredible. The bed was full of comfy sheets and spread. Turndown service was already provided when I got there with Fresh Ice and water available. In addition a rob, slippers and nice classical music was laying across the bed for me as I opened the door. The bathroom was also amazing. It had both a tub and separate shower which you rarely see in hotels these days. The property was clean and well kept and the hotel very fragrant. It shares property, a shuttle and connects to the Hilton Bonnet Creek and there is a nice golf course in between the two. There wasn't anything about this hotel that I didn't like except the fact that I had to leave. I highly recommend the hotel when visiting the Orlando Ara.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best !”
Reviews.Author: 2011MP
Reviews.Content: Very good service. Very clean hotel. Staff were very helpful. The location is very godd. Close to main attractions. Thank you for everything...

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jill G
Reviews.Content: The facilities at the hotel were just as nice as one would expect from a new Waldorf Astoria, but it was really the staff at the hotel which took my recent stay from a simply nice one to a great experience. I literally booked my vacation the same day I left-- Just a few days in the sun to celebrate a work victory. I was a little concerned about traveling on my own for a vacation. I travel a lot for business, but then I'm fully occupied with things to do. As soon as I arrived at the hotel, however, my concerns were put to rest. The bar tender re-opened the recently closed-for-the-evening bar so I could relax on the terrace with a drink. The next morning, the attendant at the gift shop graciously helped me while I tried on every bathing suit in the store and then purchased a hair clip. The concierge then went well above the call of duty helping me get my laptop to function before a conference call and arranged for a car to take me to the best location to find a good bathing suit.... The pool attendant went upstairs to get me maps and schedules of the parks. You get the idea. It wasn't that everyone was just pleasant and courteous. It's that they seemed genuinely kind and concerned that I enjoy everything about my stay. My only complaint is that the food was perfectly passable, but not exceptional,but that the prices were very high for the quality. My room, btw was completely spotless.

Reviews.Title: “NOT "the best of waldorf"”
Reviews.Author: Crissie A
Reviews.Content: We decided to go for the posh waldorf astoria instead of one of the deluxe disney hotels. The hotel itself is very nice and quiet which is a nice change from the disney resorts, HOWEVER, the promised private shuttle service is a joke. It is shared with the enormous Hitlon next door and it took over an hour for us to get home from the Magic Kingdom (not even at a peak time). Also they are understaffed. When we checked out, our bell hop never showed up (gave it 30 mins.) The REQUIRED valet parking is also understaffed and unorganized. It is a zoo when people are checking in. Plus they charge you a parking tax for each day along with the $20 valet fee which is unacceptable. We went with the "BEST OF WALDORF" package. I even called and asked ahead of time inquiring how we could use our $50 a day resort credit , I was told specifically gift shop, spa golf, food and sundries. Well it turns out, by "gift shop and sundries" they meant the golf pro shop. NOT the actual gift shop. "It is owned by a third party". I found this out after I charges some items to my room in the gift shop. The breakfast part of the package was really good. I just expected more I guess, I thought it would be like the Ritz Carlton, which it is not. When we checked out and paid our $1800 bill, we were asked if we enjoyed our stay, my husband shared some of our experiences and they credited $50 to our account.

Reviews.Title: “Service is impeccable”
Reviews.Author: justin g
Reviews.Content: I was worried that our time down in Orlando would be Disney overload but that was never the case at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. From the moment we arrived everyone at the hotel was great. I found that their bartenders and servers at the poolside bar and grill were exceptional. Rich, Andrew, and Shanna all went above and beyond. They were all phenomenal with our children and made our experience there a truly memorable one. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going down to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Attention to detail. Large, comfortable suites. Slightly cavernous in areas.”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm concluding a 6 night stay while writing this review observing the 5 star service this property consistently provides it's guests. At any given time there is a high ratio of staff to guests walking through the hotel lobby. The hotel is on Disney property at Bonnet Creek, but the property doesn't provide all the same benefits as a hotel on sight property like the Grand Floridian or Contemporary. We stayed at this property as a family visiting Disney Theme Parks. The WA functioned well in this capacity, but I see this property as better suited for corporate meetings and functions. For instance, when we checked in I needed to buy Disney tickets and I was informed that we had to make our way over to the adjacent Hilton in order to buy tickets. Considering that this is a WA property I would expect that Disney tickets and conveniences would be on property for guests. The lobby of the WA fills the guest with senses of blues and whites. According to employees the center piece clock is a replica of the clock at WA in NYC. The only difference is that the NYC clock is gold and this is silver. From my standpoint, the big difference is that the WA NYC clock is filled with tradition in a beautiful traditional lobby while this clock is new and in an unimpressive lobby that is neither quaint, warm or impressive. My daughter (15 years old) observed that the property didn't feel like a "special Disney" hotel and that it felt more like it belonged in Los Angeles or any other American urban setting. The suite we stayed in was large almost to the point of feeling cavernous. Now, traveling with children large works out well and is functional. The bathroom was huge with both a shower and tub. In November we stayed at the WA in NY and those rooms are older, but more quaint and comfortable with the fire place and tradition that doesn't get built over night in a new structure. The coffee maker was an issue for our family in that it was loud considering we wake up earlier than our children and crave that morning cup of coffee. I liked the coffee system, but it didn't please my wife. The bar area on the lobby level felt large and lacked the cozy, comfortable, warm feeling that a property like this should offer. The hotel provides bus service to the parks on a regular basis, but we decided to drive as waiting is not my favorite activity. Yes, I know, this is Disney. Hilton Diamond and Gold members do not receive complimentary breakfast and there is no executive lounge. For me, this is a major drawback and offers me no incentive to stay at this property vs other competitors. From my standpoint I would stay at the JW Marriott or the Ritz over this property because of the feel and overall experiences I've had at that property over numerous visits to Orlando. I would suggest staying at the Grand Floridian, Polynesian, Contemporary and Wilderness Lodge over this property if you are visiting to do the Disney Theme parks. I would consider this property for a business function or weekend getaways if Disney isnt the only reason for your visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Expereince!”
Reviews.Author: Alison P
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull up and the doorman opens your door to greet you to the time you check out, every second at the Waldorf is special! This hotel is truly beautiful and the staff makes you feel one of a kind. We loved everything about this hotel and we can not wait to come back and spend another weekend here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clyde K
Reviews.Content: I travel often so i nornally do not have time to rate a hotel. However, The Waldorf is exceptional. It is a true five star eperience. The living room in our suite facing Disneyworld perfectly framed the fireworks. I was especially pleased with the housekeeper. Each day got better and better as we discovered towels folded into characters like what we would find on a cruise ship. Everything was placed neatly in drawers and tucked away in an orderly fashion. The experience was like a personal housekeeper than a hotel housekeeper. For hotel management who may commend this person, I think our room was 974 from December 7-10

Reviews.Title: “A great retreat while visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: FireFlyChick
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again. The accommodations and the staff were both lovely. The rooms were very large and clean and I was a huge fan of the turn-down service and the fact that the toiletries were Salvatore Ferragamo. I also had the best club sandwich of my life in the hotel bar, Peacock Alley. The room service was very good as well. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to the four Disney parks and to Downtown Disney. The shuttle service was great and always on time. While I did not have the opportunity to use the pool, it looked amazing. This hotel is a nice, quiet place to stay (no screaming children here) that is definitely a lot more relaxing than staying at any other properties near Disney. *I wish I had taken some photos of the hotel but the hotel looks exactly like it does in the "professional photos" on their website... which is rare in most cases.

Reviews.Title: “In a class by itself”
Reviews.Author: antoinemb7
Reviews.Content: Hard to compete with a glass of champagne upon arrival...a special touch that I welcomed in today's fast paced and stressful world ! Strikingly warm and welcoming front desk and Concierge staff...name recognition is artfully executed especially by the reception staff and guest services personnel on the phone. Spectacular brunch at Oscar's restaurant - reasonably priced and excellent selection. Grounds are immaculate, beds are supremely comfortable, While I noticed some inconsistencies throughout my stay, I certainly did not allow them to damper an otherwise most enjoyable and relaxing stay. A joy to see the Waldorf Brand rising the bar of classic and timeless elegance for the modern world...

Reviews.Title: “classy option for overly touristy Orlando”
Reviews.Author: jocelynlee
Reviews.Content: i was here for a conference and stayed 4 nights. it was a much better option than any of the hotels near Disney, BUT it Was inconvenient. i was glad not to be near too many brats though, so that worked out. Good size rooms, good service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first trip to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: lgelkins
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, we chose the Waldorf to celebrate my fortieth birthday and our 20th anniversary year. We took our four children with us and stayed in the king suite with a connecting double queen room. First of all, the grounds and public spaces here are beautiful and welcoming, not stuffy at all. Our rooms were a very comfortable size, with the living room between them large enough for all six of us. The mini fridge was convenient for drinks, and I appreciated that it wasn't full of expensive snacks and drinks. We loved the Nespresso machine and housekeeping refilled the pods each day. We also had a small balcony, which was nice for us to sit out on in the early morning when the kids were still asleep. The bathrooms were beautiful, with the king room having a larger one, but both were comfortable. We put the fluffy robes to good use, although they were huge. We preferred the pool at the adjoining Hilton property, with its lazy river and dive-in movies at night. We also ate at Harvest, where the kids ate for free. The food was just fine, and the kids had plenty of choices. There were so many details that made this hotel a great base during our four days visiting the parks. Service was incredible, and the free shuttle was comfortable, clean and on time.

Reviews.Title: “Great golf trip”
Reviews.Author: Htexec
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days in Dec 2011 for a golf trip. The golf club and course was very good. We signed up for the unlimited golf package which included basically everything (green fees, cart and rental clubs if you need them and driving range). All in all, pretty much got what we expected, a first class hotel and fine golf. Pool and gym were nice as well. You have valet parking mandatory for $20/nite, and we were surprised though that they didn't have a tennis court, as it is on their map on their website. The closest one is 15 minutes away if you want tennis. The food was very good, but limited and their sushi restaurant was not open. Very convenient to Disney parks, etc. I've stated in Orlando at just about every Disney property over the past 15 years, but this was first time at the Waldorf. Would recommend it also for kids (they didn't make this trip) if you want a really nice place to stay, and can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review - more like 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: ingipg
Reviews.Content: Our room was quite nice. We had a Waldorf suite, and a connecting room with 2 queens. This was plenty of space for us (3 adults and 2 kids). Here are the good things: plenty of space, nice decor (not 5 star, but nice), very nice bathrooms, breakfast buffet was really good and had EVERYTHING, use of pool at the hilton hotel next door was super for our kids with the kiddie pool area and lazy river, plus a big slide. Free coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning was nice and convenient. Location within Disney World is great, we took cabs everywhere and had no problem Here are the not so good: housekeeping was pretty bad. we left the robes on the floor one day, because the kids spilled some juice on them and we wanted the maids to take them to be washed. well, the maid NEVER picked it up off the floor. After the first day she left it there, it was a game to me to see if she would ever pick it up, nope never, lol. It was just left in a dirty pile in the bedroom. The showers are starting to have mold/mildew stains in the grout. This is a fairly new hotel, and mold/mildew in the bathrooms should not be a problem yet for sure. The maids need to buddy up to a bottle of clorox and a scrub brush. I could tell they clean around your stuff, instead of picking things up and doing a thorough cleaning. We were there a week, so I expect at least one very thorough cleaning during a week stay. The 'kitchenette' had zero supplies. No dishes, no silverware, only a couple of glasses. there was no microwave. The only thing it had was a bar to sit at to eat room service, a fridge, and a sink. This is not very helpful if you planned on buying supplies to feed the kids in the room. otherwise what is the use of the kitchen? The whole reason I paid for a suite was to eat in the room a few times, to give the kids a break from restaurants, and give us adults a break from making the kids sit still in restaurants. we ended up order a lot of room service which was good, but expensive and it is such a waste to spend that kind of money on dinners for 2 kids under 5 years old. same for breakfast. $30 buffet when my kids are just as happy with a bowl of cereal in the room before Disney is just a waste of money. but with no bowls and no spoons it just didn't work. the gift/sundries shop didn't even carry a small bottle of dish soap so I could wash baby bottles in the 'kitchen' sink! This mattered to us as we were there for a full week The service overall was just ok. Nothing special, nothing terrible. So, the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 3, is that I have a feeling there isn't anywhere nicer to stay in Disney World at this price. The Grand Floridian was twice the price, as were a couple other of the 5 star Disney properties, but I read that they are in dire need of updating (one of my pet peeves in a hotel). Would i stay here again? Probably because I just don't see the point of spending double on a trip to Disney. The kids had just as much fun and it was nice to be a little bit away from the craziness of Disney once you left the park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorCalGirl11
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a lovely stay at the Waldorf Astoria. We arrived at about 10:30 on a Friday morning and were not only able to check in immediately, but were also upgraded to a suite. Everything about the room was wonderful, particularly the espresso maker, the enormous shower, and the comfortable bed. The buffet breakfast was included in our package, and we thought it was delicious. I really enjoyed the made to order crepes and the unusual blends of fruit juices. We had pedicures at the spa, which were fabulous. The transportation to Disney World was nice. We took it to the parks both days, but ended up taking cabs back, because we missed the last shuttle one night and didn't want to wait the other night. We did not use the pool at the Waldorf, but we did use the pool at the Hilton next door, which I highly recommend. The lazy river and the water slide were both so much fun, even for adults. Overall it was a great stay at a great hotel. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Upscale Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Teta W
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in SPG, but this hotel was the best upscale hotel in Orlando, if you are going for the sun, palms, upscale bar with live music, upscale room, good service, nice spa, etc. - this hotel is IT!

Reviews.Title: “Overall A great experience”
Reviews.Author: StacieL2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a stay at the Waldorf Orlando and it was a overall great experience. The front desk staff was always willing to help in any way they could. The first day we got there the pool staff was very attentive to our needs,however the second day the guy who was at the pool was no where to be found, and showed little to no attention to us or anyone else. At the poolside bar the bartender who's name is Ryan was absolutely amazing!! His drinks were great and he was very nice. The only thing we were not happy about at all was our first night stay. We called the front desk and asked about the bars and restaurants in the hotel where we would be able to have a little bite and some drinks. The gentleman who answered right away geared us to go next door to the hilton saying that the bar there stays open till 2am as to where the Waldorf bars/restaurants close 11pm and sooner. So we felt we had no choice and went to the bar in the hilton as he suggested and the service we got was HORRIBLE! We asked the bartender if he had a certain kind of liquor and he said no, we then asked if he had another kind of liquor and he again said no and walked away without even suggesting something else or just to make an effort. After that my husband and I didn't feel welcome there at all so we got up and left. We then went to the italian restaurant at the hilton which was a bit better but i have to say the drinks were bad, we had to ask if there was any liquor in the drinks cause it tasted like pure coke in my husbands rum and coke and mine tasted like sweet lime water instead of a mojito. After we finished there we went back to our hotel and looked at the restaurant there called Bull and Bear and when we went in and asked what time they closed the nice guy at the front told was 11pm but if you are here enjoying yourself we will stay open for you. My husband and I both said we wish we had known cause we would have went there to sit at the bar have a couple drinks and a little bite instead of going to the hilton and having such a bad experience. We just wished that the guy at the front desk would have suggested the restaurants at the Waldorf instead of pushing us to the hilton and making it sound like the hilton restaurants and bar was our only choice. Overall the hotel itself was truly amazing and we look forward to staying at the waldorf on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tomtri
Reviews.Content: I had some business in Orlando and decided to tack on a "make-up" 50th birthday trip after earlier plans had to be canceled. I searched for a nice hotel to create a special memory for my wife and me and discovered the W/A. I'm an HHonors member and booked through their site with a note regarding the birthday celebration. We showed up and were greeted with a hearty "happy birthday" and an upgrade to a very nice suite. 30 minutes after we got to our room, the wine and a note from the manager arrived wishing is happy birthday and a pleasant stay. The greeting set the tone for a wonderful 5 day stay. We found the hotel staff consistently pleasant and helpful. The room lay-out is very comfortable, the hotel lobby is beautiful, workout center is large and complete. Plenty of restaurant options on property, large pool with attentive attendents. We didn't take advantage of the on-site spa on this trip. Loved - the warmth and effort of the staff, Bull and Bear, immaculate grounds, workout center (water and clean towels at all the aerobic gear), drinks in Peacock Alley, the value (we were there in "off-season", but the room rate was LOW given the quality of the experience). Didn't love - the property is pretty close to hwy 4 and for the suites facing that direction, the balcony will be noisy (with the door closed, there is no outside noise at all), we ran into some inconsistent service in Aquamarine - slow bringing correct size spoons, incorrect orders. Very pleasant servers - just not as sharp as what we experienced in other parts of the W/A. Here's the bottom line - for the money, this property is the best hotel experience my wife and I have had. Don't come expecting 4 Seasons or Ritz (you won't be paying near the money you would at those place) - this W/A is not as formal and precise as those icons, but I don't think that's what they're trying to do. This is Orlando and the W/A is warm, comfortable, clean, friendly, easy and...worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: The-Bull-Shark
Reviews.Content: Exactly the kind of comfort and service you would expect from the Waldorf. Very convenient location. Only negative is the shuttle service to and from the parks is not as convenient as you would like it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 1 night for our Anniversary. We were greeted with Champagne in our room. Impeccable hotel and grounds. Quiet and relaxing. Beautiful pool with fire pit lounge areas. We had the whole thing to ourselves in the evening. Very romantic. On site dining is very pricey but you won't be dissappointed. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Travelcritic-ca
Reviews.Content: We are there at a conference so the price was just right. The rooms were fantastic, we lucked out with a balcony. The staff was attentive and knowledgable. Overall no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, gorgeous rooms, delicious restaurants”
Reviews.Author: kvidalambiris
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite to share between our daughter, my husband and I. Very spacious, nice kitchenette. The grounds are perfect for morning jogs. The pools between the Waldorf and the Hilton are excellent for kids - especially the Hilton's with a large zero entry lagoon and a lazy river. The restaurants between the two properties do not disappoint. Especially BEECH and Bull & Bear. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. I wanted to take it home with me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...outstanding service, our new place to stay in Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: 1wearytraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days end of October. We've stayed at several hotels/condos in the Orlando region, but this will be our choice when visiting again! From the moment we arrived, we were treated with outstanding service! Valets/bellman were friendly and always greeted us by name. Front desk check-in quick and we were upgraded to a suite! Room was large, bed very comfortable. We had breakfast buffet each morning and many choices to satisfy everyone. Has dinner at the Bull/Bear restaurant and service and food were wonderful! We also enjoyed relaxing after busy day at parks in the lobby lounge...good drinks and both nights the entertainment was good and lively. Very busy on Sat night. Pool/golf looked nice..just didn't make it out there. Overall, a nice hotel, great service and it feels like coming home after being out all day! Definitely will return on our next trip to Orlando. Thanks Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: lakeflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando for work purposes in November 2011. The hotel is in a quiet section of the Disney madness and pulling up to the hotel, I was a bit surprised at how low-key the entrance was. As another poster commented, the facade of the hotel is a bit plain, but the interior lobby space has an amazing ceiling, which appears to be lit stained glass. Check in was pleasant; the staff called me by name and came out from behind the desk to point the way to the elevators. But when I dropped some items off of my suitcase, none of the staff made a move to help me pick them up. But certain members of the staff in later instances were extraordinarily helpful so I'm not sure if it wasn't just a situational issue rather than service being off as a whole. My room faced the entryway so I did not have a view to speak of. The only negative I will mention about being on this side of the hotel is the fact that the valets pressure wash the drive and entrance rather early in the morning (5-6am). If you are a light sleeper like I am, you will be awoken and wonder what that noise is. The room itself is very nice, crown moulding all around, a large flat screen TV, stylish furniture. I had a room with two queens. I only tested one bed but it was very comfortable. I actually preferred having two beds so I could raid the pillows from the other. The only pillow choices are down, which can go flat rather quickly. There is a down mattress cover as well, so for my fellow suffers of down allergies, bring Benedryl. I was unable to find an alternative pillow choice in the room but had I called housekeeping, I probably could have gotten a synthetic. The Benedryl helped me sleep so... The bathroom was enormous, with a large one-sink vanity with granite counter, a separate tub (not a whirlpool, alas), stand up shower and the requisite phone next to the toilet. I did attempt to take a bath but the tub is not really designed for soaking and the water became cold rather quickly. The shower did have a nice showerhead and good pressure. The bedroom area was comfortable but it's not any more luxurious than some of the nicer Hiltons I've stayed at. I did enjoy the turndown service but declined to wear the robe or slippers (the robe had stains - almost like pen markings - on the cuff, which then made me wonder if it was laundered lately). Housekeeping service always seemed to do a top-notch job otherwise. The pool area is nice although the pool at the Hilton is supposed to be nicer. It was too cold for me to go into the pool but those who did seemed to enjoy it. The service out by the pool was fabulous however. I also had a great service experience from Jose the bellman who helped me with some large boxes and the morning valet who dropped me off at the Hilton very early in the morning to catch the Go airport shuttle which apparently will not pick up at the Waldorf. The woman at the front desk when I checked out was also extremely nice. The service was great for the most part and the room was really nice but not over the top. I'm sure for the right room rate, I would return, if only to try some of the on-property restaurants, which I did not get to try on this trip. If you want to be a little removed from the Disney madness but still be on-property (there is a free shuttle that picks up between the two hotels that runs to Disney) and earn Hilton Hhonors points, the Waldorf is a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service seems to be slipping....”
Reviews.Author: sunshine618
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May 2011 for a late anniversary trip. We loved everything about this hotel so much, that we couldn't wait to come back. So, with our son's first birthday approaching, we thought it would be a great reason to return to the hotel. Upon arrival, no one from the hotel held the door open for us even though we were toting several bags, a stroller and our son. We were also not greeted by name this time when checking in - not big deals, but not the great first impression we received last time. Although the hotel was aware that we were there celebrating our son's first birthday, they did nothing to recognize it. We weren't expecting a free meal or anything, but maybe a card in the room, a balloon, maybe a stuffed animal in his crib? Nothing. The man checking us in did say to let them know if there was anything they could do to help us celebrate, but should we really have to ask? Oh well. As we checked in during the evening, all we wanted to do was get to the room and order room service dinner, so we can put our son to bed. Anyway, no room service menus to be found. After a girl comes to the door w/ a crib for us (which we already had in the room), we asked her for breakfast and dinner menus. She did not return. After 10-15 minutes, we called in-room dining and asked for menus. They sent the same girl w/ a breakfast menu and a binder w/ local attractions. So, another call to in-room dining and we finally rec'd the dinner menu. After ordering, dinner was served promptly and it was hot and delicious. However, our drink glasses remained outside of the room on the floor for the remainder of our 2-night stay. Maybe no one saw them? Also, there was some kind of stains on the carpet that had been cleaned, but the texture of the carpet was markedly different in those areas and I wasn't too thrilled w/ my son crawling around on them. But - what can you do? The rest of our stay was much better. The service by the pool was great. The pool is heated to 82 degrees, which is cold for native Floridians like us, but others didn't seem to mind it. The zero entry pool was great for our son to sit and play. Dinner at Bull and Bear was fantastic! They really made us feel comfortable to have a small child and even brought out a Happy Birthday dessert w/ a candle. Much appreciated! Would we stay here again - yes, but maybe without our son or when he is older. We love that it is quiet and in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Our recent trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Waldorf Astoria ( Nov. 6 & 7 ) . We had stayed there also on Oct. 7 - 9. We were impressed that the staff remembered us . The bellman John remembered us from our 2010 stay. This time we went up just to get in another day at the Food and Wine Festival. Every time we go there I am amazed that the staff goes above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. We had a suite and a fabulous view of Disney . Our dinner at the Bull and Bear was great . Both Adrian Orgill and Manny Belete in the Bull and Bear were helpful and made our nite. Also Georgie Barabas on the front desk made check in and out easy.I had a question later and Bridget Poole cleared up my confusion. We will be hopefully staying there again soon. It is a little more to stay there but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Family Orlando Stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_1972
Reviews.Content: Our 1 bedroom suite was GORGEOUS! New, modern and beautifully decorated. Furniture, wallpaper, tile, mouldings..A+. A true 5 star hotel interior. Room had a big round table so we were able to order in room service before and after our park excursions with our 2 little children. Definitley stay here if you want to visit the parks but prefer luxurious accomodations away from the crowds. The hotels on the mono rail looked chaotic and run down. The bus to the parks were great. A few things were suprising, but had no effect on our stay...staff not overly friendly (aside from room service..door men never opened a door for us...that sort of thing) the facade, balconys and pool area were basic (cement and boring pavers..). Aside from that, you can not get any better than new! For the low rate and decor, It might be one of the nicest suites we've stayed in and I am hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “A Real 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTim
Reviews.Content: I was only there for a 4 day for a meeting, but if I have to go back to Orlando in the future, I definitely would stay at the Waldorf. It is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for. I have stayed at Disney hotels in the past on vacation and I don't think there is that much difference in price. Everything, from the greeting by the valet, to the check in, to the room, housekeeping, room service, restaurants, lobby area, to the check out was first class. No compalints at all. Wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't delay - book it now!”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: We had a 2-week stay at the Waldorf Astoria recently and were blown away by the whole experience. The hotel is stunning and the staff are quite simply exceptional. Relaxing at the pool was such an enjoyable experience particularly after a visit to the theme parks, shopping malls or to the various other popular attractions. Minutes away from the theme parks the short drive to and from the hotel along the quiet landscaped road overlooking the golf course is a joy itself. Even better, take advantage of the hotel's complimentary luxury coach service then sit back and enjoy the short journey. The hotel's refreshing ice cold bottles of water are a must for the journey. Tip No.1 no parking fees at the theme parks - normally 14 dollars a visit - when you take the bus. Regular drop-off and pick-up times and always on time. During our stay we dined at Oscars, La-Luce (Hilton) and the Bull & Bear. Top class food and thoroughly enjoyable - the Bull & Bear in particular was extra special. A big thank you to Brendan and the team for an unbelievable meal and world class service . Tip no. 2 visit the B&B early in your stay as you'll want to return...oh, and the lemon sweet (can't remember the exact name) Is a must. The food in Peacock Alley was also very good and a bit less expensive. Ditto the golf club lounge and Aqua Marine by the pool. The room, facilities and views particularly if you overlook the pool area and golf course are simply stunning. Tip no 3 ask for a room on one of the higher floors facing in that direction and enjoy the firework display at night from the theme parks in the distance. Other enjoyable and unforgettable experiences - the unique fragrance , atmosphere and subtle background music when entering the hotel. A drink in the lounge (Peacock Alley) at night while the pianist is playing. Relaxing at the pool when the singer / guitarist is performing (Sunday). The valet parking service ( self parking Facility at the Hilton - a minute's walk or 30 second buggy ride if you prefer - a bit cheaper than the valet parking and good fun). The complimentary ice cold face towels handed out by the pool area staff and frozen fruit - absolutely amazing! The jewel in the crown is undoubtedly the quality of staff. Each and every member is polite, attentive, professional and above all - caring. Unrivalled service. Take a bow the entire management team! In all walks of life there are always individuals who stand out so a special mention and a big Scottish thank you to Brendan (B&B), Ryan (Aqua Marine - loved the hiccup cure advice), Nadia and Shannon at the poolside. Quite simply, If your looking for a different Florida experience or an exceptional venue, spend some time at this hotel. A bit more expensive than the usual hotels but worlds apart and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October 2010 and have only just discovered Tripadvisor but my first review is for one of the best hotels ive ever stayed in. Firstly we were there for a honeymoon and our greeting from the highly professional staff was amazing, Especially given we had arrived in a battered hire car. Waiting for us was a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries with a complimentary voucher for some services available from the hotel. We were breathtaken at the generosity, but this was only added to by the kindness the staff offered us throughout our stay. All the front of house staff were incredibly helpful and kind and a credit to the hotels name. I wont embarrass staff with names and they wont remember us im sure, but the peacock bar staff, the maitre D' of the bull and bear and specifically the poolside attendants made us feel so at home we sometimes felt we were sat by the fire in our local pub with the landlord weve known for 15 years. The poolside staff could tour the world teaching others how to treat customers! The food is incredible, breakfast, lunch and dinner and the prices reflect the quality. Which is fair, but we wont be able to visit again for a bit! The rooms are comfortable, tasteful and good for the price. Room service is such a treat - especially when it turns up on its own fold out table. Access to the parks, room service, staff positivity, facilities, food, drink, entertainment! All of the highest standard. Thankyou very very much Waldorf Astoria for making our holiday so extra special. We will see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: 1415HenryFive
Reviews.Content: I and my wife spent a very wonderful 6 nights at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando and found it in all aspects a great hotel experience. In particular we would pick out the excellent and friendly gentleman and ladies of the hotel who helped make our time in Orlando such a great joy. On top of this the food, room, public areas and location where of the highest quality. As soon as we stepped through the doors of the hotel we felt our spirits lifted. We very much look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Barely a bad thing to say about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HanSolo3101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Bonnet Creek on business for five days last week and was very pleased with my experience. Every encounter I had with hotel staff was positive. It appears they even pay people with contagious smiles to stand in the in the lobby to make sure you are smiling. Everyone is very eager to help you and the local restaurant recommendations were always spot on and I was well taken care of at the different places because Waldorf made the reservations for me (at least that is what I was told by the hostesses). I didn't use the pool or spa, but they were only okay looking when compared to the sister property next door. I believe these are shared access properties and I highly recommend the Hilton pool area over the Waldorf. There is 3 star and 5 star difference between the two pool areas. Hilton has a lazy river, organic rock carve shapes and lots of palm trees scattered around this area to give it a more natural setting, where Waldorf is very basic concrete rectangle and flat pool deck. The rooms are extremely clean and kept that way during your stay. My bed was very comfortable. I believe they service the room 2 or 3 times a day. While I was away at dinner they would come in and clean up and put jazz on the radio a robe and slippers next to the bed with some chocolates. A very nice touch. I had several articles of clothing dry cleaned while I was there and everything was done perfectly. The pricing was even reasonable. It was delivered to me at 5pm sharpish as promised. I did not eat at the main restaurant; however, I did eat at the bar one night and the food was very good. They have a great cigar selection there as well and drinks are well executed. I used room service for breakfast and dinner and it was delivered on time as promised and was well prepared. Location to other restaurants and shopping isn't the best because you are on the edge of Disney property, but within about 7 miles you can hit restaurant row and quite a few shopping areas. Nothing within walking distance though. My only two complaints: 1. Expect to go next door to the Hilton if you want an early morning espresso. 2. The shoe shine service was very poor. Turnaround time was fast as can be, however the job that was done was the worst I have ever seen. There was black polish done right over the lighter colored threading on my shoe tips and the shine was very inconsistent, especially around the sides.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pool and golf course”
Reviews.Author: vhgolf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice the past couple of years during Tavistock. I enjoyed the entire package between the beautiful golf course, and the accomodating swimming pool. Room service food was good and not way out of line. I have one small complaint, and that is the lack of late night food fare aside from room service. The only thing they have is a "deli" over in the Hilton. But, overall I loved the accomodations and the view of the golf course from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelblog3
Reviews.Content: Finally a luxury hotel worth the price. We usually stay in Marriott's and Hyatt's because we have found Luxury hotels like the Ritz Carlton are not worth the money. We decided to splurge on a recent trip to Orlando. Surprising we found everything to be beyond our expectations. The service was unmatched and the property spotless. This is one top of the line hotel I would actually return to without concern for value received. It was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty glasses in room on check in...then more and more”
Reviews.Author: PMS00
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we found a water glass with the cover on it with about an inch of water in it. I took it down to the front desk, they just said "sorry". Then I requested a coffee maker. But, they would not refill the coffee each day. Then another day, they left another used water glass but put the cover on it. I complained about each of these things, without any satisfaction. I was there with a group. I had upgraded from the Hilton. I think it was actually a downgrade. Will never stay there again. Sent email regarding stay. Again, got nothing. Terrible, terrible stay. You would think after compaining about two things which were unacceptable, they would have made sure we were taken care of. Not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Cigar Dinner At Waldorf Astoria Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Harry K
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to attend a cigar dinner at the Waldorf Astoria, featuring Ashton cigars, Stags Leap wine, Glenlivet scotch and food from the Waldor Astoria. It was an extraordinary experience pairing excellent food, wine and cigars. The experience was unique especially thanks to the information provided on the different courses offered. For dessert we were served an ashtray with a chocoltae cigar and two Ashton cigars (photo attached). The service of the Waldorf Team and experience of this unique event makes me look forward to a next special event at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Out with the Grand Floridian,In with the Waldorf Astoria!”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: We always stayed at the Grand Floridian when visiting WDW/Orlando area. The Grand Floridian has not renovated the bathrooms since they have opened their doors for business & we finally got sick and tired of paying the exorbitant prices for the Grand Floridian. We looked for a luxury hotel to stay in and we found out that a Waldorf Astoria had built a new hotel within the WDW complex. JACKPOT! Let me just say,WOW! We got a steal at $199 for deluxe rm with Disney view and upon arrival upgraded to a suite with a balcony and a view of Epcot. The rooms are luxurious,beautifully done with high end furnishings. The bathroom is huge but has only single vanity. Has a soaking tub and stand shower with glass doors, Our suite has a bar/dining area and a large living rm & bedroom was separate. We never received the turn down service but the daily housekeeping was excellent. I used the pool,gym and ate at both restaurants,every aspect was top notch and satisfying. Bull & Bear was fancy schmancy but you do not have to be dressed tho the nine when dining here. Food was very good,not excellent but good. If you must have breakfast,get the buffet. Fresh squeeze juices,pear/strawberry/orange/grapefruit/carrot/pomegranate..etc. Italian spread of prosciutto/salami/fine cheeses/nuts/olives...etc. French pastries...the best banana pancakes! There's a lot more well worth the $28 pp I don't like ordering in but you must try their room service! I thought I was going to miss being on the monorail but the hotel has a shuttle (tour bus) that makes stops at all the WDW parks. Very professional and comfortable. They are connected with the Hilton and you can easily walk to Hilton to try their restaurants. Try La Luce! We went their twice and both times, the food was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “A proper 5* hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jackie2407
Reviews.Content: Lovely, new, clean, comfy, great restaurants, staff great, Harry Potter on the pay to view!!, fantastic steak house (best steak of my life!), beautiful (if a little costly) spa. We were only there for 2 nights. The hotel was full but you wouldn't know it. There was a very large conference going on in the adjoining conference centre but we were very well looked after and never had to wait for anything. Would love to go there again. Only one sticky - the in room AC was very noisy and I couldn't turn off one part of it. May have just been my room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jen L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was top notch in every way. Super decorating throughout! Classy, with history to draw from the Waldorf heritage, but updated with a modern twist. Not at all cold or overly modern. The Peacock Alley bar was perfect for an afternoon cocktail. Jazz music in the evenings! The Bull and Bear is fantastic. Pricey, but worth every penny. We were late for the Sunday Steak and Eggs brunch, but they let us in anyway. Brunch was fantastic--and a good deal for the quality/amount of food/drinks. Sir Harry's Lounge is a masculine, dark, perfect place for a manhattan. They even had college football on in the back. Late night was a live band. The female singer was a bit rusty, but the band was overall entertaining. The cheese and olives were a nice touch! The pool was fantastic. Clean, clean, clean! So was the workout facility. Great equipment, flavored water, chilled towels available. What more could you want? The room was fantastic. Clean, classy! Comfortable. The only thing I wish there was is a double sink so that two could get ready without bumping into each other. A separate room for toilet would also have been a nice added touch. (We were in a suite, afterall.) The free shuttle to Disney was an added bonus! Easy and quick!! Free internet and print outs in the lobby. Free newspapers. Free shoe shines. Free cocktail coupons. Free coffee in the AM. Great value, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabtastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sraj
Reviews.Content: Travelling - myself, husband, daughter 17 and son 15. We arrived after a long flight from the UK, picked up our car and drove straight to the Waldorf. I am a Hilton honors gold member and had used points for the stay. I was expecting a stuffy hotel with expensive food and drinks and nice but small rooms. When we pulled up to the hotel I was surprised as the porte corchere doesnt look like any other hotel I've visited. The main doors are frosted so you can't see through and it's really quite simple. Bell hops took the luggage and valet parked the car as we had no immediate plans to use it. We were offered cold water and towels and checked in with no fuss and straight up to the room. At this point I must say how great the bell hops and valets are. I seem to remember one called Steve who always remembered us and always had a smile and a chat. When we arrived at the room we were told we had been upgraded to a suite and wow what a great upgrade. We had two rooms with two bathrooms and a lounge with wet bar/kitchen area. The rooms were large, flatscreen TV's, very comfortable bedding and balconies. It was all great. We ate at the pool bar that night. The menu was upscale and the price reflected this. Good quality food in a nice setting. We used the bar every night but didn't eat in the other restaurants. Pool service was good too. My husband and son played 2 rounds of golf and said they were the best rounds of the holiday - better than the Disney courses with better service. My daughter was going to use the Guerlain Spa but they were fully booked so if you want to take advantage then pre book. So to sum up it was a great stay, helped of course by the upgrade, but we loved it so much we are returning for New Years Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury Resort in Orlando - Beats the Ritz by a Mile!”
Reviews.Author: TheHead33
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria Orlando completely overwhelmed my wife and I with hospitality over a short birthday weekend getaway. From the moment we arrived the hotel staff made us feel like welcome guests in their amazing home - and what a home! The hotel is impeccable clean, bright and airy, with suprisingly serene views of the Disney properties in the distance. Everyone seems to genuinely appreciate that you have come to visit and strives to take care of anything you need. It was my wife's birthday and I had only left a simple note in the online reservation (which I had forgotten about), and when we arrived we were greeted with a spectacular room upgrade to a suite with a balcony overlooking the property and Disney Lands beyond. After we unpacked and enjoyed the balcony view with a glass of wine, there was a knock at the door with a complementary bottle of spakling Domaine Chandon and some chocolate covered strawberries. the Suite itself was large and luxuriously appointed with a ful wet bar and dining area, comfortable living room area with an awesome HDTV and sound system. The seperate bed room and spacious bathroom gave us plenty of room to get ready for the evening together. We were unable to get reservation for the hotel's Bull & Bear restaurant, but the concierge was able to suggest the bar area which had a perfectly romantic small table available. Our server delightfully took great care of us with an excellent wine selection, nice conversation, and a special dessert offer. The meal was all excellent and perfectly prepared, with a creative take on Steak Frites. The next day we both enjoyed the Guerlin Spa, which rivals the service and quality of the local Ritz Carlton Spa. The facilites and talent of the massuesse are absolutely on par with any of the best in town. As a very frequent business traveller, I am ordinarily underwhelmed by the service and attention given by most high-end hotels. So it was really a very special effort, across all areas of this Waldorf Astoria, that impressed me enough to reccommend this Hotel to anyone looking for very special treatment and a genuine, feel-good, relaxing escape from the ordinary hotel experience. This is a luxury hotel that felt balanced and not stuffy; adult but not boring. I will definiately be back and am recommending it to all my local friends who like to take advantage of what the Disney Scene has to offer from time to time. In fact, this visit has caused me to reconsider all my business travel in favor of Hilton properties, so that I can enjoy this hotel many times over, using my Hilton Honors Points.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous -- Again.”
Reviews.Author: MrsT21
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times before, and I am continually wowed, particularly by the staff. We traveled very light and didn't need bell service, but we were taken to our room by a member of the staff who was very polite, friendly and easy to talk to. The entire staff was wonderfully prompt with any requests, such as bringing the car around when we were ready to head out, and they made sure that we never needed anything. We stayed in a suite, which worked out very well. Having the extra living space allowed the night owls to get along with the early bird! The hotel is in a great location -- right there at Disney, but can feel worlds away if you want it to -- and the grounds and building are gorgeous. All in all, it was a wonderful trip where my expectations were met and then exceeded again and again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and we'll absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Five star Disney resort! It's here!”
Reviews.Author: Prickett
Reviews.Content: We were relunctant to visit Disney because we are use to five star hotels and service while being aware of the fact that we are here for Disney & have kids. #1 the suites are perfect for families. We had room service every morning compliments of Amex Fhr program as well as a suite upgrade. #2 the pools are warm and fantastic. Visit the hyatt pool for a slide and lazy river.#3 the food meets five star recommendations. Try the seared tuna tacos by the pool! The resort is nor Disney themed but that was welcomed after a long day in the parks. It is simply a five star hotel with all the extras you would expect. I'm not a golfer but the golf course looks impeccable. I will even stay here if we go to universal. We absolutely loved it! Book a suite if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Deah
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend at the Waldorf Orlando for a medical conference. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area clean with attention to the guests. The conference food was very good-kudos to the chef(s) and kitchen staff. Even dinner Saturday evening for 100+ was excellent, with steak being very tender, not over or undercooked and served piping hot. The workout facilities good and did not require waiting for a treadmill or other equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sueddog
Reviews.Content: This is by far the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed in. The service is unbelievable from the moment you step out of your car, they cannot do any more to please you, their entire staff is tops and deserve high praise. A special shout out to Andrew at the pool bar who was a great bartender, very entertaining and knowledgable, thanks for some great mojito's Andrew !!! We will absolutely return !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ivett V
Reviews.Content: From the moment you drive up you feel that you are away from it all. The Valet Parking staff is very helpful, Front Desk staff is very welcoming. The suites are so spacious with great views and spacious balcony. The Golf Course designed by Rees Jones is one of the best, I would recommend anyone staying in Orlando to stay at the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, matched by great staff.”
Reviews.Author: jason r
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at this hotel and it was a fantastic hotel. We had a suite and it was large and spacious with a great view of disney. I would suggest asking for pool view so that you can see the great sunsets and watch the disney fireworks of an evening. The staff at this hotel were excellent too and couldnt do enough for you, this goes for the bar staff right through to the valet. (other hilton's should learn from this hotel and espire to this level of service) Next time we are in orlando we will definatly staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel. Flawless Service”
Reviews.Author: travelqueenfrisco
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels across the country and on Disney property (including The Grand Floridian). This by far is the most exquisite hotel I have ever visited. I booked my reservation over the phone and it was a great experience. The agent was professional and informative. I was impressed by this experience alone. We stayed for two nights and I wanted to move in within the first 20 minutes. The property is stunning. The grand foyer upon arriving has a soft and sweet aroma. The staff member are engaging, courteous and professional. The rooms have top quality furniture, linens and decor. On this visit, i forgot my shampoo and conditioner and used the set provided (I hate using hotel samples). I fell in love with the shampoo and condition. My hair feels amazing. The quality and service here are superior in every aspect. This visit surpassed any expectation I could ask for. A true luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way”
Reviews.Author: cosmogirlAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and I just can't wait to come back! It is a beautiful property, with a sophisticated yet understated decor, great attention and superb comfort. They upgraded us to a suite overlooking the swimming pool and the golf course, it was spacious, tastefully decorated and with nice balcony from where to enjoy fireworks. The attention of everyone at the hotel deserves a separate chapter: Kellly and Cris at the front desk were just fantastic, attentive and responsive. Steve, the person that took our luggage upstairs, went above and beyond to show us all the features of our room -- you could tell that he was proud to work in the property. And Mark and Jose in the breakfast room were the nicest people -- they came to talk to our table, to check that everything was OK and even gave us a little sweet treat (ice cream and cookies) before we left. The breakfast buffet was one of the best ones I have ever seen. I can't recommend this hotel enough. Everyone made our stay truly magical. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: 914newyork
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! We usually stay next door at the Hilton Bonnet Creek (also wonderful) but had a 2 night certificate for the Waldorf. From the moment we arrived the eager bellman helped us out of our car, offered to assist with our bags, provided us with cool bottled water and walked us to the front desk. Although we were dissappointed to not have a king bed, the rooms were stunning. The carpet was noticably plush and we had a great view of the pool and golf course. I found the room to be very anticipatory of our needs - it was equipped with things like nail polish remover and an umbrella - things you don't usually see in a standard hotel room. The bathrooms were spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable. One suggestion would be to change the paintings in the guest rooms - they don't seem fitting to the rest of the hotel. Pool and staff were great. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury retreat in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: jatrav
Reviews.Content: A very nice property- arguably the best in Orlando. Definitely better than the Grand Floridian(unless you want to be on the Monorail) and better location and service than the Ritz. The rooms are very spacious, extremely clean and with very comfortable beds. The food at the hotel is excellent and there are several great restauarants within a 15 minute drive- we loved Dragonfly for sushi/asian and Ocean Prime for steak and seafood. If you are a golfer, the adjacent golf course is in excellent condition. It is not physically the most beautiful but it is very well maintained. The best part of this resort though is the service!!! Every person that we encountered was helpful, friendly and with a great attitude. So, if you are going to Orlando and want a luxury resort close to Disney and local attractions, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel at the top of it's game.”
Reviews.Author: sirgreg
Reviews.Content: Very tasteful decor without being opulent. Genuinely couteous staff who seem to be proud of where they work. Our room was nicely furnished and the bed was extremely comfortable. I highly recommend the buffet breakfast. II've stayed in posh hotels all over Europe and this was by far the best offering in terms of choice and the presentation of the food was done with an artistic flair that was truly artistic. This is a hotel that is obviously manged well at all levels, from the front desk to the kitchen. The swimming pool is huge, lined with palm trees. There is a golf course next to the property for those who enjoy that sort of thing,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sagar M
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter and myself stayed at the Waldord Astoria, Orlando from 21st to 25th August 2011. We were upgraded to the Deluxe Suite as we were celebrating our 10th Anniversary. The Deluxe Suite room was very spacious and very helpful with having my 5 year old with us. Although I wish they had replenished the complimentary water bottles given to us at check in, on a daily basis, other than that, the room was excellent. The location was close to the Disney Resorts and the complimentary coach rides to Disney Parks was a great help. Mr. Patrick Cheah Revenue Manager was very helpful with our stay and other requests we had. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone as it is a beautiful property at the heart of Disney but not so crowded with the typical "Disney Family Vacationers". I would definitely be back on my next visit to Orlando. S B Mirpuri

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bman6262
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week for work and wouldn't hesitate going back in a second! From the time you pull into the property the staff treats you like royalty. The rooms are big but not huge with a fantastic king sized bed with great huge, comfy pillows. The bathroom is huge and the other amenities are top notch. The bar area has indoor/outdoor seating and the staff is very friendly and attentive. Several pools to choose from as well as a hot tub and seating areas with cool open fire pits for when it gets cool at night during the fall/winter months. I had one of the best meals I have ever had a the Bull & Bear where the food was not only great but the service was over the top. Fantastic stay all around!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: smithsmithnk
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night but wished it could have been more,pulled up outside and our cases were taken immiediatly and the car is valet parked which you have to have and is charged at $20. first impression of the hotel is beautiful.large chandelier and excellent decor throughout,great view of the pools from reception.we had a suite on the 12 floor ( room 1229 ) and it was superb.we had a table for 4, settee and seperate chair with foot stool,large flat screen tv in the main room and the same size tv in the bedroom.the balcony we had overlooked the golf club and the driving range and the course looked very impressive and when we return i will definately have a round.i used the pool which is large but the other pool was closed off for a private function for the evening but didnt spoil my swim and the service at the pool was excellent.i had a couple of drinks in the bar which i thought were reasonably priced for a hotel of this stature ( $6 for a bottle of corona ). The only negative was the free bus from the hotel,we wanted to go to downtown disney which is a 5 minute drive away took us 35 minutes on the bus as we went to the magic kingdom first so before you get the bus to the parks it might be worth checking the route it is taking.we would definately stay here again and thanks to eveyone at the hotel for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Truley Fine”
Reviews.Author: jaycam
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter on a Disney Cruise and stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando - Everything was excellent from the cleaniness to the attentivness of the staff and the promptness of the service. The only flaw with this hotel is the morning brunch, The service was truley awful every morming and they were not busy. For the price of the brunch you would expect better quality food as well as service. We couldn't even get a refill on our juice even after we asked several times. Dirty plates left on the table and this wasn't one day it was all three days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “It is a work in Progress......”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I live in Orlando and have stayed in various high end Disney area hotels for quick weekend getaways. I was very excited to try out the new Waldorf. The hotel is pretty much on Disney property, this gives them a leg up from the Ritz Carlton which is a ways out closer to the airport. They are going with the Ritz/JW concept of having 2 affiliated hotels side by side with the Hilton being right next door that you can take advantage of. From the exterior, the design of both hotels is not the impressive. The entrance, etc. Once we pulled up and went inside the lobby of Waldorf, I was VERY impressed with the styling. They did an excellent job with interior design. Sort of Chic modern with a glamorous 1930s era edge. Valet only, get ready to pay $20. This is typical for these type of hotels. If you are really cheap, there is nothing stopping you from parking at the Hilton garage and dragging your bags over….not worth it to me since we were comped for it, but I can understand. If you have visitors or others coming over, grab a drink at the bull and bear and get your $20 valet validated, that is the only restaurant that does it at the hotel. The staff was helpful enough. We were upgraded to suite with our amex platinum and was also very impressed with our room. Again, the interior styling of this hotel is quite stunning. We decided to use the gym before popping over the epcot for food and wine fest. The gym is very nice with plenty of equipment and bottled water. This is a good place to stock up on free bottled water if you need some. We even jogged on the outside jogging trails, but they were way too short and sort of took you through the front parking lot at one point….not great. The hotel offers transportation to the parks but it is on a specific schedule and is not affiliated with the Disney transportation. This is a downside to staying here. The Disney transportation is much more prompt and much more connected to different locations including other hotels. If you want to go anywhere other than a Disney park, you have to drive or take a taxi…or their black cars that are their version of taxis that charge you triple what a yellow cab does. Again, not great. We ended up going to the pool at the end of the afternoon, it is bit small but very nice with a zero entry. We ate breakfast at Oscars, which had a nice buffet. We had a free credit to try out the spa, very underwhelming facilities….not worth it. Go to the ritz in Orlando if you want a real spa experience. We had apps and drinks at the Bull and bear steakhouse. This is a beautiful restaurant with pretty good food. The views at sunset were very pretty. In regards to the staff at the hotel, they were nice but they didn’t blow me away. This isn’t Ritz or Four Seasons staff, but this could be a management or leadership issue. I feel like this hotel does not know what it is trying to be. If you stay on a Disney property or the ritz, they go out of their way to make the kids feel special. I felt like the staff didn’t know what to do with the kids at the waldorf. Overall, one of the nicer hotels in Orlando with some of the best interior design and finish, but the Ritz Carlton still wins out with overall facilities and both Disney and the Ritz win out with their amazing staff. I think there is a chance that the Waldorf could work out some of these kinks, but they have a ways to go.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful retreat in the middle of Disney madness”
Reviews.Author: bajanative
Reviews.Content: The last leg of our trip took us back to Orlando for a five day stay at the beautiful Waldorf Astoria. Upon arrival, my husband and I were greeted by the friendly valet staff. The front desk clerks were friendly and accommodating- they were happy to point out restaurant choices and local attractions. Our room had a spectacular view of the pools, comfortable bed, a large bathroom with enough towels and toiletries. As an added bonus we could see the Disney fireworks from our room’s window. The pool was not crowded- shaded areas readily available- the pool area had two pools, a jacuzzi and cabanas for hire. The pool staff was very accommodating for the most part. However, a waitress seemed a little upset that I requested iced coffee- it was very apparent that she did not want to grant my special request. The gym was wonderful- cardio machines, free weights, etc. We had breakfast at Oscar’s – they offered a breakfast buffet which had plenty of fresh fruits, omelet bar, sweet breads, etc. definitely worth it. Newspapers were readily available at the front desk, including the New York Times. We ate a wonderful chocolate dessert at our room and the strawberry shortcake did not disappoint. The concierge was extremely helpful when making dinner reservations. The hotel provides complimentary turndown services- I was very happy to find a pair of slippers and chocolate waiting for me after a hectic day at the parks. Shoe shinning services are also available at no extra charge. We checked out without any problems. We will definitely come back to this property when visiting Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Love it,”
Reviews.Author: zaramoore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first seek of our 2 week holiday and if I was to sum it up in a few words it would be classy,elegant and beautiful. The hotel grounds are peaceful,The hotel is beautiful and super clean, the pools area was tranquil and the rooms are relaxing with high beds and simply the best pillows. The bathroom has so much space and even a phone by the toilet (although I'm not sure why) the decor is of high standards-even the lifts I would live in:) The door/car staff are always smiling with a friendly welcome and helpful.our car was always with us in a jiffy and water offered for our trip. The doors are always opened for us and bags carried if you like. The pool staff are on their toes with towels before you can put your bag down and they are changed during the day. Others have mentioned about a bottle of water costing $6 dollars and yes it is does but it's a larger bottle of fancy water. We love this hotel and it's nice and relaxing away from the parks but close enough to visit. If you want busy and Disney vibes this isn't for you however if you want luxury,relaxation and to feel spoilt then go for it. Few points: The hotel does have a conference centre so a large occupancy can be business people. There is a $100 a day security hold which is returned to you at the end of your stay and parking is $20 a day however mine was included-that will depend who you book with. A bus service runs through the day taking you to the parks however we never used the bus service but you will need a car or use the bus to get about.

Reviews.Title: “A good business center”
Reviews.Author: TOURISM-HEALTH
Reviews.Content: It was a good choice. Although food is not the best, service is ok. It's ideal for business meetings and vacations.

Reviews.Title: “For the price of a standard biz-class room...”
Reviews.Author: pickyATL
Reviews.Content: There is no shortage of $50 and $100 rooms in Orlando, but precious few worth more. For the price of a business-class room in any big city, we stayed in the best hotel in Orlando. And when we checked out, we'd spent significantly less than we expected (and way less than at any Disney resort). The property is new and immaculate. The room is immediately recognizable as an upgrade to the Hilton standard. Again, no ornate pretense, just luxury and style, with features well outlined in the hotel's description. Unfortunately, the sofa bed seat canted so far forward that we kept having to brace ourselves from rolling off (honestly). Half of the rooms have a view of all 4 Disney parks and their fireworks, across Bonnet Creek and the Waldorf's beautiful golf course; most other rooms can see the D'town Disney Saturday fireworks, the remainder have a golf view. The spa is spacious, beautiful and amenity-blessed. We were blown away by the gracious pool deck and it's pools. Although we ate every meal at the hotel for 6 days, we never sat in a restaurant, so can only comment on the In-Room and poolside food: yum. Everything was fresh, delicious and well-portioned. With all of the other excellent dining options at hand, our best value and first choice was to eat at the Waldorf. Of course, the Waldorf provides every service imaginable. They invented room service and it's surprisingly affordable: choice of sandwich, fries and a soda are the b-traveller standard $20. Spa services cannot be matched. Next time we plan to spend some time with the golf pro. The staff aren't newbies, and the depth of their experience across Orlando hospitality shines. Outstanding and unpretentious applied to every staff interaction, period (I think it's the confidence of competence). If you need fawning, you only need ask. It is the hallmark of the WA brand. My only issue was my language barrier with the housekeepers. **IMPORTANT: it may be crass to discuss, but these people work hard for minimum tip-earner wages and are taxed at 18% of their sales by the IRS, whether you tip or not. If there isn't an automatic gratuity, we give a 20% tip on all sales. We also put a (tax-free) bill or two in everybody's hand, and more for personal services. Even when we feel outrageously generous, it's still very small in the costs of visiting Disney. On the other hand, the staff understands $1 means more to you than $5 to a millionaire, so don't feel compelled to overtip.** The pool culture was the best surprise of the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. It reminded me of the legendary Hollywood pool decks: cabanas, cabana kids and all. The adjacent Hilton has a splashier pool and lazy river for the kids, so families at the Waldorf pools seemed to be spending time together. We ended up spending three-of-five days in a cabana, instead of going to the parks! My one suggestion is to play something more approachable than that ominous lounge-jazz music (maybe primetime TV's favorite format: adult alternative?). Best of all at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando was the rockin' pool staff. While they sensed we wanted informal interactions, I saw rude guests handled with deferential applomb and left beaming. We noticed the excellence of the entire department, who made it blithe for us to lounge the day away. In particular, Jean, Sam and Jenna charmed their way into our hearts, and supervisors Ali and Vanessa ensured we were being coddled. We will return to this hotel because of this department. I splurged and booked a King Suite w/ balcony, Disney view and a dining table for four. I checked and my rate was cheaper than a deluxe king room in the Hilton Times Square (42nd St. NYC) for the same dates. We both agree, if this was not our best hotel or resort experience, it was certainly on the shortest list (and I've been criticizing Orlando hotels since 1972). Hilton knows how to price a room and they're still building the clientele of this property, so even in-season rates may be low for awhile. Eventually, this property will collect a premium on every other hotel room in Orlando, and be worth it. Stay at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven after the madness of the parks”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteLulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a WDW / Universal holiday. Incredible service as you would expect. On arrival, I asked to change my pre-booked rate plan to the "Best of Waldorf" plan. This they did quickly and efficiently with no fuss. We had a personal concierge who spent a huge amount of time with us in the room (possibly too much!) after check-in sharing loads of information about the parks and other options. Stayed in a king-bed suite with disney view which was huge. It had a wet bar (basically a kitchenette without cooking facilities), a dining table for 4, livingroom with sofabed and a Nespresso machine. Masses of closet space which was bliss as we were not tripping over suitcases or shoes. Bathroom was also huge with a separate bath and shower, high quality toiletries including bath salts, and more towels than we knew what to do with. We watched the fireworks every night from the balcony (can see both Epcot and Magic Kingdom). Pool area was gorgeous. Pool boys and girls prepare your bed with towels immediately and bring a change during the day too. Nice chilled out music in the background. Yes, cocktails are expensive, but you're on holiday, just grin and bear it. The food at the pool bar is delicious and reasonably priced - amazing tacos with seared tuna. Went round to the neighbouring Hilton to use the lazy river. It was very busy, you had to walk to the kiosk for towels, and it felt like a noisy holiday resort. Soon returned to the calm of the Waldorf! Dined at the Italian restaurant in the Hilton two nights as the Waldorf's restaurant was more aimed at adult fine-dining and therefore not great for kids. You don't even have to walk the short distance if you don't want to as hotel staff will drive you round on a golf buggy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ! Will be back”
Reviews.Author: jvasquez1970
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend there with my wife. We had an amazing experience. Hotel spotless, rooms comfy,clean and quiet. Staff friendly, courteous and wonderful ! Great location......just everything awesome and 5star !

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TwoOnTheGo_01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned for another anniversary weekend at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando and once again it was an exceptional experience. The concierge supervisor Nicola took special care of us -- we enjoyed an upgraded suite overlooking the pool as well as complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Our suite was beautiful and provided a great view of the Epcot and Magic Kingdom fireworks in the evening. The Waldorf is a beautiful property. It has lush landscaping, a wonderful golf course and a fantastic spa. We have visited many spas and this one remains our favorite--the service and level of professionalism is second to none. And, of course, the perfect way to end an evening is with a delicious dinner at the Bull & Bear Steakhouse. We loved the macaroni and cheese and the filets! The pool is very enjoyable with live music, good food and plenty of servers. If you haven't been to this hotel, we highly recommend it. It is one of our favorites and we are already planning a return visit this winter!

Reviews.Title: “This must be the best hotel in Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: EGGBY
