Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights from the 4th September following a stay in Naples and at Portofino Bay (Universal). Our first 2 hotels were very good and so the Waldorf had a lot to live up to. This was WITHOUT DOUBT the best hotel experience of our trip. From check-in to departure it was PERFECTION with the best facilities and staff service you could imagine! Check-in: We had 2 king rooms booked and Adam & Byron arrange for us to have the 13th floor AND with DISNEY views. The rooms were STUNNING with great beds and superb housekeeping standards. The robes are wonderful and we actually bought one as a gift. The Pool: What fantastic staff! From day one we noticed that the "supervisors" who managed the bar and pool area (Ali and Vanessa) were very efficient and kept all the staff on their toes. They had a terrific team who were SO attentive and I must mention Shanna and Jerome who seemed to love their job and made the guests feel good. While we were there we witnessed a very troublesome guest who was always professionally handled and all credit to the hotel team for that!!!! We enjoyed the luxury of a Cabana one day and these are highly recommended! Love to the pool team from the Sinclairs! Dining/drinking: We used Peacock Alley, Sir Harry's and Bull & Bear. We thought prices were reasonable especially for cocktails (around $9). Service was impecable and friendly... never in the least stuffy! The steaks at B & B were incredible. It was my birthday and a complimentary desert, complete with candle, was provided. Such a nice touch! We enjoyed rooms service one night and our only complaint would be we had too much food!!! We loved the valet parking and the fact that the staff welcome you back to the hotel after every trip. Valet parking can be a bit pricey but it was a special holiday and added to the luxury. The car was always delivered promptly with no issues whatsoever! This is undoubtably a luxury hotel however you need not worry about feeling it will not be relaxed as the team do everything to look after you and give you a great time. We cannot wait to return and now plan short trips to Orlando JUST TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL!! Dear Manager... your team are doing a great job so thank you for all the training and coaching as it is definitely paying off for your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the name!”
Reviews.Author: Msfla29
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel...it was such a treat to be in such a beautiful, well appointed place. The staff was simply amazing...they were helpful, polite and so courteous. This hotel is a must stay and we will definitely be visiting it again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable by any standard”
Reviews.Author: Jasflora
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many fine hotels and once you have a taste for 5 star, you will not tolerate anything else. This hotel did not dissappoint at all from the spotless interiors, the lavish and very well prepared breakfasts to the service you get that often went beyond the call of duty. eg the eledrly member of staff ( I forget his name now) who looked after the entrance hall was incredibly friendly towards my young daughters and offered to keep an eye on them while they played on the Imacs and we had a drink outside! Well done! He didnt have to do that and we would have been happy with just his pleasent personality but this is the kind of staff we could all do with. Bar and restaurants are pricey but hey this is 5 star and prices are comparable with any of the 5 stars in London, Paris etc. I will definitely stay here again and would have no reservations in whole heartedly recommending this fine establishment

Reviews.Title: “fantastic would go again tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: riandei
Reviews.Content: Best hotel experience EVER ... the staff at this hotel made our stay the best experience. I cannot say enough about the employees here !! ... My husband needed to be in orlando for business so we added on the weekend at the Waldorf for our anniversary. It was a wonderful stay. The value for the money for this hotel was great. The restaurants are a bit pricey but the food was wonderful. We would stay here in a heartbeat. We upgraded to a disney view suite. It was nice to watch the fireworks every night. We used the pool all weekend and there was hardly anyone there. The pool was a perfect temp. STAY HERE !!!

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel with Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: TiataniumCups
Reviews.Content: Business bought me to this hotel for 4 days and three nights. I was greeted by a wonderful front desk that was very attentive and expeditious. The grounds are kept spotless as was the hotel and my room. Room was very spacious with all modern amenities and nice touches. The last day I had a chance to Golf on the course and was very impressed. The course was very green and well maintained. Service again by all staff was exceptional. Bull and Bear restaurant should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU WANNA BE A KING, GO TO WALDORF. EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: RICKBSAS
Reviews.Content: This is a kind of Hotels that you feel very happy from you stop at the door. The staff, ALL STAFF, are really friendly and very helpful. The rooms are enormous whit all amenities you need, plus Nespresso Coffee Maker. Bathrooms are amazing. Swimming pool and Jacuzzi are the place to be. And you can use the pool river at the Hilton that is very close walking to. IF you go without car, don´t worry, Waldorf offer complimentary shuttle service from to all Disney Parks, including Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend get away!”
Reviews.Author: Jennie P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to visit the Waldorf for a romantic get away this weekend (we live in Tampa) and must say our expectations were not only met but exceeded!. We were warmly welcomed the moment we arrived from everyone from the valet, the bellman, the front desk staff. all very sincere and in step with a top notch accommodations. When I asked the front desk staff for extra cream and coffee later in the stay, they were quick, and very helpful with my request and followed up shortly after it was delivered (love the follow up). Our suite was breath taking over looking the pool area and Disney were you could watch the Epcot fireworks from our private balcony, very, very clean, with attention to detail from the cool Italian coffee maker to the comfy couch to curl up and watch the sun set. The bed is amazing and finally figured out it had a really thick feather topper on it that made you feel like you were sleeping on a cloud! Linens were crisp but soft and hard to leave (I would love to buy in the shop, hint hint). We also had a chance to meet another couple for dinner at the Bull and Bear and also had a first class experience there as well. The Auqamarine wait staff by the pool on Saturday (9/24) was friendly and recommend a sinfully refreshing cocktail while listening to LIVE music which was perfect. Although we did not have a chance to take advantage of the private pool side cabanas this trip, we will check it out on our next visit, they looked perfect! I also noticed that the housekeeping staff was not as noticeable and intrusive as some hotels but still did an excellent job, straightening and leaving things perfect after the TWICE daily visit to straighten bed linens and leaving chocolate mints and a weather advisory for the next day on our pillow! I know I am missing a million details that made this weekend special for us but would love to thank the entire staff for a job well done on such a relaxing get away!!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reumann
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to have a banquet at this hotel and while there had a look at some of their rooms. Great value during the off-season and great location. From a number of rooms you can see EPCOT and the nightly fireworks show. Very friendly staff. Has it own golf course along with the Hilton next door. Easy to get to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Could not get any better!”
Reviews.Author: Eugene O
Reviews.Content: Great great great hotel;. Very clean, very quiet, and very quick service. The only thing that was just okay was the Spa, don't get me wrong but, it was nice but could have had some better staff. Went there twice while at hotel firstly for a pedicure which the lady had to tell me her life story and the pedicure ended up taking over an hour to finish (which was not a nice job) second time for a message which was very nice! Hotel staff was all about helping us out. VERY GAY FRIENDLY ATMOSPHERE! Always had taxi's waiting outside. Had to be one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at! A+ Hotel

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: csunny163
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, top notch service, and great location near disney attractions. The breakfast was excellent, poolside servers were attentive and friendly. The rooms are comfortable, the beds are fabulous, and the bathroom is well appointed with everything you would need. I would absolutely stay here again and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “First-class experience, top-notch staff”
Reviews.Author: hg6649
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 days at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando and I highly recommend it. Every aspect of my stay was first-rate. I was immediately and warmly greeted by the hotel desk staff who were eager to assist. Check-in was a breeze. And, I was upgraded to a suite due to the hotel being at capacity. My room was outstanding, scrupulously clean, with large overstuffed furniture, big marble bath with separate glass shower, stacks of huge towels, robes, high-end bath products, etc. I loved the Nespresso espresso/coffee machine and free bottled water, as well. Everything was brand new. The king-size bed was heavenly. I don't usually sleep well in hotels (which isn't fun since I travel frequently for work and pleasure), but I enjoyed several nights of great sleep at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. Huge down pillows, high thread count linens, beyond comfy comforter -- it was a struggle to get out of bed each morning. I cannot say enough about the friendliness of the staff. Every staff person I encountered stopped what they were doing and greeted me (often by name), asked how I was, how my stay was going, etc. The desk staff was eager to help with every request I had. We were coordinating a large dinner with clients staying at the hotel but at another location. Without needing to be asked, the front desk staff and the team out front stepped in to help us when they saw us rushing about trying to get clients into several shuttle buses leaving for the event. We had a night cap in the bar after an evening event at the hotel ended. It seemed like all of the other 450 people attending the event had the same idea, so all of the hotel bars were very busy. We found a table and I thought, forget it, we'll never get service. Then I noticed staff members from all over the hotel streaming in to help with the unexpected overflow of bar patrons (it was almost 11 p.m.). Clearly, the hotel immediately recognized the situation and responded. Our drink orders were taken promptly and delivered to us in no time. When several other friends joined our table, they were quickly served. Nice work! My room was freshly made up promptly each day. I noticed little things, like my papers were neatly restacked, or shoes realigned into a straight line. During turn-down service each night they freshened up the room again, closed the drapes and put the TV on soothing music channel and a lamp so I wouldn't return to a dark room. I would return to the Waldorf Astoria in a heartbeat. My only regret is that I didn't have time to enjoy more of the amenities. The pool looked gorgeous as did the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the best service you will find in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: todd_fix
Reviews.Content: I am late in writing this review, however the fond memories I have of our stay will linger a long time. We stayed at the Waldorf for two beautiful nights in May, 2011. Firstly, I will admit that it is the "small things" that I am most impressed with. If you stay at the Waldorf you can expect valet which opens the driver AND passenger doors upon arrival, questions from the valet such as "did you enjoy your evening <name>, and door men who welcome you into the understated yet lovely lobby. The front desk was very accommodating and after one evening's stay, we were so impressed that we decided to check if there was a suite available. Of course, they war happy to oblige and helped us gather out belongings from one room and took them to the other. The front desk attendant even hand-delivered our new room keys to our room. The suite was lovely also. Very well appointed and modern, comfortable bedroom, living room, dining area, wet bar, and large bathroom were found. The cocktail service in the lobby lounge was impeccable and the servers remembered my libation from visit to visit. Each time we would enter the lobby, it was apparent that a member of the Waldorf's management team was present, waiting by the center clock tower to verbally welcome us back. The pool and the cabana's are very nice. The fire pits were very modern and welcoming, with soft, comfortable sectionals around each. The nightly turn-down service was as expected and met all the hotel's other standards. When walking through the hallways, we never once passed a housekeeper that didn't look us directly in our eyes and say hello...even asking occasionally if we needed anything. Let's face it...there are many hotels with magnificent facilities. A guest has a candy-store to choose from. I am so thankful that we picked a hotel that remembers what service and personalization is all about. Kudos to the staff at the Waldorf. We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Patty C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely one of the most places I've ever stayed in my life!! As soon as I walked into my room I wished that I could've just moved in and stayed forever. Every one who worked there was kind and greated me with a smile. Got up in the morning and went to the gym with had lots of room and plenty of cardio equipment. The pool area was a cool area to hang out and chill for the day. My only complaint would be that my stay was too short.

Reviews.Title: “Bedding is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: aprilinlondon1970
Reviews.Content: The bedding is seriously so comfortable...it was beautiful outside, and I only wanted to curl up in bed. Room was clean, although other reviewer was correct that sometimes second housekeeping visit didn't do a 100% job. Also, food was not very good and extremely expensive. But it is an upscale hotel in a tourist spot, so I expected that. Overall though, staff was extremely accommodating, especially to my disabled 5 year old, who thought it was the best place ever.

Reviews.Title: “Most impressive hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Maria282
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a 10 night stay at The Waldorf. Myself and my husband stayed in a suite with our 2 baby boys. I cannot fault the Waldorf at all. It was impeccalby clean. The staff were execeptionally polite, and very very helpful. There wasnt many children staying at the hotel, and it didnt seem to be a hotel where you would bring children. Nonetheless, we were made feel so very welcome, and no one raised an eyebrow when my toddler did laps of the foyer!! The buses that transported us to the parks were very punctual and the staff very helpful. We didnt even have to fold our double buggy, as the driver wheeled it straight under the bus!!! I would most definately stay at this hotel again. I wouldn't even consider another hotel. I would definatley recommend it to a friend. I hope to be back next year. To all the staff at The Waldorf, I would like to say thank you for your kindess and patience throughout our stay. You always said it as a pleasure to assist my family, but I must say it was an absolute pleasure to stay at The Waldorf. Maria If anyone has any queries regarding my stay I'd be happy to help if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: debbie828
Reviews.Content: This is a very inviting place in the midst of Disney chaos. From the moment you catch a whiff of the scented air to when you gaze over the pool and take in the peacefulness of your room, you will be glad that you stayed outside of the parks. However, we encounter some inconsistencies in terms of service from both valet, bellmen and housekeeping staff. Staff was either fabulous or flat out ignored making eye contact with you. We found some things in our room (stains, nicks, time-worn, etc.) that were inconsistent with WA quality & the newness of the hotel. That said, we would stay here agian. We just felt like there were still kinks to be worked out. Lastly, do not get a room on the third floor. It's a strang floor, with very few guest rooms and what appears to be office space.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler30
Reviews.Content: I was here for a wedding and it was an incredible experience. Central location, impeccable rooms and service. The banquet facility was beautiful and would suggest it to anyone who is considering getting married in Orlando, but wants something more upscale and not so Disney. I was impressed overall with the service that you receive. Quick and would get you anything you needed. The food was really good as well. Would definitely return here for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: 2goSomeplace
Reviews.Content: The Orlando Waldorf is a very nice hotel. It caters to a mixed clientele, business people/conferences, families, couples and golfers. Keeping in mind the mix, you know you will encounter people that you wouldn't normally spend your days with at some point, but if you can let it slide, you will LOVE this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and have the amenities that come with a luxury hotel; robes, slippers, large walk in showers with a separate soaking tub and plush towels. Outside the room: the bar has wonderful martinis. The food in the restaurants was exceptional and the wait staff very attentive. The pool is very comfortable and the cabanas, although a little pricey are very enjoyable on day you are planning to simply relax at the hotel. Transportation is available to the theme parks and is direct between the Hilton/Waldorf Bonnet Creek. Will we go back again... the answer is a resounding YES! And we'll make sure to look Manny up at the Bull & Bear, his suggestions were dead on. The food was a true highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: zimme3
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Oasis in the middle of Disney maddness. Beautiful room, professional and cheerfull service and great food. If you are going to Orlando the Waldorf Astoria is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in orlando”
Reviews.Author: maesmom
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility. Enjoyed the sophistication of waldorf pool and the fun-laden Hilton pool. Staff are attentive, friendly. Close proximity to Disney parks but also relaxing- not overwhelmed by tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect - everything.”
Reviews.Author: BoilerSammy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days labor day weekend then till Thursday afterward. I travel quite a bit as a consultant and consider myself to be a hotel snob over the years after getting spoiled on business travel. This was family vacation. From the first step till leaving, the Waldorf is the best experience I've ever had at a hotel. Soon as the doors are opened for you, the cool air and a fresh smell hits you in the face, and you are greeted with chilled champagne. Check in was smooth and Steve our bellman gave us brief tour of hotel on the way to room. Room was a suite overlooking pool and golf course. Beautiful. Could see Epcot fireworks every night. Room is expected clean. High end decor and trim in room impressive. Robes, Espresso machine, fridge with wine rack, etc. Pull out bed for kids was comfy, not a foam pad with bars poking your back. Bed is absolutely the most comfortable ever! King size triple down - like being swallowed by a marshmallow. Food - while on the higher end, outstanding is only way to describe. If you're coming for chicken fingers and pizza, go to Pop Century. The hotel connects to Hilton Bonnet creek (which their restaurants were great too. They offered a mid tier price level where kids eat free). Pools - quiet, beautiful. As mentioned, can go over to Hilton pool across property. That pool is better for kids with lazy river and water slide. This one more crowded. We like coming back to our quiet retreat when kids got tired. Service - second to none. Front desk, Concierges, bellman, - everything great. Had some issues with transportation - Concierge Jeremy promptly took care of it. My daugther lost a disney trading pin while walking to restaurant. I asked if it got turned in to lost and found - later that night the front office mgr Zoltan called me. He "found" a new one through "friend". That was on our final night - he didn't have to do that and it made my daughter's day. Nice touch. All the employess seemed generally happy here, and happy to help. If you're considering a high end Disney resort vs here, it's a no-brainer. You pay $300+ at those to stay on property. This location is very close to all parks and has free transpo on air conditioned buses to parks. I've now done both. The Disney rooms are like Holiday Inn express - similar service. What you're paying for is the grounds and theme of resort. Here you get best of everything - service, beautiful pool, great room, food. Loved it and hope to be back next trip to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “the beginning of a wonderful tradition”
Reviews.Author: korhuxt
Reviews.Content: This was our second summer visit at the Waldorf. All the wonderful things we experienced last year (and which were a factor in our return) were experienced again this year. We upgraded to a "Disney" view - mainly because we wanted to see the fireworks from the room - but ended up out late in the evenings and missed them. The view, however, is lovely - from the pool to the golf course to the Disney parks beyond. The room was clean, modern and roomy. LOVED the bathroom and toiletries. Housekeeping service was excellent, timely and unobtrusive - I love the fact you don't see their carts in the hallway. Even though the Hilton and Waldorf are connected - both indoors and outdoors - I prefer the Waldorf side. It's definitely quieter and less crowded. As a Waldorf guest, you can use the Hilton pool area which includes a lazy river and slide. My husband and 12 year daughter played golf each morning. Very attentive staff, the driving range is well maintained (free tees and ball markers) and the course was in excellent condition. There's no coffee maker in the room, but just go down to the lobby to get a complimentary cup in the morning. We did not visit any of the Disney parks but love the fact the hotel has free shuttle service on a scheduled basis. The concierge was helpful in helping to arrange babysitting services for our friends who were traveling with a toddler. Will definitely be back next year - if not sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Grand Luxury Hotel with really amazing service”
Reviews.Author: NicolasGr
Reviews.Content: Actually we didn't really care about the hotel choice , during our visit in Orlando (as we knew we would spend all day long in the parks). We only wanted a decent , beautiful hotel always in the 4-5 star category.Thus we chose a deluxe king in Waldorf Astoria and our expectation were really surpassed. Although I usually prefer the more modern hotels, Waldorf Astoria Orlando is a beautiful luxurious hotel without ending being old fashioned or too uptight. Rooms are really great (especially for their price), with gorgeous views and some amazing mattresses. The bathroom design was maybe the only fault I could find to the hotel. It is quite old-fashioned but at least is quite spacious. Valet and concierge services are exceptional. All staff in Waldorf are really polite and make you feel like home. Extra credit as well for the pool area. Very relaxing and elegant. To sum it up: Positives: - Exceptional Service - Great Rooms - Excellent sleep quality - Cool Pool Area - Politeness Negatives: - Bathrooms Design (which is quite negligible taking into account the whole good experience) - No Free Internet in the room All in all we had a great stay during our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 5 star feeling”
Reviews.Author: iTravelG
Reviews.Content: We had a regular room facing the front of the hotel. It wasn't important to us to have a view of the pool or disney. Waldorf is a 5-star hotel, but unfortunately there are some points that ruin that impreession. The valets and bellman seem to handle the stress periods poorly. When we arrived, we had to call and ask for our luggage, even though it had been over 30mins wait. The same night we were going out for dinner, so i called the reception and asked for the car. After 40mins wait outside, i asked the valets where the car was, and it turned out the reception hadn't even called for the car. The next day we asked the concierge for directions, which he promised he would print and leave in the car for us, but the prints never showed up. The valets were the ones saving the situations each time. They got the car immediately, and they got us directions.  The breakfast buffet has good selections, but again they can't seem to handle stress. It was a 20mins wait for omelets, and the cooks started messing up the orders, and on top of it all, out of nowhere comes one of the waiters and starts cutting the line for other guest. The one female cook made excellent omelets and crepes and was friendly and professional all the time.  The pool is overcrowded, lots of loud children, and the pool staff was inattentive. All in all: Waldorf gives the impression that it tries hard to provide good service, but unfortunately there are too many things that have room for improvement, and that ruins the experience. It has great rooms, great bathrooms with a tub and shower, but it's not enough to save the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would go back”
Reviews.Author: Manish M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf in August on a family holiday for two weeks. The hotel is located in the heart of Disney and travelling between the Disney parks was convenient and easy. The room we stayed in was the basic room with two queen beds and was very comfortable and spacious. The pool is great and the Hilton has a child friendly pool which is only a couple of minutes away. The breakfast was good with lots of choice. We had hired a car and valet was included in our hotel package and the service was great and friendly. If the price was not included it would of been rather expensive and I don,t think there was any alternative. The hotel rooms have a blu ray player but the hotel does not provide any blu ray discs for guests which I found defeated the purposes of the player. We would Xgrid toy consider staying at this hotel when we next travel to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Good !”
Reviews.Author: albeeee
Reviews.Content: Reviews are accurate, hotel was underbooked for last week of August with most schools started so customer service was beyond compare. Rooms are spacious and beds were great. We left at 9 AM each day and came back at 11 PM each night, so the rooms and Oscars were really all we used. Oscars food quality is great, service was mixed- you do NOT want Clay for a server- he really is there to over-socialize and we were on a kids eat free plan- he brought us the wrong bill twice - we asked about it- and he said "well I will just fix it all later"- he challenged back. Why not just bring the correct invoice and save the attitude ??? Overall- great hotel location and atmosphere- well done W/A

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: TOaqesNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Waldorf Astoria Orlando this august, the rooms are awesome. We booked a suite which was spacious and very luxuroius. Plenty of room for the four of us, large living room with bar (Nespresso, fridge) and a sleeping sofa for the children. The bedroom was big with a fantastic bed. The bathroom had a seperate bath, a large shower, sink and wc. There was a second 1/2 bathroom with wc and sink. All suites have balconies. We overlooked the pool area and had a great view over the golf courses. At night we could see the fireworks at Epcot. Everything is very clean, the resort is very luxurious! The Waldorf has a great swimmingpool and enough longchairs for the guests. And there is a Great gym! Besies all the facilities at The Waldorf there are restaurants, a swimmingpool etc. at the adjoining Hilton hotel. We have not used the restaurants except for Oscar's for breakfast. The buffet was very good. The Waldorf Astoria is situated on a perfect location to visit all the theme parks, specially the Disney parks which are all very nearby. Location is also very close to the I4 highway. After been to Orlando two times before we chose the Waldorf Astoria over the Ritz Carlton because of the very spacious rooms. Overall the hotel is fantastic. There are however some things which also have to be said: - service is great but this is not experieenced with all the staff. Everbody at Valet were very nice and helpful, the staff at Oscar's did a great job but the staff at the reception (not all of them) were a bit detached and formal. We experienced overall a much friendlier staff at the Ritz Carlton! - although the rooms were clean and we did not have the beds to be changed daily (we used the card to say when the bedlinen could stay) we experienced that sheets were not changed when indicated. - most doubtful: we asked for a late check out because our (total over 12 hour) flight was early in the evening. This was not a simple thing to arrange. The check out is at 11.00 and a complimentary hour is given by the hotel if possible. Actually the hotel was not at all completely booked so we could not see the problem. But the strangest thing is that we had to pay by the hour for a longer use of the room. After a stay for THREE weeks we tought that this was very unusual. We have stayed in several hotels for shorter or longer stays but have never experienced this sort of formal attitude! We think this is dealing by the rules but aso very unprofessional, every rule can be changed per situation. Incredible experience, we used the room and have payed for it although we basically would refuse to pay for the three hours on a stay for three weeks... Anyway thanks to everyone who contributed on a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel with first class staff.”
Reviews.Author: jsidhu
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Orlando and a 10 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria. Stayed at a few hotels in Orlando but this one has far been the best. The whole complex from the spa to the golf club is class.Don't normally do reviews but after the way we were looked after thought they definately deserved a mention. So thanks to the whole team and if you suffer from insomnia like me the staff at the front desk are great company for a midnight chat !!! Hopefully see you soon and thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria Orlando - place to stay if you are going to Disney Theme Parks !”
Reviews.Author: ameeral
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, new , great service and everything else you would expect from a Five Star Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel With a Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: ceabee115
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel if you are looking for something close to Disney but with the feel of a luxury resort where you can escape to a beautiful, clean and quiet room. The hotel is very well appointed and the furnishings seem new and elegant. We were upgraded to a small suite which was nice since we have a small child. The staff were pleasant and professional. The spa was fantastic and both therapists were well trained and also pleasant. I had one of the best deep tissue massages and pedicures I have ever had. The pool is big (they don't have life guards though), with plenty of towels and umbrellas. They also have poolside service. The food was quite good, both outdoor, casual food and the very pricey, but delicious Bull & Bear. At lunch time, they had a guitarist and singer and usually this can be annoying, but to the contrary, he was very good and you found yourself simply enjoying the sunshine and the live music. There is an 18 hole golf course at the hotel, which i did not play, but heard was very nice, albiet very challenging. My only beef was that there is piped in music everywhere (hallways, elevators, patio, common areas), so if you just want to read a book on the patio and have some quiet time, you need to "tune out" the music or head back to your room. I would also recommend that you let the front desk know when you want your room cleaned or turned down as they seem a little behind. Other than that, I was pleasantly surprised. We would most definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: BradfordR
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for a hotel before, but this hotel was so amazing I decided to do so. I stay approximately 50 nights a year at Ritz-Carltons, but thought I'd give the WA a try on a trip to Disney World with the family. First thing that struck me was the attitude of the staff how much they truly gave of themselves. It was apparent that they wanted nothing less than their guest to have the most amazing experience. We stayed in a luxury Suite, and it was fabulous. Everything was super clean and new. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever stayed in....Puts the Westin Heavenly bed to shame. Breakfast was amazing. Again, made more amazing by a staff that went above and beyond. They converted me into an instant fan. We will be back for sure. Nicer than any Ritz-Carlton I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “"We Loved it and we'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia B
Reviews.Content: Just remember this hotel is in Orlando not Vegas. So, you have to remember this first factor! The bed will make you will feel like you are sleeping on a cloud. Everything is new and clean. If you have kids with you, please know that the Hilton pool next door has a slide and a lazy river available to Waldorff guests. Also, delicious Italian restaurant and a Disney store. You can purchase your Disney tickets there if you are not a Florida resident. The transportation to Disney parks and village is easy. The bus is taller, and more comfortable than the rest I have seen at the parks. It arrives on time. So, get your schedule. If you have questions about parks, the bus driver will be happy to help. Just great not to having to drive to parks or get the tram. We like breakfast in bed. We also like 24 hours room service. We love waldorff salads! We love the Waldorff Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Judith_Chalmers5
Reviews.Content: From arriving to leaving we absolutely loved our trip here. The hotel was fabulous and the staff were wonderful. The bedroom was very comfortable and spacious and the bathroom was a good size and we were a family of 4 using it for 2 weeks. We had a nice view of Disney and the fireworks at night which was great. The valet parking was really convenient (included as part of the price because we were staying more than a week) and so long as we gave them about 10 mins notice, we never had to wait. The staff on the desk were very helpful with restaurant recommendations or tips for days out and so on. The pool area was great and little touches like getting your towels for you and bringing cool towels round when it got really hot made it really special. We only ate at the hotel once at the steak restaurant (the Bull & Bear) which was excellent although pricy for a family of 4! All in all, I rate this hotel very highly and would recommend it for couples, families or small groups of friends. They did have a couple of conferences on during our time there which made it quite busy but it really didn't detract from the service or experience. The only change I would make is to have complimentary wi-fi in the room which was prohibitively expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Waldorf in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: eton1970
Reviews.Content: Having been raised in New York, it still strikes me as odd to see a Waldorf outside the city. Regardless, excellent, friendly staff with large and functional room. Pretty pool and good gym. Orlando being what it is, this hotel can be used as a comfortable base to go to Disney World (it is actually on the property but not identified as such) or just relax. Oddly, a Hilton is connected to it (you can tell when the marble ends) but overall is a very nice resort-style property. Fine golfing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: mgb38
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel- the bed was sumptuous, the pool was never crowded, and service was pleasant. The gym is beautiful- weights and cardio equipment, water bottles and headphones. Way better than Hilton next door. They don't tell you at concierge but should, that the cabanas along the pools are available for half day and full day rentals with drinks, fruit plate, wait staff, etc. We stayed with our four yr old and sixteen yr old, and they loved it. Not snooty at all- we've been to Ritz and Four Seasons everywhere, and this was an equal experience. La Luce at Hilton had wonderful dinners, and Oscars has a great a la carte breakfast at noon if you miss themad breakfast buffet rush( we always did). Peacock Alley has a pianist and filling food- very relaxing and delicious fare. Location is great to Downtown and Hollywood. No microwave or fridge - stay at the Hilton next door if you want that.we just enjoyed the atmosphere and pampering. Make sure you get water for your drive back if you did drive- they forgot ours. The golf cart that brought us back and forth to Hilton was fast. We will be back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TommyK3769
Reviews.Content: First I want to start out saying that the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando is NOT a 5 star hotel. It is, at best, a 4 star with a staff that needs a bit more training. Check-in: This was quick. I was not accommodated with the king bed request, but that was not a big deal. Two queen beds were fine. They also "upgraded" me to a "park view" room so I could watch the fireworks at night. The view was actually quite impressive and I did enjoy the fireworks. Bell Service: It took almost 30 minutes to get the bags from the car to our room. Normally I wouldn't care, but the baby's diapers and food were in those bags. So that was quite inconvenient and unacceptable for this hotel. A plus for the bell service: They did help us install the car seat into the rental car. This was highly appreciated. Room cleaning staff: Out of all three days we were there, the room was never cleaned before 3:00 PM. This was totally unacceptable and quite inconvenient when we had to bring the baby back for his nap. Additionally the ice bucket was only filled up once during the entire stay, despite the fact that I had a wine bottle in it the entire time. Once again, not a big deal, if you are staying at a 4 star hotel. Valet service: Generally quick and efficient. highly appreciated. One complaint is that I asked them if they could pull the car around because we left a package in the car. They said no need to pull around, they would check for us and bring it in. We never heard from them again on the topic. Since we found the package in our room, I can't complain too much though :) Rooms: I had the normal double queen room, and found them to be quite small. (I did know this going in though.. so no complaints). The blankets on the bed were quite heavy. I need to be covered the whole night and I couldn't because I was sweating profusely. This caused me to wake up several times during the night. The beds, though, in general we comfortable. The blu ray player in the room was appreciated, and kept baby happy. The rooms were ok... I hate to keep repeating myself, but think 4 star ok. Nothing special. Robes and slippers were something you find in a Radisson... the toiletries were nothing special... The one thing that was very tacky was the Voss bottled water in the room with a $6 price tag on it. C'mon... really... in a supposed 5 star hotel. Food: We didn't try the room service or the any of the resort restaurants, so I cannot comment on that. The coffee in the lobby was very good in the morning. The remove it way too early though. Overall, for the money, I would rather stay in the Radisson Lake Buena Vista. The rooms are a little bigger, they have large flat screen TVs and you get the same basic service (minus valet parking). Granted it is listed as a 4 star hotel... but that is what it is! Suggestion: unless you just want to say you are staying at a Waldorf Astoria, save your money and stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: cookie4rue
Reviews.Content: This place was like something you see on a movie. I was there for a conference, and could probably never afford this myself. If you can, though, I reccomend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waldorf stay with two year old”
Reviews.Author: nctravelnut99
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay at the Waldorf! We had initial hesitations booking here as there were not a lot of reviews of families with small children. The Hilton next door (5 min walk through the conference center) is absolutely more suited for small children, but having access to their facilities, we went for it. When we booked, I made reservations directly on their website and completed the standby request to upgrade to a Deluxe suite if available - we were interested in this option to provide us a little privacy from our two year old. We arrived Sat before 10am and were granted the upgrade, but they upgraded us to a Luxury Suite - very nice! We were treated with every courtesy in each and every way during our stay. Thank you to all the staff of Waldorf for a wonderful stay. As I hesitate to repeat what previous reviewers have written, please see my pro/cons below. Pros: Bus transportation to Disney attractions, always on time and not shared with other resorts - Magic Kingdom was 2x per hour Room was top notch Housekeeping staff was excellent, room always tidy and special attention to our little one's needs Pools had zero entry for small children Concierge and bell staff very attentive Breakfast free for children at Oscars Dinner free for children at Hilton Bistro Rollaway bed for our two year old - propped with pillows and chairs to prevent rolling off $50/day resort credit (we blew through this quickly) Cons: Limited times to Downtown Disney (can alternatively take a town car for $10 each way) Bar/Kitchen in suite has no utensils, soap/sponge, plates, etc (only wine glasses) Food was average, but priced for excellent (WA & Hilton both) Water slide min height 40" could not accompany with parent Room service was $3 delivery + 22% service charge on top of expensive prices (really!?!)

Reviews.Title: “Total luxury at a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Anthills
Reviews.Content: I will start with the only very small negative and that is that the hotel just will not appear on a sat nav, but once you find it it will be well worth the search. You will be greeted by vallet parking which does cost $20 per day so see if you can have this added as a free extra when Booking, it was included for me which helps cost wise but also with the storms which can occur during the summer it is very welcoming and appreciated. The staff are fantastic and really can't do enough for you. The location is great for all the Disney parks and none Disney parks.There is a free bus service which runs to all the main Disney parks every half hour but it is so easy to drive to the parks you may find it easier!!!. The rooms are spacious and very clean there is a twice daily room service and also a evening turn down service slippers and chocolates included. The pool is great and very relaxing you can also use all the facilities at the next door Hilton hotel which is connected and includes more restaurants, pools and has a lazy river for the children again with lovely attentive staff who replenish towels and drinks at regular intervals. I suppose one other negative would be the cost of the food in the hotel which was quite expensive but there are so many other places to eat in and around Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JildyC
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip one week before we left based on the positive feedback we read on the site and we definitely agree. Hotel was immaculate and the staff were all pleasant and accommodating. Special mention to Jill at the lounge area who provided valuable advice to us regarding attractions and local beaches. Hotel location was perfect for visiting Disney parks and we appreciated the bus shuttle service. My husband, I, and my 6 yr old daughter really appreciated the little extras. From the complimentary punch in the lobby to the easily accessed ice water by the pool. The turn down service at night with chocolates to the ability to share the Hilton lazy river next door until midnight. The valet parking service to having 6 elevators always at your disposal. Everything is first class and you are definitely spoiled. Only wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: abusinesstraveller20
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights during a business meeting in the joining convention centre. Room was great, very comfortable. The staff are fantastic, everything I needed, including tracking down an Ipad all managed impeccably. I will be going out of my way to stay again as soon as i can !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property and staff, I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sstrait
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria was amazing. The property and the grounds was impeccable. I would like to comment on the staff from the bellman, registration, conceirge, food service, housekeeping, and most of the the security. I was very impressed with Robert Perez and they way he conducted himself and his team. I felt very secure throughout my stay. I highly reccomend the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Scruggs5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Not only is it beautiful, clean and luxurious, the service is impeccable! This family will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “If for business that's the one”
Reviews.Author: Dawid J
Reviews.Content: If want to avoid all this Disney crowd that's the place for you. It is located a little bit of the family crowd corridor, next to the golf course, nice views, excellent pool, big rooms and nice staff. We've stayed there for a week, got a car at the hotel so we were able not to get to bored. And it is not a WA where you need to follow a dress code, it's still Florida... :)

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: munchkin80
Reviews.Content: I am admittedly a hotel snob and have stayed in some of the best hotels in the locations to where I travel and the Waldorf Orlando is, by far, the very best in Orlando. It is luxurious and elegant with a very modern exterior (not what I expected). Staff was the most professional, courteous and extremely helpful (with the exception of a couple of valet personnel, who acted like they were doing me or management a favor - the only drawback from a hotel that receives the highest marks in each and every category you can come up with). The turndown service was the best I've had - I returned to a room with classical music on the large flat screen tv, slippers by my bed, bench cleared off, water by the bedside. I was so impressed that I wrote her a note with a nice tip (as I had forgotten to leave one in my haste to go shopping) and left it with the front desk. The bathroom offers you a separate tub from a shower; and while I love a good soak, I take a bath in a hotel - except here. A single king size room is very large and I believe the sofa maybe a pull out. I don't sleep well when I travel, especially alone, yet I fell asleep immediately in the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, anywhere. I even removed the linen to find out the brand so I could buy the pillows, they were perfect. This is a quiet, sophisticated hotel and I didn't see the usual unruly, screaming kids running around; especially for being located in the Epcot resort area of Walt Disney World. I would even recommend staying here while visiting any of the Orlando area theme parks (check to confirm but you can always buy the Express Passes instead of staying at one of the property's hotels), or while on business in downtown (which is where I had to travel to). I didn't have much time to enjoy The Guerlain Spa, but I did treat myself to a wash/style inside their hair salon (so convenient to have one in the hotel, instead of driving to another location) - which is high end and accordingly priced. The stylist did a great job on my hair, but the Florida humidity is cruel and one of the least attractive parts of summer; so keep this in mind. I only got to stay one night but I will most certainly return with either the hubby for a romantic visit or with the teenagers for a family outing. Needless to say, I absolutely loved this place and it is definitely my favorite hotel (favorite resort - Mohonk Mountain House in New Paltz, NY). **NOTE** I did have a problem locating this hotel on both my Garmin GPS system and my IPad2's GPS application (not worth the $30 cost). Keep the hotel's number handy in case you have to call for guidance.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nicknesta
Reviews.Content: I stay in great hotels all over the world but the waldorf orlando might just be my new favourite. We were there for a week doing all the theme parks and the stay was perfect in every level. Our suite was fantastic. The food in the hotel is excellent and thE service first class in all areas of the hotel from pool to concierge. The pool deck is great and the perfect place to relax after a tough day of lines and screaming kids. Location is great for everything and I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: G3A
Reviews.Content: This is a very sophisticated, elagant otel. Rooms are spacey. The staff is very helpful. The only problem we had was with room cleaning and it was a very little detail. They fixed it immediately. So I recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for a comfortable, spacey, friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: I just spent the last two nights in Orlando at this hotel attending a short conference. The hotel is situated within Disney World, and is adult oriented and geared for the business traveler. The hotel itself is 1 1/2 yrs. old and is nicely appointed. From the outside, it looks just like the nearby Hilton and the architecture is not all that impressive. However, the interior is immaculate. The conference and meeting facilities are first rate. The guest rooms are spacious and comfortable with amenities such as slippers, bathrobes, upgraded toiletries, large flat screen tv, and the floor I was on was very quiet. In fact, during my two day stay I did not see another guest on my floor. Restaurants there are named after the ones in the original Waldorf Astoria in New York, like Oscar's and Bull & Bear, and though I did not dine in them, they looked elegant, pricey too. I did enjoy the pool area as it was blazing hot there. The pool is quiet - no waterfalls, etc. and is nice for relaxing. There is a large Guerlain spa and a superb Rees Jones designed championship golf course which I want to return to play. The staff is very professional and friendly as one would expect. Turndown service at night was automatic and welcome. Excellent stay and I would definitely enjoy staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and still in love with it :)”
Reviews.Author: lissybubs
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet! This was our 2nd visit and it was just as fantastic as the last time. It's simply a totally fantastic luxury hotel with lovely helpful staff and wonderful facilities. We are very demanding when we stay somewhere and I can honestly say that this place is faultless. We LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “best luxury hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: marvel_pl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful top class resort with gardens, lakes, swimming pools and golf courses. It is situated very close to Disney (there is a hotel free shuttle bus available) but you don't feel this as the hotel neighbours Bonnet Creek Nature Reserve and on the way you pass green forests and nature areas. Lovely! The reception area is enormous and stylish with a replica of New York's Waldorf Astoria clock. We had a suite with a sleeping area and living area, both equipped with large LCD screens. It had also kitchen/ dinig area with nespresso coffee machine, refrigerator and freezer! Swimming pool is great, we rented a private cabana with TV, cooler and WI-FI. Ycan swim until late in the night which is great for guests from Europe suffering from jet-lag. you can also visit sister hotel Hilton situated within the same resort area, with more swimming pools and lazy river, but with more children. Breakfast was delicious, we were offered even crab omelette, crepes and selection of dishes from aroound the world. Dinner we went to Bull and Bear's to try their famous steaks and Thousand Island sauce, which was originally created in Waldorf New York! The stuff was extremely professional, friendly and helpful. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Second time we stayed there and will go again.”
Reviews.Author: donnaearnhardt
Reviews.Content: Went to the Waldorf Bonnet Creek for a conference Sunday 31st July thru Wed. 3rd August. Very nice place, close to all attractions, great service, clean & comfortable. Stayed there once before and certainly will go again.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok”
Reviews.Author: faige
Reviews.Content: Maybe because it was a holiday weekend but the hotel was just ok. The pool was very crowded and it didn't seem that clean to me, the servers looked like they were doing us a favor each time you asked for something. The food at the hotel was just ok , nothing memorable. I would not stay there again and regretted that I did not stay onsite as I was not entitled to early entry, etc.... It was also a bit of a trek to all the parks...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Resort - My New Top Orlando Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DC_NOVATraveler
Reviews.Content: This resort was a real gem - luxurious, relaxing, affordable and very convenient. Located within the Walt Disney Resort, this hotel has all the trappings to provide a luxurious, comfortable stay. The room was spacious and clean, the pool was well maintained with great poolside service, and the transportation to the Disney Parks was convenient and frequent. It is connected via the shuttle buses or a short walking path to the Hilton Bonnet Creek - which allows free access to their pool & lazy river which is open later. The Waldorf was clearly the more quiet, relaxing location while the Hilton next door had more family with young children activities. You can be sure we'll be back at the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Carrottop
Reviews.Content: Having visited this part of the world on many occasions for a holiday, this was certainly up there with the best of them. Two wonderful weeks. A few hic-ups at the start after half a days travel were sorted out by the front desk staff almost immediately, one of these being no fridge in the room, one was delivered within the hour. View over Disney parks in the distance and the golf club in the foreground were beautiful but even more inpresive was the pool area which was always inviting. The room was most comfortable, beds were a joy to sleep in. Bathroom was also a delight, with towels chamged whenever required and sundries were always replaced regularly. The peacock Lounge was used often by my wife and I, it was such a relaxing place to be. A grand piano being played every evening by a very accomplished pianist (my daughter plays, so she should know) made it all the more special. The serving staff were also very attentive, special mention of Jill who got to know our likes and dis-likes, I hope she gets her wish and succeeds in the hotel trade, she does have the qualifications, and the will, i'm sure. The pool area was great for relaxing, beds were very comfortable and staff always ready to help everyone settle down for a days sunbathing. Pool staff would bring cold facial towels, frozen grapes or melon and and drinks through-out the day to help keep you cool. The pool side bar served delicious food and drink all day. The staff here were also brilliant. In case Andrew who serves at the bar reads this. "Thanks for taking the bet on the World Cup Ladies Final". The Waldorf Astoria Golf Club was a joy to play, all 4 rounds that we managed to get in. As one who normally prefers to play a few different courses in the area, on this occasion we only went to one course, Falcons Fire G.C., outside the resort. This was due to the great service at the resort course, turning up well before tee off allowed you time for complementary coffee or tea with a good selection of cakes and pastries. The restroom was also well stocked with various toiletries after your round. Maybe they could look at giving hotel guests a better price, but that is NOT a complaint. My wife and daughter visited the Spa for some treatments. They had nothing but compliments about the place, might try it myself next time. Try the Bull and Bear restaurant, food was remarkable, dare you try the 40oz Tomahawk steak? If I've missed any area of this hotel to write about its because there was just so much to rave about. Thanks Waldorf, so many memories.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations but not 5-star service.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLolly
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property and the accommodations are very nice, however, the service is not what I would expect from a 5-star resort. We stayed in 2 king executive suite rooms. The suites had a separate living room with a wet bar area & mini-fridge. The balcony was great, but for some reason there was only one chair on ours so the two of us couldn't enjoy the nice view of the golf course & pool area at the same time. Our bed was oddly higher at the foot - not sure what the cause of that was - it was just odd. The linens & pillows were nice. The bathroom was luxe with a separate tub/shower. The live music on Friday & Saturday night in the "Peacock Alley" lounge was fantastic. There were some interesting libations listed on the lounge menu so we tried several of them. My "Alpine Pear" cocktail ($14) was wonderful until I noticed a dead fly was floating in it. The server was kind enough to bring another one promptly when I pointed this out to her, but I was a little surprised that it wasn't complimentary...not that I'm looking for something for free, but I guess I kinda expected that level of service from a 5-star when you serve someone an insect. On Friday night (1-2am) there was an overnight party with loud music, etc., going on in a room adjacent to that of the other couple in our party. Security went to the offending room, but afterward there was banging on the door and prank doorbell ringing which was disconcerting & frankly, a little scary - particularly since our group had not interacted with them at all & had left it up entirely to security to resolve. Though the following day, hotel staff were nice enough to move the other couple in our party to another room on a different floor. While we certainly don't blame the hotel for the ridiculous behavior of these other "guests", it did cast a pall over our weekend. Again, this is a lovely property with some nice amenities (servers in the lobby greeting you with champagne in the afternoon, chilled citrus-infused water available in the lobby), but next time I think we'll stick with the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “BeautiFul hotel for business people”
Reviews.Author: urdunn
Reviews.Content: Good for business travelers who need to be apart from the disney crowd not too family friendly. Go to sister hotel next door at the Hilton for a great pool. If you have children be prepared to get stared down....by the staff and business travelers at hotel. Rooms are nice hotel is lovely but food is extremely overpriced and slow to come out. My particular room had to be cleaned and refrigerator did not work although the manager on duty took $50 off bill and replaced it next day

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and outstanding service in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Middelburg
Reviews.Content: After a disastrous stay in a 5-star de Luxe hotel in Italy together with my wife we travelled to Orlando with the family. What a difference.... We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, Orlando Fl. The only comment I can provide is that this is a truly outstanding hotel from any perspective. The service, the rooms, attractive for couples and for children, the restaurants, the gym, friendliness of staff. Great value and wonderful luxury in an easy going way in the middle of Disney busyness. A problem at check-in was being treated fast and with total focus on customer satisfaction. We will definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, wonderful, oustanding!!”
Reviews.Author: fabcris22
Reviews.Content: When I was choosing the hotel for our vacation I took under consideration all reviews I`ve read at trip advisor. All the terrible reviews were about service, so I went expecting to battle for a good service. Here I am now, two days after arriving and I just couldn't wait to write my review. The hotel is amazing, beautiful, clean and sophisticated. The pool is excellent, just the right temperature. The pool boy is very helpful. In fact, about the services : WONDERFUL. I didn't have any problems or questions that weren't solved right away and with courtesy and a smile. Everyone here is great. The room service was simply delicious. In the room there’s a big television filled with channels, which is something very hard to find in a hotel; a bathroom with a big sink, tub AND shower, besides being extremely clean. Wi-fi is free while at the lobby. You have to pay when in your room, but it isn't very expensive. The breakfast is extraordinary, and the servers there helpful and efficient. I'm having an amazing time, and I hope to be back time and time again. Everything here is impeccable!!

Reviews.Title: “A must see”
Reviews.Author: MKGMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but it falls short in some areas. Check-in desk is the most "professional" place in the hotel, room service is fast however they never brought a table cloth and the food was served on the table without prior cleaning and covering. 22% tip is included in the total price of the room service and there is also a 3$ fee for the room service (you can tip more if you want). The hotel does have milk for the little ones but they do not have organic milk. I would expect a regular hotel not to have organic milk but in my opinion this in not any hotel... Now the good stuff: beautiful view from the balcony; beautiful, spacious and clean rooms; impressive lobby. The food is good regardless of the restaurant you choose.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior106
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a classy getaway with your spouse or spa weekend with your girlfriends, book a room. Great prices for Florida residents. It is not cheap to eat or drink here, but you don't go to the Waldorf Astoria and expect 2-4-1 specials!! It connects with the Hilton, and that seems to be more of a family spot! The Waldorf needs one more good restaurant for evening dining. The Bull and Bear was fabulous, but expect to spend some money. The service throughout the hotel is impeccable, and the beds are fabulous!! The golf course is in great shape, but it is narrow and difficult! It was great to drive 1-1/2 hours and feel like we were on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SammySquirrell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at WA for two weeks, check in efficient, first impression was luxurious hotel, courteous staff. View of disney and pool meant we could see disney fireworks at night, don't know if I would pay extra for this though as most nights we were out and about, but view over pool very pleasant. Travelled with 2 children 8 and 10, they really enjoyed the lazy river at adjoining Hilton and in fact we ate breakfast there most mornings as kids ate free and good choice, speedy service unlike the Waldorf which despite it's 5 stars had a distinctly 3 star servive for a very expensive buffet. Waited 30 mins in vain for drinks order to be taken and had to complain before we were approached by a server. They took my meal off the final bill but as the restaurant was far from full very disappointed, decided not to waste valuable holiday time again although the food selection was very good. Similar fare at the Hilton and much more efficient. Valet service was nice to have, phoning down from room is worth doing as saves waiting particularly at busy times like 11 am checkout. Pool service was good, chilled towels, frozen fruit lovely on hot days but also got these at the Hilton. Turn down service was nice but didn't get it for a couple of nights in the middle of the stay. Room always spotless though, beds comfy and liked having a paper every weekday. Gym facility looked very good,and complimentary bottled water. Overall a very nice hotel, great to come back to after the hustle and bustle of the theme parks. If booking again would probably go to Hilton though as it seemed a bit more family friendly, however thought it was great to be able to use facilities at both hotels, and just a short air conditioned walk between the 2 properties, or hotel buggy if you are lazy. Complimentary coffee/ tea in lobby area in mornings and chilled fruit punch/water during day was a nice touch .Biggest bugbear though was no free wifi! Really enjoyed our stay and would recommend Bonnet Creek resort as beautifully kept resort with great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury, glamourous pool - a hike for casual dining to the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fairly new property and it is joined to a next-door Hilton Hotel with a convention building in between. I was there for a convention hosted at the Hilton, but I chose to stay at the Waldorf just to have a more upgraded, quieter stay. The check in experience was nice at the hotel. My room was ready even with a morning arrival. They gave me a high floor with a view out over the beautiful pool, cabana and garden area. The rooms were well appointed. Two free bottles of water are given - on the FIRST day only. Bathrooms were large, with a nice soaking tub, separate shower and large vanity. More than enough towels and toiletries were provided. Wifi in the rooms was kind of intermittent and not great - i ended up using my mobile broadband for better signal strength and access. For food and dining, although the hotel houses its higher end properties like Oscar's in the building, the more casual choices are a hike away - all the way in the Hilton Hotel (you have to walk fairly far through the convention center and then to the Hilton - although there is an outdoor golf cart shuttle that runs outside but i never tried it). Food at Oscars was great for dinner. The pool area was nice, but its food and bar area shut down early around 7pm. So a dusk cocktail was a bit hard to come by. But the pool area itself was beautiful. It includes private cabanas that can also be rented. There is a good size safe in the room. Flat screen LCD TVs are large as well (I think it was 46 inches). Beds were fairly comfortable with down comforters and pillows. Decor was nice - not super high end but in keeping with the property. This does not seem like a place to bring the kids however. That is more appropriate at the neighboring Hilton. This is more for adults and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Details”
Reviews.Author: durban111
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the Waldorf Orlando after hearing about how luxurious it was...and our expectations were exceeded by far. The rooms are fantastic and warm. Loved the Nespresso so much that as soon as I got home...I went out and bought one! Fresh cut roses bedside and my wife loved the hairdyer (must be a woman thing!)...oh, and the bedding was great ( you never want to get out of bed!!). We ate at the Bull and Bear, and OMG...the Tomahawk steak was incredible, as was the service. Everthing on the menu was absolutely delicous. We loved everything about our stay,and the service was outstanding. We were definately pampered, and cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding from staff to property”
Reviews.Author: CheyeneW
Reviews.Content: Loved the staff, front desk Jon Simonelli was so helpful and genuine at check in. Mick the Bellman was friendly and knowledgeable. First time at the hotel and will certainly be back. We enjoyed the restaurants and the room was perfect. Great for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Milouxxx
Reviews.Content: The beautiful and luxurious rooms certainly surpassed my expectations - they cannot be faulted and are incredible value for money. The Bull and Bear is good by American standards.

Reviews.Title: “The best.”
Reviews.Author: Fruitcake13
Reviews.Content: We stay at 4- and 5-star resorts consistently when we travel. This is by far one of the best. The room (one-bedroom suite) was stunning. The pool is beautiful, and the pool food is healthy and just plain good. Unique drinks are on the menu, and one can order wine poolside off the Bull and Bear winelist...wow. The staff is wonderful. I hate to say this because we are Disney people and are DVC members, but I'd choose this hotel over any comparable Disney hotel for value, ambiance, food and service. This blows away the Grand Floridian (no, folks, it's not on the Monorail, but you won't care once you stay here), which is supposed to be Disney's top end, but we have never had service like this anywhere on property. The Waldorf is setting the gold standard for me in Orlando. Sorry, Ritz Carlton Grand Lakes, that includes you too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: tmbmjo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so amazingly gorgeous! There is nothing that is not luxurious and rich with detail. The staff is incredibly helpful and kind, but that's what you should expect from a Waldorf property. And the beds are the most amazing things, you will never want to leave. The only complaint was the shuttle was not the most convenient mode of transportation to and from the parks, it was almost always easier to drive ourselves. Especially since finding the pick up point was usually an adventure and the wait was quite long, not something you want to deal with when you've been doing the theme park thing all day. But the hotel was worth it, absolutely. Just next time we will drive ourselves, and there definitely will be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED WITH LACK OF SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: missuk186534
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the waldorf with my husband and our 2 kids for 14 nights. The hotel was gorgeous, staff were friendly, although I found the reception staff a bit snotty. I had to request for the toiletries to be replenished. I found the evening turn down service disappointing, the duvet was merely pulled back and although there were 4 of us staying in the room, they only left 2 chocolates each evening. We were only offered water when collecting the car on 2 occassions. Being offered it daily would have been better. Also complimentary water was not replaced in the room and I had to ask for the carpet to be vacuumed. I was also disappointed with the lack of restaurants within the hotel, none of them catered well for kids. Each morning there was complimentary tea/coffee in the lobby that all guests including myself took full advantage of, however, I think it would have made more sense and encouraged more guests to eat breakfast in the hotel if it wasn't so expensive, $28 each. We visited Oscars for breakfast one morning, it was a nice selection, however, not worth the money. We stayed at the poolside which was really nice, although according to the activity guide within the room the staff did not offer complimentary frozen towels, grapes and drinks nearly as often as they should have. Having stayed at other 5 star hotels I was disappointed with the service at the hotel and having to ask for things which should have already been provided, after all it is a 5 star hotel. There was a level of complacency with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - As nice as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: brightsun1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage daughter for a few days. First class in all respects. Very friendly staff. We were able to upgrade for a small additional fee into a great room with a seating area outside. We were on the fourth floor. Note- this is not high enough to truly see the evening fireworks at Disney - need at least 5 floors! We had a wonderful view of 50 % of the fireworks. Not a big deal. The rooms are just spectacular, reminded me of the WYNN in Las Vegas (when it was brand new). Services are pricey, as you must expect.

Reviews.Title: “High Luxury and Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTravelers13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel for business and pleasure more than 150 nights a year and are Diamond members with Hilton. We stayed at this hotel because a manager from our favorite Chicago area hilton moved to this location and we were very familiar with his exceptional customer service. We travel to Orlando once or twice a year and have stayed in condos, luxury hotels, and the Hilton Grand Vacations clubs, but this beats them all and we will be staying here again this year. There is nothing better for luxury, relaxation, and customer service. We had a great view of the parks over a very nice golf course and had plans to go to the parks, but stayed five days and couldn't manage to leave the relaxation of the resorts dining, pool, and room. One evening we sat at the lobby bar listening to live jazz and relaxed with a couple drinks. Still the difference maker for us when it comes to staying at nice resorts and you have several choices is the customer service and this resort had the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic - pure luxury and the Bull and Bear Restaurant to die for”
Reviews.Author: Veryhappy75
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Orlando is magnificient. We have stayed in alot of 5 star hotels in the world but this one takes the cake. We had a presidential suite two bedroom the linen was so cuddly and the service really good with real coffee perculator. No cooking facitilties but the Bulland Bear Restaurant is one of the finest of I have ever dined in. Well don Waldorf Astoria Orlanda we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid but Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Kazamyor
Reviews.Content: Great stay and best bed we've ever slept in but the ducks in the pool didn't please, especially when they did as ducks tend to! Gym great but food expensive. Valet parking at $20 per night expensive as there was no self park option. Overall fab hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Resorts Can't Compare! AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Bahunkus
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my daughter's graduation at DW. I wanted an upscale resort that was quiet and non-Disney. WOW! The Waldorf put our vacation over the top! Exquisite accommodations, warm and courteous staff, surprise champagne and chocolates when one of the managers heard that it was our 20th anniversary. We couldn't have made it at all 4 Disney parks plus Typhoon Lagoon without each evening's glorious recharge at the Waldorf! Private and QUIET! No little rug rats roaming the halls and grounds. Deluxe Room with Disney and pool view was perfect! Both bathrooms were oversized with every amenity. Beds were heavenly! We never waited more than 5 minutes for our car. The complimentary buses to DW were quite handy. The Waldorf was absolutely perfect! It prevented Disney overload. The staff should be commended! Beautiful job! We will return to Orlando numerous times in the near future and this will be the only place we stay.

Reviews.Title: “the best in orlando....., one of the best hotels in North America”
Reviews.Author: budsy987
Reviews.Content: i was extremely dissapointed with the Waldorf in NY, and what a pleasant surprise to come to the Wlaldorf Orlando. Beautiful hotel, ofcourse its almost brand new,the rooms are big and gorgous, the lobby is small but extremely nice amd the pool area is fantastic. The Bull and bear has well earned its reputation, the good was EXCEPTIONAL and the service was excellent. also its very easy to walk accross to the Hilton where the pool is better for kids with the lazy river.. we loved it and we will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: php-aqua
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful holiday here and would recommend it to anyone. The staff were very helpful and the location for visiting the park convenient. Our room was spotless and the housekeeping were polite and friendly. You must try one of the steaks at the Bull and Bear, one word amazing :)

Reviews.Title: “The quintessential Orlando hotel”
Reviews.Author: Talbert101
Reviews.Content: I have to say that if it was put to me I would place this hotel as the #1 hotel in Orlando. My stay here has been the best experience I have had at a hotel in a long time. The Waldorf Astoria has exceeded my expectations. Parker Henderson the director of the front desk was extremely accommodating and I believe the front desk could not have a better team leader as he surpassed what I have come to expect as exceptional customer service. My family and I have enjoyed the Waldorf's pool as they have a zero entry pool. My children loved that they could also use the Hilton's pool next to the Waldorf as they have a water slide and an awesome lazy river. We dined at Oscars for breakfast. Please make sure you ask for Jose as he is the best waiter I have ever encountered. His level of customer service is amazing. We stayed in the deluxe suite that has a separate living area from the king size bedroom. My husband and I enjoyed the balcony view every morning as we had a cappuccino while watching the golfers tee off. The room also has a small sub zero refrigerator in it that includes a small wine rack within it. The bathroom is gorgeous. It has a seperate shower and bath tub. My family and I will return very soon to this property. I hope that you are able to come to the Waldorf to experience the ultimate vacation as my family has. Kudos to the Waldorf Astoria for opening this hotel in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: actressmom99
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations in almost every area.
