Wonderful staff, delicious food (both in the restaurants and room service), great pool, and gorgeous,comfortable (fantastic beds!) rooms. The rooms are quite spacious and they are spotless. From the moment we checked in it was clear this is a special place. If you need anything at this hotel, any employee will help you - even if it isn't their department. I believe that this extraordinary staff is why the hotel is so fabulous. The pool area is very special - they even have a beautiful firepit. The pool attendent on Friday night helped to make our visit special - he welcomed us and helped us even though the pool was closing in 1/2 hour. The only area of improvement could be valet parking - they need a better system, I think. Room service did something very nice for us: We ordered dinner for 3 on Saturday night, then realized I needed to get to the emergency clinic to take care of a cut I recieved on my leg at Epcot. I called to try and cancel the meals for my husbnad and I, but the food was already en route to our room. I told them to just leave the food for my daughter - that we couldn't eat because we'd be at the emergency room. I fully expected them to charge us for the entire dinner - they made it, I ordered it. Very surprised to find that only my daughter's meal was charged. This was really thoughtful and kind of them. Lastly, at the airport we realized my daughter left a special ring in our room or by the pool. A few emplyees helped to search for it, then finally I got a call from housekeeping because the housekeeper found the ring. We can't wait to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Toto00777
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our stay at The Waldorf Astoria in Orlando and we were not at all disappointed. We found our suite to be very clean and of a good size. All the staff that we encountered were friendly and polite, the staff at breakfast always took the trouble to engage our son in conversation. We enjoyed a lovely meal at La Luce, which was a short walk/ride away at the Bonnet Creek, as was the waterpark which my son enjoyed enormously. Highly recommended, we look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: fulltimeholidayer
Reviews.Content: What you can't fault is the service - from the reception to the bar to the spa (special mention for Vanessa who 'spa-treatment'd-me into holiday mode' after an annoying journey), it's really very good. The room was above average - exceedingly comfy beds and luxurious bathroom. Breakfast consisted of one of the most extensive buffets - fruit, cereal, cheese, cake/chocolate, waffles, grits, omelette station, pancakes, cooked breakfast things, breads/toasts, juices and there was probably more I've forgotten about, and all fresh. Surprised that the latest bar was only open until midnight, though you could call room service to serve you at the bar until 3am. However the hotel staff happily delivered you on a golf buggy to and from the neighbouring Hilton where the bar was open until 2am. Cocktails were great. If you didn't want to pay $20 a night for parking here, self parking in the neighbouring Hilton car park was $13 a night. One gripe as always with Hilton is no free wifi, get with the times!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at Disney”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler11594
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 for a Disney trip. Last year we tried the JW Marriott on the recommendation of a friend, but we wanted to be closer to Disney this year. We narrowed our choices down to the Waldorf and the Grand Floridian. Having stayed at the GF before we knew that although we liked the convenience and the main area of the hotel, but that the rooms themselves were not so great. After hearing good things about the Waldorf we chose to stay there. Pros: * The Waldorf is located on the Disney property. It is very close to everything. * We found the staff and service to be terrific. Wonderful check in and bell service. We called ahead for our car about 10 minutes before we left and it was waiting for us every time. * Our suite was wonderful. We were in a corner suite on the 15th floor--the side facing Disney. We had a wonderful view of the Epcot fireworks. Bathroom had great amenities and linens were great. We had a large living room area and a kitchenette with a dining table. We enjoyed breakfast in the room several times. Both the bedroom and the living room had flat screen televisions. This allowed for mom and dad to watch the news, etc. in the living room while the kids watched what they wanted in the bedroom. * The turn down service, chocolates, slippers, robes, etc. were so nice and appreciated at the end of a hectic day in the parks. * We enjoyed the wide selection of newspapers and the complimentary coffee each day. * Although we did not use it, the hotel does offer bus transportation to and from the parks. * The lobby and main areas of the hotel were nicely appointed and pretty quiet. It was a nice escape from the crowds/heat/noise of Disney at the end of each day. *One example of excellent service: We took the kids over to the Hilton to use the lazy river. On the way back, the shuttle was delayed. The staff immediately offered to take us in the hotel's Escalade, offered chilled water, etc.. Cons: * I agree with the poster who was upset about the Coke situation. Although we had a mini Sub-Zero fridge in our kitchen that we could have stocked up (we did this the second night) we did not have time to do this the first night of arrival. I found the lack of a mini-bar inconvenient. * For some reason, we received washcloths when we checked into the room but never again despite requesting them. * Charging for the internet is ridiculous. Wireless internet is complimentary at most three star and below hotels. It should be included in the price of the room. We truly enjoyed our stay and at the end of the day a respite from the Disney commotion. We had excellent service and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This was, same as a year ago, the most wonderful Hotel stay in along time”
Reviews.Author: Hongkon
Reviews.Content: This Hotel knows how to please. Wonderfully appointed rooms. Courteous, efficient check in, valet parking. Exceptionally friendly and efficient room service. Superb quality of in room dining. The draw back of not providing a mini bar in the room is perfectly compensated for by the speed, selection and quality of room service. The interior design of the rooms may not be to one's liking. The amenities spaciousness, views again compensate easily. The location, access, proximity to all theme parks is excellent in a setting without the kitsch and hype of the parks that you may enjoy during the day but just love to get away from for a relaxing, tranquil evening with privacy and excellent service. I am certain to come back next year

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! ...We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Rummy123
Reviews.Content: Just completed a two night mini-vacation with our kids and grandkids.(four adults and two children (2 and 5 yrs old) We booked two rooms with a center living room suite between us through American Express Platinum. It was PERFECT! The rooms were spacious, very clean, exceptionally quiet and elegant. marble bathrooms with upscale soaps,and lotions. Turn down service in the evenings was great. Robes and slippers were awaiting us, as were chocolates on our pillows We were on the 14th floor with an exceptional view of surrounding areas from our balcony and oversized picture windows.. The beds were firm with luxurious linens. Kitchenette area with wet bar, table for 4, Subzero mini fridge were fantastic. In fact, we ordered room service one evening and enjoyed a FANTASTIC dinner around the dining table. (Service was great and food quality exceptional) A MUST DO after being at Disney's Magic Kingdom most of the day trying to navigate through huge crowds, and enduring extremely hot, humid temperatures. We couldn't wait to return to the hotel at the end of the day...it as if we had arrived at an oasis. Wish we could have stayed longer since we didn't have enough time to do everything. From the moment we arrived everyone was very welcoming. Check in a breeze. We had a $100 dollar voucher per day, per room that could be used for food, spa services, purchases, etc. Several exceptionally nice things about this hotel. First, it is peaceful, quiet, elegant and welcoming. Won't find dozens of clusters of loud kids running in all directions. Second, Has all the special touches you'd expect at a hotel like this...fresh flowers gracing the public areas, live musical entertainment in dining area, an exceptional staff who is very attentive, Third, complimentary shuttle service to Disney was convenient, comfortable and on time. Saved us from collecting car, navigating streets, parking the car, etc.etc, A couple of negatives: 1) There is a daily charge for high speed internet service (should consider dropping that extra fee0 2) They are still working out 'kinks" in terms of moving groups of people in and out of the breakfast buffet dining room. area Wait was too long with many empty tables still available. Food, however, was delicious with a wide assortment of items to choose from. Omelette station, fresh crepes, delicious homemade granola, fresh fruit, breads, rolls and muffins, juice, homemade pasties, etc. etc, It's very obvious the staff and management want to make your stay not only enjoyable, but memorable!!!. We highly recommend the Waldorf Astoria Orlando and we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: trvlnsurgn
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is undoubtedly a beautiful place with clean, immaculate, beautiful, and spectacular physical facilities, golf course, etc., they just don't have it together yet. If you want a true 5 star experience you are going to have to stay at the Ritz Carlton. I commend the management on some things. For example, on check in, when we had been promised adjoining rooms when we booked, we found that they had put us across the hall from each other. When I refused to split the family and was ready to go elsewhere, the management actually upgraded us to a suite with an adjoining room for no extra charge. It was a spectacular suite. Well, the issue isn't the willingness of the staff, they are all very nice with good intentions and seem very capable. It's the forethought put into the way things are done here with the food services and other ancillary services like the valet. For example: twice, when we needed food or drink after 10 pm we were given the option of either ridiculously expensive room service(8 bucks for a coke), or "going to the Hilton next door"! You have got to be kidding ? Oh, don't worry about how far it is. "there is a shuttle". What an incredible joke for a supposed 5 star property to be sending it's guests to a 4 star property 300 yards away to get a damn coke! ( also no stocked minibars) . Another time we just needed a sandwich. Same deal- Hilton or room service. Then, for the valet, the guy has to run super far to the , you guessed it, Hilton parking deck, to even get to where they park you car to get it too you. We never had a wait under 10 minutes and had several more like 20 minutes for the car to be brought out. If you are in a hurry to drive anywhere you better call ahead - way ahead. Local car service to places nearby also costs around 15 to 20 bucks for a short trip. Nice to have it available, but it is complimentary at many 5 star properties. Also room service itself is super slow. 50 minute wait for burgers and a sandwich our first night when we were tired and hungry and arrived late. Had to stay up another hour and a half just to eat!. Food service at the pool - same deal - very slow and inconsistent. Wife at pool said waitress at pool didn't return with drink for 30 minutes and then forgot her bill so she had to get up and go find her. So, I feel this place is rated 5 star based on it's name and it's sister property in New York. If it had any other name and had to be rated based on their actual performance right now they wouldn't be a 5 star property because of the service issues. It looked 5 star , but it isn't. It seems that while the staff is great and very willing( sent me a complimentary coke when I complained about having to go the Hilton for one), that some of these issues just haven't been thought out well by whoever is ultimately in charge. So, lot of loose ends right now in terms of service but not so much quality of the people but the systems themselves. They need a consultant to come in a fix this stuff. I definitely would not stay here again with all these inconveniences when you expect a 5 star hotel not to present any whatsoever .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: BeachGal3333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Orlando in late November 2010. We wanted to try the Waldorf because we felt the nicer Disney properties (Grand Floridian, etc.) weren't that great for the price. We loved the Waldorf - property is beautiful, service was great and the suite was fantastic. We stayed in the Waldorf suite which had a lovely view of the Disney fireworks at night. The location is perfect for Disney. We will stay there again when we return for a Disney visit.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value at Waldorf Astoria Orlando”
Reviews.Author: UrbanRedTag
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the summer of 2010 and received top notch service from front desk to complimentary cart shuttle staff. There's exclusive Disney resort air conditioned transportation, shared only with next door Hilton guests. Beautifully maintained interior and grounds, free coffee and tea and super value for a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service and quality for a luxury hotel! We are going back!”
Reviews.Author: BasketballMama
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria in mid June. We were fortunate to reserve our room using our American Express Platinum card, and we were upgraded to a deluxe king suite with a balcony and a Disney view! So luxurious! It was my son's birthday, and we told American Express Travel, who informed the hotel. Our first evening at the hotel, they treated my son with a birthday surprise and had room service deliver us a plate of cupcakes, and a snack basket of goodies. My son was thrillled and felt very special. My son slept in the sleeper sofa in the living room, and he thought that it was comfortable. The suite had a wet bar area with a sink, subzero refrigerator and a table for four, and we were able to enjoy our Nepresso every morning, sitting on our balcony. The bath products were Agraria San Francisco, which is a luxury bath product line with amazing scented shampoo, body lotion and bath gel. The marble bathroom was exquisite and I looked forward to using it everyday. The buffet breakfast at Oscar's had a great variety of breakfast foods, including a homemade crepes and an omelette station. The servers at Oscars were friendly and helpful. The gym on the first floor had plenty of the top of the line cardio machines, and there was bottled water and towels readily available - plus, the gym was very clean. My kids loved going to the Hilton next door and using their pool , which has a "lazy river". My family enjoyed their entire stay at the Waldorf, and I am looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: athina19130
Reviews.Content: It's the Waldorf, not the Holiday Inn...right? The main part of the hotel was nice, the pool was fine, rooms were ok, and the service TERRIBLE. Shockingly terrible. The pool service basically didn't exist..it took an hour just to get a menu. Although, once the food finally arrived, the fish tacos were by far the best I've ever had. Aside from that, the staff in general were very rude and uninviting. Truly an experience I wasn't expecting and don't wish to have ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Legos1963
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, beds were confortable and service was excellent. Close to the attractions. Pool was nice and you could also use the Hilton's hotel pool. Rooms are very quiet and you could not hear anyone around. Great view of the fireworks on the back side from the building.

Reviews.Title: “Superb attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: makua
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a weekend anniversary celebration at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. I agree with the comments from past guests about this wonderful facility. The attention to details was amazing: Check-in - was delayed by 90 minutes (not starting off the visit on a good note) This was overcome quickly by the excellent service later. We had let them know earlier it was our anniversary and a complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were served. The bellman made sure he reviewed with us all of the suite details (how to work the espresso maker, and other specialties of the suite). Hats off to the management in their selection of staff. Each were committed to friendliness and excellent customer service. There are many examples to share; the lunch at aquamarine with service that overshadowed the food, which was just okay, and the breakfast restaurant Oscars where you were greeted by everyone passing your way in and out of the restaurant. This was a great customer service experience that is not frequently seen today at other "resort" hotels. Thanks to the Waldorf Astoria staff!

Reviews.Title: “One of thes best hotels on the east coast...and I don't say that lightly”
Reviews.Author: exBFF
Reviews.Content: Travel is my passion. In 10 years, we've taken our son to 42 countries...so we travel a lot. I always hate Orlando it's so crowded and everything is designed to push through the maximum number of people. Saw some great reviews of the waldorf, so decided to give it a shot. I'm halfway through my stay and am SO glad we chose this property. It's not the princeville in Kauai or a One and Only, but it's pretty darn close. Beautiful public areas. Exceptional attention to detail by the staff. They are helpful but not intrusive. Our first day walking by the pool, two different people came up and asked if we needed anything...towels, drinks, etc. In the lobby, I asked for directions to one of the 11 onsite restaurants and they offered to drive us in a golf cart because it was sprinkling outside. From the valet to the bellman to the pool guys...everyone has been exceptionally attentive. Awesome food (yes, expensive, but you're in Orlando). The rooms are nice. Probably the one area in which they can improve slightly. Small things. No coffer makers in the rooms. Our room is supposed to have a couch, but there is only a chair...so either my wife or I has to always sit on the bed. The walls are a bit thin - we heard the neighbors talking last night. Small, nit picky things that is no way diminish the experience. And, best, although there are kids, it's not packed with loud, screaming children. Overall, an exceptional value. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: clyons24542001
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf Orlando multiple times for both business and leisure. Orlando desperately needed a high end alternative to the Ritz Carlton. Service is King at this property. They have successfully married the "historic grandure" of the Waldorf New York and current day luxury and technology. All room types are very nice. The pool is fantastic. Take the time to reserve a private cabana at the pool. Full service and televisions included. This property is coupled with the Hilton Bonnet Creek connected by a large convention center in between. The signature restaurant at the Waldorf (Bull and Bear) is a great place for dinner with excellent steaks. The feel of the decor at Bull and Bear is very refined, lots of leather and dark wood. Above average wine selection "for Orlando". The sister property has a signature Italian restaurant worthy of comaparison and not to be missed, La Luce by Chef Donna Scala. This property is on Disney property BUT you're not constantly surrounded by "Mice" and stuffed animals. You get the best of both worlds as you are very close to the attractions but don't feel overwhelmed by "Disney". Very close to all worthwhile attractions in Orlando. Fantastic Golf Course at this property as well. My only complaint would be room service. Quite slow. Perhaps they have worked out the "kinks" by now.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: mcg73317
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Honeymoon, staff upgraded our room due to a mix up made by a 3rd party, fabulous hotel and very friendly staff.....

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experieince”
Reviews.Author: jobymaloby
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to experiencing the Luxury brand of the Hilton Group, but this proved to be a real anti-climax. The hotel was nice, the rooms were well equipped, but it was all very predictable. There were no pleasant touches or surprises. Ho0wever, what was most disappointing was the service. Almost without exception it was under-whelming. Zero anticipation was used, it was very mechanical and I didn't feel that anyone wanted to veer away from the standard operating procedures. Would I return? Not on my own dollar, no.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Martynk
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stop over here, lovely hotel, nice rooms and very comfortable all round. Parking is valet only and apart from the Hilton you can't walk to anything, but there is a park shuttle. They have tents around the pool, but they are $200 for the day - more than we paid for the hotel room! But again lovely pool

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great!”
Reviews.Author: gwhite216
Reviews.Content: Just had a "staycation" at the WA Orlando. I took my Dad to play golf for Father's Day and my wife, 9 month old, and I decided to stay the night. I feel the stay was nice other than a few lapses. I booked the unlimited golf package as it was a fantastic deal. I had an early tee time and my wife came to the hotel around 3 PM that afternoon. I finished my round of golf around 1 and went to check in. There was a 10 minute wait as they were quite busy. The desk agent was great, presented me with 2 drink vouchers, a code for HSI, and upgraded us to a deluxe suite. The room was not ready and he said it would be ready around 3PM. I went back out to the golf course and decided to play another round. At 3:30, I looked at my phone and had 2 missed calls and 3 text messages. My wife was told the room was still not ready. I called the front desk and they said it was. It was a game of back and forth between ready and not for 30 minutes with a fussy baby. After 2 more phone calls and an interupted round of golf the problem was rectified by 4PM. Other than the initial problem the room was great. There really is no where to eat dinner at the hotel besides the B&B or room service. The other option is to go to the Hilton. We did go to the Harvest Cafe which was mediocre at best. The valet took a good 25 minutes at 10PM because they were dealing with a "VIP" coming in. Other than that it was fine. The rooms are great, facilities great, and service is not what you would expect at a 5* hotel. I believe it is comparable to the Ritz but not nearly the level of service. If you have questions feel free to PM.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious”
Reviews.Author: MIdiner
Reviews.Content: We went for the "Wine and Chocolate Romance Weekend" that the hotel put together around Valentine's Day, which included wine tastings, chocolate tastings, couples massages, and dinner at the (uber-fabulous) Bull & Bear Steakhouse. It wasn't cheap, but it was worth it. What a gem to have this property in Central Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Centre of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: paul meekin
Reviews.Content: I am going to keep this short and sweet!!! everthing about this hotel screams luxury! The service is first class as is the food ,comfort of rooms etc recomend to anyone for business or liesure!!.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraRWD
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel very close to the Downtown Disney area (formerly Paradise Island). It is part of a complex with the Hilton. The facilities were fantastic. I made the mistake of turning down the turn down service the first night. I quickly learned my lesson. The service was amazing, and I loved the chocolates. We had dinner at the steakhouse the first night, and the food was excellent, even though we were part of a group and our choices were selected from the menu and not the full range. The pool area was very nice with a great outdoor bar, and wait service pool side. There were a number of cabanas to be had, if you so desired, but we just sat by the pool in chairs. We were there for a business meeting, and the facilities were immense and well apportioned. The gym was full of brand new equipment, loaner headphones, bottled water and towels. It also had a great view of the pool and the golf course. If you want to visit the Disney resorts, you can take a shuttle bus, or walk to the restarunts and bars at Downtown Disney. If you are there with children, the Hilton's pool (next door and very close, and available to Waldorf guests) was more "kid friendly" with a "lazy river" type feature and inner tubes for floating. There were also indoor and outdoor bars in and connected to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.....wonderful experience, wouldn’t stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: JAB271
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando and it won’t be the last. When you arrive at the Waldorf you are greeted by very friendly and professional doorman and valet attendants. My family stayed at the Waldorf for a birthday weekend and they made it special. The upgraded our room, birthday wishes from the front desk clerk and an amenity in our room awaited us. The view was out of this word. Every night you could watch the fireworks from Epcot and didn’t have to fight the traffic or wait for the shuttle when it was over. The windows are large enough in the room that you could relax on the couch or the bed and watch them. The bathrooms are extra large with a shower and tub. The staff was out of this word. There wasn’t a staff member that I came across that didn’t smile and say hello. The bellman and valet staff were always ready to open the door, fetch your car and offer you bottled water. The bottled water was a nice touch in the Orlando heat. When you returned from a day of shopping or being at a theme park the staff always welcomed you back. The truly made you feel like you were their guest not just a person staying at a hotel. The food in room service was excellent and delivered fast and hot. Ate at Oscars for breakfast and loved the food. The service was great; the server Jose was one of the best servers I had in a long time. The pool area was very nice and clean. The gas fire pits with couches was a nice touch to relax in at night. The resorts Shuttle to the theme parks were always on time. Extra special thank to Christian the Valet Attendant for being so nice and helpful. Waldorf Orlando you knocked it out of the park. I stayed at many hotels in the Disney area and I found a new home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: azazello04
Reviews.Content: This is certainly one of my best hotel stays. The hotel is classy, trendy, spotless and at times simply perfect. The pool area is clean and offers superb service from the pool attendants. The rooms are great and comfortable. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to Disney Parks. The bus is never full and is ALWAYS on time. The only minor complaint was that they had a convention at one point and did not inform the guests. This left possibly 10 recliners for the whole hotel to use just because some high tech businessmen had to party. The concierge had a "deer in a headlights" look when we asked about the matter. But the bottom line is: if you are looking for great service in a classy, clean, near perfection hotel - this is it. Will definitely stay here again if I want to shell out another few hundred dollar to hang out with Mickey and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Enjoyable - with a few small issues”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Orlando is an elegant hotel and a much needed entrant to the Disney hotel scene. From the moment you arrive to a bright and airy lobby you feel enveloped in a luxury cocoon. The property is visually appealing and in outstanding condition making in all the more inviting. Things we loved: 1. The staff are extremely friendly and always greet you. 2. The suite we had was impeccable with a huge bathroom, kitchenette, dining tables and seating area. 3. The soundproofing was good. 4. The shower was huge. 5. Breakfast at Oscar's had a great selection and was available until noon. 6. La Luce restaurant at the Hilton is top notch. 7. The bedding was over the top (though we had an issue) 8. The location makes it easy to go places. 9. Poolside prices are fair. 10. Nothing appears chipped, beat up or run down. 11. The gym is awesome 12. Service is generally good. Some areas for improvement: 1. There are not enough pool umbrellas and they do not move. 2. Getting towels by the pool is agonizing as a staff member must fetch them and they are never around ( 3 days we had this issue) 3. Housekeeping struggles to be consistent in that we missed 1 turn down service and towels were provide sporadically. 4. The pillow top down mattress can sting you in that down feathers poke you. A few issues aside the hotel is well managed with gracious service and nice environs. Definitely on my list in Orlando and I recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready yet...”
Reviews.Author: AWWNYC
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came back from Orlando after spending a few days on this property. We always stayed at the Ritz but I thought why not gave this hotel a try given the rave reviews in here. At the end, I was quite disappointed from the moment I arrived till departure. First, when we arrived, there were no bell services so I had to carry my two large luggages to my room so that was interesting. It was never offered to us. Second, when we entered the room, I realized that there were no drinks or snacks available in the fridge. Empty! When I called the operator, the lady told me thats the way it was there and gave me an attitude. She said that I needed to call room service to get these things ordered. Honestly, I was tired and didn't want to call and wait for another 20 minutes for someone to deliver a beer to my room. My mood was already gone! Third, House-keeping forgot to make our room the first day so we needed to launch a complain to the front desk in late afternoon. Luckily, the lady at the front desk was very professional and took care of the matters. Forth, after a long hot day in the WDW, my daughter wanted to take a bath but found hair and other dirty stuffs in the bath tub. Fifth, the choices of cuisine in the property's restaurants (excluding Hilton) and the hours of operations are very limited. If I wanted to have a late lunch at 2:40pm or a late night snack/ice cream at 11:45pm, I had to call room service. Sixth, the valet was super slow in getting my car ready each day despite I called 20 minutes ahead. It doesnt really worth the $20 comparing with other 5-star neighbor hotels. One employee told me that I need to ask for services so does it mean I need to ask for bell services, food to be delivered in advance, making the room, cleaning the bathroom nealy and getting my car faster?? Growing up in NYC, I know what the name Waldorf stands for so hopefully one day the services at WAO will live up to its brand.

Reviews.Title: “Disgracefull!!!”
Reviews.Author: Awley0191
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks over Easter and from check in to leaving we had one problem after the other. I spoke to zoltan the front desk manager who said he reported everything back to the hotel manager and I should receive an e mail within 24 hours and I'm still waiting! Not 5 star service in any way... Had too many problems to mention! We are going back to Orlando next year but we won't be staying at the waldorf!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property!”
Reviews.Author: LovetheOrient
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our older son's 2nd birthday and absolutely loved this property! Pros: Property - Lavish property with extremely well maintained facilities like golf course, pool, public areas. Excellent view of the Disney fireworks at night from the room. Food - while I think the cuisine selection could be better, the food, particularly the dessert menu, was unmatched. Rich, decadent desserts that we look forward to on our next trip here! Service - I would expect nothing short of 5-star service from a Waldorf property, and the staff didn't fall short here. Very nice service and friendly staff. Location - great location and short driving distance to Disney theme parks and Disney downtown. Cons: Kid-friendly - not really a con, but it seems this property is meant for business travelers judging by most people who were staying here. We had no problem really, our kids loved it here. The pool is good, plus they have a short walkway to an adjacent hotel (I think the Hilton) which has a lazy river and kids really loved it there. Restaurants - I think the cuisine selection could definitely be improved. Overall this is an expensive, but completely worth it, hotel. We plan to visit again in the Fall this year.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Trip to a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: phillip_norton
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando. Both have been a mix of business and pleasure. I will only write about the pleasure side of things. The rooms are very nice, large, new and comfortable. The location is fantastic if you are going to Disney since it on Disney's property, but not affiliated. It is also attached to its sister property the Hilton. The Waldorf is calmer with two great relaxing pools and the Hilton has the more kid friendly pool with the lazy river and a water slide. It has a number of very good restaurants, but they are not cheap (but it is a Waldorf so you don't expect cheap). I also used the SPA and it was a great experience, a plethera of rooms and treatmentsm, big steam room , jacuzzi and other amenities. Two items that I thought I would mention: 1. They messed up my initial reservation of two connecting rooms. At first they said that there were no connecting rooms available and that I would have to make do with what I had. Not the acceptable option since I have two young children. I then ended up talking to a manager who quickly took care of things and we actually got two connecting rooms that were bigger than were originally planned. That worked out very well. 2. They were very diligent in handling my daughters food allergies. She has life threatening food allergies to dairy and nuts and they were excellent at accomodating her and us. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience- would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: shannonm27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando this past weekend (Memorial Day). Being a family with 2 small children (ages 4 and 7), we were not sure if it would be an ideal family hotel. But we were wrong- it was perfect! My kids loved staying at the "fancy hotel" as they called it! The service was top notch, our suite was clean and comfortable, and the pool area was fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel to families with younger children.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic fantastic fantastic”
Reviews.Author: djh2601
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando and wanted to write this review straight away ! This place looks amazing from the minute you enter the property, the lobby is stunning, check in was smooth and efficient we had chosen the optional upgrade when booking and were upgraded to a Waldorf suite with a Disney view. The suite was huge with 2 1/2 bathrooms and a lovely Disney view from the balcony, lovely furnishings but with a lot of un-useable space ( this is only my personal design view not really a criticsm ! ) All the staff at the hotel were very pleasant and every member greeted us, especially the gentleman that checked us in even remembering my name 2 days after we checked in very very impressive. I decided to treat my partner to a very special private dinner, after checking with the fantastic lady concierge I learned that they had no private rooms that were small enough for 2 people ( quite understandable too ) she suggested an in room dining experience and set up a meeting with the In room dining manager Gino Rincon. He could not have been more helpful, knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the dinner, he made great suggestions and then followed them all through. A great big thank you to him for making our evening so spectacular. We found out after the event that this was the first time that they had ever done this dining experience , which makes it even more impressive ! Other thanks must go to some other members of his team, thankyou to the wonderful Martha such a fun lady and to Goba and the server that looked after us all evening so sorry we cannot remember your name and to the gentleman that was running around behind the scenes all to make our evening so special THANKYOU ALL SO MUCH !! Must also mention the free shuttle to the Disney Parks and Downtown Disney it works really well but ask where the bus is going before you board as my partner ended up back where he had started. The only downside that we found with the hotel is whilst the disney view is great especially for the fireworks at two Disney parks, the hotel will have functions going on outside ( we live in the countryside and are not used to any noise at all so this may not bother some people ) although the latest a function went on until was 10.00pm we did find this very disturbing and did complain to Tara Tait who dealt with it beyond our expectations so a big thankyou to her too. All in all I cannot recommend this hotel more ( keep in mind the outside functions though ) and am really looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Third Tims's A Charm!”
Reviews.Author: tanqm
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from our THIRD stay at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando! This particular visit was very special in that I was there celebrating my 40th birthday. My husband had surprised me with a grand birthday trip to Aruba just a few weeks prior to this. While Aruba was breathtakingly beautiful, their accommodations left a little to be desired. I am a recovering “hotel snob” and while there, I couldn’t help thinking (out loud) about the Waldorf. My very perceptive husband took the hint and the rest as they say, is history. We arrived at the Waldorf and just like on our two subsequent visits, the valet personnel were courteous and professional. Throughout the duration of our week long stay, we were always offered cold waters as we entered/exited our vehicle. Additionally, they were always more than happy to provide driving directions. My husband would like for me to send a special thank you to William. He remembers us year after year and goes out of his way to be cordial… thank you William. At check-in, much to our surprise, we’d already been checked –in! After a very FULL flight, we really just wanted to get to our room. So, this was a very thoughtful gesture. Everyone at the front desk knew that it was my birthday and extended to me very kind birthday wishes. I was very appreciative of the warm sentiments. As we began to walk away from the desk, my family and I were shocked (in a good way) when a lovely young lady, wearing a warm smile, appeared from a side door. She introduced herself as Nicola Gonda, the Personal Concierge Supervisor for the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. We knew exactly who she was- as she had made us feel so welcome on our last visit. We were unable to meet with her on our last stay; and it was really nice to finally meet her and express our thanks for the awesome job she’s doing. Now, my family and I travel a lot. We’ve never however, had the Concierge Supervisor personally escort us to our room. Nicola did just that. We had been upgraded to a MAGNIFICANT suite with a BEAUTIFUL view! Nicola stood by silently as my husband, son and I, toured the room. She allowed me to “stumble” upon a gorgeous birthday cake, compliments of the Waldorf! I was speechless…my husband and I are still trying to figure out how she obtained the picture for the cake. Not to be left out, Nicola even provided a little something special for the dinosaur lover in the family. Who, just like a kid, conveniently mentioned that he’s phasing out his love for dinosaurs…kids! Throughout the trip, special things like this were done for us. I was even left a cute gift basket from housekeeping! The customer service and hospitality of the Waldorf Astoria Orlando continues to be unmatched. The hotel is I believe, entering into it’s third year and it looks as immaculate as it did during it’s opening year. Everything continues to be clean and in wonderful condition. Even the cabanas around the pool were in top shape. As you know, being exposed to the elements, pool furniture and the like can get a bit worn. Sitting inside our cabana we took notice of how nice everything looked. Having a TV inside was an added bonus, according to my son  I apologize for such a long review but I just can’t say enough good things about this hotel. As I mentioned earlier, this was our third visit and we’re already making plans for a fourth. We can’t wait! The Marks Family

Reviews.Title: “I Could Live Here”
Reviews.Author: DonJulioAnejo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of resorts and the Waldorf Astoria Orlando is in my top five of favorites. The room in which I stayed was stylish, comfortable and luxurious. A resort should be able to provide a guest with quality sleep and the Waldorf Astoria passes this criterion with flying colors. The mattress and bedding were top notch and the HVAC was quiet. My wife and I spent a few days at the amusement parks, and after each long day, spending the evening, chillaxing in our room was just as great as our daytime activities. For the first time staying at a hotel, I literally felt like I was at home. The furniture and decor made the stay comfortable and having two--yes, TWO--large flat screens was amazing. The staff were great. They were friendly and engaging. At breakfast the chef pointed out the crab meat for omelets, and I joked that they needed avocados. The chef was willing to somehow acquire avocados based on my simple joking. That's service! Lastly the attention to detail is what really blew me away. No detail was overlooked.The toiletries, by Agraria, were lavish (I love the pomegranate smell). This is the first room I ever seen that had a Blu-Ray player and a Sub-Zero mini-fridge. Even the balcony furniture and chaises by the pool were high quality when compared to some resorts that compromise by supplying outdoor furniture made of resin.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and high class - enjoy the pool and the suites”
Reviews.Author: LegsForDays
Reviews.Content: My first visit to a Waldorf Astoria property was delightful - mostly because I went for free on points and flew my parents in for the weekend before Thanksgiving to enjoy some sun at the property. - Pool: gorgeous, immaculately cared for and staffed by very attentive servers - although I will say it was not at all busy, so we got plenty of attention - Service: excellent - never had an extra set of towels come to my room faster! - Prices: it's the Waldorf, and high prices are expected. Drinks were good at the pool and in the $10 range To my dismay, another HH Diamond guest was comped breakfast (a typical frequent guest perk that I was denied despite multiple calls to the property). I didn't feel like arguing at the desk, but if you have status I suggest you press the front desk for bonus perks. (I did get upgraded to a suite, which was lovely).

Reviews.Title: “Superb Comfort and Attention”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. I won't repeat what has already said about the positive attributes of the hotel, including a very nice, beautiful room with a wonderful view of the pool, spacious bathroom, nice desk with good lighting and many plug-in outlets. The two downsides to staying here was that the hotel maid service moved my personal toiletries from the sink counter into a drawer in the bathroom. Unfortunately, I do not like my personal things moved around. When I came back to my room in the afternoon, I could not find my personal toiletries including my medications where I had left them. Long story short, a call to the front desk and then a visit by hotel security solved the mystery. My items had been moved into a drawer that really did not look like a drawer. I still did not appreciate my things being moved around by hotel staff. The second mishap was an error on my hotel bill discovered after I returned home. A hotel guest from the adjacent Hilton Hotel property had eaten lunch at the Waldorf and correctly put his hotel room number on the bill on the Hilton Hotel line (versus the Waldorf Astoria line). Yet, the accounting staff charged that to my hotel invoicel. After two phone calls to the hotel for a copy of the signed receipt restaurant ticket uncovered the error. The hotel should have at least compared the printed name written by the guest against the name that came up printed on the receipt. They would have noticed that the names did not match. Long story short, the Waldorf reversed the charge. I'm glad I reviewed that bill because I would have had to pay for a $23 lunch. While the Waldorf Astoria is a nice hotel, I would probably stay at the Hilton Hotel next door, which is probably a better bargain and has a more family oriented pool scene. If it were just a visit with my wife and me, I would come back to the Waldorf for its serenity and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: bpc_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff seemed overwhelmed in the evenings. There was a large group that was celebrating passover in the hotel and staff. Due to religious observances, staff members were needed to operate the elevators (i.e. push the buttons). Perhaps due to staff being required for special events, our more routine needs were repeatedly overlooked. Specifically, we requested turn down service between 6-8 pm each night. I believe it only happened the first two nights. Additionally, we asked the staff to prepare a fold out couch for our children to sleep in. After paying $4000 for a six night stay, I thought the request was in line with the class of hotel. More importantly, this service was specifically offered by the bell person who brought us to the room. Unfortunately, it only happened one night and only when I went to the front desk. In fairness, the property is exquisite in terms of lobby, room, furnishings, pool, workout facility. The room was very nice and roomy. Our restaurant experience was generally good. Food was well prepared with the exception of breakfast on Easter Sunday. In room coffee was excellent with high quality espresso maker. On the whole, I will probably not return. I would have appreciated the staff taking care of this without being prompted. I cannot criticize the quality of the facility itself in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible handling of Internet policy highlights lack of interest in customer satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: KutyShalev
Reviews.Content: In most hotels I've been at, and I travel plenty, there is an internet charge which can be used across multiple devices. Be aware that here, that is not the case. Now. I went to the front desk and asked them to adjust my 3 $40 internet charges, each for a 7 day connection. And I had plenty of other premium charges on the account. The front desk could not make the adjustment and so i asked to speak to a manager. He explained that they use an external vendor and so he could not adjust it either. Let's just say that after spending the money to stay and pay in this facility, to be snubbed for a policy that smacks of unfairness without even a courtesy adjustment is a slap in the face. In an age of Amazon and Zappos where you get unexpected exceptional experiences, I am shocked that a brand like the Waldorff Astoria hid behind a vendor and refused to adjust a unfair invoice. Unbelievable. Not be unfair myself, the beds, the rooms, the cleanliness where all wonderful. This lack of attention to customer satisfaction to the point where it smacks of unfairness

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - didn't want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea3011
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on a suite (booked it way in summer for $189 a night). The suite is spacious, overlooked Disney and pool. The service was superb, the bed was ultra cozy and it was clean. However, last night, housekeeping was not thorough enough - garbage in kitchenette was not emptied. Another thing is that some pool boy (I am not going into specifics to describe him) gave me attitude when I nicely asked him to move my umbrella as it was putting a shade on someone else's chair (I later heard him talking about this also with a colleague). There was free internet in the lobby so if you need to check in any flights etc, the service is available. Breakfast buffet was ample and good food. Pool area had a great atmosphere. Went to the spa - good service, however, not enough nail polish colors to choose from and quality of polish very poor. Free shuttle service to Disney but not Universal. Would I return? Hell yeah! Absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: soccermomNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Waldorf Astoria Orlando for a week with children 12, 10 and 8. Was very impressed with the property and had an excellent, relaxing, enjoyable resort vacation near disney/universal parks! Something I was never able to accomplish in past trips to Oralndo! We were in a beautfiul 15th floor suite, very nicely appointed and had a fabulous view of the disney fireworks at night. Overall, my children enjoyed Universal, but we spent many days just relaxing on the property, service was very attentive, food and drinks were great, we enjoyed all of the restuarnts, excellent steaks at Bull/Bear, yummy food and snacks by pool, also enjoyed the Harvest Bistro at the Hilton for the breakfast buffet (where kids eat free). The resort is pricey, but a much prefered alternative for us to the Grand Floridian or other high end Disney resorts. Also beautiful golf course and my daughter and I enjoyed some treatments at the spa. However, there were a few negatives. No free internet service in the rooms, some of the housekeeping was not as attentive as we would have liked, for the price everything should be perfect. A few minor improvements and this resort would be.

Reviews.Title: “Thank G-d It is now possible to go to Disney and be treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: podreal
Reviews.Content: As a father and grandfather who visited Disney 8 times in the last 25 years....It was great seeing my chidren and then grandchildren visit Disney and become enchanted...with everything that presented to them..I always stayed in some of the Better Hotels but always felt like like I was being tortured...everything was geared to the kids. The adults were treated like cattle herded here and there with shabby rooms disgruntled staff...Yes shabby rooms and disgruntled staff , even at the Premier Hotels.....It was so bad I told my wife I could not go to "Disney" again......Luckily my 35 year old son said there was somehting new near Disney...THE WALFORF ASTORIA..orlando...As a new yorker I am familiar with and have stayed at the waldorf nyc..I said I would give it a try...I did and it was Fantastic, excellent and More..Great rooms superb staff up to and including the Hotel Manager " JC"...I extended my trip....Yes I extended my vacation, because at the beginning and end of every day I had the Waldorf to pamper me and my family...I was rested relaxed and content ....What took so long for a major hotel to understand that Adults needed a little Love also?....I am an avid travelor and cruiser and have been to 35 countries..and countless hotels...The Waldorf is spectacular, this is the first time I have given a review ro any website ...but I I felt they deserved this review and more.........Congratultions to the Waldorf.......especially the Management .and hotel Manager..

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault, but hard to rave about.”
Reviews.Author: APURKISS
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Orlando is quite clearly focused at the more luxury focused family who is in orlando under family obligations, with a very good spa and golf course to make one feel the trip is not all about the kids. The rooms are crisp and well appointed, the service efficient and courteous. All as expected for the leading brand in the Hilton pack. But will I remember it in two years, unlikely! One gripe Hilton, stop being so cheap about the water - charging $6 for what should be complimentary at this level is absurd!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: J0sRad
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning hotel and grounds. The staff was very friendly, helpful and 'went the extra mile" in anticipating our needs. We rented adjoining rooms and they were elegant, roomy and very comfortable with views over the pool area and golf course. While on the Disney campus with all the easy access that implies, it is far enough from the crowds, traffic and noise that we felt like we were at a private, remote resort. Great restaurants and pool area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TCJF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf four nights while attending a conference. My husband tagged along for a vacation. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that had a balcony with a great view of the golf course. The Waldorf is a luxurious hotel -- everything about it was just wonderful -- beautiful decor, terrific room, and excellent service. The bedding is so fabulous that when you ciimb inside it you don't want to ever get out. We didn't have a car and this particular hotel location is not really within walking distance of any shops, etc other than what is contained within the Waldorf/Hilton complex. We used the fitness center which measured up to the high standards of the rest of the hotel. We didn't eat that much on site because it was mostly a business trip, but several times we ate at Aquamarine (pool bar/kitchen) and the food was also excellent. The pool area looked great and included large tents. Despite the fact that the hotel was busy with both business and leisure travelers it was pretty quiet. Everything is a bit pricey but that is true for every luxury hotel. We definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria is what I talked about most when I got home.”
Reviews.Author: ellenshepard
Reviews.Content: It had been years since I was in Orlando. Staying at the Waldorf Astoria was the best part of my recent visit. The hotel lobby is striking and offers wonderful spaces to enjoy your morning coffee. The pool is beautiful and the setting very calming. The room was elegant but comfortable. The mattress and bedding were out of this world. I enjoyed all that Orlando has to offer but my stay at the Waldorf Astoria is what I talked about most when I got home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: winggy1
Reviews.Content: Had occasion to stay at this hotel for rest after chaperoning 200 HS marching band students for Festival Disney for 3 days. Our family exteded our stay and changed hotels for a quieter more relaxing environment. First thing I noticed is that eventhough the property is so close to Diney parks, it is not decorated nor feels associated with anything Disney. I liked that. It was beautfiul and very sophisticated. We had two rooms and one had a very heavy cigar smell, so we were moved to a 2 bedroom suite (sweet!), which was great when traveling with 2 teenagers who want to watch different things on tvs. Rooms were great as were beds, very well appointed. All staff was very helpful and accomodating. The hotel was not particularly full when we were there so it had a quiet realxed feel. We did not eat on property except for the breakfast buffet, which was very nice with not only made to order omlettes, but crepes as well. Very expensive, but if you are looking for a high end hotel in Orlando, this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: gusterviv
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a four night stay at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. From the hotel website, we got a 4 nights for the price of 3 deal, which was a great value. Our flight got in at around noonish and we were able to check in early. The front desk staff was very friendly. Our room, a deluxe with two queen beds, had a view of the parking lot, but we were barely there, so I was glad I didn't spend the extra $ for a Disney view. The beds were super comfortable, lots of fluffy pillows that I wanted to take home with me. We had twice daily maid service. Whoever did the turndown service had fun with arranging my daughter's stuffed animals in different ways every night. The bathroom was huge with a showerhead tall enough for my very tall husband to stand under it comfortably. We enjoyed both the zero-entry Waldorf pool (great for my 4 yo daughter) and the lazy river pool at the Hilton next door. Steve - one of the guys who works outside - was great about shuttling us over to the Hilton and back with his golf cart. A super friendly guy. Service at the Waldorf pool was a little slow at times; I had to track down the pool guy to do our towel set-up and even though I pushed the button on the lounge chair for drink/food service, no one came until I hunted someone down for that too. But the pools were nice. We ate mostly at the poolside restaurant at the Waldorf, called Aquamarine--a nice lunch selection including a yummy guava drink. We also ate several times at the Harvest Bistro at the Hilton next door (kids eat for free during breakfast or dinner, if you purchase an adult entree or adult buffet). The best meal of the trip was at La Luce at the Hilton next door. Great service and fabulous food. Even though it's a fancier restaurant they have a kid-friendly pizza with just cheese and tomato sauce ("no green stuff") which comes with french fries on top (much to my daughter's enjoyment). On the last day I hit the Waldorf Spa...we got a voicemail saying that the spa was offering a 20% discount on all services. Bob the spa concierge was very helpful in booking my appointment. I loved the esthetician Noemi and the manicurist Yanitza -- super nice and they did a great job with my facial and pedicure, respectively. The lady at the spa who gave me the tour was super friendly as well (Myrna? I can't remember her name.) The spa had the most comfortable bed ever...I could've stayed there all day! The Waldorf serves Illy coffee in the lobby for free every morning; I am now a huge fan of Illy coffee. YUM. The Waldorf was significantly cheaper than the nicest hotels on Disney property, e.g. The Grand Floridian...so if you want five-star accommodations then I'd pick the Waldord any day. The shuttle to the Disney parks runs every half hour like clockwork, and the shuttle drivers are super nice and helpful. We will definitely rebook at the Waldorf next time we come to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding location, rooms, and service - hands down the best luxury option within shuttle distance of the parks!”
Reviews.Author: jrnd57
Reviews.Content: The entire team worked with me for months to make sure my engagement was absolutely unforgettable. Shuttle service was always fast an easy. Restaurants both there and at the hilton were top notch. The Disney View rooms allow you to see every single DW landmark in all four parks, with spectacular nightly views of Illuminations. Blows away all Disney resort hotels in terms of value for the money. Definitely not ideal foe kids, however...we saw very few during our stay, but plenty at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “How to mess up a good trip, ask the management”
Reviews.Author: Allinov
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 26th Dec to 6th Jan. The first few days were great. It was obvious that it was busy at the hotel, and the staff were working hard. As New Year approached, the staff seem to be overwhelmed, and the speed of service slowed over time. We had a small incident, where something went missing after the cleaning staff went through. We notified the management, and in general received no satisfactory response. Over the latter half of our vacation, again most of the trip was comfortable. Again, when I reminded management about the missing items, not enough attention was given. We left with it unresolved, and received a letter dismissing our complaint out of hand. So we spent in excess of $10,000 at the hotel, had a $100 item lost by the staff, and received a rude letter claiming that they had no responsibility. Despite our satisfaction of the hotel, the petty response left us speechless and dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at Disney”
Reviews.Author: SUorange2011
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull into the entrance you see what a beautiful and almost secluded place this is. Although it's a great business hotel it's also wonderful for families. There was a great kids room with all kinds of games and arts and crafts for my son. The fitness center was clean and open looking out at the pool...a little motivation for getting in shape. It had everything you would get at your own fitness center and more. The pool was next with a zero entry pool so parents can relax poolside while kids make friends. The cabanas both give you privacy and comfort in front of what seemed like a quiet pool. The pool bar was great and the menus had a bit of everything. We enjoyed late night pizza after spending the day at the parks and ordered a great in room breakfast that got us ready for the trip home. The staff was informative at all encounters including Jose from bell services and Byron at the front desk. Very well trained team with a never ending sense of what great customer service should be. Now for the actual lobby and room....awesome is all I can say the lobby is like you just walked into a palace and off the lobby is the view of the pool and golf course. The room was everything we could have imagined LCD tv with great beds and all the amenities from home.... We will certainly stay again when we come back we have stayed at every Disney resort and if you want that little extra smile, the five star five diamond experience right on Disney property the Waldorf Astoria Orlando is your choice......

Reviews.Title: “luxurious relaxation”
Reviews.Author: kwbest
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria with some friends for two luxurious nights. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the facilities were absolutely beautiful. We enjoyed two days by the pool, and in the evening we were able to watch fireworks from our balcony. The lobby of the hotel is breathtaking. The room was lovely. We will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Hilton minus some amenities”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed at the Orlando Hilton (about 7 miles away) and loved it. Like that hotel, the Waldorf is pretty new. The Waldorf rooms are larger with a couch and larger bathroom and upgraded furnishings (looked fancier). But the Waldorf doesn't include a refrigerator, mini bar, or even coffee maker. The room service menu at the Waldorf is pretty minimal (and expensive) while the gift shop doesn't offer much food. You can get a breakfast buffet for $28 at Oscars on the lower level or other fairly high priced options. Golf course and spa are very nice (not included in price, but nice perks). The pool is decent, but not as nice as the Hilton next door. The fitness center is excellent. While we didn't stay at the Hilton next door to the Waldorf, I would give it a serious look over the Waldorf. The Waldorf just lacked some life -- duller colors and stiff. Not a bad hotel and decent service, just a questionable value in a very competitive area for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “They failed at the "little things"”
Reviews.Author: ec1234
Reviews.Content: Staying at the top of the line Hilton owned property (Waldorf), we had high expectations. The week was one of all the little things going wrong. We booked a double queen room, which was very well appointed (wonderful bedding!) but was missing a few basic things, like a coffee maker. When we inquired we were told "not all rooms have coffee makers". I explained even the Hilton Garden Inns have coffee makers and the front desk person said "we get that complaint all the time". They sent up a coffee maker. It was not cleaned, replaced, nor replenished a single day. I had to call every day, sometimes twice, to have the honor of paying a bellman to bring coffee pods and creamer. &^%! The water bottles ($6 each) were both broken and half empty when we arrived and there were toiletries missing. They quickly took care of that. There was no refridgerator in the room in the clearly made-for-a-refridgerator furniture (an empty hole). Again, we were told "our room was not one that came with a refridgerator". We had to pay $20 a day for valet parking, they don't allow self park (even though the "Hilton Self Park Lot" is right next to the hotel). They even charged for the tubes on the lazy river next door (adjoining) Hilton. Don't expect to be nickel and dimed at a Waldorf. Finally, it took THREE DAYS to get our morning newspaper delivered. Husband is a Hilton Honors member (gold) and we get newpapers at all Hilton Hotels. The desk help said newspapers are available in the lobby, not delivered. Gee, how come every other door had the newspaper hanging on it every morning? Internet is $10.95 a day in room. It is, as others say, a beautiful hotel, but for whatever reason, they got all the little things wrong. At $349 a night, and being a Hilton Honors member, we expected more. We won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey - but classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Global_vagrant
Reviews.Content: A relatively new property, the Orlando Waldorf-Astoria has great facilities and the rooms are well appointed. In fact, the rooms are a class above the usual standards found in US hotels which typically do not match 5 star standards found in Asia and Europe. Given a room on the 12th floor with fantastic views over the pool and the Disney properties. Big plasma TV and well sized bathroom with a separate walk-in shower. On a downside, no coffee maker although complimentary morning coffee available in the lobby if you wanted to make the hike downstairs. Ate at the bar in the Bull & Bear steakhouse and the food was truly excellent. Service at the restaurant, although friendly, a little iffy. All-in-all service levels at the hotel remain below the luxury mark and not entirely consistent (one example was a 15 minute wait for my car, which for reasons of some sort of valet mix-up was not in fact being collected) and for the high room prices being charged need to be further enhanced. For that reason, I am not able to provide a top rating but not far away if they can elevate service levels.

Reviews.Title: “PURE LUXURY”
Reviews.Author: zildana
Reviews.Content: Absolutely GORGEOUS new property with exceptional quality in all details of design and decor. Fabulous pool area complete with private cabannas. Rooms are spacious and well-appointed with luxury bedding. Had gorgeous view over pool and golf course and was able to see Disney fireworks at Epcot and Disney World. Friendly, helpful staff. Good-sized fitness center. Room rates are quite reasonable but breakfast and valet parking are a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “What NYC Waldorf Could be if Had More Room To Build/Rehab”
Reviews.Author: Meenanall
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria many times, but had never been to Orlando property. Was blown away by the generous rooms, finely appointed decor and soft goods, but above all - the service provided by the staff was astounding. I wanted to move in! The decor takes its cue from NYC but with a modern twist. Truly elegant and enveloping. Would be a great place for a wedding and I am sure they do many! The pool, golf course and window-scapes were gorgeous. Would definitely go back on my own dime!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Elegant! Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: GNLKWS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando for one night, as we had a Hilton certificate and have always wanted to stay at this property! We were not in the least bit disappointed. We were greeted at the overhang by a valet who took our car for us (they do not offer self-park) and then again at the door by the bellman who offered to take our luggage. At the front desk, we had a fantastic front desk staff member who welcomed us and got us checked in. He also gave us an upgrade for our Hilton status and escorted us to the elevators so we were pointed in the correct direction. Our suite was beautiful and we didn't want to leave the room for the evening. It was so comfortable and plush. We did leave for dinner and when we returned, "turn down service" was provided which was a nice touch with robes and slippers by the bed! The ground were kept so beautifully and the pool / hot tub area was definitely that of a 5-star resort. It overlooks the golf course and it's a very relaxing atmosphere. My husband and I would stay here again in a heartbeat and hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience at the Waldorf-Astoria Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MrsT21
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times so far and will definitely look forward to going back again. The rooms and lobby area have always been immaculate, and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect from the Waldorf.”
Reviews.Author: jetdrvr
Reviews.Content: A truly fantastic hotel. Undoubtedly the best hotel on the Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: gtravel721
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Orlando in November for leisure and again in January for business. I don't even know where to begin! This hotel is very new and it shows! The lobby is absolutely beautiful and the rooms match. I had a Disney view room decorated in warm tones and a bed that I was very grateful for after a long day of walking in Disney. The bathrooms are big and provide a separate tub and shower. We ordered room service more then once and not was it excellent but consistently excellent! The hotel does provide transportation to the Disney parks and they have a schedule of pick up and drop off times in the lobby. The pools are great and if you plan to spend a day there... I recommend the cabanas. The staff was very nice and attentive both times I've been here... willing to bend over backward for anything I needed. I didn't get a chance to visit the spa but I am going to be staying in this hotel at the end of march and hopefully I will get a chance to try it. Many of the hotels in and around Orlando are worn and in desperate need of an upgrade! This hotel excels in all areas and is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “I got bumped as well!!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyPastafreak
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is beautiful, it really seems like everyones first day on the job. I was bumped upon check in and having travel insurance , I would have been able to make other arrangements had they told me even the day before. While they were very generous upon my return( when they had room for me), you just can't buy back the time lost on checking in and checking out . You don't expect overbooking at a hotel of this caliber....thats why you book it. Perhaps in time they will have their act together, although one of the employees had mentioned that the turnover of initial employees was great in just the 18 months of opening. I hope they work it out soon.

Reviews.Title: “True deluxe property close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: MtlFire
Reviews.Content: Despite being a hhonors diamond, this was my first experience in a Waldorf Astoria. I purchased the Experience Waldorf package which included a 50$ credit per night and breakfast vouchers for two. Upon check-in I received two personalized envelopes, one as a diamond guest with two drink vouchers and a spa discount as well as the vouchers for the Waldorf package. There is no self park, and the daily 50$ voucher cannot be applied to valet parking. This pretty much encourages you to eat on site, but the free breakfast and the credit was worth it compared to regular rates. The hotel was spotless and we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom king with a view of the pool as well as the fireworks at Epcot. The bathroom was huge with a large walk-in shower as well as a tub with jets. The living room had a bar area and was larger than most hotel rooms. The staff were super nice and overall it was a great experience. I often stay in Disney properties, but the Waldorf puts Disney deluxe hotels to shame for about the same amount as paying full rack rates at a Disney hotel. Its connected to the neighboring Hilton property via a convention center or an outside walk.

Reviews.Title: “This plase will take your breath away!”
Reviews.Author: Cancun6Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Entering this hotel was breathtaking! The customer service from the moment we pulled into this resort was spectacular! The southern hospitality we received from check-in to check-out!! The beauty of the resort, the enormous rooms, and the best part of all the pools! Wow is not even the best word for this awesome place. The spa - You will never walk into a spa more perfect. The massage was the best Swedish Massage that I have ever received. My mother-in-law also enjoyed a Swedish Massage and she said the same. I have stayed a lot of places and this resort by far exceeds all my wants at a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel may be nice--if they honor reservations (and don't rely on phone confirmations)”
Reviews.Author: FemaleBizTraveller91
Reviews.Content: Bumping 16 of us with confirmed reservations and a big deposit wasn't the worst of it: When those of us on the later end of arrivals called to confirm our reservations, they lied and told each of us we were confirmed. But when we arrived at the hotel, the desk clerk got the manager who handed us an envelope with an apology typed on 30# paper (The attempt to convey quality failed.) and sent us to another hotel about 20 minutes away. This could have--and should have--been handled more efficiently and truthfully. Contacting just one person with the group and electronically sending the paperwork to the accepting hotel would have saved a lot of time and aggravation for 16 people. I'll never trust a Waldorf property again. Booker beware.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: holiays
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone! accommodation and service both high standard but the food was superlative - quite the BEST steak I have ever eaten ( and I have travelled widely in the US).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl84
Reviews.Content: Many pros and cons of this hotel leaves one with mixed feelings upon departure. Pro's - new facilities, plush comfortable rooms, good golf course on-site. Con's service is distracted and harried, housekeeping average (eg they don't re-stock toiletries or water, don't refresh towels at turndown, etc), you get nickel and dimed for everything (eg there is no free parking option, Internet is extra, etc), the bus service to Disney parks is ok. Bottom line, a bit of a "pretender" in the luxury hotel category. It's a good option for adults who want to play golf and sit by the pool. Not great for families who want to visit the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Luxury in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Coug1995
Reviews.Content: I just wrapped up a three night stay at the WA Orlando and I was practically in tears having to leave, I wish it didn't have to end. The room was wonderful. Marble flooring, separate living/dining room and a king size bed to die for. I don't know if it was the mattress or the wonderful blankets, sheets and pillows or the combination of both that made it so luxurious but each morning I did not want to get out of bed. the bathroom was spacious with separate shower and bathtub and the provided hairdryer was a T3. (For those of you who are unfamiliar, T3 hairdryers are professional quality and quite expensive.) The service was nothing less than you would expect from a hotel with the name Waldorf-Astoria. From the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out, I felt like royalty. I booked the room on Travelocity and as a Hilton Diamond member I was unsure what benefits, if any I would receive. I was pleasantly surprised to find out I was given every Diamond benefit and then some despite the fact I didn't book direct with Hilton. Free breakfast at Oscars, complimentary glass of wine each night of my stay at the Peacock Lounge, free wireless Internet access and as an added bonus $50 resort credit per each night of my stay. Taking advantage of this credit, I ordered room service two of my three nights and booked a spa treatment at the Spa by Guerlian. The resort offers free shuttle service to all of the Disney parks as well as Downtown Disney. The shuttles are actually very large buses, which accommodate plenty of people. The drivers are also friendly and helpful. The pool area is great and the pool attendants are very attentive. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Sadly, I had to move on to the Embassy Suites on I-Drive for the remainder of my stay as this is the hotel my client is paying for. If I ever come back to Orlando, I will certainly stay at the Waldorf again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed EVER”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelsfor2
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and elegant hotel. Marble is everywhere. The rooms are amazing and the bed is absolutely the best ever! The pool is pretty incredible. My only complaint was the cost of the food and the limited business office. I had to go next door the the neighboring hotel for business printing needs. The food was very good, but being on Disney property, it was expensive. I did not use the fitness center but I heard it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed and Bedding Ever”
Reviews.Author: foodiehotelguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located to disney for those of you with families. We stayed here because we had a wedding to attend. The room itself is pretty good, the bed was amazing. My only negative comment is in regards to housekeeping. When staying at this level of hotel, we would expect that our toiletries be lined up nicely on a wash cloth and the bathroom left in pristine shape. This was not the case. Everything was sort of left lying around as we left it. The other strange thing is that my wife wanted to keep an extra shower cap for home so she put it in her travel bag. When we returned to the room, we noticed that the housekeeper actually took the shower cap out of her travel bag and put it back on the counter. Beyond that the facilities and grounds are amazing and there is a great jogging track around the two hotels.
