Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: joe-at-Koenigstein
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in calm location. Clean and spacious rooms and bath. Very good bed. Overall service is outstanding. The restaurant is expensive but worth the money. Breakfast could offer a bit more variations. The spa is expensive. Since being there in January, I was more or less the only guest. The Gym is equipped with state-of-the-art equipment and located in a nice area with view to the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: SButta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty and very lavish, the service is superb, the halls are pretty big, room service top notch, the quality of food was EXCELLENT, just an excellent hotel choice. The hotel recommended A1 Elite transportation for our limo needs, their service was also top notch. The surrounding area near the hotel was very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SERVICE AND FACILITIES”
Reviews.Author: David7015
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights having been to Naples for 3 weeks. We normally stay at the Waldorf in New York which we love. This time we wanted to see Epcot & the other Disney parks so the shuttle service was fantastic running virtually every half hour - you get a full list of times from reception. The hotel staff were unbelievably courteous and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble and the concierge staff were very accommodating. From 6-9am the hotel serves complimentary coffee & tea at the main lounge/bar area which was unexpected for a 5* hotel and very much appreciated. The king bedroom was excellent and very well serviced. Highly recommend the Bull & Bear restaurant for dinner. The gratin potatoes were to die for!!!. The waiters were very courteous and informative about the choices on the menu and again nothing was too much trouble. We didn't have breakfast but on our last day we purchased 7 small pastries for $10 + tax (Try doing that in UK!!!!!) The golf club attached to the hotel looked very pretty although I did not play the course. One of the staff by the caddy cars let me have complimentary use of a putter and wedge to use on the practice green nearly every day. The swimming pool area was also staffed by very attentive people Thank you so much everyone at the Waldorf for making our stay so memorable. We would definitely come and stay again. We were sorry to leave

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Rich experience”
Reviews.Author: pkelly8
Reviews.Content: We’ve never had the pleasure to stay in the Waldorf in New York city but if it’s anything like the one in Orlando, it may be the ONLY place we stay in New York. I cannot emphasize enough the quality of every exchange and experience. From the bellman, to the Concierge to waiter/waitress, front desk, room service ect..there wasn’t a single person that didn’t make us feel like they wanted us to come back. This hotel is impeccable inside and out. Meals were outstanding and certainly NOT overpriced for the quality. Highly recommend for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Top 5”
Reviews.Author: 2dman
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting at the Swan Hotel. After reading negative reviews on the Disney hotels, we decided to book at the Waldorf. Costco has deals there, but we booked on our own for 2 nights. It is easily one of the top 5 hotels in which I have stayed. We chose to upgrade our room, so we got a separate bedroom, so this review is based on that. The hotel is only 15 months old, so everything appears new and it is beautifully designed, but not stuffy. Every employee was extremely helpful and friendly. My wife was awestruck. We stayed at the Dolphin for one night after that and it was a big step down, except that it obviously is easy walking to Epcot. Waldorf has dedicated buses to Disney sites. You won't be disappointed with this hotel if you have any degree of class. PROS: wonderful workout facility Good Steakhouse on site Top 10 golf course on site Beautiful pool with cabanas; adjoining Hilton has lazy river Wonderful staff large flat screen TV in both rooms rooms are very quiet DVD Blue-ray player with digital soundbar Very comfortable beds w/ LED reading lites plush bathrobes and slippers provided walk-in shower w/ good showerhead separate soaking tub fridge w/ wine rack nice wine glasses; best I've seen in-room espresso maker; best coffee I have had in a hotel couch and reading chair lanai in room upgrade overlooks pool and golf morning paper Nice 1 mile jogging loop around complex CONS: No Beer on tap No free internet access Pillows are very nice, but too large; no small ones No in-room Bar; wine and beer not sold in shop valet park only

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - miserable view”
Reviews.Author: gypsy03
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention at the Waldorf Astoria. The hotel is impressive: beautiful rooms, comfortable bed, great amenities, impecable service. The one flaw, and it was significant, was the view from my room. I was in 305, which literally looks out on an ugly rooftop. I know other rooms were available, because many others attending the same convention checked in later than I did and nobody, as far as I could tell, had a view of a rooftop. It is surprising that a hotel of this calibre (and cost) even has rooms with a view of a rooftop. It is even more disappointing that the front desk staff would assign this room when many others were still available. I would have asked for a different room, but had to clean up and change quickly and get to a meeting. I would recommend this hotel, but would also recommend that if visitors are assigned a room on the third floor at checkin they refuse it and insist on a different room.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star all the way”
Reviews.Author: Helping_husband
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Orlando from 17-20 January. The hotel lives up to 5 star rating - wonderful facilities and good service. I recommend it for people who want to escape the Theme Park Crowd and pamper themselves. The only changes I'd make are in the Bull and Bear Restaurant and the main hotel bar. The restaurant does not excel in the same way the hotel does which is a disappointment. Come on Waldorf you can do better (detailed comments in separate review)! The barman in the main hotel bar was surly. I asked for a dry Martini and rather than clarify how much vermouth I wanted, he just made me an iced Gin! He also shook the cocktail rather than ask how I wanted it (who wants bruised Gin???). When I came back after dinner and wanted a digestive, I asked for Grappa. The Waldorf Orlando doesn't stock it. Amazing how a 5 star hotel doesn't stock a basic drink like this. The barman thought he was being helpful when he suggested I try a different hotel bar to see if they had any....... So although the Waldorf needs to polish it's restaurant and bar, I still highly recommend it when staying in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great new building, but below average staff”
Reviews.Author: specialgifting
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff could use some extra training: It takes forever for them to remove dirty dishes from the hallway. They let you use the same tiny soap bar for days.. It takes the whole day for the cleaning lady to get to your room.. Breakfast at Oscar's was disappointing - not because of the food, but because of the ridiculous wait and because of the restaurant staff - rude, unpleasant, always rushing us... Don't they understand that guests have paid a lot of money to be there and enjoy a relaxing vacation? There is no fridge in the room. Also, no coffee, no tea. They have a coffee machine downstairs but they put it away by 9am or so... The hotel itself is very nice - the building is pretty much brand new, elegant, etc. The location is great if you're looking for a quiet vacation. Unfortunately that doesn't make up for the other troubles.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but poor front desk”
Reviews.Author: nat1774
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, great service especially Wesley at the Breakfast he was so much willing to always please!!!! Matresses were fantastic! Very nice Golfcourse with Top Service! The Best Steak in the US is definetly at Bull and Bear at Waldorf....wowwwww The front office manager is really nice as well is Tina at the front desk...all the others got an attitude...a no go for me! But I still would definetly return! The price/quality is very good and it's worth the money definetly! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: chasu
Reviews.Content: Just returning from the Waldorf and it was very relaxing, upon arrival we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The room was very nice and roomy and we enjoyed coming back to this hotel after spending all day in the parks. I would recommend this place to anyone traveling with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “A the best un-Disney hotel when vacationing at Disney”
Reviews.Author: markefried
Reviews.Content: I booked the Waldorf Astoria through the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts plan (a platinum card's advantages far outweigh the annual cost) and reserved a room here for about $175 less per night then if I stayed at one of Disney's top resorts (Grand Floridian, Polynesian, Yacht Club, etc). Part of the program provides for an upgrade when available and boy did they not disappoint. Instead of simply moving us to a deluxe king, they upgraded us all the way to a luxury king which includes a wet bar and living space. With breakfast included and a $100 resort credit, at $370 a night this simply cannot be beat if you're staying in the Disney area and want luxury. They have a complimentary luxury coach to take you to all the parks and the drivers amuse you with jokes and facts along the way...it gets you in the mood for Disney. The service at the hotel, as you would expect at a Waldorf, is top notch. The Concierge was extremely helpful when we were planning our days at Disney, something on NYE that needs experienced insight. The bell hops are always right there to open a door and help you with bags. The maid service was unobtrusive and efficient. The restaurants also have above average service although we only did breakfast here. As a couple traveling without children, this was the perfect hotel for us. It was right next to the parks and provided the easy shuttle service to and from. At the end of a long day of walking around Disney, it was a luxurious escape from that world which can be a little all-consuming for adults. The pool is beautiful to relax beside and even on a crowded weekend like New Years it wasn't too crazy and we had beautiful weather so people were taking advantage of it. The gym is also more then you would expect from a hotel. If I was going to have one criticism, I would say that the view from our room wasn't the best because it faced the parking lot. It happened to be a beautifully landscaped Waldorf parking lot, but it wasn't the Disney and golf course view I had hoped for. With that being said, this is really a great option for people looking to do Disney in style but not stay right in the thick of the Disney madness.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Cascarol
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria in Orlando Florida is by far one of the BEST 5 STAR HOTELS I have ever stayed at. The staff treats you like family and because we were traveling with kids you never quite know how the kids will be received at a 5 star hotel. The kids loved it! The pool and grounds are perfectly manicured and there is always someone waiting to ask if you need ANYTHING!! The beds were amazing, down comforters, high thread count sheets, slept like a baby. The rooms are tastefully decorated and spotless and the food was fabulous. The Disney parks are a 15 minute complimentary luxury shuttle ride away. I would and will plan to visit again. TOP NOTCH!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but take your wallet”
Reviews.Author: griggsfiona
Reviews.Content: this hotel we found to be lovely our room overlooking the golf course wasnt that big for 3 people but it was clean and nice.the golf course was very well run but very expensive at $250 for two people for 18 holes but buggies are good and a nice touch to be able to order fod on the way round via the tv in the buggy i did however think that the driks cart that came round shouldve been complimentary . breakfast was good although as the hotel filled up we found we had to wait to get in but Tarik the chef and John were fab and made a mean omlette and made our experience a pleasure. room service was very very expensive we had breakfast one morning of cereal toast and tea for 2 which was $99. i would eturn to his hotel and would recommend it also thanks to Trudi on the front desk for helping us out with our christmas shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel...staff not ready for New Year's crowd”
Reviews.Author: hank1065
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is nice & the staff is very friendly. That being said, this would not be my first choice of a resort in the Disney area (or second, or third...). Our suite was not very clean - entertainment center was dusty, counters were smeared. The biggest problem was that the hotel was not ready for the New Year's crowd. The restaurant experience was awful - 2 hours before our entrees were served & the food was not good at all (on the positive side, it was comped). Hour & a half wait for room service for the kids. Over an hour wait for a bellman at checkout. Forty-five minute wait for our car to be brought around...we barely made it to the bowl game on time. Bottom line: the hotel is nice, but next time I'll choose to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Local Weekend Away at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: D_E1328
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a weekend away...or a staycation if you will. Living in Orlando, we decided on trying the Waldorf Astoria out as our weeekend "destination." Overall I thought the hotel was very nice. We were looking for an upscale hotel to stay at that would allow us the opportunity to go to some of our restaurants and such. The Waldorf, on the outside, is asthetically pleasing. Well manicured drive up with fountains etc. However, I cannot say that I was wowed by it. With a regular Hilton hotel right next door that looks strikingly similar, I'm not sure it has the initial wow factor that one would look for with the "Astoria" name. But certainly don't get hung up on that. I am writing the review the hotel all around. Normally I'm not too picky, but I want to give our full review. As you pull up you are quickly welcomed by a very attentive staff. The valet crew were on their game the entire stay, and we never waited for our car. That includes the night in which that had a very large NBA team's x-mas party there. Check-in was very easy, and they were attentive to any details that we had on our reservation. The Lobby is certainly the centerpiece of the hotel. They had it all decked out for Christmas, but it certainly had a granduer about it. We had a king bed, deluxe room. The room, upon entering was very nice. With a king size bed and then a sitting area with sofa certainly gave the room a large and accomodating feel. My wife loved the large bathroom, and I thought the seperate shower and jacuzzi tub were a very nice touch. Very very clean, and the room itself was well put together. The decor stayed with the many gold shades that you find in the lobby. During our stay we did not eat at any of the restaurants as we went offsite both nights. We were not there for Disney, so that did not factor in the weekend. The Waldorf is owned by Hilton, and if you are in need of any internet service, you will have to pay for it. For me, that probably has turned into my biggest travel pet peeves! The only other quasi complaint i'll have is the parking. The valet was very nice, and very efficient, but the self parking was adjacent to the other Hilton hotel, and still a pay/day and not close if you had to walk out. The workout facilities were very nice. We did not use the spa or golf course or pool as it was cold and rainy. Overall, it was an excellent hotel that I would recommend to many others. I cannot complain about our stay. It is not the New York Waldorf Astoria, so if you can come in without any pre concieved images, you will really love this place. Hopefully this helps! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Management equals a superlative experience.”
Reviews.Author: Rkenn44263
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just checked out from a 4 day Christmas time stay in this amazing property. On check in we were upgraded to a golf course facing suite which was spectacular. The room i beautifully decorated and furnished with everything one needs for a perfect stay. I especially loved the bed with it's fine linens, the nespresso machine and the blue ray player. Housekeeping always knew when we were out and the room was kept perfectly clean. The spa is beautiful and very relaxing. Bull and bear was a great place for christmas dinner. The hotel is very well located for visits to all Disney resorts. This was the best room device experience I've had after extensive traveling. You've gotta try the chicken sandwich and of course breakfast in bed. This is obviously a very well run 5 star hotel and the entire management team deserves a pat on the back. Well don Hilton. We loved it so much we just rebooked ourselves to return again on January 8th! R Kennedy.

Reviews.Title: “Always nice when it's what you expect it to be”
Reviews.Author: originalsix
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with excellent service and friendly staff. We had a two bed room on the 9th floor facing the pool, and were able to see the Epcot fireworks quite well at 9:30 each night. Only ate at La Luce, which was good. The golf course was inviting but didn't get a chance. Location is not within walking distance to restaurants or shops outside Waldorf or Hilton. There is a bus to take you to the Disney parks, but it was too full ... we ended up taking a taxi ($21+tip). 2 miles up the 4 fwy is Panera for breakfast and 5 miles is Sand Lake Rd, (1 mi. south of Universal) where there is a Whole Foods, many good restaurants, CVS, and the best Starbucks (Dr. Phillips Drive). The pools are heated! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great property, great staff”
Reviews.Author: aviators99
Reviews.Content: Got two rooms for a two night stay. My HHonors status was recognized several times, and I received an excellent upgrade. The staff was incredibly attentive, answering any and all of my questions, and even giving me a tour of the property (something I would not expect from such a large hotel). They have free transportation to the theme parks (which I did not use), and they will gladly give you a golf cart ride over to the Hilton, where there is a giant pool and lazy river. I will definitely return there again.

Reviews.Title: “A new deluxe option near Disney”
Reviews.Author: MickiD
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria is is wonderful alternative to the WDW deluxe properties, particularly if the Disney ambiance is not required. It was a pleasure to stay in such fresh, luxurious rooms and be surrounded by staff with a "can do" attitude. The environment is a bit corporate/sterile and hordes of people with name tags are often milling around the lobby, so small children might not enjoy it as much as a property where Mickey's face is everywhere, but for us it was a small price to pay to be so darn comfortable. Our room was well appointed and had a view of the fireworks in the evening. The pool looked to be superb. The WA is attached to the Hilton Bonnet Creek, which provides additional restaurant and activity options. It can be a long haul from one end to the other, however. We drove to the parks, but bus service is available. It is well located, a short drive to all of the parks. There is a true spa and large fitness room to add to the amenities. Everything worked, the staff seemed happy to be there and our stay was a pleasure from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: miroslife
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted by a smiling staff. They immediately and politely asked for our car keys so that they could give us a valet ticket since the hotel doesn't offer self-parking but was informed that we could park at the connecting Hilton next door. We arrived at around 8:00 p.m. for a smooth check-in the staff was very friendly and asked how our day was. The room was very clean and the hotel was very quiet really good location for people going to Disney World.We were here for a 3 night stay from July 21th - 24th and every night we would have turn down service and a delicious chocolate candy awaiting our arrival the beds are extremely comfortable. Our room was a Deluxe 2 Queen room with a golf course view. We went to Universal Studios Orlando it wasn't that far and the traffic wasn't at all bad. Everything went smoothly we really enjoyed our pleasant quiet stay at this hotel I hope to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “If you really have to go to Disney, this is where to stay :)”
Reviews.Author: fabfourNJ
Reviews.Content: We travel to Orlando every year for a sports competition. And have endured it but not more. This year by accident we ended up at the Waldorf and were pleasantly surprised. It is a very big hotel, but they do a good job. And it has a lot of the things that kept the children busy and out of Disney world.... It is close though, actually within the borders of the great Mouse country so if that is why you are there it is a great location. The swimming pool is fab, and going over to the Hilton one for some change was an added bonus, they have a lazy river and slide so the children were busy. Golf course was really good fun, seeing an alligator sort of made the day really! And the Italian restaurant at the Hilton makes the stay really easy, food on location....

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Sophistication in the middle of Disney World; great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacobs-Family
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at this location for a quick trip to Disney World on the tail end of our Thanksgiving trip to visit family in south Florida. I chose this hotel because it was the only 5 star location in Disney World, is a brand new hotel, and we got a resort credit through booking with American Express. The hotel is located on the Bonnet Creek Parkway, sharing grounds with the Hilton Bonnet Creek and the Wyndham Vaction Club properties, near Lake Buena Vista at Disney Main Gate. The Waldorf Astoria Orlando exudes elegance and class from the moment you arrive. Staff was friendly upon check in and had tons information on dining, golfing, spa, and Disney World attractions. There is a shuttle bus that runs every half hour from the property to area Disney theme parks. We were able to leave our car parked for the entire trip and utilize the shuttle service to get to and from Disnay and LBV dining/restaurants. On Sunday nights in the Peacock Alley Lounge at the hotel, there is a pianist that is wonderful to listen to and enjoy a cocktail or coffee. We ate at the Bull and Bear restaurant on property for appetizers and drinks and found the dark-wood bar inviting and cozy to slink into and relax. All in all the hotel was a destination worth splurging on if you want 5-star accomodations, just far enough away yet still close to the hustle and bustle of Mickey Mouse. *ROOM DESCRIPTION -- large and spacious, deluxe king room. Comfy bed with down comforters and large king-pillows, seperate seating area with couch and chair, working desk with wifi hook up (extra charge!), clock radio with ipod/iphone charger, large swivel flat screen TV, 2 free waters upon arrival, large marble bathroom with seperate soaking tub, walk-in shower with large shower head and good water pressure, nice grapefruit scented toiletries (forgot my shampoo!), nightly turn-down service, 24-hour room service, * but did find it odd there was NO mini-bar in the room (guess it is put in on request!), modern design and aesthetics for room decor. There is a professionally designed golf course on property, Guerlain spa on property, and large pool with cabanas that you can rent for the day. Unfortunately we did not use these ammenities b/c we were there for Disney World theme parks, but would be great to have if staying longer than 2 days and are able to enjoy these additional perks. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family, and would stay here again when visitng Orlando/Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: DougM123
Reviews.Content: While originally there for business, we extended our stay for some family Disney time. This hotel is not only beautiful, but the staff goes above and beyond in everything they do. Notable standouts include Mike from room service who didn't just drop our food off, but setup the table in our room (tablecloth, silverware, drinks, everything just as though we were in the restaurant) and the manager who overnighted (at their expense!) my son's jacket that we accidentally left behind . On that note, if you have kids, bring them over to the Hilton pool where the lazy river and beach type setting are loved by the kids (the Hilton is connected via the convention center). Oh and the hotel is so well built that I never heard any of my neighbors or anyone in the hall - one of the quietest hotels I can remember (and I'm sure my neighbors appreciated that as well since my kids like to wake up early and make more noise than they should). I can't say enough about this hotel - even the rate was reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property.”
Reviews.Author: Rap1958
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night for a weekend getaway. The property is beautiful. Everything is first class. Could not find anywhere they cut corners. Service was first rate. Property still feels brand new. Not many dinner options on site but there are more at the Hilton next door. Far superior to the Disney "luxury" properties, at comparable cost or less.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Luxury and sophistication!”
Reviews.Author: lactamom
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Orlando from Atlanta with our 2 young boys for a 5 day Disney vacation. We are Disney experts and have made several trips. This was our first time staying off-property. We chose the Waldorf Astoria Orlando due to being Hilton Diamond members and having a free stay. As far as the hotel goes, it is beautiful! Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite (without even asking), which was amazing! In the suite we had a large eating area with refrigerator and a large living room area complete with a nightly view of the Disney fireworks and a large flat panel TV. The bedroom had 2 queen beds, large flat panel TV, ample closet space, and an idock for your iPhone or iPod. The bathroom was spacious with marble tile and a separate shower. The service, cleanliness, and comfort could not have been better. The staff is practically tripping over themselves to assist your every need. As mentioned, we traveled with 2 young boys. Our children were treated very well and were not made to feel unwelcome as other posts have suggested. That being said, the Walforf Astoria is definitely not kid friendly. We did not see any other children for the duration of our stay. When at the pool, we felt the need to constantly remind our kids to be quiet and not splash. However, the connecting Hilton Bonnet Creek is SUPER kid friendly. If you have children, stay there instead. We spent much of our time next-door (there is a complimentary golf cart shuttle) at the Hilton's pool which has a waterslide. The Hilton also has a weekly movie night by the pool. Be sure to ask for a printed schedule of events. The Hilton offers lots of little "extras." That being said, we are not regretful that we stayed at the WA, we just probably would not do it again with kids. If you are looking for a full Disney experience, you probably do not want to stay at the Hilton or Waldorf. Though the location is very convenient, there is definitely a disconnect. The resort transportation is nowhere near as convenient as the Disney resort busses. We had an issue where the bus was very late so we ended up driving our own car to the park and having to pay for parking. I will say that the resort made up for this 110% without us having to put up a fuss. They sent complimentary cookies and milk to our room that night w/ an apology letter and gladly removed that day's valet fee from our bill. How could we complain after that level of service recovery? Speaking of valet fees, if you have a car, it must be valeted and you are charged approx. $22 per day for this fee. Obviously, tipping is also necessary every time you need to access your car. Bring your wallet to the Waldorf; you will need it! The pool guys and gals that set up the pool chairs and umbrellas will also bring you cool wash cloths while you are sunbathing. This is a super nice touch, but is another area that you'll need to tip. The pool-side restaurant and bar are VERY expensive as well. The same goes for the Hilton. If you are looking for a luxurious reprieve away from Disney, this is the place for you! If you are looking for a full Disney-good-time complete with daily park hopping; this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional”
Reviews.Author: nyudude
Reviews.Content: I chose to get engaged in disney world and was originally considering staying at one of the disney hotels because of convineince and package deals to the theme parks. Im so glad i didn't go down that route. The waldorf astoria was trully the most amazing experience immaginable. They beant over backwards to enhance our special weekend. Upgraded us to a great suite, treated us to drinks and constantly made us feel like we were on our honeymoon. Im a little nervous that our honeymoon wont compare with the emasculate service we received. the hotel is done in good taste. not to mention they have a great golf course and a pool area that stays open to a reasonably late time. The hilton is also part of the complex and both share wonderful emmenities. even if we weren't on cloud nine from the engagement this hotel trumps any options at disney, because the quality is just better. and parents who want there kids to experience disney's parks properly shouldnt be discouraged to stay here. the kids will have fun and the parents will be able to relax and enjoy there vacation as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheYoungLaird
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after staying in a villa for a week close to Disney World. This hotel is excellent. We were staying with my three sister in laws + husbands/boyfriend + 2 babies. We arrived after a very trying Virgin flight from Manchester. It was the first time that we had travelled with the new baby and we were very tired! The moment we arrived we felt a massive weight off our shoulders. The Waldorf is pretty much brand new, so it is all sparkling! There are hundreds of staff all very eager to please with big smiles and efficient manner. Apparently the hotel runs at between 20% and 60% occupancy, which would explain the excellent service. Room service takes 5 minutes, as does baggage pickup and car delivery etc. Our room overlooked the front of the hotel, which was quite good, but did not compare with my sister in laws room which overlooked the pool - This looked BEAUTIFUL at night. Being American you get two double beds which is great since Mrs M-B is very pregnant and separate beds is a real treat! The duvets and pillows wear virtually worth taking home with you, as were the bathrobes - none of your standard white towelling robes in sight! It had one of those Bose radio ipod things and a huge TV. Bathroom was spotless with huge walk in shower, seperate bath and a set of scales! All very upmarket. Unfortunately they had not put in the cot that we had ordered. I called reception and ten minutes later a knock at the door annaounced a guy with a single bed! Apparently what I wanted was a 'crib' not a 'cot'. 10 minutes later the 'crib' arrived - what you and I would call a big cot! We were very tired and only managed a couple of drinks in the bar before bed without dinner. At 2 am I called for some warm milk for the baby. Delivered in 2 mins ($8.39 for a glass of milk might be considered expensive by most!). The girls went for a day at the pool while the boys played golf at the club twent yards away. It is the Astoria Golf Club but kind of shared with the Hilton next door, I think. Our round of golf was $100 dollars but, like the hotel, the service and facilities were excellent. After a light breakfast from the golfers buffet I stepped into my freshly cleaned shoes with my gleaming clubs. The buggies (included) had the inbuilt gps screens that you could email for assistance and order food through. This and the course made it a great morning. We had lunch with the girls in the golf club. Excellent burgers etc. There was virtually no check out costs when we checked out at 2 pm since we had prepaid - through Travel Republic. £120 a night. Absolute bargain. We came back a week later. This time it was only Mrs M-B and Hector staying but everyone piled in to use the pool for the day - maybe a bit cheeky but we spent ALOT at the pool bar! The pool facilities are very good. The loungers have a buzzer thingy on them to call a waiter, the frozen margaritas are as good as you will get, and the food is excellent. We had a boozy lunch after another round of awesome golf. $400 for lunch for six is quite alot but the rooms are quite cheap so you kind of make up for it that way. Mrs M-B had a facial in the spa. $180 but it was very good! We departed very early the next day to goto SeaWorld so missed out on any breakfast so cannot comment on that and I fell asleep before dinner so cannot comment on the Bull and Bear steakhouse. My only gripe was the room on the second stay had a kingsize bed but felt quite tight when the cot was in there too. Admittedly we had alot of luggage and there was a sofa in there too, but i think if I had been there for longer I would have asked for a bigger room. At the end of the day the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando is just another big chain hotel. But it is very good and shiny new! Get in while you can... Oh yes, if you think it is going to be full of kids, it is not! I didn't see (or hear) any other kids when I was there. The people stayubing there were all very smart - not a tattoo in sight!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Wins”
Reviews.Author: bob_marvin68
Reviews.Content: It started great and just got better: The lobby and arrival was just great AND we got an upgrade to a suite on check-in. Room had a great view was very spacious with all the amenities you can think off. The place is definately on top of its game with very personal service and great food - but pricey. The location is great too, very close to everything and they even have a shuttle service (we heard). They share facilities with the Hilton next door and you can use those as well.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Murphy14
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the beautiful Waldorf Astoria in Orlando was the perfect hotel experience. From the moment we arrived until the moment we reluctantly checked out, the service was exceptional, friendly and professional. The hotel was immaculate, elegant and extremely comfortable. The staff was friendly and most happy to provide the highest quality of service. The large pool area was beautiful and we enjoyed the icy towels brought to us poolside. We will definitely stay at this hotel again and urge others not to miss this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: ben1233
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf on business in early October 2010. Having stayed at the Boca Beach Club (also part of the Waldorf line) since it's major remodel, I was interested to see how this one measured up. As others have mentioned, the place is brand new so everything is pristine. From the front doors (which are beautiful), to the lobby (outstanding) to the rooms, it all works very well together. As a lot of others have mentioned, it's (seemingly) pretty easy to get upgraded to a suite for free. I am Hilton Gold, and the recognition program at this particular property is pretty robust. The suites are indeed amazing, at almost 1000 sq. ft. A blu-ray player and a wine fridge were nice touches. In terms of features, the rooms are better than those at the Boca Beach Club. My room was made up twice daily, and when I was about ready to go to the ice machine, I picked up the bucket and lo and behold, fresh ice was already there. The service was outstanding. One day I had gone overboard on the sun tanning and ended up with some pretty painful burns. The concierge at the front desk gave me a free drink ticket (on top of 2 that I had already received) and sent someone to the neighboring Hilton (after closing hours) to get me a bottle of "Aloe Freeze." Although it was $15 (ouch) it was nice to have it delivered even though the gift store was closed. Probably the only downside of my stay was my trip to the Spa. Although the massage itself was outstanding (and very interactive), for $180 I would have expected the overall experience to be more of an "experience." The Spa at the Boca Resort has this place beat hands down. At Boca, you can make a whole afternoon out of it. The massage beds weren't heated and the treatment room itself was too noisy. As great as the massage was, I'd have a tough time spending that kind of coin again. I did walk to the neighboring Hilton one morning and although it seemed nice, it was a noticable step down from the Waldorf. As others have stated, if you're looking to get away from the wet kids and old ladies who wear their swim suit cover-ups to the breakfast buffet, the Waldorf is the place to be. Going another BIG step down, after a couple of nights I had to move to the Swan/Dolphin in order to be closer to the conference I was supposed to be attending. I'll post my review of the Dolphin separately -- but WOW what a dump...totally unsatisfactory. I give the Waldorf two big thumbs up and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This place is AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: While your children will have the time of their lives in Orlando if you stay under a tarp, this is the kind of hotel that makes the experience for parents. This is an absolutely top shelf hotel in an incredible location. We stayed for 8 nights this month. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by name (this is before we checked in!). We were upgraded to a suite with a balcony for the entire stay by the evening manager. We also had a $100/night (!!) resort credit which was really nice. During the check in process it was clear that the staff were invested in making sure we were getting set up for a perfect stay and it really was just that. The valet parking is quick and organized if you want it, although you can save $20/night if you use the attached Hilton garage which is a 2 minute walk from the Waldorf front door. I had business in Orlando during the trip so it was very important that we had a place to stay where I could work comfortably and efficiently while my family vacationed and the Waldorf was perfect. You could be at a first class/business level resort anywhere and the staff is ready for the business traveller (incidentally they have excellent conference facilities). However, for the family the attraction is the beautiful and peaceful pool (and the walking proximity to the more "fun" Hilton pool with slide, lazy river, etc.) and the great food. The staff treated our children wonderfully and made them feel very special, especially the pool staff. One of the best parts of the entire experience is that if you are here for Disney, you are as close (or closer) to the parks than some of Disney's own hotels, but even though it is located within the Disney property, it is a world apart. Each day you can take their free shuttle (which is actually a luxury coach) to and from any park and then back again. At the end of a busy (and exhausting) day touring a park, you can retreat back to this oasis away from all the craziness. Not only is this nice for parents, we found it to be good for our kids to get them to settle down, take a break, swim and get a good rest for the next day. Speaking of rest, the room itself was terrific. The room was totally quiet, silent in fact. The bed was amazingly comfortable, the living room of the suite was great and the pull out bed was very nice for our son. There was a full table for 4, perfect for room service, and a small fridge, which was nice for laying in a supply of snacks. Overall, just a great room. In summary, if you are going to do Disney, this is really the only way to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Its_Tina
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Waldorf Astoria was superb. We truely enjoyed our experience. The pool area is gorgeous, the gym high end, the food was good. It was very close to Disney with free shuttle service. We had a 1 bedroom suite and we loved it. The bed was a dream with white linen ... it was hard to get up. The bathroom was huge with a nice shower and robes. Upon our arrival a bottle of champagne along with a fruit platter was delivered (upon my husbands request prior to arrival). When we were leaving the shuttle service to the airport which we had paid for and arranged with the front desk was a no show. The hotel pulled up a town car and sent us on our way - free of charge. If you want to be close to Disney, without all the little monkeys running around, this is your hotel. Sophisticated, elegant, quiet - perfect! It also has access to the Hilton so you can enjoy all of their amenities as well. The pool bar has the best food! And Sangria, too!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: admem
Reviews.Content: Our family has traveled to orlando several times over the last several years. We have stayed at many top hotels: The Ritz, The Portafino, Hard Rock, and Grand Floridian. It was by far the nicest of all of the hotels. Our family included 2 children (6 yr old and 8 yr old) We spent a lot of time at the adjoining Hilton pool. The water slide and lazy river were our favorite. The service at the hotel was perfect, and the facilities were beautiful. We will stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service”
Reviews.Author: Ken017
Reviews.Content: From the time you pull up to the front of the hotel until the time you leave, the hotel staff is constantly at your service. To be perfectly honest they were so attentive it was almost annoying some times. May this level of service is for some people but for me it is little over the top. To each his own. Overall though, nothing bad to say about the hotel, clean, comfortable, great location.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigAlCumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and thoroughly enjoyed it, I really can't say enough about how good this place is, we had a suite which was on the 15th (top) floor at the rear of the hotel. The room was really nice and spacious, the bed big and very comfortable, big flat screen TV with good choice of films. The bathroom is lovely with a separate bath and shower and nice hotel toiletries. The supplied robes are absolutely wonderful, we wanted to buy one from the gift shop, but they are so popular they were out of stock. The living part of the suite was great with a 4 place table for room service, fridge with free water, a pretty good coffee machine, another TV and sofa & armchair. With a suite you also get a balcony, which we really liked, looking out over the pools and golf course. One thing I found a little strange, was that there were 3 phones in the bed/bathroom, but none in the living area. With our suite being at the rear of the hotel, we had views of Disney and could see the nightly fireworks at EPCOT and Magic Kingdom from our balcony at about 9PM, I'd stay here again just for the view, never mind all the other amenities. Valet parking is $20/night and there is a self-park option available for $13, but the valet service is great, it's worth it, they will also give you free water. They run a coach service to Disney, which we used one night, which was fine. The whole hotel is lovely, which you might expect as it's quite new and a Waldorf, the thing that set it above other "very nice" hotels was the level of service we got. It was exceptional from everyone we dealt with from the valet, bell-hop, reception, bar & restaurant staff, not just the people expecting a tip. The bars and restaurants we used were all excellent, if a little pricey (but you don't go to the Waldorf for cheap), the bar by the lobby has live music which was really nice. You can also go through the attached conference centre to the Hilton and use it's facilities as well. The pools were generally very quiet during the week, they got a bit busier at the weekend, but I didn't ever see more than about a third of the loungers occupied, which was really good as I don' t like crowded pools. The one thing that irritated me was their internet access policy, it's $10/day if you want it in your room. However, if you go down to the lobby or bar, it's free down there, so I don't really see why they need to charge you to have it upstairs, it can't cost them anything and I can get free wi-fi in a cheap 3* hotel. However, that's a small grumble about an otherwise outstanding establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OilIsle
Reviews.Content: I was really underwhelmed with this property. It certainly is not worthy of the the standard set by its New York namesake. This is just another overpriced touristy Orlando hotel. I typically stay at the Ritz when in Orlando, but decided to give this property a try mainly due to Disney proximity. That's about the only benefit. The hotel is a typical "nice" hotel, but not particularly memorable for the name and the price. The service was non-existent - plastic smiles but nothing actually gets done. The rooms were OK, but again nothing to write home about. If this wasn't advertised as a high-end hotel I may have enjoyed it, but for the price and the brand I walked away really disappointed. I'll stick with the Ritz from now on.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel accomodations, golf course and staff!”
Reviews.Author: CasaMarinaManagement
Reviews.Content: Group of friends and I recently stayed at the hotel for a reunion of sorts, all male golfers. The hotel is virtually brand new and it shows being in flawless condition. The golf course was surprisingly well established, almost "mature" and in excellent conition considering the greens were top-dressed 10 days prior to our arrival. Staff all were eager to greet, proud of the facilities and quick to respond to any request. All in all, a tremendous experience. The only issue was with the taxi drive who brought me to the Hilton right next door despite me telling him twice I was staying at the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately...... over-rated”
Reviews.Author: WhenCanWeRetire
Reviews.Content: Very pretty property but... for the money? Room service food was "just alright".. overpriced (1 sandwich w/fries & desert w/milk= $42) wow that's even high for me. Pool was nice "for adults", but found we kept leaving the property for the Hilton next door. Their food was better (they have wonderful breakfast and dinner buffets) and pool area was a lot of fun for everyone. We did have a lovely view of the Disney parks & firework displays at Waldorf. I'm pretty sure we won't be staying at Waldorf again. It's nice but we just felt it lacked in many ways for a high-end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday Party”
Reviews.Author: travelagent2236
Reviews.Content: Luxurious king and queen suites....beautiful pool area..excellent service they have private shuttles to take guests to disney venues//virtuoso rates provide breakfast for two daily,75.00 spa cresit...4pm check-out

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Experience at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: FAMURattler
Reviews.Content: My family and I were there when the Waldorf Astoria Orlando had it's grand opening in October 2009. We had such a great time, a year lated I decided to celebrate my birthday and enjoy another Disney vacation at this wonderful resort. It was great to see that a year later this wonderful property is still holding itself to a higher standard and delivering great customer service in a gorgeous setting. If you're looking for a true luxury hotel experience in Orlando, the Waldorf is definitely the way to go. Of course, most Orlando/Disney hotels tend to offer a more "themed" experience. There is nothing wrong with that, I've lodged at many of these types of hotels (Grand Floridian, Animal Kingdom Lodge, Boardwalk, Coronado Springs, etc.). The Waldorf offers an elegant alternative to these properties. Because the Waldorf is so close to all the Disney parks, guests get the best of both worlds - the opulence of a 5 star hotel and all the great "themed" activities that Orlando has to offer. Of course, beautiful hotels are not uncommon and the Waldorf is a shiny new property, so I must say that what really sets the Waldorf apart is the level of service. Prior to arrival, my wife contacted the Waldorf and informed them that I would be celebrating my birthday while at the resort. She also told them that my son, who loves animals, would be traveling with us. When we checked into our room we were greeted with champagne, wine, chocolate covered strawberries, and a card in honor of my birthday. For my son - a stuffed animal peacok toy (Waldy the Peacock - the Waldorf Mascot).

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to rest after a day at the park !”
Reviews.Author: rapho
Reviews.Content: Its so relaxing you dont feel you are in Orlando with 4 kids ... my case

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels We Have Ever Visited!”
Reviews.Author: Monnie_10
Reviews.Content: I never leave hotel reviews, but I cannot say enough great things about this hotel! My husband and I just returned from a long labor-day weekend stay at the Waldorf-Astoria to celebreate my birthday. The hotel is beautiful and the service was exceptional. The hotel staff was able to upgrade our room upon checkin and the room was probably the nicest that we have ever stayed in. The location to Disney World and free shuttle service to the Disney theme parks definitely came in handy (we used the shuttle almost every day). The pool was soooo relaxing and everyone was so pleasant. The food was great, we loved the outside bar by the pool, and the food at Bull and Bear (one of the onsite restaurants) was so delicious that we ended up going back for dinner the next night (something I never do when on vacation; truly one of the best meals I have ever had). The staff was truly professional. I planned on visiting the spa, but it was so relaxing just lying by the pool that I never made it to the spa (a first for me). I have stayed at my fair share of 5 star hotels/resorts for leisure and business purposes, and this hotel has definitely made my top 3 favorite hotels list.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel but they put a hold on your funds”
Reviews.Author: fusionchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly beautiful. We stayed for three days and were upgraded to a suite with a balcony view. Every physical aspect was amazing. The pool was empty at night and you could see the fireworks from it. We splurged to stay at the waldorf so we were upset that the hotel holds an extra $100 a day on your card "just in case". It shows as a debit with your bank and even though it is refunded in the end it put us in a bind because unfortunately we had some financial issues on our way to Florida. We were given a $25 credit per person pet day for breakfast as part of our package. The buffet was $24 per person so for the food it was $48. The actual bill was $59 after the tax and mandatory tip for someone getting you a drink. I had read valet was $20 a day and there isn't any other option. The joining Hilton has a parking garage but the waldorf must use valet. On the second day the $100 fee was declined by the bank and we were called to the lobby to present another card. The hotel is gorgeous but unfortunately I don't think we will return.

Reviews.Title: “did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: barbiflys
Reviews.Content: We slept like rocks at this hotel. The bed was so comfortable. Everybody that worked here was great. We ate at all of the restaurants snd enjoyed them all. My husband loved the golf course--he played it twice.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: shoutlouder
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria Orlando is a fantastic hotel! From the moment we arrived we were treated like absolute royalty. Valet walked us from our car to the front desk to check in - and the front desk walked us to the elevators leading up to our room. The bellhop met us with our bags within 5 minutes of us arriving in our rooms and he was so friendly and helpful! He even remembered our names for the rest of our 3 night stay. The hotel is GORGEOUS. The lobby is stunning, and the rooms are beautifully decorated - as are the hallways leading to the rooms. I loved every inch of this hotel! There are 2 quiet pools at the Waldorf and a massive pool with a lazy river next door at the Hilton that is a nice added bonus to use as well. We didn't use the fitness center but it looked great. The spa was also really nice although we only used it for manicure/pedicures and not full treatments. The location is excellent, on Bonnet Creek Lane which is just minutes from Disney's Hollywood Studios and Epcot and Magic/Animal Kingdom aren't very far either! The hotel provides shuttle service that seemed pretty frequent, but we had a car so we didn't utilize this. There is only one snag we found, but it wasn't enough to take away any stars from this wonderful hotel. The pool area service left something to be desired. While the pool area is gorgeous, and the staff is quick to cover your chairs with their plush towels - the drink service is really spotty. We had some mediocre weather (Not pouring rain or anything however, just periods of drizzling mixed with clouds and sun here and there) while we were there and the pool bar closed early for this reason and there was nowhere for us to get drinks (even coffee!) to enjoy by the pool. There were plenty of people enjoying the pool in this so-so weather, yet they still closed the bar early two days we tried to utilize it. This definitely needs to be improved as high-quality hotels with great pools should have equally great pool-side service for their guests. Like I said, that one snag wasn't enough to take away any points from this incredible hotel and we cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic … loved the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GGplusE
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, we used the facilities (restaurants and pool) of the adjoining Hilton a little more as they seemed more geared to the younger guests. But the room was brilliant, quiet spacious with nightly view of the Disney fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: NaplesFloridaJfk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights ,what a delight. Beautiful room with view of epcot fireworks, lovely pool area and lobby.Very nice concierge and staff.A nice respite away from crowds. Can use all Hilton amenities attached by walkway. Wonderful Italian restaurant Le Luce at Hilton. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape!”
Reviews.Author: TheTexasTerrys
Reviews.Content: Great vacation and great adventures! I wanted a quiet hotel with a comfortable bed. The Waldorf exceeded my expectations. The staff was excellent, the room was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, the pool was peaceful, the shared pool was great for the kids. The day of our arrival, my son scratched his toes on the pool. I called guest services to get a band aid (no details shared). They sent security with band aids, wipes, antibiotic ointment. He asked me what happened and asked to see my son's feet. He then asked if he liked ice cream and sent two bowls of vanilla and chocolate. After we returned home that evening, he again came to check to see if my son was ok. The service is above and beyond. The pool was not crowded and the kids enjoyed both the Waldorf and the Hilton Lazy River. The hotels is 10 months old, so the rooms are new, fresh and comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and has a separate shower and tub (great for soaking after a long day at the parks). The bath robes and slippers were a great touch. The transporation service to Magic Kingdom was perfect. Pick up and drop off at the front door of the hotel. My husband used the fitness center and was impressed with the quality of the equiment. Awesome treadmill that synchs to wifi. Only valet parking is available $20 per day. Wifi fee applies if used from room - free in the lobby, pool, fitness areas. All in all the hotel did not disappoint! We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Definitely stay here :)”
Reviews.Author: lissybubs
Reviews.Content: To put it into context; we have stayed in many many lovely hotels worldwide so we know what we like and what good service is. Were we disappointed with this hotel ??? - NO WAY! It's amazing. From the minute the grand doors are opened for you, you are whisked away in a paradise of perfection along with genuine great service. It was totally perfect every step of the way. There are so many staff buzzing around, the place is positively gleaming and you are never far away from a smiling & helping hand. Pool was excellent - again the service was 100% perfection. Rooms were excellent quality although a bit of a tight squeeze for a family of 4. Would upgrade next time to get more space and intimacy! We used the adjoining Hilton for breakfast every day and there is a great Italian restaurant there too with amazing staff. Not cheap but still worht every penny. Can't wait to return and indulge in such a friendly 5* hotel. Well done to everyone for making our stay very memorable indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Amidst Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: travelingatlantamom
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week touring Disney with our two young children and I must say this hotel made the trip very relaxing and restful for my husband and I. The service was excellent, beautiful suite, spa was amazing and the location cannot be beat. We loved having a roomy fridge and Nespresso maker in the room, it allowed us to eat breakfast in our room each day before touring. We dined one evening at the Grand Floridian and were so thankful that we had chosen the Waldorf. It gives you a chance to recharge your batteries after being in the Disney crowds all day. My children loved the pool next door at the Hilton. I highly recommend this hotel to any family traveling to Disney, very close to the parks, but worlds away when you want to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet with superb service”
Reviews.Author: zeldawannabe
Reviews.Content: From the fabulously fragrant lobby to the serene, quiet room, my husband and I loved everything about the Waldorf Orlando. The staff and service could not have been more professional or helpful. The room was quiet and comfortable. The food was excellent. the hotel is beautiful. We're planning a return trip for pleasure so we can enjoy the golf course and the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Away from the stress of Disney!”
Reviews.Author: hopelessdreamer
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to this hotel from the sister hotel, the hilton. We got upgraded to a suite and free golf for the whole trip. The hotel was amazing! Wonderful rooms, huge comfy beds, amazing service from everyone there! The pool was quiet and the restaurant was very good at catering to our needs (we eat very little variety). We could see the Disney fireworks from our balcony and had an amazing view of the whole of Disney. The location is second to none, just close enough! There are free coach's to most of the Disney park's. All in all this hotel made what would be a wonderful holiday and AMAZING one. (just not a hotel for those who want a lively hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the heart of Disney - a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SimonGeorgeUK
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no hesitation at all in recommending this hotel. If you are planning an Orlando trip for pleasure or business you must stay here! The location, the amenities, the level of guest service and overall experience were second to none. My family and I are fortunate enough to have travelled to many destinations around the world and have stayed in countless hotels. I can honestly say that the Waldorf Astoria is definitely one of the best if not the best we have ever stayed in. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the level and friendliness of the service we received was truly exceptional. Every member of staff was a credit to the hotel. We could have simply spent 2 weeks in the hotel going between the pools, the spa, the golf club, the bars and the restaurants but sadly trips to the theme parks and the shopping malls got in the way! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Pristine Perfection for the Discerning Guest”
Reviews.Author: loveyhowell
Reviews.Content: My husband & 5 children aged 17, 11, 3, 2, &1 stayed in a Deluxe Queen Suite w/Disney view 7/25-7/31/10. We are accustomed to a certain standard of living & expect the same accomodations when we travel as we enjoy in our upscale home. WA satisfied us in every way, including the attention to detail in pre arrival planning. Pre arrival coordinator Patricia Chu was efficient & prompt in responding to multiple emails & succeeded in getting every detail right. She understood my family's need to have the room sanitized completely before our arrival & together w/ head of housekeeping Rosemary McClafferty, provided a room in pristine condtion, right down to the freshly shampooed carpet & bottle of Purell waiting for us in the bathroom. Those with small children will appreciate the completely sound proof walls between the bedroom & family room area! In fact, the only fault I could find with the room was the fact that there is no way to keep the door open when delivering room service. Housekeeping was impeccable from start to finish, even picking up & delivering the ice packs we needed for baby bottles daily. At one point, I noticed what appeared to be a grease stain where a piece of furniture may have sat before & they promptly re shampooed the carpet for me the next day. Amenities & towels were bountiful, including mouthwash & pre packaged lemon scented towels that were invaluable in the sweltering parks. The beds are so incredibly comfortable that I was able to sleep every night without the Tens Machine I usually need for my chronic back problems. Valet was divine, & offered to bring our giant triple stroller to us when needed. The only negative experience we had was that room service for breakfast was inconsistant. Raw French Toast, overcooked eggs, then undercooked the next day, chewy toast, then missing toast. Weak coffee no matter how often we asked for it to be stronger. Even though room service was included in our rate, at one point we gave up entirely & had breakfast at Epcot instead. They did offer to send replacements but it would have been better to get it right the first time. To be fair, my husband is a chef & we own a restaurant, so perhaps our standards are higher than others. We have spent the last 8 summers at Disney's Grand Floridian for our annual, week long Anniversay trip spending between $500-700 per night for rooms sized at 450-750 sq feet. Waldorf Astoria offered a 2 room suite nearly 1,000 sq feet in size. WA provides true 5 star service, not Disney star service, which, as anyone who has stayed at the GF can attest, is equivalent to 3 star service at 5 star prices. If you are the type of vacationer who believes most of your time is spent in theme parks so who cares about the room, then you probably won't appreciate what Waldorf has to offer. If, however, you are a traveler who values their hotel experience as much as the rest of the vacation, WA is the place to stay. Even though I thoroughly enjoyed the convenienc of staying 'on the monorail' at the GF, the service at Waldorf is just too superior to pass up. My family will stay here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “First class luxury and service from the moment you arrive!”
Reviews.Author: melliemels
Reviews.Content: Following a very disappointing stay at the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes last summer, we were hopeful that the Waldorf would live up to its reputation as a first class hotel. We weren't disappointed. From the moment we arrived, the hotel staff were warm and welcoming, particularly William, the bellman, who took us to our fantastic room. Nothing was too much trouble for all the hotel staff, from the front desk and valet parking team, Pablo and his colleagues by the pool and bellman Jose who bade us farewell on our last day. The rooms are fantastic with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and a great view of the pool, golf course and Disney parks in the distance. The Housekeeping service was second to none with very attentive, discreet staff. The hotel grounds are beautifully landscaped and well worth an evening stroll. The food was very good with a wide variety of excellent restaurants available, offering a good selection of fare. If you like good Chinese food, make sure you visit P F Chang's, located at the Mall at Millenia, which is also good for some serious retail therapy! All in all, we had a fantastic time and can't wait to come back next Easter. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, very elegant hotel in the middle of a golf course”
Reviews.Author: Ioannis78
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with our 5 month-old daughter for 3 nights in a deluxe suite with balcony. Very elegant and roomy, brand new hotel, and only 30-40% full at the time we stayed. Main objective of our trip to Orlando was to see the Universal Studios theme parks, but when we werent queuing for attractions. the hotel offered very nice pools, bars, restaurants, a Guerlin Spa and a gym to relax. Dining was great, although apart from the Bull & Bear Steak house which is excellent, there is not much choice inhouse, but there is a very good Italian at the Hilton next door. Would definitely go back there when in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Best luxury hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: S0uthFla_m0m
Reviews.Content: We frequently vacation in Orlando and stay at the 4-5 star hotels. The Waldorf is better than the Ritz. Great for kids too. 5 star!!!! And fantastic value when compared to the Disney so-called luxury hotels. Waldorf even has free bus service to the Disney parks. Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITION OF LUXE? WALDORF ASTORIA, ORLANDO”
Reviews.Author: prissypapers
Reviews.Content: n. 1. The condition of being elegantly sumptuous. 2. Something luxurious; a luxury. [French, luxury, from Latin luxus.] luxe luxe adj. In short, The Waldorf Astoria Orlando!!!!!!!!!! OMG, I don't quite know where to begin because the beginning was just as good as the middle and the ending. The family and I stayed here for a much needed vacation. We drove up to absolute beauty; gorgeous grounds, cleanliness, and the epitome of elegance and class! We were warmly greeted and welcomed in and were so impressed by the interior that had we had a wait a bit for check-in, we would not have minded at all. But of course, they didn't make us wait. We were about an hour or so too early to check in but were placed in a room immediately. Now, we initially asked for a deluxe suite with a bit more space but didn't realize that this meant a king bed with a sleeper. Since we preferred two queen beds, we were immediately MOVED AND UPGRADED to a larger, more exquisite space w/a connecting room, which worked out perfectly! We were told that the room chosen for us was not prepared. So, we went out to lunch. When we returned, we entered into an impeccably luxurious space and a platter of fresh fruit welcoming us to our temporary home! By now, we were sold! We had a wonderful three nights stay, with a staff that somehow stayed one step ahead of our every need, who all looked as if they were enjoying their jobs, and who made my husband and me feel like a king and queen traveling w/their prince and princess! Our only regret was that we didn't book for an extra day (flight). I had been (up to this point) a dedicated "Ritz" fan but I am certain that going forward, I will be looking for WA properties. We are already planning on going back to WA, Orlando! Patricia, Michael and Jonathan, you are all class acts! We can't thank you enough for making us feel like we were your only occupants! See you SOON for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property and impeccable customer services”
Reviews.Author: AffairsinMiami
Reviews.Content: I recenlty visited the Waldork Astoria in Orlando while attending a conference. Although I did not stay overnight, I did tour the facility and found it to be amazing! My meeting was with Ms. Jane McLean from the sales and catering department. She was very courteous and friendly. Ms. Mclean answered all my questions pertaining to conferences and events, showed me the meeting spaces and showed me the restaurants on property. She detailed the history of the Waldorf Astoria as a company and shared some of her past experiences as a planner. I would certainly recommend this luxurious property to my clients as it suits wel for both corporate and social events. I also found it surprisingly family oriented.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Atlglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an absolutely fantastic stay at the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando. This is the first time we have stayed in this property and even though I lived in FL I thought the Waldorf was only in NYC. We have stayed in different hotels in different countries and the Waldorf has the best staff that we have experienced. They made our stay extra special which made this such a fun trip. The property is immaculate and has an amazing Golf course. Also its located within a few minutes of Epcot/Magic Kingdom and other fun Disney attractions. If you are in Orlando, you absolutely cannot miss out on The Waldorf Astoria. We are looking forward to our next trip. Make it a point to book a room with a view and I am sure the friendly staff will make it a memorable event for you as well!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Experience - Round 2”
Reviews.Author: JNJJ
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review on this hotel back in April, and had good things to say about it. We booked again with at the Waldorf for a 7 night getaway for the 4th of July holiday weekend... and my opinion of this hotel has not changed at all... this hotel is first class, and is affordable. I cannot write enough on this hotel, except that it is top notched. When you come and stay at a hotel as this, you must expect to use Valet parking. The parking garage is quite a walk to both the Hilton and the Waldorf, but Valet parking is close and it was worth it, since most of the week we were there, it was raining. Bell service is superb. I was surprised to find that the gentleman who checked us out the last time was the one who would greet us into our new room. Since I can't use any names here, I will say that he remembered who we were and later in the week greeted us again with a special package that he, himself, put together for our family. This was beyond our expectation and was a thoughtful gesture to us to make us feel at home. Our room was more than adequate. If you get a Deluxe Suite, you should book for a room that over looks Disney and arrive early. If you're fortunate enought, you'll get one of the "end" suites, which are bigger than the ones in the middle. This was close to 900 sq. ft. of space and had two bathrooms, a wet bar, expresso machine, refridgerator, two large screen tvs, a king size bed and a pull out mattess couch. The view was spectacular, since we had one window in the living room which over looked the golf course, and faced toward Hollywood Studios, and the other window in the bedroom overlooked the pool where the cabanas are. The bed was comfortable, with goose feather downs and feathered pillows, which I didn't respond too well to, so I asked the front desk if they could bring an alternative, and they were more than happy to defeather our room so that I could sleep comfortably without sneezing. We used room service about 5 times: 1 for dessert, 2 for breakfast, and 2 for dinner, and it was consistent each time. Basically, whatever time you put down for breakfast to be delivered, breakfast was ready to go before that time. Coffee is free downstairs at the bar area, and it does shut down at 9am, so if you do order in room breakfast, just go downstairs for the free stuff. Shuttle service to the park is posted on the website, or you can get it at the front desk. We did not use this service, but it seemed that the bus ran on time. It does run to Magic Kingdom every half hour, and it does run very late. We didn't use it because of children, and lugging around a stroller, but we would have used it if the circumstances were different. House cleaning comes twice a day, and they are sweet ladies who will work and chat with you if you want. They clean everything and tuck away shoes, and later in the evening will get it ready for bed for you to slip right in. The pool area is great since they have a zero entrance side of one pool, so the kids can play and you can just sit back and relax. You can also use the lazy river and pool area at the Hilton as well. Overall, our experience was great, and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “A whole excelente hotel”
Reviews.Author: dudaBrazil
Reviews.Content: Great room, great view, EXCELENT pool and fitness center, a lot of elevators, do not wait 1 second, the confort in your room ( robe, bath tub and shower, lcd tv) , great staff in the pool bar, richard, jeff..... great stay

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: kb293
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Disneyworld, Florida and stayed at one of the Disney hotels, whilst it was great for our 2 year old daughter, we didn't find it in anyway relaxing as they are definately geared towards children. However, for the second part of our stay we wanted to have a look around before we booked anything and decided on the Waldorf Astoria, which although is tucked away is very well located to get to the parks and any shopping you might want to do. We had booked a regular double queen room, but were a bit concerned how our daughter would manage in a regular bed, so on arrival we asked if we could change it to a king and a lower rollaway bed. They didn't have anything on check in (hardly surprising as we were trying to check in at about 9.30 in the morning, way before check-in time!), but after a conversation with housekeeping upgraded us to an absolutely fabulous suite, which they gave us immediately. The hotel has a great steakhouse restaurant called the Bull & Bear, we tried the hotel bar for food at 10.55 (they close at 11 - we are awkward!) and they accommodated us we some fab snacks and also room service, which was very prompt. and again exceptional. The pool area is tranquil, with a graduated area at one end, which made it safe for our daughter and also great for us to sit and read our books in when it got really hot, they also have bungalows with tv's. If you want to got to any of the parks, there is a free shuttle bus to all of them. The service by the pool, by house-keeping, bell-boys and reception was impeccable and we couldn't fault a thing. We fancied trying breakfast at the Hilton next door one morning and were promptly taken over by golf cart as soon as we asked for directions. The Hilton's pool area is great if you have older children as there is a water slide and a lazy river, they also have a lot of activities going on if you want a bit more action. However, after Disney we preferred the peacefulness of the Waldorf. We have stayed in a lot of good 5 star hotels, but the Waldorf Astoria definately went the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations; nice oasis in theme park land”
Reviews.Author: traveler2099
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at all the upmarket brands - Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons and St. Regis - and this hotel is definitely in that league. Having been open since the fall of 2009, the hotel (public rooms and hotel room I was staying in) was immaculate, elegant and contemporary. Service at the front desk, lobby bar and with room service was fast, efficient and gracious. Stayed in a standard king room and was pleasantly surprised by space and amenities, including a beautiful live orchid in the room. Extremely quiet property and room, which was a nice oasis in all the over-stimulation that is Orlando. This hotel is definitely geared toward adults though. Think conferences and meetings. While LITERALLY adjacent to Disney, its miles away when you want to call it a day. Turndown was completed every evening and was QUITE the presentation! This is NOT a Disney owned or operated hotel, so forget about themeing and character breakfasts. Had room service two mornings and it was delivered before the time as promised and very good. Also ate dinner in the Bull & Bear Steakhouse which was convenient - a true resort feature. Beautiful room, great food, but pricey for the uninitiated ($300 for two - cocktails, entrees, sides, a bottle of wine, and tip). Service was a little odd and we had three servers who we couldn't determine which one was the lead. If we needed something we just asked whoever was walking by. Minor beefs - no newspaper delivered to room and the pool area was a little underwhelming (A family of ducks in the pool. All day. Every day.). Corporate HIlton has scored with this expanding the WA brand outside of NYC. Let's see how they can replicate in other markets. But this one was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TripleDeckers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Hilton Honors points while visiting Disney World. The property is adjacent to Disney and we were a 5 minute drive from 3 of the parks - fantastic location. The hotel is absolutely beautiful - both inside and the grounds. They only have valet service ($20 per day) - but it was a lovely luxury. The staff was incredible - everyone was very cordial and attentive. We were upgraded to a suite and within a half hour of our arrival a staff member brought a beautiful plate of fruit and water to our room to welcome us as Hilton Honors members - great touch! The suite was very large with a dining table and wet bar, large living room area, bedroom with 2 queen beds, and bathroom with a lovely glass shower and separate tub. Our room overlooked the incredible pools, cabanas, and golf course. We spent the better part of our time at Disney, so we weren't able to enjoy all the hotel amenities. This is a great hotel - and its location next to Disney makes it all be better!

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Robengar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe suite with Disney view, room 1513. The hotel grounds are very beautiful and the gym is one of the nicest we have ever used at a resort/hotel. There is a very nice pool area with frozen grape skewers in the afternoon. The room was very large and had a sitting area, dining area and bedroom with a small balcony off of the sitting area.
