We had a view of Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We were able to see Illuminations from the balcony. The Fili D'Oro linens in the room were some of the best in any hotel we have stayed. We only had room service, but the Mac & Cheese and Angel Food Cake were incredibe. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. We would highly recommend this hotel if you want to be close to the parks but want a more grown-up atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel! Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: AWalter48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend to celebrate my birthday! It was wonderful, we were greeted with smiles and treated very well from the moment with entered the hotel until we left. The staff is excellent and very accommodating. The restaurants at this fine hotel are very good also. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and for pleasure. Very attentive service”
Reviews.Author: phillip_norton
Reviews.Content: I went to Orlando for both business and leisure. I was their for a business conference and extended over the weekend with my family. I really couldn't have been happier with the experience and I don't typically like Orlando. This is a very new hotel (opened at the end of 2009). It is also attached to a Hilton property. It has two pools, the more leisurely Waldorf pool and the Hilton pool with water slide and lazy river for the kids. The lobby is great looking out over the pool and the golf course. The rooms are spacious, very nice with large bathrooms and comfortable beds. They all have flat screens, DVD's, etc... They do have a SPA which I did not experience. It is 10-15 minutes from Disney with shuttle service. It is one of the only properties within Disney that is not owned by Disney. The location is fantastic if you are planning on hitting Disney. The service was really great. My family came in a couple of days after me and we had connecting rooms for my two young kids. We were checked in early, crib already in the room and a very attentive and detailed staff ready at all times. When there was a problem with an in room dining order because of my daughters food allergies, they not only fixed it, but they comp'd another nights meal. They have a few very good restaurants between both properties and you never have to go outside if you don't want to in order to get to the Hilton. The golf course is a lot of fun with a great club house, but water all over it so it can be challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Set the standard”
Reviews.Author: AZlovesHI
Reviews.Content: We loved this new property at Disney World. The service was exceptional. We used the in room dining, bell staff, concierge, laundry and of course housekeeping services. All were performed with a high level of professionalism, courtesy and efficiency. Room and bathroom were very spacious. Furniture including bed was very comfortable. Bathroom had separate tub and shower which was nice. Having a quiet room is important to me and ours was very quiet. Only complaints: not enough pillow selections, so had trouble finding a comfortable one. Also, it is located just slightly outside the Disney property and shares a bus with the new next door Hilton and schedules are not as frequent as we would have liked. This is a minor complaint, however. Not too many kids, so it was pretty quiet, even at the pool. I would highly recommend this property, especially for adults only. For families, the Hilton looked like a better choice for food and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not Enjoyable - Awkward - Customer Service Missing Completely”
Reviews.Author: flgator1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando last month on our first weekend getaway since our youngest child was born. The time for these trips is difficult for us to find, and we were very disappointed in our stay. Our visit was from March 25th to March 28th. We chose the Waldorf because we wanted to simply relax and take advantage of the hotel amenities. It is hard to explain, but the vibe of the hotel was awkward. Everyone was trying to be nice, and the luxury suite was absolutely beautiful, but it never felt welcoming. When we first arrived, we were greeted at the check-in counter with “Welcome to the… (long pause) Waldorf Astoria… we really appreciate your brand loyalty”. We laughed about this on the way up to our room because she thanked us for being loyal to a brand that we have never visited before, and one which she could barely remember the name of. We didn’t think anything of it until our experiences the rest of the weekend. As I mentioned, our plan for the weekend was to never leave the hotel since it offered all of the amenities we were looking for. I don’t want to write a book, or sound hyper-critical, but here are some of our experiences: - The lobby bar was the epitome of stuffy. We tried it a few times… one time I received a terrible poor from the bartender who corrected my pronunciation of a scotch (twice), and the second time we were never greeted after sitting there for over 20 minutes. - The pool area was beautiful, but on the first morning we had to listen to loud maintenance workers while shifting from lounge chair to lounge chair as they updated the lights. The following day, when the pool was busy, there was one server for the entire area, and getting a drink was an effort. - When we ordered room service, we were given an exact time the food was going to be delivered, unfortunately it came 25 minutes later and was completely cold. - We were told Sir Harry’s had a nice selection of drinks, but it was never open. - Our dinner at the Bull & Bear steakhouse was mostly pleasant. The service was great, the oysters and the carpaccio were amazing, and I enjoyed my scallops. Unfortunately my wife’s filet that she ordered medium-rare came out medium-well. The server was sympathetic and wanted to replace it, but we wanted to eat together rather than watching each other eat, so she kept it. We also ordered the soufflé, and were told it would take about 20 minutes to prepare… it ended up coming out 50-55 minutes later because we were told the first 2 had collapsed as they were being made. The waiter was fully aware and apologetic for the situation, which wasn’t his fault, but never offered to do anything with our bill. The funny thing is that as we were walking out, the manager asked us if we enjoyed everything, and we mentioned that the filet was overcooked, and his reply was shockingly, “yeah, that happens from time to time, have a nice night”. - We really enjoyed the very challenging golf course, but again had a weird experience in the restaurant there. We sat down at a table and were the only ones there. The server, who was seemingly doing side work behind the bar, never came over to greet us. After 15 minutes, I walked over to the bar and grabbed some pastries and coffee which were out. - We ended up walking over to the Hilton, and had somewhat better experiences there, but they also seemed confused and understaffed. (Note: I sent these comments to the general manager, Micheal King, and he sent us a letter offering a free room upgrade if we decide to come back... yippee! hahaha!)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravDaddy
Reviews.Content: There were a few elements that met the Waldorf standard, but even more shortcommings. Poor rooms design--move desk to access PC plug, etc.... Staff was indifferent. No bell service at arrival. Slow check in. Small room. Dreadful in-room lighting. Dreadful parking lot view. Only positve note was the comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: The Positives: The hotel is beautiful when you pull in. The flowers and the property are absolutely georgious. The location is fantastic and the disney shuttle is very nice. Upon entering the hotel, the lobby is beautiful and exudes luxury. The off lobby bar, called Sir Harrys is really nice. The bartender was great and it was not too crowded. The fitness center is first class and everything was working properly with a good variety. The pool area was nice and not overly crowded. The steakhouse restaurant is also beautiful and has a private club type feel. The Neutral: The room is acceptable, but not great. On par with other high end hotels, but really not special. To be expected, good bed, good towels, good bath products, but again not great or "the best ever". The restaurants are okay, but not special. Certainly not up to the standards set by the Ritz Carlton/JW Marriott Orlando that houses two top end restaurants (Norman's and Primo). They could really use a top level restaurant at this hotel. The Bull & Bear steakhouse was okay (asthetically it is beautiful), but in my opinion the food is not up to the standards of a Ruths' Chris or Flemings Prime, it was good, but not great. Certainly, a step down from Orlando's famous Charley's Steakhouse (maybe they could attract Charley's to take over the space)... The negative: Nobody opened the door for me when I walked in (and a doorman was standing there looking at me). The front desk attendant failed to make me feel welcome and did not provide me with the drink coupons, nor the bottled water that is mentioned on the Hilton Honors website. I visited the gift shop and the attendant did not even say hello, but just looked at me and continued to fold some t-shirts. All in all, the hotel did not remotely exude a home away from home feeling. It actually left me with a "cold" feeling. I agree with the earlier comment of "stay at the Ritz instead" in Orlando. This hotel is beautiful, but just didn't make me feel like I was special. I believe that at this price level, you should feel like a "king". I felt much more like a "common citizen" than a member of the "royal family". Maybe a little more time will allow them to improve. In the mean time, I would make a different choice, unless you get a great deal... At the end of the day, this is a nice hotel that will make most travelers happy. It just falls a little short of being truly great.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: csharon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was first class with elegance and service that puts a person on cloud nine. The staff awaits your stay and is proud to serve you with a smile. The room are very comfortable and very very clean. The food, serving a very large group, was of the highest quality and never over done nor under done. The steak restaurant was mouth watering. The staff is engaging and they are not at all put out by a request and in fact they want to serve you and provide the highest quality service they can. Lastly if you forget an item like I did they will hurry the product to you and are as concerned as you are about getting it back. To top it off they have a great fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Ritz instead”
Reviews.Author: solotravelergirl9
Reviews.Content: First, the good stuff: Beautiful, opulent and luxurious. Now the not so good. I reserved for a one night stay-cation with spa appts. The spa appts I reserved were noted incorrectly; I had wanted a combo facial and massage but they were booked as separate appts. The treatment rooms were wonderful, however, in the middle of my massage, someone from the outside unlocked and opened the door. Not good. The therapist was very apologetic, and the charge was removed but this should NEVER happen. They really push buying the products which I think is obnoxious. My facial person hovered around the check-out area and again pushed buying the products as she did in the middle of the service. Then, when I checked in, I was assured that I had gotten the upgraded room; when I got up to the room, it was the same standard room that I booked. I was willing to pay the upgraded price, why did they screw this up? The room is lovely and clean, but no mini bar, no coffee maker, no bottled water (obviously, not the Ritz). Room Service was atrocious. No nice touches--no flower, nothing special. My order was pretty basic, burger and fries and a salad. The burger was dry, the salad had brown apples in it. My half bottle of wine ($54) was good. I had to check out early, (may have been fortunate), my invoice was prepared as requested but the front desk girl was as surly as they come. All in all, I left disappointed that I hadn't gone to the Ritz. For the prices they charge at the Waldorf, they need some serious polishing up.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet but not 5 star. Service needs imporvment!”
Reviews.Author: dcco1945
Reviews.Content: Reserved a luxury suite. Room was very spacious and clean. There are no mini-bars in rooms nor was there a store remotely close to get beverages if desired without calling room service. The hotel was ok overall but service was not up to par. I requested that the pull out sofa be made after we checked in. I was told there was nightly turndown service and it would be made then. We went out for dinner and upon returning @ 8:30pm we had not received turndown nor was the pull out bed made up. Neither remote for either of the TVs worked. Made a request the next day for them to be repaired and that never happened. We finally got remotes working after making another request the following day. Turndown also never returned after the first night and room had not been cleaned when we returned @ 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “Over-the-Top Glamour in the Heart of Disney”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend for 2 nights with another couple and their 2-year-old daughter. We could not fault this place and in fact, I didn't want to leave.... The hotel is brand new, having opened for service in October of 2009. Everywhere we went in this place just screamed "high falootin." We got an excellent rate online (we are Florida residents) but it was one of those prepaid deals where you cannot cancel or you lose your money. If I had paid full price I would be even more broke than I am now but even then the lost funds would have been worthwhile. My husband has stayed in the NYC Waldorf and said that while the lobbies were similar in comparison, the overall decor of this one in Orlando and the size/quality of the rooms surpassed the Waldorf in NYC by far. We had one room that was a suite of sorts, with a large king bed and a pull-out sofa, which wasn't used, and that room faced the golf course (room 738). The other room was a standard king room with no sofa, and that room faced the pool (737). There are also Disney view rooms available for an upgrade fee. Every bathroom in this place has both a walk-in shower and a separate tub. The decor, specifically the tiling, in the bathroom was to-die-for. There were Guerlain bath products, lush towels, and a hairdryer nicer than the one I OWN. Turn-down service in the evening was awesome (included in the rate of course). To come back to the room to find the robes and slippers laid out, the bed ready to be slept in, and dark chocolate on your pillow was like something out of a dream. Room service is available 24 hours a day and we took advantage of this on our second night, after having had a bad meal at a restaurant in Downtown Disney. The cost for our room service was comparable to the cost for our meal earlier that night but the quality simply cannot be compared. What I'm saying is that unless you need to leave this hotel for a meal, DO NOT because you may be disappointed. This is Disney so meals will be expensive, and you might as well get good quality when you're paying premium prices. The pool area is amazing. Three pools, ample lounge chairs and cabanas that you can rent. Do yourself a favor and order a bloody mary or two. We questioned whether or not we should rent a cabana (I've been to hotels where you have to leave your room at 5 a.m. just to claim some freaking pool loungers) and were told that it was not necessary, which it wasn't. The hotel was not at capacity and we had no problems finding five seats together at 1 p.m. on a Saturday. Valet is $20 a day but very prompt. There is complimentary bus service to the Disney parks, leaving the hotel every 30 minutes. Everyone on the staff had a can-do attitude. We arrived at the hotel bar pretty late one night and even though they were closing up shop (they close at midnight so bring drinks if you want anything later than that!), the bartender stuck around so we could order a bottle of wine and didn't act huffy when doing so. The decor and ambiance in the bar was unbelievable as well. We ate at Oliver's, the 'daytime' restaurant and the food was outrageously good. Try the french toast. Prices are a tad high in their restaurants but hey, it's the Waldorf and it's located near Disney so we expected that. We also saw a wedding taking place and it looked like something out of a fairytale! If you're looking to plan any type of getaway - girls, family, dudes, whatever - STAY HERE and you will not be let down.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: PinkPearl2
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! The staff was wonderful and went out of their way to make us feel like the most important people in the hotel. Jeff at the pool bar and Manny of the Bull and Bear restaurant are great! We will defiinitely return. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service! Overcharged!”
Reviews.Author: atlantamartin
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were welcomed by a snoody staff who did not want to see our children (5 and 9) in Orlando. Our bags took forever to arrive in our room while the kids were ready to go to the pool. The staff made it very clear from day 1 that kids were not welcome with little remarks such as we do not have a kids' meal. The first night in our suite, we realized that we were missing a comforter for the kids' pull out, we called and after waiting for almost 1 hour, we called again and NOTHING! We asked them to make sure that we would get it the next day. We were replied to by with "we will see about that!). Staff brought us coffee when we did not order it and with a do not disturb sign! This was a mess!!! My car got damaged by the MUST valet parking service and I have to let you know about the best. We were charged for a $213 cabana rental after we checked out. The finance manager even implied that I probably used it and just did not want to pay for it! Did I mention that they also tried to charge us for 5 nights when we only stayed 3 nights and that we never received a clear check out statement when leaving. I will never return there! and frankly, they do not care and I do not care either...Go to the Omni at Championsgate...Much better place or the Hilton next door!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: therapistgee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the one in New York City so I thought this one would be at that level of SERVICE. WOW was I wrong. We had notified the hotel on 3 days before we checked in that we were going to be a late check in after 11:00pm at night so I wanted the master bedroom turned down for the evening and that the sofa bed in livingroom be turned down as well for my 8 year old. The front desk clerk said the room had already had been prepared for the evening turndown. When we got into the room NONETHING had been set for turndown. No cummunincation with the staff. A Mini bar that's in the room is empty. No snacks were available for the child to nibble on for an evening snack. It's very inconvenient and not 5 star service to have available to snack on that late at night unless you wanted to go downstairs to the bar area or order room service that takes a while to get to me. No Concierge Level at this hotel. I'm a Gold Hilton Honors Member and I expect alot for my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, however the service and cleaning needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_G10184
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for 9 nights recently in a deluxe suite. The rooms are beautifully and tastefully decorated and the bathroom was luxurious and spacious. It felt like being at home and the living room was large and comfortable. The location is perfect as it is near all the Disney parks and restaurants. My biggest issue with the hotel was that the rooms were not cleaned properly. Even after complaining to the front dresk we still had the same problem. There was dust everywhere and the bathrooms sinks were not wiped properly neither were the bathroom mats changed. We were also disappointed with the room service. My fiance and i are usually late risers so we normally order from room service for breakfast however after trying the food on offer at the hotel we were so put off that we just waited until we left the hotel and found a nearby restaurant to eat at. The housekeeping is also quiet slow and sometimes we'd have to call a few times just to get what we requested. Overall i enjoyed my stay at the hotel and would recommend it to people however the housekeeping and room service really needs to get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: AAshley27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for a bacherlorette weekend trip. Nice, but DEFINITELY NOT 5 stars. Rooms and grounds were nice, but nothing special about this hotel. Staff was not very friendly. Rooms were not very impressive. Would not go out of my way to stay here again. Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes in much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “*** MUST STAY ***”
Reviews.Author: JNJJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and very accomodating. Originally, we were suppose to stay at a hotel on 192, but because of lousy accomodations, my wife decided at 9pm to book at a Hilton hotel (which was her first choice while looking into hotels a few weeks ago). We ended up leaving the hotel on 192 and booking with the Waldorf Astoria. The lady who booked us into the Waldorf Astoria set it all up and we were on our way, and we were amazed by everything this hotel has to offer. Valet Parking was awesome. Whenever we needed our vehicle, we just called Valet, and it was ready to roll, with someone waiting at the door to open it for us. The Bell Service was awesome, with very polite gentlemen taking care of luggage and personal belongings. As we checked out, I asked if he could bring our bags down and store them till we got downstairs, and he said "Do you have Valet with us? If so, I'll just get your vehicle and load it up". (EXCELLENT) The rooms... OMG... what an experience. Two robes, and two sets of slippers await you to slide into! The rooms have soft, comfortable beds, with TWO huge comforters on each bed and four huge pillows. The TV is huge with blue ray disc capability off to the side. The bathroom is huge with separate tub and shower. The quietness of the room is excellent considering we had an adjoined room (with guest who we did not know next to us). We have small children, and so did the other guests, but we could barely hear the next door neighbor. We were also across from the ice machine room and we could not hear people moving in and out of that area (whereas with other hotels, one could hear the noise from the ice machine and people coming and going). We used in-room service for some dessert, and ordered the "CHOCOLATE I.V." All I have to say is "Oh my Lord.... BLESS MY SOUL!" This dessert is evil and should not be eaten by the faint hearted. The location of this hotel appeals for those visiting ANY Disney Park. It is less than 10 minutes away from Downtown Disney, and just a few blocks away from Disney Hollywood Studios. Whenever you call down to Valet, or the Operator, or Room Service, they answer you BY NAME, and are very accomodating.... There is NO WAY that you will EVER stay at another hotel after staying at THIS Waldorf Astoria. YOU MUST DO IT! It Is Calling YOUR NAME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent Rooms... Marginal service, poor choice for kids”
Reviews.Author: feeshmonCA
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for 5 days. The hotel is brand new, rooms are spacious and confortable, the location is close to all the local attactions. Even though I didn't play golf, the adjacent course looked immaculate. But.. for a luxury hotel the service is typical of your average Hilton (owner of the property). "No" was the first answer, and when you could get somone to agree to help you.. it took a few times asking to get it done. Called down to get our car from valet.. 30 mins later no one had told the valet. Don't stay here with kids. Even though it is an Orlando destination, the only dinner restaurant inthe hotel (Bull and Bear) has not accomodation for food any real kid will eat. The waitress had no interest in trying to help.. sorry, that salad only comes with anchovies. Room service solved this, but you have to enjoy eating in your room.. aftre enough coaxing, we were able to call room service and have it delivered int he lobby bar. There is a new Hilton hotel on the same property, about aq 10 minute walk.. in fact every time we asked for something kid related, we were told we could walk to the Hilton to get it. For an adult couple, probably a decent choice.. for a family.. stay at the Hilton, or maybe better, a Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: schnikelfritzFlorida
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location next to Disney properties just down the street from Disney's Hollywood Studio's and Epcot. We got the Disney view from our room and could see the fireworks from both Epcot and the Magic Kingdom. The beds were great and very comfortable. This is a new property so everything was very clean and new. Service was great as well. We actually commented that there seemed to be too many people helping us at one point. The only downfall was that there was no self parking, only valet at $20 a day. It was nice though having the car waiting for you each time you were ready to leave. I would definitely stay here again. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: billyg51
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent two nights at the hotel on a spring training trip. We had a Deluxe Suite which was beautiful. It consisted of two large rooms , one bedroom and one living room.Both rooms had large flat screen tvs. The living room had a pull out sofa which a very comfortable foam mattress. The place was immaculate. It almost felt like we were the first to use it. The hotel itself has beautiful common areas but a rather boxy, bland architectural design from the outside.The common areas never seemed crowded or busy. The pools out back were beautiful. The fitness facility was state of the art. While the restaurants were also beautiful, very few guests seem to eat in the restaurants. The prices might have something to do with that. Seventeen dollars for bacon and eggs seems a little steep. They also charge for internet access . Valet parking at twenty dollars per day is almost a must since the garage is quite a distance.Like my son said, they nickle and dime you pretty good here. Service was not what one would expect at this kind of hotel. Staff is nice but not overly accomodating. When I asked for a one hour late checkout I got it but with the admonition that we had to be out at 12 sharp. Hopefully the service will catch up with the quality of the bricks and motar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: stylist13
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and comfortable rooms, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and SPA, Near Disney yet worlds apart if you want to be”
Reviews.Author: irish17020
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, adjacent to Disney World and easy access to I-4 which can get you anywhere you want to go in Orlando. But who needs to leave? Golf, swim, loll along in the lazy river or take a day trip to Disney. After all that strenous vactioning, hit the luxuious SPA, where you'll feel pampered from the moment you walk thru the doors. I reccomend the facial which made me a new woman, but my daughter loved her full massage just as much. This Waldrof SPA is a world apart. Sleeping Rooms are mostly (or all, not sure) suites with living rooms separate from bedroom. Gorgeous bath en suite. Plus, our room had a little wet bar refrigerator area for easy snacks. Quiet if you need it, fun things to do if you prefer that as well. Hotel has lots of on property shopping and restaurants. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend away with the girls.”
Reviews.Author: JMN19701
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend here with friends on a girls weekend – the place is amazing and the service is first class. I don’t understand how someone can really have anything negative to say. It is in the perfect location – so close to Disney, but yet feels so far away. I would stay here with my family in the future. It is pure luxury, but not stuffy. We had a suite and it was the perfect amount of room and sleeping space. We ate dinner our last night in the Bull and the Bear and it was just amazing – the service, the food, the wine, the dessert ( and the price too! ) however, very worth it! My husband and I are planning a weekend away there in the fall, can’t wait! It was sad to return home to reality!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: TallahassseeSmitty
Reviews.Content: As I walked into the lobby I could see the luxury of the hotel. I have been to the Waldorf in New York and immediately recognized the legendary clock. It was a nice correlation for the Waldorf brand. The bellman explained where the restaurants and spa were as he took me to my room. I loved the marble foyer and the bathroom was nicely appointed. My turndown was impressive. Slippers placed on a linen mat next to my bed with a VERY comfortable robe. (A card is placed in the room where you can buy one - and I did. I would also add well worth the price). Delicious dark chocolates and my ice bucket was filled with fresh ice and water. The beds were comfortable. I could see the Disney fireworks from my window. Must try the french toast at Oscar's. Challah bread dipped in sweet crunchy cornflakes and berries. Lastly, the cabanas at the pool are private and the pool service was very attentive. Didn't get to use the spa or play golf - but I will be back for a leisure stay with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Bull and the Bear out of this culinary world”
Reviews.Author: porterfnb
Reviews.Content: Dinner at the Bull and the Bear was fantastic. The hostesses greeted and seated us professionally, the service was impeccable and the food perfect, The crab appetizer and the creamed corn side should not be missed. Had drinks pre and post at the lobby bar. The only negative of our experience was the bartender Suki, kind of snooty, no conversation, refused to serve me when I went up to the bar from a table, told me she would send a cocktail waitress over, perhaps a job in accounting would suit her better. One last thing, the band at the lobby bar, my goodness are they am extremely talented trio, fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Finally! A luxury hotel in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin57
Reviews.Content: My husband was traveling on business, but I went along while he was there. I enjoyed my overall experience and would definitely stay here again! The rooms are well appointed and luxurious, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the amentities are extensive. We enjoyed a very upscale dinner at Bull & Bear and also were surprised at how much we enjoyed the restaurant La Luce also. The spa, gym and golf options also make sure you are never without something to do. Finally a hotel I can come to in Orlando and not feel like I'm in Disney World! Congrats!

Reviews.Title: “Blah Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IHopeThisIsHelpful
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful so congratulation for that. But being lucky enough to having been to quite a few five stars hotels this one, unfortunately is not part of our top list. Overall the architecture has nothing making it indistinguishable from the the Hilton next door. And that's a big point, when you go to nice five stars hotels you just expect more and the Waldorf has nothing more to offer. Hilton, the owner, knows how to build business hotels, but doesn't know how to built five star hotels to add this extra touch that makes them so special. That lack of 'something more' is apparent throughout the hotel. Rooms are nice but still very business looking with noting standing out that makes you want to come here again and sadly the room service still need training in replacing amenities. We used the salt bath available on the first night and it was never replaced, the mouth wash was replaced on our 5th and last night... The shampoo, bath gel etc are no name, no flavor nothing to them. The Oscar restaurant downstairs, the only available option if you don't want a $35 - $45 entree a Bull and Bear restaurant upstairs not only provide very average food but the decor is even less interesting than the hotel architecture itself. You are almost at a chain restaurant next door. Last but not least and very annoying as we were having breakfast the waiter asks us if we wanted orange juice. At $6 a glass we just declined. Yet he brought the bottle and leave it on the table in front of our 5 and 7 years old kids. At that point it was very difficult to say no to the kids. So we had some juice. Contrary to what was on the menu it wasn't fresh squeezed but instead a Tropicana of some sort. $12 for two glasses of $2.5 bottle of Tropicana was more than annoying. We don't mind paying the extra for true luxury. But between the blah architecture, non descript food at 6 star prices this just wasn't what we expected. One good thing to finish: If you go to the bar near the lobby, order a 'Pomme' cocktail, these are very good and correctly priced :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Night Away”
Reviews.Author: escapedad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Orlando and were desperate for a night away. We have two young children, and an escape was in order. The Waldorf was amazing. We started the stay with massages in the spa. The men's locker room area was spotless and extremely well kept - as if it were a private bathroom. The treatment was perfect and my wife and I were even treated to complimentary champagne and strawberries. Our room was upgraded at no additional cost to a deluxe suite. We had a fantastic dinner and breakfast in the room the next morning. I also got some time in the fitness center - also very well kept, clean and inviting. Overall - a great evening away. One much needed night had us feeling refreshed - as if we had been gone for a week.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: lowella
Reviews.Content: my family loved our stay here best bellhops but location of the hotel is too secluded fr wdw travellers we don't mind coming back again

Reviews.Title: “more like a 4star”
Reviews.Author: catmalways
Reviews.Content: spent Valentine weekend at the Waldorf for business.. took the wife along... beautiful hotel and shiny new since it was recently built... enjoyed the comforts very much, but not different than most 4star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “New, but Nothing Great About It.”
Reviews.Author: James-Laynie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe Suite (one up from the Deluxe Room), where we had a separate living room. This is always nice to have, especially when you have a near-1-year-old. There was no full kitchen (nor did any of the rooms have one that I saw on the website), but it did come with a small refrigerator. It was bigger than I thought it was going to be. It held what we needed, which was milk for baby. The bed was super comfy, as was the SLEEPER SOFA. We pulled it out so my husband and I could watch a movie and he actually ended up sleeping on it while I slept in the room with baby. The mattress is a 3-fold foam. Not your traditional folded up mattress with bars going across your back and legs. They even had a Crib for baby. Not the pack 'n plays that we usually get at other hotels, but an actual crib. I thought this was nice. CLEANLINESS: Very clean - afterall it's only 5 months old. However, my husband did find an old tangerine that must have rolled underneath the TV console unit - after going and searching for our child's toy. Eeew. AIR CONDITIONING: There were 2 separate units. One for the main, living room area and one for the bedroom. I couldn't get EITHER one of these at a comfortable temperature. Every time I set it to go cooler, it was too cold. And when I set it to be a little warmer, it got hot. All I did each time was push the button down and up 2 times for 2 degrees difference. BATHROOM: Very nice, but I've been seen nice. The tub was not that big. I don't have a tub at home, so I indulge in baths when I go on vacation. After laying down, my whole body wouldn't fit; my legs were bent and body not fully immerged in water - and I'm not even tall - 5'4". From laying in the bathtub, I could see underneath the vanity - and there was a missing piece of tile (a small piece), but it looked like the builders just did have a half-"butt" job and didn't bother cutting the right sized tile to fit in the corner. There was a piece of painter's tape up on the ceiling behind the bathroom door - and I think the main center light bulb was out. Or maybe that fixture was there just for decoration - OR - I just couldn't find the light switch to turn it on. SPA: I had the intensive hand AND foot treatment. Form definitely took precedence over function. While benches and tubs where you got your pedicures done LOOKED nice, it wasn't very comfortable. So for a 2-hour treatment, I wish I could have the opportunity to get comfortable. Instead, I came out with a back ache. AND...For the money paid for this treatment, I should have been offered to use the rest of the spa, but I wasn't. GOLF: My husband got an all-you-can golf package for one day, but since it was SO windy and rained on the one day, they let him play again the next. He said the course was very nice. He also described it as "tight", meaning a challenge to play. SHOPPING: Very close to the Orlando Premium Outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room/grounds; Service needs an "upgrade"”
Reviews.Author: AiredaleTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days and 2 nights at the Waldorf (this past weekend). The physical plant was excellent - the building, grounds, rooms, restaurants, fitness center, lobby, etc. were all top notch - 4+ to 5- star quality. The service, however, needed help. The front desk folks were helpful and very friendly - but, once we got past the front desk, things weren't so great. Oh, I should mention, the valet parkers were excellent - always timely, friendly, helpful and professional. Examples of mediocre service - After the first night, we needed new, little shampoo/conditioner bottles - these weren't provided automatically, each day as in other luxury hotels - so, I asked a housekeeping attendant in the hallway and she said that she "would get to it" (never happened); Also, I asked a coffee/tea attendant who was serving complimentary morning drinks where I could get a tea after he closed his station at 11am and he responded "not here" - that was it - no helpful suggestions - there was just a lot of this - not awful service, but not 4 or 5 star quality. Also, I should mention the room - we were upgraded to a huge suite, overlooking the Disney properties - excellent view - the room was very elegant and special - but, the bar/kitchen area was odd - it had a small refrigerator but no mini bar, no microwave, no way to make coffee/tea . . . all it had was a couple of bottles of water and 4 wine glasses in a cupboard. Given that the rate on the suite could go up to $1,400/night, it should be better appointed (in the kitchen area). In sum, the property is very clean, new, bright and promising. The suite we stayed in was near perfect. The valet parkers and front desk employees (including the concierge staff) were excellent. But, the employees who we encountered once we were past the front lobby needed work - their resistance to helping us was inappropriate - especially given that the hotel was barely 1/2 full when we were there. I do recommend this hotel - but, the managers really need to push the staff to deliver a higher level of service (I didn't expect the Ritz or Four Seasons - but, kind, helpful staff members would have been nice). P.S. - the pool area was awesome . . . too cold to enjoy it while we were there . . . but, on a sunny, warm day, I imagine that it's the perfect place to be in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way!”
Reviews.Author: AZJJ
Reviews.Content: From the bellman upon arrival to the front desk check in to the restaurants, everything was beyond expectation! I especially enjoyed Bull and Bear - great steaks! I suggest slipping over to Sir Harry's late night for a drink - we had a great time in there sipping an after dinner drink and reminiscing about our day. We played golf too. Not my best day, but still had a great time on the course. Beautiful condition and enough of a test for anyone. So much more to see and do, wish I had a few more days there.

Reviews.Title: “Most extraordinary hotel in Orlando by far...exclusive and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: LoveLuxuryAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked through the attended doors, elegance and quiet beauty just surrounded me. Staff is quietly in the background anticipating your every need. The clock tower is masterful but warming. It seemed everyone knew to meet there. I loved the positioning of Peacock Alley, the lobby bar, which is wide open. Day or night, it seems to have it's fit for lingering guests over tea or cocktails. The Bull & Bear Restaurant was supurb. The Guerlain Spa, incredible, where the massage was a mixture of just what I needed. And I've had my share, this is in the tops. The pools ~ I could live by a pool and especially this one. Whether your need is lounge in the sun or sit under a gazebo in welcoming sofas. The watermelon mojito was the best pool cocktail ever! Gracious service from the doorman to the waitstaff. Absolutely the best views ever overlooking lake, golf course into just nature. At night, you can see the fireworks from Disney. Dinner, dancing, a mix of amazing activities for children in group on private island was the best ever. Kids in group had more fun than adults....amazing kid program. Comp shuttle to Disney. Amazing, Amazing, Amazing, I could go on ~ you just have to go there yourself to appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars all the WAY!”
Reviews.Author: thriller615
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf for our honeymoon. The grounds, rooms, and pool area are beautiful! The staff was extremely kind and helpful. In fact, they treated us like stars. My car that was valeted everyday is well.....old and busted. Not once did I feel judged or treated differently. The views of Epcot are amazing, and the suite upgrade was awesome. This is a real review and trip advisor is one of the reason we choice this place!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to get out of the bed!!”
Reviews.Author: simonpoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new Waldorf in a spacious corner suite for Christmas week. It was great to come back to the large bathroom, plush bed and comfortable furnishings and also be minutes from the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. Service still needs a little work (rooms not ready until right at check-in time), but the breakfast buffet is yummy, and the Bull & Bear had great food as well. The other nice feature is the lazy river pool at the Hilton, which you walk to in no time - plenty of chairs, and a little mini-slide for the kids. Also got a mani/pedi at the spa, which was very nice as well. Overall, we'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: lillious
Reviews.Content: We decided to hotel hop a few nights in Orlando instead of staying in one location. Was a bit challenging finding the Waldorf Astoria because it isn't in the GPS systems yet. However, driving around and around was worth it when we finally found it! We're Hilton Honors members so we got a double upgrade. Hotel was only 1/3 full so there was plenty of staff to make us feel extra welcome. Our suite was fantastic. Definitely the most comfortable hotel bed we've had in a long time (we stayed at the Ritz in Sarastota and the Gaylord Palms this trip as well-they're beds were no where near as luxurious!) Although the accommodations were truly fantastic we did notice a few things that surprised us and thought they might have done differently. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous. But, no separate sink or toilet area. No phone in the living room/bar area. My husband wanted to surprise me with breakfast in bed and had to use the phone in the bathroom-which didn't have directory. Very insignificant issues and we only noticed because many of the staff had asked the guests for their comments. We both went to the spa for facials. The spa bed was so comfortable. Finally someone who knows how to design the right shape bed. No back ache after the hour is over! Fantastic and yes expensive but since we're not regular spa goers we didn't mind. Really liked that the Hilton is on the other side of the property and connected via an elegant corridor. We had lunch at the Hilton cafe which was very good. Dinner at Bull and Bear was excellent. Again, expensive but you're paying for service, atmosphere, wine knowledge and quality. They were exceptional! This hotel was truly wonderful. We will definitely go back again when we're in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Brand New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkWorldtravellerplus
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel and it seems no expense has been spared to create it. It is immaculately designed and luxuriously appointed. I stayed here 8 nights in a two bedroom suite which for a family with two children provided plenty of space and lots of home comforts. The beds are wonderful and so are the furnishings. The bathrooms are equipped with both baths and spacious showers but no bidets. The kitchen in the parlour was not fully equipped, in fact we had to ask for plates, cutlery and a microwave. This may be because the hotel is still new but on this count they fell short of what they advertise. There is a complimentary shuttle service to the Disney parks but it is far from ideal, it takes 45 minutes to get you back from Magic Kingdom because it makes a stop at Animal Kingdom. When you have waited 20 minutes for the bus with small children, that is not great. The breakfast at Oscars is very good but not a buffet on weekdays, and we ended up having breakfast at the Hilton next door, which is part of the same complex but a very long walk away. Dinner at the Bull and the Bear is excellent but costs a small fortune. The spa prices are prohibitive, $180 for a massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: jpearlsew
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Waldorf and it was a truely amazing hotel. We traveled with our children, ages 4 and 8 and used this hotel while going around the parks. Upon arrival, there were numerous bellman available, check in was fast and they had a room for us well before check in time. They have more than ample staff available to help with anything you may need. Service--was truely great. The room-was a wonder. They don't miss a beat with the high end fixtures, lovely marble floors, drapery and fine linens. We had both a tub and shower in the very large bathroom and two very comfortable beds. They came in for turn down service daily. The room service was great as well. We ordered it New Years Eve at 11 pm and it was delivered within 30 minutes. They offer a selection of children's items on the room service menu as well. The daily buffet breakfast at Oscar's had a lot of choices. Omeletes, breads, cereals, meats, cheeses, freshly squeezed oj---very complete and tasty. It was $24 per adult and $12 per child. Since there is no where else to eat near by--we ate here every morning. It was great but pricey. We noticed a lot of children around the hotel and the staff was very accomodating to the kids. Event though the hotel is very upscale, there were a lot of families with young children staying there. The shuttle to and from the Disney parks loads up first next door at the Hilton-where there are 1000 rooms--and we were told that on busy days the bus may already be full when it arrives at the Waldorf. We went to Universal and Sea World and the buses do not go to those locations so we took a town car there and a Mears cab back--the ride back in the Mears taxi was always less. Overall, we loved this hotel. The pool looks amazing (it was too cold to swim during our trip )and next door at the Hilton (which is connected to the Waldorf) there is a lazy river, an even larger pool with a water slide that you can access when staying at the Waldorf. We heard that they are keeping prices low for now while they get everything perfect. I would suggest, if you like classy hotels and great service and the price is right, pick this one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: floridawoman32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel two weeks before christmas and the staff couldnt have been nicer. I'm very particular and spoke with a kind gentlmen David who assisted us with a room at the end of the hall since I am a very light sleeper. When we arrived that Friday the room was ready . We ate dinner on Saturday night in the steakhouse everything including the staff was wonderful. The lounge is relaxing and drinks and snacks wonderful. It's nice to be able to head to Orlando and not have children running around as in the Disney hotels. We have older children and finally found a hotel we shall return too for our frequent visits. I hope it stays just the way it is. Thanks for a relaxing weekend!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect way to experience Disney.”
Reviews.Author: jdc4
Reviews.Content: I am a very non Disney kind of person. I wanted to take my family to Disney for a week, but there had to be a compromise in that I could get away from the craziness at night. Originally we booked a suite at the Ritz, but my AMEX agent talked me into checking out the Waldorf due to the close proximity to the Magic Kingdom and knowing that my wife and I were going to be toting around a 5 and 2 year old along with strollers and all the other stuff that goes with taking two girls to the parks. I knew going in that we were taking a risk on a new hotel and not having all the kinks worked out, and after reading the first few post on Tripadvisor I was more than a little concerned. I was very close to changing the reservation back to the Ritz, but decided to wing it as I didn't think that it couldn't be that bad. Well within 5 minutes of our arrival all of our concerns disappeared. The Waldorf did not disappoint, while on the outside it is not as aesthetically pleasing as you might expect, the inside is simply stunning. My little girls loved siting and then chasing each other around the clock tower in the lobby and the staff made them feel like they were coming into their very own Cinderella castle. The suite that we were in exsquisitely furnished and the only complaint that I have is that it would be nice if they had more than just a few wine glasses in the bar. We kept fruit, juice, and snack in the fridge and a few plates and some silverware would have been useful. I also did not mind not having a coffee maker in the room, because i enjoyed waking up before the kids and going down to the lobby to read the paper and have some free coffee from the well stocked coffee and tea service. We did Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom during our stay. We utilized the free shuttle service and it was great. You do have to get used to the schedule, but the convenience of it was great. It takes you right from the hotel to the transportation center for MK and right up to the gates at Animal Kingdom. It takes about 25 minutes to get into the MK from the hotel and I would say a good hour to get back from the park to the hotel after the monorail, and the shuttle stops at the other parks. We did get a towncar one night after getting stuck at the Grand Floridian and it was a worthwhile 20 bucks. Next trip we might take the shuttle in the morning and a towncar after the park for the convenience. Overall, as you can probably tell we were thrilled with the hotel. We were all very sad to leave and look forward to getting back down there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance at it's BEST!”
Reviews.Author: OCarr
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria Orlando is now our #1 hotel in the area. Where other luxury properties in Orlando vie to “wow” guests with their fancy facades, outrageous holiday decorating, characters come to life and obnoxious art, the Waldorf is simply understated elegance. I was actually taken aback by the simplicity and tasteful décor in the lobby and rooms. And although the hotel is beautiful, the employees are what made our stay exceptional. From the bellstand, to the front desk to housekeeping, to room service…WOW. For just one example, Ryan at the bellstand heard my name in passing, once, when we arrived. The following morning after seeing dozens of people go in and out of the hotel, he still called me by name when I stepped out of the hotel to ask for my car! This was not an isolated incident as all the employees we passed offered a pleasant greeting. Most importantly, when my husband checked in early and went to play golf I asked him on my way to the hotel how check in went… he said it was the most pleasant check in he’s experienced in years. We were even able to put in a request for an upgrade online (done once you make the original reservation). My husband played the golf course and said it was outstanding. My 10 year old son did not want to leave! He was very impressed with room service. We had both dinner and breakfast in our room and he loved how the tables were set, and the “cool” silverware. The fitness center is not to be believed! Holy cow, I almost wanted to start my work out as soon as I stepped in the room. It is FILLED with the latest machiines, TV's on each one and plenty for a large group. There are towels and water set up at each machine as well. Very nicely done! Any complaints? Well, maybe just one - - the valet parking is really expensive at $20 a night (the hotel may be named the same as the one in NY but this is FLORIDA). This would be just fine however in order to park your own car you must park in the adjacent Hilton parking garage which is quite a very long walk back, up hill. I wouldn't mind paying valet when my husband and I arrive together but we usually take two cars and I'm not a fan of paying $40 a night for a parking space PLUS tips. Despite the parking charge, not only will we be back, but I’m putting my Orlando resort list away. I don’t need it anymore. There is only one destination in Orlando that I will return to with complete confidence – the Waldorf Astoria Orlando Bonnet Creek! We stay in Orlando quite often as we are only a little over an hour away in the Tampa Bay area. I've stayed in almost every luxury hotel in greater Orlando - believe me, you will be impressed too!

Reviews.Title: “Only bad part was the weather, and the Gators losing!!”
Reviews.Author: kbeck45
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying I am a somewhat laid back traveler, whereas, if I have clean sheets I am a happy camper! So when I get service and extras, it is just icing on the cake. My wife and I do a Disney weekend every year around Christmas because no one does it better than Disney, it is a great way to get into the holiday spirit, plus it was my wife's birthday. We originally were going to stay at the Grand Cypress, however, changed our reservations when we saw the opening of this hotel, plus I am a Hilton Honors member. I read some of the reviews about the newness, and the inconsistent service that came along with that, but for the price ($239 a night for a Deluxe King Suite with Balcony vs. $400 and up for Disney Resorts), we were willing to try it out. Being a little proactive, I responded to the likely automated e-mail that is sent to your e-mail account a few days prior to your stay. It is from the Front Desk Manager. I responded to him to state concerns about the service I read on some of these posts, and to express how much we were looking forward to staying at the hotel. He was quick to respond to reassure me, and to even offer something special to celebrate my wife's birthday. With his prompt communication I felt good about the weekend. I was not disappointed. The hotel was beautiful, and tastefully decorated for Christmas, and the service throughout the weekend was what I expected and more. Starting with the room, I think it is perfect for a weekend get away, and with a lot of closets and cabinets, it was perfect for our 21 month old to keep her entertained. It doesn't have a coffee maker, but the coffee is free downstairs, so not a big deal. The fridge was just the right size too. If you have to sleep on the sofa bed, don't sweat it, the mattresses they have on them are amazing!! The Deluxe Suite is definitely the way to go, plus we had a great view of the Epcot fireworks. And the TV/Audio in the room was great for watching the SEC Championship game, unfortunately with the Gators losing! Next is food. We ordered room service twice, once for breakfast, and another for a grilled cheese for our daughter while my wife and I went to Bull & Bear (we had a family sitter for our daughter). Starting with the room service, what can I say, it was great, food quality was very good, and the wait time was less than 20 minutes each time. It can be a little pricey, but you are staying at a luxury hotel, so it is to be expected. As for Bull & Bear, what a great restaurant. My wife and I both got the Filets, she got the cognac sauce I got the red wine bernaise, both were very good. They have ala carte sides, and got the Mac & Cheese (I know, at a upscale restaurant!), at the recommendation of the waiter, and we loved it, we also got the mushroom side. We also brought our own bottle of wine and cut cost that way, only getting charged the corking fee. Again, it can get pricey, but we knew that going in, and the quality of food was worth it. Plus, they had a free dessert for my wife's birthday. Location is great, it is about a mile away from Downtown Disney, and very close to the resorts. I agree with a previous poster, it is just far enough away from Disney to feel secluded, which is nice for a change of pace. Also, I was salivating the whole time as their golf course looks AMAZING! Will definitely have to bring the clubs the next time. As for the location of the entrance as some posters have written, I could care less if I am driving through cow fields on my way there, as long as it is spectacular when I am inside and get treated with care. Other amentities that we observed but didn't use were the kids area, with video games, art stations, crayons, etc, very nice and staffed until 5PM, the fitness/gym was awesome, very large area to work out, and the pool both at the WA and the joining Hilton looking very nice but too chilly for this weekend. Also, as for the $20 valet parking, compare it to places like the Dolphin Hotel that charges $12 or $13 a night when you are staying there for self parking, and it is not much of a difference, I'll pay the few extra dollars for them to go get it for me!! Overall, we were very, very pleased with our stay, the weather actually worked in our favor because we got to enjoy the hotel more, as we ended up at the Parks on Sunday. I would definitely recommend, and we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to Disney but far enough to get away from it.”
Reviews.Author: dalcard
Reviews.Content: We visited the brand new beautiful Waldorf Astoria near Disney World during Thanksgiving break with our two teenagers. My husband is a Hilton Honors member so we were upgraded to a beautiful and roomy suite. With two nearly grown children, the room was very much appreciated. The hotel was quiet since it is not well known as of yet, but we loved it! The staff was very attentive and friendly. The pool area was large with two generous sized pools. Since our children are older, we had one day left on a four year old Park Hopper Disney pass and decided to spend the day hopping from park to park going on all of our favorites. We did not need to stay at a Disney owned property, nor did we want to since our kids are older. This hotel was close enough to all the Disney fun when we wanted it but far enough to be out of it for some quiet relaxation. The Hilton is right next door with a lazy river and water slide which we had access to as well. Hurry up and enjoy this hotel before the secret gets out.

Reviews.Title: “Spa-scrum-didili-umpcius!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fabuleux
Reviews.Content: I know this will be viewed by all, but I really hope that the eyes of MY massage therapist at the Guerlain Spa sees this. His name girls, is Will...!!! Now, I am not really one to write all these big, fancy reviews of places and things, but The Guerlain Spa at The Waldorf Astoria deserves some light thrown on it. The treatment rooms are below the lobby, almost like a hidden gem. Will was so sweet and charming when we first met -- he said hello to me in French which I did not realize at first is what this spa is all about. The entire time I was there, I would not have believed that I was next to Disney -- writing this I feel like a school girl outside of Paris. I know I was giggily when I checked out, and I loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Think again..Not what you expect from the name”
Reviews.Author: TheConcorde
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando in November for 14 nights. The first unexpected surprise was the Valet ONLY parking at $20 a day despite the web site failing to mention this fact. Actually the web site was pretty vague about the hotel in general. Not only do you pay $20 to have your car parked whether you like it or not but the service is poor and slow, Valet staff leave mud in the car as they have to run a gauntlet through unfinished areas of the grounds and then work you for tips (this service is provided by AAA and seems to be beyond the hotels control). The hotel is beautiful but they have failed to get finishing touches right and staff in some areas seem to lack customer service training. The room we had been given was facing the Disney parks (1117). On arrival we were surprised to find the room without a fridge despite the fact that the furniture which had been placed in the room had been designed for a fridge to be fitted. After 3 calls to reception a fridge was finally installed. (We were advised that we should have asked for a room with a fridge, not really what you would expect from the Waldorf Astoria and very odd considering the furniture had obviously been ordered with the intension of a fridge to be fitted. Breakfast was taken in Oscars only once. Whilst the quality of food was good the service again was imposing. We were approached by 5 different members of the serving team asking if our food was ok and if we were enjoying our breakfast (we would have enjoyed our breakfast if we had been left in peace for 5 minutes). This was not the effortless service we have previously experienced from the original Waldorf Astoria in New York. My partner decided to make use of the Guerlain Spa area at $30 a day per person (this cost is just for the steam room and Jacuzzi) but he was disappointed to find the steam room was not working and maintenance engineers were trampling through the shower and relaxation area. Hardly the tranquil experience he was expecting and as a result of this and the initial poor handling of his complaint he chose not to make use of the spa and treatments again. Above all else the worst thing about the hotel is the house keeping. They seem to follow no standard when servicing the rooms and its hit and miss as to what is done and more important what isnt. They don't seem to follow the information provided by the hotel advising guests on what to expect from there stay. Information in the room advised that a full change of linen would be carried out every 3 days. This wasn't the case and we had to ask for this to be done. Bath towels ect would be changed if placed in the bath tub like most hotels but this wasn't always the case and we had to poor mouth wash onto bath linen to get the maid to realize we wanted them replacing and not just hung up. Long black hairs were found in the bath after the apparent cleaning and the vanity unit round the sink was not cleaned throughout the stay as when we re packed our toiletries there was dust and dirt marks where they had been. We also had to ask for the room to be vacuumed. These are just the basics of good house keeping and something that really should be addressed. We were also surprised that despite there being 3 of us staying in the room only 2 robes and 2 pairs of slippers were provided for use during our stay. We would have expected this kind of information to be passed to house keeping by the front desk and wouldn't have expected to have to ask a week into our stay. Its disappointing when you choose to splurge on a little luxury for a vacation and find that you could have got better service from a lower grade hotel. I work in the travel industry and spend two thirds of my working year in hotels around the world and really expected better from a hotel with such a heritage. The final straw was being woken by the in room alarm clock at 7 am on a Sunday morning despite non of us even touching the clock radio during our stay. We viewed this as a petty response from house keeping to our complaints. Despite raising these issues early during our stay with the duty manager it is our view that the Waldorf Astoria staff failed to turn the situation around and were slow to respond. Very disappointing and if i were the Manager of the Waldorf Astoria New York I would be concerned for future damage to the brands reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Need to Work Out Kinks”
Reviews.Author: JPinJupiter
Reviews.Content: I was attending a weekend conference being hosted at the nearby Gaylord Palms resort and thought that I would combine work and pleasure by bringing my wife and toddler son with me for the weekend. Instead of staying at the conference location, I decided to "upgrade" and stay at the recently opened Waldorf Astoria Orlando. We paid about $220 per night. Overall, the Waldof Astoria is a nice hotel, but it's more comparable to a Hyatt than to a Ritz, Four Seasons or even a Peabody or J.W. Marriott. It was not the special experience that your mind conjures up when you think "Waldorf". Here is my review: Front Desk: Poor We arrived about 2 hours before check in (had requested early check-in at booking time). When we went to check in, the front desk clerk told us that he had us confirmed for three nights but that our room was not ready and that although it was clean, a supervisor would have to "check off" on the room before he could give us keys. We were told that would only take a few minutes and I was asked for my cell phone number. After about 5 minutes, the same clerk came up to me in the lobby, asked me for my name again and repeated that he would contact me. I told the clerk that my wife and I would go to lunch in order to give him some extra time to get our room "checked off." When I went back to the front-desk after lunch an hour later, I was told that the room still hadn't been "checked off" by a supervisor. I had to instruct the young man that I had a toddler that needed to take a nap and that we couldn't continue to wait beyond the hour that we had already waited for our room to be "checked off". This is unacceptable for a three-star hotel, much less a property billing itself as a five-star hotel (hence, one of the reasons I'm only giving the Waldorf Astoria Orlando three stars). On a separate occassion, I called the front desk and the phone rang 10 times without anyone answering--and nobody ever did. BELL MAN: Excellent Very courteous and friendly. He asked us if we needed any help or information as he brought our bags to our room. On another occassion, I was leaving the hotel early in the morning and asked the bellman on duty if there was a place I could buy a coffee. He said that the restaurants were closed, but that he would get me a cup of coffee. I declined the offer, but I definitely appreciated the offer. VALET: Fair On one occasion I had used the guest services button to call down to have my car brought up. When I got to the front of the hotel, nobody had left to get my car. Another time when I was returning to the hotel, the valet saw the blue ticket on my dashboard and asked me "Is this one of ours" to which another valet responded, "yeah, they changed them over today". The only time I was addressed by name by a valet was when I was picking up my car at the Gaylord Palms for the conference--and I wasn't even staying there! I also read a review where a reviewer said that she was offered bottled water while waiting for her car. That didn't happen once to me in the three times I picked up my car from the valet. ROOMS: Very Good/Excellent This hotel is brand new. The room had individual reading lamps and HDTV, which were nice. The beds were comfortable and the bed had a beautiful comforter for bedding, although I thought it was a bit heavy and warm for a Florida hotel. The room lamps also had a dimmer switch which I thought was a nice touch. I had a king size room with a view of Disney and could see the fireworks above Disney in the evening. BULL & BEAR RESTAURANT: Execllent My wife, son and I ate in the Bull & Bear. Both the staff and the food were exceptional. We ordered a Caesar Salad as an appetizer and the salad was made table side. Our waiter was attentive without being intrusive and our steaks were cooked to perfection. Whoever trained the restaurant staff should be placed in charge of training the rest of the hotel. I highly recommend this restaurant. POOLS: Very Good The Waldorf pool is designed more for adults, but you also get access to the adjoining Hilton with a "lazy river pool" which is great for kids. I wouldn't put the pool in the same category as the J.W. Marriott Orlando lazy river pool as it is shallower and not as well landscaped, but it's very nice. The pool and bar staff is also very friendly and helpful. LOCATION: Excellent The Waldorf Astoria is located next to Disney and is very convenient if you're visiting Disney. GIFT SHOP: Fair I had forgotten my belt and tried to buy a standard black dress belt at the gift shop. However, they didn't carry belts, an item that most hotels catering to buisness travelers would have. It was just a reminder that the hotel is really geared towards Disney tourists. OVERALL RECOMMENDATIONS: -I would set the appropriate price point for this hotel at around $200-250/night. If your room rate is less than $250, you may want to go ahead and book it. However, once you reach the $250/night category, there are far better options in Orlando for the price. -Call ahead to the hotel on the day you're arriving. This should be totally unecessary for a luxury hotel, but given my experience with the front desk, I'd recommend doing so until the kinks get worked out. -If you do decide to stay here, eat at the Bull & Bear. It's one of the highlights of the hotel. -This hotel caters mainly to Disney tourists. If you're traveling solely for business, this hotel may not be for you. Overall, I can't recommend this hotel to a friend because it's not a five star hotel, which is what it purports to be. Maybe the Waldorf Astoria Orlando will get there with some additional staff training and improvement, but for now I think there are better options available.

Reviews.Title: “This is NO Ritz Carlton!! If you like the Ritz do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Seminole97
Reviews.Content: Ok. The inside of the hotel lobby is nice as well as the hallways. We had reserved an 1800 sq foot Waldorf Suite but the layout was really strang so we asked to be moved to a Deluxe Suite which was actually much better even though it was smaller. I do not see the need for really large kitchenette areas....poor use of space. If you compare this to an executive suite at the Ritz at Grande Lakes the Ritz room is MUCH nicer and better laid out. Maid service and turn-down is non-existent...we had to call for it every time and wait for them to clean and bring towels, etc...not sure what the problem is here? On the bright side, all aspects of dining is superd from the Bull and Bear to Oscars as well as La Luce over at the Hilton. We had dinner for 20 in a private room at La Luce and it was fantastic! The staff is awesome!! Bull and Bear is equally as good but is definetely on the high end price wise. If you are a thrifty type you might want to avoid the Bull and Bear. Ocsars staff was awesome for breakfast and it was good but also very pricey. Breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children with 20% gratuity was $104.00!! $6 for a glass of OJ and $5 per cup of coffee. We went back to La Luce on our last night and it was awesome the second time as well!! Cannot say enough about the staff at this establishment. I may drive there for dinner even if I am at the Ritz! The pool area and landscaping at the Waldorf is sub-par....really dissapointed!! We spent our time at the Hilton pool instead and it was much better. The outside of this hotel looks very institutional and the landscaping was very cheap. I am in the real estate development business and I know what I am talking about. Good food, great staff in the dining establishments, poor in-room service, very dissapointed with the look and feel overall of the hotel. I would rate this a 4 star hotel definetely NOT 5 star! I will be back at the Ritz next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: SPF12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go check this out for our anniversary. While they did have some positives we were overall disappointed. The service at this hotel is horrible. The room cleaners didn't replenish our shampoo and shower gel so we called and asked that they bring it at turn down. Again, they came and did not leave any. We had to call a third time. In addition, the rooms have no coffee makers in them. We called down for hot water and it took about 45 minutes to get it from room service. Then, at breakfast my husband got up to go to the bathroom and when he came back the whole table was cleared. He hadn't finished eating his first plate of food. We visited the spa too and that was way overpriced. The spa had no monthly specials, no Florida resident discounts, nothing. I though the spa was a bit sterile and stark looking with very little in way of amenities. We mentioned the lack of service to the hotel and they told us a manager would call us. It's been over a week and we've had no call. I have to say if your coming to Orlando go for the Ritz or JW Marriott. The hotels have a lot more for kids, families, and couples. The spa at the Ritz is great and is cheaper than the Waldorf. The service at the Ritz is far superior. I was surprised and disappointed. Thought the Waldorf would live up to it's name. The rooms are nice. The beds are very comfortable. But other than that I can't find a whole lot of positives about the place. All I can say is we were really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria…Luxury Defined”
Reviews.Author: tanqm
Reviews.Content: On October 31st 2009, myself along with my husband and six year old son checked in to what is arguable the most luxurious hotel in Orlando, if not the South East…the newly built Waldorf Astoria. While our vacation didn’t physically begin until the 31st of October, communication with the Waldorf Astoria “professionals” began weeks prior. It all started when I joined the Bonnet Creek/Waldorf Group on facebook. In joining the group, I was extremely surprised to see that posts from other members were actually being responded to! I soon began adding my own posts and unbeknownst to me, one post in particular caught the attention of one Vanessa Sain-Dieguez, eCommerce Manager for the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. More about the post and Vanessa shortly. As we neared our arrival date, my husband began receiving correspondence from Joshua Ruck, also part of the Waldorf Astoria group of professionals. Joshua contacted my husband bi-weekly if not weekly inquiring about any special needs/requests my family might have. With each email, Joshua’s determination /commitment to ensure that our family’s first visit to the Waldorf Astoria Orlando would be a memorable one, was genuinely evident and greatly appreciated. The attention Joshua gave to my family in the weeks leading up to our arrival really made us anticipate our stay at the Waldorf Astoria all the more. Pulling up to the breathtaking entrance, the three of us each had our door simultaneously opened by (3) members of the most professional valet team ever encountered. We would like to take this opportunity to thank Rodney, Tara, Edward, Chris and Stewart (as well as the entire Valet staff) for the special attention they gave. Each member of the team daily inquired about the type of day we were having and were always very cordial. We were always offered cold bottles of Fiji water as we waited for the car to be brought around. While my son and I took pictures in front of the stunning clock, my husband checked in and happily informed me that we had been upgraded to a suite! Entering the well appointed two bedroom suite, I knew instantly that my family would never stay at any other hotel while visiting Orlando. As we were being given our tour of the suite, I noticed a little something extra that further solidified my allegiance to the Waldorf… I have been diagnosed as having OCD. Because of this “ailment” I have a love-hate relationship with hotels and I stated this on the Bonnet Creek/Waldorf Astoria facebook page. In the post, I detailed how I clean “everything” in hotel rooms before my husband and son are allowed to touch anything. I physically clean every item in the room, right down to the light switches! Well Vanessa, the young lady I spoke of earlier, read and responded to my post by providing me with lovely baskets of hand sanitizer, wipes, soap, etc., to use when outside of the Waldorf! I was overcome with emotion to see that she actually took my OCD serious enough to “hand write” me a lovely note and provide me with the thoughtful baskets. I was even allowed to attend a morning meeting with the housekeeping staff to see first hand the detail that goes into taking care of the guests and their “homes-away-from home”. I was honored to have been invited. The Waldorf Astoria Orlando is not just a hotel, it’s an Experience; an Experience that you will have to see and partake of firsthand to believe. The plentiful restaurants, the lush grounds and golf courses, along with the resort like setting of the pools aid in making the Waldorf Astoria Orlando truly an unforgettable place. It is obvious that all associated with this phenomenal place have been extensively trained in the area of customer service. Additionally, my family’s numerous trips to the pool were made all the more enjoyable by Michael and his willingness to keep us cool and comfortable on the hottest of days. Michael along with each member of the staff is to be commended for succeeding in helping me overcome my OCD (for the week ;)! Please continue your quest in providing the best in the areas of customer service and hospitality. See you in March.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: cherie40
